articles.headline: Pfizer vaccine available for over 60s in WA from next week, Mark McGowan announces
articles.description: West Australians aged 60 and older will be eligible to receive the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine from Monday next week, the Premier says.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: 'Not very pretty': Whale carcass to be recovered by SA Museum as big 'stench' heats up
articles.description: The smelly carcass of a rare whale, which has been mauled by sharks and left to rot on a northern Adelaide beach, will be cut up and removed by SA Museum staff and the local council.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: ACT lockdown extended for a month, as territory records 22 new COVID-19 cases
articles.description: The ACT will remain in lockdown for another four weeks amid persistent new case numbers in the community.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: NSW records 1,127 COVID-19 cases, two deaths
articles.description: Deputy health officer Jeremy McAnulty says it is too early to tell if the drop in case numbers means the state is over the highest peak of the Delta outbreak as NSW records 1,127 new COVID-19 cases.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: AIS vaccination hub booking error results in hundreds of rescheduled appointments, late-night doses administered
articles.description: More than 600 Canberrans have their COVID-19 vaccination appointments rescheduled after an overbooking error occurred at the AIS mass vaccination hub.
articles.author: Charlotte Gore

articles.headline: Could Lawn Hill mine be site of next Juukan Gorge tragedy?
articles.description: The fallout over the destruction of Western Australia's Juukan Gorge rock shelters is being felt at another mine in Queensland, where a group of Indigenous elders is trying to stop the proposed excavation around a sacred site.
articles.author: Peter McCutcheon and Bridget Brennan

articles.headline: Wild 'de-extinction' plan aims to bring woolly mammoths back to life
articles.description: Genetics company Colossal secures funding to create an "elephant-mammoth hybrid", saying its technology has the potential to bring back ancient extinct species and restore damaged or lost ecosystems.
articles.author: Peter McCutcheon and Bridget Brennan

articles.headline: 'Limb-threatening' injuries after massive brawl involving 40 armed men in Brisbane's south
articles.description: Queensland police investigate a brawl involving 40 men armed with bats and poles in a southern Brisbane suburb last night.
articles.author: Peter McCutcheon and Bridget Brennan

articles.headline: Amy spends up to $20,000 a year on magnetic therapy to treat depression. Medicare changes won't help her
articles.description: After years of lobbying, Medicare will soon partly fund repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation to treat severe depression. But existing patients won't see a cent.
articles.author: Edwina Seselja

articles.headline: Regional supermarket operator accused of 'systematic' wage theft of more than $1m
articles.description: South Australia's shop workers union alleges the operator of 20 regional Foodland and IGA supermarkets owes at least 64 workers more than $1 million in unpaid wages, launching a claim in the Federal Court.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: Citizenship rules change: Wallabies' Quade Cooper can become an Australian at last
articles.description: The Immigration Minister changes residency rule for "distinguished" applicants for citizenship to become Australians, after a Wallabies rugby star was rejected multiple times.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: US Secretary of State defends chaotic Afghan withdrawal, blames Trump deal
articles.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken pushes against harsh criticism, saying the Biden administration inherited a deal with the Taliban to end the war but no plan for carrying it out.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Melbourne man who died of COVID-19 at home had not been tested, health officials say
articles.description: A man in his 20s and a woman in her 80s become the fifth and sixth people to die from COVID-19 during Victoria's Delta outbreak. The state has recorded 445 new local infections overnight.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Decade-long ban for Algerian judoka's Olympic withdrawal
articles.description: Fethi Nourine's decision to pull out of the Tokyo Olympics judo competition because of the possibility he might face an Israeli opponent all but ends the Algerian judoka's career, after his actions draw a 10-year ban.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Authorities praise families, contact tracers as one new COVID case detected in Queensland
articles.description: Chief Health Officer Jeannette Young says she thinks Brisbane's latest COVID-19 outbreak has been brought under control after a 15-year-old girl who attends St Thomas More College at Sunnybank tests positive.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Prince Andrew challenges a US court's jurisdiction in sex abuse lawsuit
articles.description: Prince Andrew argues a US court does not have jurisdiction over a lawsuit filed by a woman who claims he abused her at Ghislaine Maxwell's home and Jeffrey Epstein's island.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: We fact checked Immigration Minister Alex Hawke on refugee resettlement. Here's what we found
articles.description: Immigration Minister Alex Hawke says Australia ranks around third globally every year in the amount of refugees it resettles. Is that correct? RMIT ABC Fact Check investigates.
articles.author: David Campbell

articles.headline: At 62, Ross watched a TV show and decided to go for his first run. It went for 10 hours
articles.description: Eight years and nine ultramarathons later, the 70-year-old endurance runner is eyeing off a 120km challenge.
articles.author: Zilla Gordon

articles.headline: Shipping costs have risen by hundreds of millions of dollars and you may be about to pay for it
articles.description: The competition regulator is investigating a dramatic surge in fees and charges imposed by port operators on trucking firms to load and unload cargo. ACCC chief Rod Sims believes the higher charges are being passed onto consumers in the form of higher prices.
articles.author: Sue Lannin

articles.headline: ASX slips, as NAB says business confidence is improving on 'vaccine rollout'
articles.description: Australian shares fall in morning trade, following a mixed performance on Wall Street as investors focused on potential corporate tax hikes in the United States and upcoming economic data.
articles.author: David Chau

articles.headline: Unlawful force used in 'disturbing' arrest shows need for better cultural training of police: lawyer
articles.description: There are renewed calls for greater training of police in Aboriginal towns after a court found officers used unlawful force during the arrest of an elderly Indigenous man.
articles.author: Julia André and Larissa Waterson

articles.headline: Aboriginal health workers fighting COVID vaccine misinformation
articles.description: In the Northern Territory's remote community of Yarralin there's a new push from the local Aboriginal health service to get residents vaccinated. While progress has been slow, despite door-knocking and community cook-ups, residents and health workers are determined to get their community protected.
articles.author: Kate Ashton

articles.headline: Crown floats mandatory vaccination policy for both staff and customers
articles.description: The resort and casino operator says it is consulting with staff about a mandatory vaccination policy for its 20,000 workers. Unvaccinated people would also be banned from visiting its venues.
articles.author: Kate Ashton

articles.headline: Demand on Queensland's public hospital emergency departments outstripping population growth
articles.description: A Queensland Audit Office report says demand for emergency departments is growing at a faster rate than population growth, and more people are presenting at EDs with complex issues.
articles.author: Emilie Gramenz

articles.headline: 'Please come forward': Rene Latimore's family say they're searching for answers
articles.description: Katie Marchetti is already living with the agony of losing a sister Rene in a suspected homicide but she fears the "worst is yet to come". She is urging anyone with information, no matter how small, to contact police.
articles.author: Angel Parsons

articles.headline: 'Close to not having an arm': Killick Beach shark attack survivor makes slow recovery
articles.description: Two months and eight surgeries later, great white shark attack survivor Joe Hoffman is on a long road to recovery after his near-fatal encounter on the Mid North Coast.
articles.author: Kate Aubrey

articles.headline: Queensland MPs give emotional speeches ahead of vote to legalise voluntary assisted dying
articles.description: Queensland MPs fight back tears, detail personal stories and reveal the "exhausting" experience of weighing up opposing views ahead of a vote on proposed laws to legalise voluntary assisted dying in Queensland.
articles.author: Kate McKenna

articles.headline: WA misses out on extra AFL grand final tickets as Bulldogs allocation sells out in hours
articles.description: Hopes of additional WA tickets have been dashed after the Western Bulldogs fans quickly snapped up the 12,000 AFL grand final tickets allocated to them.
articles.author: Blake Kagi

articles.headline: House prices jumped $52,600 in three months, and the RBA says it can't do much about it
articles.description: Reserve Bank governor Philip Lowe says he understands concerns about rapid house price growth, but it's helping household wealth to grow.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Mystery donors pay some of Christian Porter's legal fees
articles.description: Former attorney-general Christian Porter tells federal parliament anonymous donors have covered some of the legal fees he racked up during his defamation case against the ABC, and says he has no way of finding out who they are.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: 'They fall into our trap': WA Police pose as drug suppliers to infiltrate organised crime gangs
articles.description: WA Police say they posed as international drug suppliers to infiltrate local organised crime gangs, resulting in the seizure of more than 30 kilograms of heroin and methylamphetamine and $7 million in cash.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: ‘Exciting development': DNA water testing hoped to stop cane toads gaining foothold on Kimberley islands
articles.description: In the past decade cane toads have marched across most of the Kimberley, so protecting animals on island sanctuaries is now a key priority.
articles.author: Ted O'Connor

articles.headline: Perth sibling murder accused asked grandmother for shovel after neighbour heard muffled scream from apartment
articles.description: The grandmother of a man accused of murdering a brother and sister in Victoria Park told police he was bloodied and crying after she picked him up from an apartment complex where the bodies were later found, a court hears.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: 'Held hostage in their own homes': People forced to stay in isolation long after 14-day period
articles.description: A staff member at a public health call centre in a Sydney hotspot area says people in isolation after testing positive for COVID are being trapped at home for weeks after the standard 14-day period because of paperwork delays.
articles.author: Sally Sara

articles.headline: 'I come from a lockdown under': T-shirt design competition relieves the stress
articles.description: When James Valentine posed the question "if you could sum up this lockdown in one sketch or design, what would it look like?" Sydney responded. And you can now wear it.
articles.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

articles.headline: Boy and mother with COVID-19 transferred from Broken Hill to Adelaide hospital
articles.description: A boy sick with COVID-19 is flown to Adelaide for treatment, accompanied by his mother, who also has the virus.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert and Leah MacLennan

articles.headline: NSW Premier in 'heated' meeting with mayors from Sydney's COVID hotspots
articles.description: Gladys Berejiklian's meeting with 12 mayors from Sydney's COVID hotspots becomes "a little bit heated" when the topic turns to discrimination.
articles.author: Alison Xiao

articles.headline: Hope, empowerment and a Balenciaga shadow on the Met Gala red carpet
articles.description: The highlight of the fashion year returns with stars switching out their sweatpants for elaborate and sometimes outlandish outfits.
articles.author: Sarah Motherwell

articles.headline: Federal Court judge orders minister to explain 'sudden' $21m Beetaloo Basin fracking grant agreement
articles.description: A Federal Court judge says he is "concerned" by Federal Resources and Water Minister Keith Pitt's handling of a $21 million grant agreement with a gas company eyeing the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin.
articles.author: Kate Ashton

articles.headline: Farmer escapes strawberry jam by making 25,000 jars of strawberry jam
articles.description: With no-one around to do the plucking on his pick-your-own farm, Anthony Sarks's crop looked bound for the back paddock. But he simply couldn't bring himself to waste the fruit.
articles.author: Keely Johnson

articles.headline: Albanese tells dumped Labor candidate not to be discouraged by Keneally seat swap
articles.description: Labor hopeful Tu Le is told not to be deterred from politics, after her candidacy was derailed by senior Labor figure Kristina Keneally being parachuted into her electorate.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Political inquiry warns abuse of female journalists on social media poses threat to democracy
articles.description: Social media giants must do more to eliminate fake accounts and political parties must establish an online code of conduct, a multi-party Victorian parliamentary inquiry recommends, warning harassment of journalists represents a threat to democratic elections.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Body modifier with no medical qualifications was 'very convincing' before woman ended up in hospital, court told
articles.description: A woman who had a procedure performed by body modifier Brendan Russell tells a Sydney court she felt she was in "really good hands" and doesn't recall being informed of all the associated risks.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Battery discovery could propel EVs from Sydney to Melbourne on one charge
articles.description: Australian researchers say they've opened the path to a new generation of batteries that could allow an electric vehicle to drive from Melbourne to Sydney on a single charge.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Israeli boy orphaned by Italian cable car crash allegedly kidnapped amid custody battle
articles.description: Italian relatives of six-year-old Eitan Biran, who was the sole survivor of a cable car crash earlier this year, allege he has been taken to Israel by his grandfather without their permission.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: 'Her victory takes her way beyond tennis and sport': Raducanu tipped for earnings windfall
articles.description: Emma Raducanu is an instant millionaire after her stunning US Open win, but her rapid emergence, youth and background are all leading sports marketers to predict much bigger off-court earnings.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: How are we going to get to 80 per cent vaccinated? Here's what some experts think
articles.description: Health authorities say getting an extra 10 per cent of people on board to reach 80 per cent vaccination rates is going to be a challenge. This is what experts think will help.
articles.author: Claudia Long

articles.headline: British diplomat draws attention to removal of Chinese mosque minarets
articles.description: Changes to the nation's mosques come amid an ongoing crackdown on Muslims and other faith communities under the ruling Chinese Communist Party's "Sinicisation" of religion.
articles.author: Dong Xing and Max Walden

articles.headline: We’re back to record property price growth, so what’s being done about it?
articles.description: Officials from Treasury and the Reserve Bank front a parliamentary committee to wrestle with what is driving record property price growth and what can be done about it.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: Inside inner-city Sydney's latest COVID-19 battleground
articles.description: The inner-city Sydney suburbs of Glebe, Redfern and Waterloo have been flagged as new areas of concern — and all have high populations of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander residents.
articles.author: Nakari Thorpe

articles.headline: First dose COVID vaccination rates in inner Darwin and Palmerston jump by 10 per cent in two weeks, new data shows
articles.description: New Australian government data shows first dose COVID-19 vaccination rates have shot past 90 per cent in Darwin's CBD and inner suburbs, but rates are still progressing at a crawl in some remote parts of the NT.
articles.author: Kate Ashton

articles.headline: Dozens of 'liquid gold' vaccine appointments vacant at Queensland Health hubs
articles.description: Data finds dozens of appointments at Queensland Health vaccination hubs and clinics are still vacant the day before, despite the push to increase the state's slow inoculation rates.
articles.author: Brittney Kleyn

articles.headline: For you, this house may cost $500k. For Habib, it's $546,000
articles.description: Buying a house in Hobart right now is hard. For Habib ur Rehman, it's even worse. That's because migrants face an 8 per cent surcharge on the cost of a home.
articles.author: Sarah Jane Bell

articles.headline: A sixth of NSW Health staff 'completely unvaccinated'
articles.description: One in six NSW Health staff are yet to have their first COVID-19 jab, despite a looming mandatory vaccination deadline, according to documents submitted to state Parliament.
articles.author: Kathleen Calderwood

articles.headline: Booker Prize shortlist: Americans dominate, one author makes history
articles.description: Nadifa Mohamed is the first British-Somali author to be shortlisted for the Booker Prize, joining a Pulitzer Prize winner and a first-time novelist, while big name authors Kazuo Ishiguro and Rachel Cusk miss out.
articles.author: Dee Jefferson

articles.headline: Will everyone need a COVID booster shot? Here's what we do (and don't) know
articles.description: There's still a lot to learn about COVID-19 booster vaccines. And then there's the billions of people globally who haven't received their first jab.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: Last year we were all in it together. This year COVID demands an agonising choice
articles.description: Economics is called the dismal science in part because it is about hard choices — situations where we can't have our cake and eat it too. We're about to see a lot more of them when it comes to COVID, writes Peter Martin
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: Online activity during COVID lockdowns sees surge in cyber attacks
articles.description: A cybercrime is now reported every eight minutes in Australia with criminals and spies taking advantage of large numbers of people working from home during COVID-19 lockdowns.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Stranded Adelaide couple plead for health authorities to let them come home
articles.description: A young Adelaide couple stranded in Broken Hill are pleading for SA Health to let them cross the border after their camping trip took a turn for the worse.
articles.author: Isabel Dayman and Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Trent Cotchin steps down as Richmond captain
articles.description: Cotchin will play on in 2022 but is handing over the reins following a decorated stint as Tigers captain, which includes three premierships.
articles.author: Isabel Dayman and Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Roosters hit with finals blow as Sam Verrills receives two-match suspension
articles.description: Sam Verrills will only play again this season if the Sydney Roosters qualify for the NRL grand final, after the judiciary upholds his grade-two careless high tackle charge.
articles.author: Isabel Dayman and Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: The new freedoms given to NSW aged care facilities and why some may not use them
articles.description: After suffering through nearly 12 weeks of another strict set of COVID-19 lockdown orders, some freedoms are being returned to aged care residents in NSW.
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: Inquiry shown video of 'extreme' bushfire tornado that flipped a fire truck, killing volunteer Samuel McPaul
articles.description: An inquiry hears how a fire tornado sucked smoke and flames six kilometres into the air into a whirling ball, created winds of more than 320 kilometres an hour and flipped a 10-tonne fire truck.
articles.author: Jessica Clifford

articles.headline: Rare raptors hatch but others fall prey to a fox in overnight raid
articles.description: Cameras show the vagaries of life for rare osprey chicks with two hatching successfully while two others are snatched by a fox.
articles.author: Jodie Hamilton and Emma Pedler

articles.headline: Rabbitohs brimming with confidence as they eye off first premiership in seven years
articles.description: The Rabbitohs, who are one win away from advancing to the grand final, feel they have the self-belief to claim the NRL premiership after beating the Panthers in the opening week of the play-offs.
articles.author: Chloe Hart

articles.headline: It takes a village: Ungarie community turns town hall into post office after death of local postmaster
articles.description: Residents in a regional NSW town take on the postal run after the death of the much-loved local postmaster.
articles.author: Melinda Hayter and Sally Bryant

articles.headline: 'They've cruelled this town': Border businesses say support package 'too late' to save some
articles.description: Despite fresh funding support for struggling businesses on the southern Gold Coast, many people fear it might be too late for some traders.
articles.author: Cathy Border, Alexandria Utting, and Tara Cassidy

articles.headline: AFL greats named to present premiership cup to winning team on grand final day
articles.description: Garry Lyon will hand over the cup to the Demons if they win the grand final in Perth, while Chris Grant will have the honour if the Bulldogs win the season decider.
articles.author: Cathy Border, Alexandria Utting, and Tara Cassidy

articles.headline: In pictures: How the world's sporting stars stole the spotlight at the Met Gala
articles.description: They may have been sporting some unfamiliar gear, but some of the world's top athletes were rubbing shoulders with the sartorial elite at one of the most extravagant events on the celebrity calendar.
articles.author: Tanisha Stanton

articles.headline: Snow industry on brink of collapse after second winter without trade
articles.description: Industry experts and retailers are concerned Australia's snow industry may not make it through to next year without significant aid from the state and federal governments, following a second winter without trade.
articles.author: Breanna Holden

articles.headline: 'Fire, explosions, rockfalls are recurring — why?': Mine safety expert warns against complacency
articles.description: There have been nine people killed in Queensland mining incidents since July 2018. Mine safety expert professor David Cliff says managing risks in the industry is complex.
articles.author: Erin Semmler

articles.headline: Disability carer's assaults only uncovered because father checked security vision on phone
articles.description: The family of a man with a disability who was assaulted by his carer said it took him six months to smile again after the incident, which was captured on home security footage.
articles.author: Matthew Smith

articles.headline: Star jockey Jamie Kah facing longer ban after misleading stewards about COVID breach
articles.description: Kah may be banned for up to five months after being found guilty of "wilfully" omitting details about a much-publicised gathering in Mornington, which was a breach of Victoria's lockdown protocols.
articles.author: Matthew Smith

articles.headline: SA teacher cries as she apologises for grooming high school student for sex
articles.description: Renee Underwood fronts the District Court charged with making a child amenable to sexual activity after earlier pleading guilty to the crime.
articles.author: Sarah Mullins

articles.headline: Two teen survivors of Launceston nurse sue health system
articles.description: Two teenage girls who were allegedly groomed and sexually abused by James Geoffrey Griffin sue the Tasmanian Health Service for failing to investigate the numerous complaints against him.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Third Big Bird bandit appears in court, bail curfew varied to allow work in hotel
articles.description: The third 'Big Bird bandit' appears in an Adelaide court over the theft of a $160,000 Big Bird costume.
articles.author: Matthew Smith

articles.headline: Brisbane school students tested for COVID-19 after allegedly mixing with locked-down teenagers
articles.description: Four students from Runcorn State High School and their families are isolating in the wake of the students allegedly mixing with locked-down teenagers from Sunnybank's St Thomas More College during a house party.
articles.author: Matthew Smith

articles.headline: Curtin University lobbies for retraction of unethical AI study on Uyghur facial recognition
articles.description: An Australian university implicated in unethical research using facial recognition technology to identify Uyghur and Tibetan minorities unsuccessfully lobbies for it to be retracted by publishers on multiple attempts.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: A dispute over $30 fuels axe assault on grandmother, court hears
articles.description: A 30-year-old man, who threatened a woman at a Mount Gambier park with a tomahawk axe over a $30 dispute, has received a six-month suspended sentence.
articles.author: Grace Whiteside

articles.headline: Gold medalist Ariarne Titmus receives superstar reception on hometown visit
articles.description: Olympic medalist Ariarne Titmus returns to Launceston to inspire the next generation of elite swimmers.
articles.author: Damian McIntyre

articles.headline: What happened to Gulf Livestock 1? Questions remain unanswered a year on from sunken live export ship
articles.description: It has been 12 months since a live export ship sank off the Japanese coast, but a number of details about the tragedy remain a mystery.
articles.author: Matt Brann

articles.headline: 'He pushed me': Aged care resident identified alleged killer before death, court hears
articles.description: A Canberra man accused of pushing a fellow nursing home resident, who broke her hip and later died from complications, stands trial in the ACT Supreme Court after pleading not guilty to manslaughter.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: 'I've never seen such a tight margin': Just two votes decide Alice Springs Mayor
articles.description: The Northern Territory Electoral Commissioner says he has never seen such a narrow result for such a high profile position, after the Alice Springs mayoral race was won by just two votes.
articles.author: Stewart Brash, Mitchell Abram, and Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Port Adelaide confirms interest in want-away Swan, open to move for GWS forward Jeremy Finlayson
articles.description: Port Adelaide confirms it has interest in want-away Swan Jordan Dawson, as pressure continues to grow on head coach Ken Hinkley.
articles.author: Camron Slessor

articles.headline: Mark McGowan's warning that SA 'may regret' border reopening prompts rebuke from Steven Marshall
articles.description: SA Premier Steven Marshall's decision to reopen borders to the eastern states once vaccination targets are reached could see the state's western border slammed shut, WA Premier Mark McGowan warns.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: Endangered fly with 'legs for days' named after drag queen RuPaul
articles.description: A luminous, long-legged soldier fly called Opaluma RuPaul is one of 150 new species named by the CSIRO in the past year.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: Fugitive on run for 30 years hands himself into police because life will be 'much easier' in prison
articles.description: Darko Desic, who broke out of Grafton jail 30 years ago, decides life will be "much easier" if he is behind bars again after the pandemic stripped him of work and left him homeless.
articles.author: Mark Reddie

articles.headline: 18yo man granted bail over alleged 'severe' group attack involving metal bat that left boy on life support
articles.description: The court was told police received an audio recording from the elevator in the building, which allegedly depicts the group "celebrating" after the alleged assault and referring to the child as "dead".
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Mice breeding fast for another plague after short winter respite
articles.description: Experts have significant concerns about the plague exploding again with mouse numbers reported in Queensland, NSW, Victoria and WA.
articles.author: Lucy Thackray and Lucy Robinson

articles.headline: Stoush brewing after regions abolished in planned overhaul of WA's 'broken' electoral system
articles.description: The McGowan Government endorses new rules which critics say will diminish the voice of the regions in State Parliament.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine and Jacob Kagi

articles.headline: Man dead after three-vehicle crash on Barton Highway
articles.description: Police confirm a man has died after a multi-vehicle collision on the Barton Highway in Canberra earlier today.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine and Jacob Kagi

articles.headline: California's recall election results are in: Newsom stays
articles.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom defeats an attempt to remove him from office, a move coming from disapproval of his pandemic policies.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine and Jacob Kagi

articles.headline: COVID-19 blamed for design delays on army's troubled $5b Boxer vehicles
articles.description: After first denying its largest-ever weapons project had a problem, Defence now says its Boxer fleet faces a 12-month delay.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: It's official — the flu did 'basically disappear' this year
articles.description: Before COVID-19 arrived, the number of influenza cases was soaring above 300,000. This year, there were less than 500.
articles.author: Melanie Vujkovic

articles.headline: Alfred Hospital, Ballarat building sites among latest on COVID-19 exposure list
articles.description: New tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites have been identified at The Alfred Hospital and building sites in Ballarat suburbs.
articles.author: Melanie Vujkovic

articles.headline: He's saved over 60,000 lives. Some want to stop him
articles.description: Oscar Camps was a lifeguard on the calm beaches of Barcelona. Then in a single day he saved more lives than in an entire career.
articles.author: Eric Campbell and Matt Henry

articles.headline: Former disability carer fined $15,000 over incident that left man with life-threatening injuries
articles.description: A former disability carer has been fined for breaching workplace health and safety laws over an incident that left a man with injuries that almost killed him.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: Children under 12 share their concerns as Australia attempts to open up without them vaccinated
articles.description: Australia's COVID-19 vaccination rollout is now in its next phase with 12 to 15-year-olds eligible for Pfizer, but younger children say they are worried they are not safe.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: Why Sydney's COVID-19 lockdown could end a week early for fully vaccinated people
articles.description: An ABC analysis shows NSW could reach its target of fully vaccinating 70 per cent of its population aged 16 and above as early as October 8 — something that would see its COVID-19 lockdown lifted a week ahead of schedule.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: With just two ways to flee Afghanistan, this is what it's like at one exit
articles.description: With the Taliban's flag flying over Afghanistan once again, there are only a handful of ways to slip out of the country. Those who make the treacherous journey to Torkham on the border must talk their way into Pakistan.
articles.author: Tom Joyner

articles.headline: As Australia burned, the oceans bloomed with algae feeding on the ashes
articles.description: Iron-rich ash and smoke from the Black Summer bushfires dropped from the atmosphere into the Southern Ocean, fuelling enormous blooms of algae between New Zealand and South America.
articles.author: Belinda Smith

articles.headline: Porter's 'blind trust' leaves more questions for Morrison to answer
articles.description: Porter's "disclosure" has raised far more questions than it has answered. It's created all-new political problems for the Morrison Government too, writes David Speers.
articles.author: David Speers

articles.headline: The stories of Australia's unemployment crisis: 'I noticed a decline the minute I turned 50'
articles.description: Finding work after being made redundant can already be a soul-destroying process — but it becomes crippling when you're facing further hurdles outside your control.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: Would you take a pay cut to keep working from home?
articles.description: Working from home is here to stay long after the COVID-19 pandemic, according to the federal government's key economic adviser, with a new report suggesting some people might even take a pay cut to remain in their home office.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell and Peter Ryan

articles.headline: Australia to get nuclear-powered submarines, scrap $90b plan to build French-designed subs
articles.description: The ABC understands Australia will use American and British technology to configure its next submarine fleet in a bid to replace its existing Collins class subs with a boat more suitable to the deteriorating strategic environment.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn, Stephen Dziedzic, and Andrew Greene

articles.headline: These foreign-owned retailers received millions in JobKeeper and doubled their profits
articles.description: Two of Australia's most recognisable retailers doubled their profits after claiming JobKeeper, new figures reveal.
articles.author: Dan Conifer

articles.headline: Judge awards parents $125k for birth of seventh child after failed sterilisation procedure
articles.description: A WA woman who gave birth to her seventh child after a failed sterilisation procedure is awarded $125,000, which includes less than $90,000 for raising the boy.
articles.author: Briana Shepherd

articles.headline: TGA threatens Craig Kelly with legal action over 'seriously misleading' COVID texts
articles.description: The nation's medical regulator demands rogue crossbencher Craig Kelly stop distributing "seriously misleading" information about COVID-19 vaccines.
articles.author: Jane Norman

articles.headline: Property value evidence thrown out in windfarm court battle
articles.description: Two men are seeking damages from the Bald Hills Wind Farm in Victoria's south-east, claiming it has affected land prices while turbine noise is also a nuisance.
articles.author: Emma Field

articles.headline: Growing dissatisfaction with federal politics sees Coalition seats under threat from independents
articles.description: The next federal election is set to see a new wave of independents fight for safe Coalition seats, as discontent with the major political parties grows.
articles.author: Emma Field

articles.headline: WA's South West lives up to its 'seismically active' reputation
articles.description: Scientists have recorded more than 1,100 earthquakes in Western Australia's South West over a recent eight-month period.
articles.author: Madina Jaffari

articles.headline: Inmates sue NT government and Correctional Services over treatment after Darwin prison riot
articles.description: Two prisoners allegedly involved in a riot at the Darwin Correctional Centre last year commence legal action, claiming they were subjected to assault, battery and false imprisonment in the aftermath.
articles.author: Melissa Mackay

articles.headline: Shepparton locals share a message of hope as Ballarat prepares to re-enter lockdown
articles.description: For weeks, it's been quiet on the streets of Shepparton, but now that's about to change – much to the relief of its residents.
articles.author: Ellen Coulter and Kirsten Robb

articles.headline: Can the Wallabies win consecutive Tests for the first time in two seasons?
articles.description: The Wallabies took on the physical Springboks and won last weekend on the Gold Coast. The challenge this Saturday is to do something they’re yet to achieve under coach Dave Rennie — win back-to-back Test matches, writes Brett McKay.
articles.author: Brett McKay

articles.headline: BOM says La Niña's now an even chance to reign again this summer
articles.description: It's looking like a cool, wet summer — again — for much of the country with a good chance of the return of La Niña, amid other key indicators, say forecasters.
articles.author: Kate Doyle

articles.headline: Ex-partner of former minister Adam Brooks gets extension of interim family violence order
articles.description: Adam Brooks' ex-partner has been granted an extension of an interim family violence order against him. In court, the woman alleged the former politician stalked and harassed her and entered her home without permission.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Drivers are challenging Victoria's electric vehicle tax, arguing it may be unconstitutional
articles.description: Electric vehicle owners are taking action in the High Court against a levy introduced by the Victorian government.
articles.author: Margaret Paul

articles.headline: Roosters put faith in rookie hooker for NRL semi-final clash with Sea Eagles
articles.description: Sydney Roosters coach Trent Robinson backs reserve grade hooker Ben Marschke to be up to the task in Friday night's semi-final.
articles.author: Margaret Paul

articles.headline: Northern Australia Minister David Littleproud criticises NT's stage 3 roadmap
articles.description: Federal Northern Australia Minister David Littleproud says the Northern Territory government's decision to launch its own stage 3 COVID roadmap adds to inconsistency across the country.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Memory lapse or new nickname? Joe Biden calls Scott Morrison 'that fella Down Under'
articles.description: It might have been an awkward fumble or just a term of endearment, but having Joe Biden give Scott Morrison a new name is not the most embarrassing thing that's happened to an Australian leader in the US.
articles.author: Rebecca Armitage

articles.headline: 'When a vet tells me to vaccinate a horse, I vaccinate a horse': Victorian racing industry to mandate COVID-19 vaccine for staff
articles.description: Horse racing spectators are not yet required to be vaccinated to attend races despite an industry-wide mandate to all staff to be vaccinated by the end of November.
articles.author: Emma Field, Shannon Schubert, and Kimberley Price

articles.headline: Immigration Minister to issue further bridging visas to Biloela Tamil family
articles.description: An Australian government barrister says the Immigration Minister intends to issue further three-month bridging visas to Priya, Nades, and Kopika Muruguppan next Thursday.
articles.author: Erin Semmler

articles.headline: Taiwan plans $11 billion boost in defence spending as it warns of 'severe threat' from China
articles.description: Taiwan's government is proposing extra defence spending over the next five years, warning of an urgent need to upgrade the nation's weapons in the face of a "severe threat" from neighbouring China.
articles.author: Erin Semmler

articles.headline: Targa rally report into triple fatality calls for speeds to be reined in to avoid 'further deaths'
articles.description: A report into three deaths during the Targa Tasmania rally earlier this year makes recommendations including dramatic changes to the route and warns the cost of the race will rise significantly.
articles.author: Erin Semmler

articles.headline: How Victoria's COVID restrictions will change this weekend
articles.description: There are slight changes to COVID restrictions for Victorians on the way. Here are the changes coming into effect from 11:59pm Friday.
articles.author: Erin Semmler

articles.headline: Former sex worker choked and threatened to kill MP after long-term relationship, court told
articles.description: A former Perth sex worker allegedly choked and threatened to kill an ex-politician with whom she had a long term relationship, a Perth court is told.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh and Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Morrison has gone nuclear — and there's no turning back
articles.description: The geostrategic wrestle between Washington and Beijing is one for the ages and Australia is now to play an even bigger role — in a stealthier and speedier bit of nuclear kit, writes Andrew Probyn.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn

articles.headline: Doctor in jail on attempted murder charges banned from practising medicine for the rest of his life
articles.description: A doctor who is serving a prison sentence for the attempted murder of a pharmacist has been banned from practising for the rest of his life, in the longest sanction ever imposed in Australia.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Murray border communities plead to be treated as one
articles.description: State governments have promised throughout the pandemic that border communities will be treated as one, but few people are feeling that it has been honoured.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Sly-grog laws unveiled to target illegal liquor trade in WA
articles.description: From this weekend, police will have right to seize and destroy alcohol carried in cars in Western Australia's north.
articles.author: Erin Parke and Ted O'Connor

articles.headline: Brad Scott out of the running to be Carlton head coach after taking up key AFL role
articles.description: The former North Melbourne mentor, who had been linked to the vacant Blues coaching position, takes a job in the AFL's football operations department.
articles.author: Erin Parke and Ted O'Connor

articles.headline: Police charge 15 men over 'large consensual fight' with clubs and swords in suburban Brisbane street
articles.description: Police say the men are aged between 29 and 36 and have been taken into custody and charged with affray. Several men are also facing more serious charges.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Alanis Morissette hits out at 'salacious' documentary about her life
articles.description: Alanis Morissette calls the HBO documentary Jagged, which she participated in, "reductive" and "salacious" just hours before the film's premiere at a film festival.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Mayor's 'genocide' comparison slammed as 'disgusting' by Deputy Premier
articles.description: John Barilaro has criticised the Broken Hill mayor Darriea Turley after she equated inadequate COVID planning as "tantamount to a genocide".
articles.author: Bill Ormonde, Callum Marshall, and Bension Siebert

articles.headline: They're silent and stealthy, but not always nimble. Why does Australia want nuclear submarines?
articles.description: Australia has announced a plan to make the Navy's next submarine fleet nuclear-powered. So what's so special about these subs — and why are we doing this?
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: Last tickets sell out within minutes for Perth AFL grand final amid fears over stadium staffing
articles.description: The final tickets to the first-ever Perth AFL grand final sell out within minutes, as the venue puts out an urgent call for 600 extra workers to cope with the capacity crowd.
articles.author: Tom Wildie

articles.headline: The grave of women's rights activist Jessie Rooke was lying in disrepair, then Harvey came along
articles.description: Harvey Jones has been restoring graves along Tasmania's north-west coast for the past 15 years, his latest project has been to bring new life to the headstone of women's rights activist Jessie Rooke.
articles.author: Jessica Moran

articles.headline: 16yo critical after 9m fall from Gold Coast balcony
articles.description: The 16-year-old's friends carried him back up two flights of stairs and paramedics weren't called for 45 minutes, by a stranger.
articles.author: Heidi Sheehan and Tara Cassidy

articles.headline: Remembering Australia's 'audacious' first scheduled air service 100 years on
articles.description: A century after Sir Norman Brearley led the first scheduled air service, bringing a lifeline to some of the most remote and rugged parts of the country, his feat is being celebrated.
articles.author: Samille Mitchell

articles.headline: Opening WBBL games move to Tasmania
articles.description: Cricket Australia announces the first fortnight of the Women's Big Bash League will be played in Tasmania due to mainland COVID-19 outbreaks.
articles.author: Samille Mitchell

articles.headline: How an awkward conversation over Christmas lunch unlocked a family's dark colonial legacy
articles.description: In a search for answers about his family history, Sam Carmody hears stories so disturbing that they have implications for an entire region, where his ancestors have a statue, a highway and even a town named after them.
articles.author: Samuel Carmody, Anthony Pancia, and Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: How voluntary assisted dying will work in Queensland
articles.description: Queensland's Parliament has just legalised voluntary assisted dying. Who is eligible, who can opt out and how does the law protect them? Here are the facts as set down by the legislation.
articles.author: Kate McKenna

articles.headline: COVID going undetected in NSW border zone because of home septic tanks
articles.description: Thousands of residents in the New South Wales border zone are not being monitored via sewage testing for COVID-19 infections due to their use of home septic tank systems.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: Nuclear sub deal sees Australia 'strategically naked' for 20 years
articles.description: Former prime ministers on both sides of politics are calling for a rapid acceleration in the building of a fleet of nuclear-powered submarines, with claims Australia will otherwise be left "strategically naked" for the next two decades.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Friday News Quiz: Do you remember all the headlines from earlier this week?
articles.description: Will you be proud of your score this week or will it make you want to hide your face like a certain Met Gala guest? Test yourself.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Hundreds of Australians stuck in New Zealand as National Cabinet examines home quarantine for overseas arrivals
articles.description: As more than 400 Australians wait to return home, National Cabinet looks to home quarantine for a solution.
articles.author: Jade Macmillan

articles.headline: For the first time, AFL Grand Final contested by two clubs with female presidents
articles.description: On September 25, either Melbourne or the Western Bulldogs will become the second club with a female president to win a flag.
articles.author: Georgie Tunny

articles.headline: International students work on COVID-19 frontline. Is it exploitation?
articles.description: The federal government has lifted working caps for international students in "essential sectors" during the pandemic, but some students and advocates say the change is exploitative.
articles.author: Georgie Tunny

articles.headline: As Victoria's months ahead come into focus, these issues could be game changers
articles.description: Employers' liability in the event of a worker's COVID-19 death and the chance of hospitality venues opening in time for the AFL grand final are some of the issues Victorian residents are businesses are the state's roadmap will provide clarity on.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: US raises concerns about China's economic coercion of Australia
articles.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken raises concerns about China's use of economic coercion against Australia.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: 'I never really understood the danger I was in': Rosie Batty joins new campaign to prevent coercive control
articles.description: Former Australian of the Year Rosie Batty is joining a coalition of family violence organisations and advocates calling for prevention to be at the heart of national solutions to coercive control — regardless of whether or not it is criminalised.
articles.author: Hayley Gleeson

articles.headline: 'Crikey!': Schoolkids' fossil find turns out to be new species of giant penguin
articles.description: A fossil collected by school children in 2006 on the west coast of New Zealand's North Island is a new species of extinct giant penguin that lived around 30 million years ago.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: From the seas to space, China is ramping up its military might — and Australia's position is now clear
articles.description: The announcement of a historic partnership between Australia, the UK, and the US to share nuclear submarines is likely to draw the ire of China. But are we ready for a showdown, asks Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: 'A stab in the back': French anger with Australia over cancelled submarine deal
articles.description: France's Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian lashes out at Australia's decision to cancel a $90 billion submarine deal, saying that "trust has been broken".
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: 'This intensifies the arms race': China slams AUKUS pact as Abbott warns China is a 'common danger'
articles.description: China's foreign ministry hits out at the AUKUS pact for nuclear submarines as a threat to regional peace, while former Australian PM Tony Abbott says it is the 'biggest decision' made by an Australian government in decades.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Four arrested at Sydney cemetery amid calls for more compassionate approach to funerals
articles.description: Mourners at Rookwood Cemetery say they were treated unfairly and would like to see some exemptions surrounding funerals for communities in hard-hit Western Sydney after police were called over breaches to health orders.
articles.author: Kathleen Calderwood

articles.headline: Social media videos spark Illegal hunting charges
articles.description: Wagga Wagga man charged with illegal hunting offences after probe is sparked by videos posted on social media.
articles.author: Isadora Bogle

articles.headline: Northern Territory Police investigating Tiwi Island death
articles.description: A team of detectives travel to the remote Aboriginal community,  about 80 kilometres north of Darwin, to investigate the death of a 32-year-old man.
articles.author: Isadora Bogle

articles.headline: An Indigenous prisoner and sexual assault victim had her human rights breached during strip search, review finds
articles.description: A review into an incident at Canberra's jail where an Indigenous woman was forcibly strip-searched has found that she had her human rights violated.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: Rocket catches fire during latest lift-off attempt on SA's Eyre Peninsula
articles.description: An anticipated rocket launch on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula has again been delayed after the rocket caught fire — but the company involved says the blaze was contained to the launch pad.
articles.author: Evelyn Leckie and Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: Wondering why people are talking about nuclear submarines? Here are the basics
articles.description: Are you wondering why there's so much fuss about Australia's decision to acquire nuclear submarines? Here's what you need to know.
articles.author: Evelyn Leckie and Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: French forces kill IS Sahel jihadist leader wanted by US
articles.description: The head of Islamic State in the Greater Sahara, who was wanted for deadly attacks on US soldiers and foreign aid workers, is killed in an operation by French troops.
articles.author: Evelyn Leckie and Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: Susanne lives in the shadow of SA's naval hub, and is nervous about nuclear subs being made nearby
articles.description: Residents on Adelaide's Lefevre Peninsula — home to the nation's naval construction hub — have mixed feelings about the federal government's new nuclear submarine deal.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin and Gabriella Marchant

articles.headline: Shayna Jack free to return to swimming after CAS dismisses appeal
articles.description: Jack can return to competitive swimming immediately, as the Court of Arbitration for Sport dismisses the appeal lodged by the World Anti-Doping Agency and Sport Integrity Australia.
articles.author: Tracey Holmes

articles.headline: 'Get on your knees': Inquiry told female mine worker allegedly propositioned for sex at Rio, FMG
articles.description: Astacia Stevens alleges men on several mine sites asked her for sexual favours in exchange for career advancement. She declined, is on maternity leave and is scared to go back.
articles.author: Eliza Borrello and Eliza Laschon

articles.headline: Private school teacher charged with child exploitation offences
articles.description: Police charge a Sunshine Coast man after spending nine months combing through his electronic devices.
articles.author: Jacqui Street and Jake Kearnan

articles.headline: Let's talk about the final season of Brooklyn Nine-Nine
articles.description: The writers leaned into the headlines about police brutality and institutional racism while trying to maintain the light-hearted spirit.
articles.author: Paul Donoughue

articles.headline: Nuclear subs have 'long history of accidents', environmentalist warns
articles.description: Environmentalists are concerned by the public safety implications of Australia developing nuclear-powered submarines — but the retired naval officer who chaired SA's nuclear royal commission says the risks can be managed.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: 'Gross breach of trust': Judge jails travel agent who stole to fuel pokies habit
articles.description: A pokies-addicted travel agent is jailed for pilfering refunds from travellers who cancelled their holidays because of the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: 'Nobody should be forced to have a vaccine': Paramedic's legal challenge
articles.description: A NSW paramedic's Supreme Court challenge to a COVID vaccine mandate may not be heard before it's due to take effect.
articles.author: Isadora Bogle and Emily Doak

articles.headline: Teen jailed over COVID-19 medi-hotel breach in Adelaide
articles.description: A Sydney teen who tried to leave an Adelaide medi-hotel to get fresh air has been jailed for breaching COVID-19 directions.
articles.author: Candice Prosser

articles.headline: Porter's future as Minister increasingly uncertain after decision to accept mystery funds to cover part of his legal bills
articles.description: Embattled Cabinet Minister Christian Porter's future on the frontbench is looking increasingly uncertain, with the Prime Minister offering no defence of his decision to accept mystery funds to cover his legal bills.
articles.author: Jane Norman

articles.headline: 'It's not enough': Drug-affected driver who killed a WA mum, son sentenced to nine years' jail
articles.description: A WA family is still grieving after a drug-affected truck driver was jailed for causing a late-night crash that killed a young mother, her 10-year-old son and seriously injured her three other children.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: StarTrack truck drivers to strike for 24 hours next week, as Australia Post struggles with record volume of parcels
articles.description: StarTrack truck drivers are striking for 24 hours next week, claiming standards are being driven down across the industry.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Taliban thanks world for $1b in aid, says US needs 'to have a big heart'
articles.description: The country's new government includes some of the United States' most-wanted terrorists, and donors worry about legitimising the hardline Islamist group.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Man accused of having 'desire to inflict pain and suffering' in massive suburban street brawl granted bail
articles.description: Court documents alleged the five men charged with grievous bodily harm were "all united against a believed common enemy" and that Maan Singh had "significant emotional involvement".
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: After-school appointments offered to students and staff in new plan to boost vaccination in WA schools
articles.description: A rolling school-based vaccination program will begin in Term 4, making it easier for WA students and staff to get a COVID-19 jab.
articles.author: Eliza Laschon

articles.headline: At 101, Virginia Oliver says she has no plans to retire from catching lobsters
articles.description: The oldest lobster catcher in the US state of Maine says there is no place she would rather be than working on the water.
articles.author: Eliza Laschon

articles.headline: This shire in regional WA has backflipped on cash incentives for staff to get vaccinated
articles.description: The Shire of Manjimup will discuss the incentive program at a council meeting after the decision was met with backlash from the local community.
articles.author: Eliza Laschon

articles.headline: South Australia's home quarantine trial expands to overseas travellers
articles.description: South Australia's home quarantine trial, which uses a facial recognition app, will ramp up next month with up to 250 households to be managed each week.
articles.author: Sara Garcia

articles.headline: NSW's rules for returning international travellers will change soon — this is what you need to know
articles.description: Sydney is taking the first steps to regaining its status as an international city, with plans for some overseas arrivals to skip hotel quarantine for the first time in 18 months.
articles.author: Maryanne Taouk

articles.headline: Mexico raffles off safe house where El Chapo escaped from marines
articles.description: El Chapo escaped through a tunnel hidden beneath the bathtub when Mexican marines surrounded the house in 2014.
articles.author: Maryanne Taouk

articles.headline: 'Historic is an understatement': Excitement builds ahead of NRL semi-finals in Mackay
articles.description: The first of two historic NRL semi-finals will be played tonight in the rugby league-loving north Queensland city.
articles.author: Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: Three-day-old baby Zamia could have been saved if homebirth was refused, inquest finds
articles.description: A baby who died three days after a homebirth on the Gold Coast in 2018 could have been saved had she been born in a hospital, a Queensland Coroner has found.
articles.author: Kimberley Bernard

articles.headline: Stephanie's older boyfriend pushed her into 'increasingly demeaning' sex. She didn't know how to say no
articles.description: Stephanie thought sexual assault was a stranger jumping out from a bush in a park to attack. Then she realised it could be somebody "pushing you and pushing you" until you said yes.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Adelaide man sentenced over 'vile' abuse of Cambodian children
articles.description: An Adelaide man who sexually assaulted children in Cambodia has been sentenced to eight years in prison.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Melbourne Demons keep sick coach Simon Goodwin away from players
articles.description: Melbourne's grand final preparations hit a hurdle, with coach Simon Goodwin and his assistant Adam Yze falling ill and kept away from training a week out from the big game.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Australian Wool Innovation preparing to commercialise WoolQ online market platform
articles.description: The company says it is preparing to commercialise a part of WoolQ, its online wool market platform that woolgrowers have criticised as a waste of industry levy funds.
articles.author: Luke Wong

articles.headline: That's the spirit: Winemaker, distiller come together for muscat gin collaboration
articles.description: A north-east winemaker and distiller are refusing to let regional Victoria's lockdowns dampen their creative mindset.
articles.author: Annie Brown

articles.headline: Olympic gold medallist Emilee Cherry forges a new path in coaching
articles.description: With an Olympic gold medal and 31 caps for Australia, Emilee Cherry felt lost when she retired from playing rugby. Now she's part of a move to bring more female coaches into elite sport.
articles.author: Daniela Intili

articles.headline: New to Australia? Here are the culture shocks no-one tells you about
articles.description: From the lack of homework at school, to ferocious possums — here are six things that shock migrants most about Australia.
articles.author: Wing Kuang and Prianka Srinivasan

articles.headline: What impact does the nuclear option have on Australian submarine contractors and jobs?
articles.description: There are two overwhelming reactions from the local defence industry to this week's announcement that Australia will tear up its contract with Naval Group and build either US or UK designed nuclear submarines instead. One is relief, the other fear.
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: Research discovery suggests AFL pioneer Tom Wills participated in massacres of Indigenous people
articles.description: Tom Wills was Australia's first great sportsman and helped invent Australian Rules football. But a startling discovery suggests he took part in the mass murder of Aboriginal people.
articles.author: Russell Jackson

articles.headline: 'You will face a hefty fine': People told to stay away from central Melbourne ahead of anti-lockdown protest
articles.description: Public transport is suspended in central Melbourne as police attempt to disrupt planned anti-lockdown protests.
articles.author: Leanne Wong

articles.headline: Daylight saving was originally brought in to reduce power use. But does it?
articles.description: Australia's three time zones will soon become five as daylight saving time kicks in.  So, does the "saving" part of daylight saving time still hold up today?
articles.author: Belinda Smith

articles.headline: What if you really can't be vaccinated? Grant and Heather have a long wait to see what happens
articles.description: People with a history of serious allergic reactions to medication and vaccine ingredients say they've been struggling to get an appointment with their specialist as Australia moves closer to opening up.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: Long-standing shibboleths have been demolished — and Morrison isn't looking back
articles.description: This week's moves – the announcement that Australia may build submarines with US and British technology and news of more US troops rotated here – fundamentally change our relationship with the world, writes Laura Tingle.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Carlton receives much-needed boost after snaring former Geelong CEO
articles.description: Brian Cook joins Carlton as its new chief executive following a brilliant administrative career at the Cats, as the Blues looks to rebuild themselves on and off the field.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Lawyer charged with fraud and conspiracy after planning own murder for $13 million payout
articles.description: A lawyer in the US is charged with planning his own murder to enrich his son, after battling depression in the wake of his wife's shooting death.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: New Zealand calls off Pakistan cricket tour citing 'security concerns'
articles.description: New Zealand postpones its cricket tour of Pakistan over security concerns that mystified the hosts, just days before the Black Caps' first scheduled match in Pakistan in 18 years.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Penrith dealt injury blow with To'o ruled out of semi-final against Parramatta
articles.description: Outstanding winger Brian To'o is sidelined with an ankle injury, as the Panthers look to keep their premiership campaign on track following the shock loss to the Rabbitohs.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: SA police raid alternative community meeting alleging group becoming 'ideological and erratic'
articles.description: A 53-year-old man has been refused bail following his arrest during a police raid in Adelaide's south. Police allege he is part of a group that is becoming increasingly ideological and erratic.
articles.author: Eric Tlozek

articles.headline: Tom Trbojevic scores double as Sea Eagles hammer Roosters to advance to NRL preliminary finals
articles.description: Trbojevic is at his scintillating best against the Roosters in Mackay, as the Sea Eagles post a 42-6 win to reach their first preliminary final since 2013.
articles.author: Eric Tlozek

articles.headline: 'We were deliberately ignored': French Ambassador found out about submarine deal through the media
articles.description: The French Ambassador accuses Australia of deliberately keeping his country in the dark over a decision to scrap a $90 billion submarine contract.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn

articles.headline: Chinese astronauts return to earth after 90 days on space station
articles.description: Three Chinese astronauts are spending their first night on Earth in three months after completing the longest mission in the country's space program.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn

articles.headline: 'This will be a staged farce': Chinese embassy unhappy with Australia-US joint statement
articles.description: The Chinese embassy in Canberra has accused Australia and the US of making "erroneous accusations" against China in a joint statement. The exchange comes a day after the announcement of the AUKUS deal.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn

articles.headline: Why this Brisbane scientist is one of the world's 100 most influential people
articles.description: Professor Lidia Morawska is named by Time magazine as one of the 100 most influential people in the world for helping highlight the airborne spread of COVID-19.
articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

articles.headline: Iron ore safe for now amid China ruckus over subs, but experts warn on long-term outlook
articles.description: While China's scathing reaction to Australia's nuclear submarine deal is unlikely to translate into short-term trade sanctions, experts caution some exports — including iron ore — may come under threat in the long term.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: Bettongs, nature's soil engineers, thriving on the Yorke Peninsula
articles.description: A group of brush-tailed bettongs sent from an island off the SA coast is flourishing.
articles.author: Gillian Aeria

articles.headline: Outback ingenuity on display as vaccination clock ticks for Delta
articles.description: Northern communities are getting creative as urgency builds to get Indigenous people in remote areas vaccinated before the WA border reopens.
articles.author: Erin Parke

articles.headline: Coal power waste could help to create jobs in this mining town
articles.description: A new recipe for concrete isn't just about finding a use for coal combustion waste buried in Collie — it could also create local jobs.
articles.author: Kate Stephens

articles.headline: Police arrest offender involved in fatal hit and run at Browns Plains in Logan
articles.description: Queensland police say they've arrested a 20-year-old-man who allegedly hit and killed a man in a road rage incident south of Brisbane.
articles.author: Nibir Khan and Baz Ruddick

articles.headline: Melbourne man spends $280,000 on a tent site that he can't visit
articles.description: How much would you pay for a tent site with no mains power, water or sewerage on a remote island?
articles.author: Phil Brandel

articles.headline: 'Absolute spirit lifters': How four-year-olds are creating joy with seniors
articles.description: A program connecting seniors and children, which is being credited with mending broken hearts, creating intergenerational connections and improving IT skills, is expanding in Queensland.
articles.author: Kylie Bartholomew and Sheridan Stewart

articles.headline: The average Aussie eats six kilos of bacon every year, but where does it come from?
articles.description: Almost 50 per cent of Australians have bought bacon in the past week, but research shows most don't realise that what they think is local produce is often imported.
articles.author: Kylie Bartholomew and Sheridan Stewart

articles.headline: ACT records 15 new COVID-19 cases as Barr says new Doherty modelling shows opening at 70 per cent 'not prudent'
articles.description: The ACT has recorded 15 new COVID-19 cases, at least seven of which spent part of their infectious period in the community and eight currently unlinked to other known cases or clusters.
articles.author: Charlotte Gore

articles.headline: Federal Labor staffer charged with two counts of rape
articles.description: Alexander Matters, 20, who works for ACT federal Labor MP David Smith, is charged with two counts of rape, over an incident alleged to have taken place in April this year.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Robert Durst found guilty of murdering best friend
articles.description: Durst, a multimillionaire real estate heir who was the subject of documentary series The Jinx, is also suspected of killing two other people in the US.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: NSW records 1,331 COVID-19 cases and six deaths as state runs Indigenous vaccine blitz
articles.description: NSW Police prevent another anti-lockdown protest from taking place in Sydney's inner-west as the state records 1,331 new COVID-19 cases and six deaths.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Australia is sitting on a seriously valuable crop of canola
articles.description: The ducks are lining up for Australian canola growers, as Canada starts harvesting one of its poorest crops in years.
articles.author: Matt Brann and Joanna Prendergast

articles.headline: One new COVID case in Queensland as large numbers turn out at vaccination hubs
articles.description: One new locally acquired case of COVID-19 is recorded in Queensland overnight, as high numbers of people gather at vaccination hubs for today's major push on Pfizer jabs.
articles.author: Matt Brann and Joanna Prendergast

articles.headline: Sunshine Coast brothers ride into US motocross history
articles.description: Jett and Hunter Lawrence both finish in the top three of the US motocross championship standings, and make history.
articles.author: Jake Kearnan

articles.headline: Biennial World Cup proposals slammed
articles.description: German and Portuguese national football federations attack FIFA plans for a biennial World Cup, claiming players would suffer and women's tournaments would be marginalised.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: For Nadine, going to boarding school is 'pretty cool', but experts worry other Indigenous kids are missing out
articles.description: Experts warn the COVID-19 pandemic could send Closing the Gap targets backwards as the Australian Boarding School Association reveals the number of Indigenous students attending boarding schools in SA has almost halved.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: Bumper wildflower season in outback sets deserts blooming
articles.description: Alice Springs Desert Park has been bursting with flashes of colourful outcrops of wildflowers thanks to perfect rainfall conditions earlier in the year.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: When 9/11 happened, I spent eight hours in a Washington bunker thinking about my baby son on the other side of the world
articles.description: ABC cameraman David McMeekin was travelling with former prime minister John Howard in Washington on September 11, 2001. Twenty years on, he recalls a harrowing experience documenting the aftermath of the terror attacks.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Victoria records 535 new COVID cases and one death as contact tracers 'under pressure'
articles.description: Victoria records 535 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases and one further death as the state wakes to a slight easing of restrictions.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Vending machines bring safe, cheap water to Nairobi slums
articles.description: Mukuru residents will soon be able to source clean water from vending machines that the city government is installing in an effort to ease the slum's water stress.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: 'A declaration of war': Farming groups call out 'parasitic' alternative-meat labelling
articles.description: Vegan and animal rights groups have hit back at claims plant-based meat products are misleading consumers, arguing the government should be promoting the industry.
articles.author: Hugh Hogan

articles.headline: 'How can we trust Australia?': Government braces for EU backlash over France submarines
articles.description: Senior figures in France are hinting at possible economic repercussions after the federal government's decision to walk away from a $90 billion submarine contract with the European nation.
articles.author: James Glenday

articles.headline: Federal government chose not to stockpile COVID treatment despite being warned of likely global shortage
articles.description: The peak body of immunologists and allergists last year urged the government to stock up on Tocilizumab, marketed as Actemra. Now arthritis sufferers are struggling to access the drug because it is being used to treat COVID.
articles.author: Dan Oakes

articles.headline: The X-factor: Why Australia's fate is tied to China's Xi Jinping
articles.description: China is a great power and demands to be treated as such. It is clearly not a democracy but that doesn't mean its rise is not legitimate, writes Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: I used to drink until I passed out so I could forget my  past. Then I got a cat
articles.description: When I was recovering from a devastating sexual assault, my cat helped me to feel things again. He helped me feel things that were stronger than my urge to die, writes Lucia Osborne-Crowley.
articles.author: Lucia Osborne-Crowley

articles.headline: As a psychologist, this is how I navigate difficult decisions around kids and COVID
articles.description: There is a new variant of Monday-itis. The symptoms may include the endless roundabout of decision-making about what's safe for kids, writes Brittany McGill.
articles.author: Lucia Osborne-Crowley

articles.headline: How did the global solar boom end up in China, not Australia? 'Tinpot companies' and hope
articles.description: Twenty years ago, Australia appeared set to be a global player in the solar panel manufacturing industry. Today, with panels in high demand, we hardly make any of them. Here's how we lost our head start.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Picnics, teen vaccines and a flattening curve — but it all depends on where you live
articles.description: There was a palpable sense this week that Australia’s strategy to tackle the third COVID wave had at last clocked up some small wins and momentum was building. But there is a long way to go.
articles.author: Catherine Taylor

articles.headline: Meet the frontline healthcare workers driving the COVID response among our most vulnerable
articles.description: Meet some of the frontline healthcare workers treating COVID patients in homeless, remote and diverse community settings.
articles.author: Ahmed Yussuf

articles.headline: Experts add weight to implication of sporting hero Tom Wills in mass murder of Indigenous people
articles.description: Biographers and frontier violence experts add legitimacy to an archival newspaper discovery that suggests Australian Rules football pioneer Tom Wills participated in a massacre of Indigenous people in 1861.
articles.author: Russell Jackson

articles.headline: Popular tourist spots across Asia-Pacific are reopening, but risks remain
articles.description: Popular tourist destinations like Phuket, Fiji and Bali are looking to reopen their borders to foreign travellers experimenting with various programs intended to contain future outbreaks.
articles.author: Russell Jackson

articles.headline: What happens once you escape the Taliban's clutches? This is life inside a secret safe house
articles.description: In an unremarkable home, unlikely housemates share the same fear — 'Maybe the Taliban will find us'.
articles.author: Tom Joyner

articles.headline: Leading epidemiologist weighs in as Victoria awaits roadmap out of sixth lockdown
articles.description: A leading epidemiologist has warned Victorians to temper their expectations ahead of the state government's roadmap reveal, saying case numbers will continue to shape the state's future.
articles.author: Tom Joyner

articles.headline: Malaysia warns Australia nuclear sub project could 'provoke other powers' in Asia
articles.description: Malaysia joins criticism of Australia's plan to build nuclear-powered submarines, warning it could spark a renewed arms race in the region, while the diplomatic crisis with France sparked by the decision continues to escalate.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Taliban seizes women's ministry building for new 'preaching and guidance' ministry
articles.description: Afghanistan's new Taliban rulers set up a ministry for the "propagation of virtue and the prevention of vice" in the building that once housed the women's affairs ministry, escorting out World Bank staffers as part of the forced move.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Former Knight McManus misses out on NRL concussion compensation
articles.description: Former Newcastle Knights winger James McManus walks away empty-handed in his $1 million concussion claim against the NRL club.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Panthers survive gritty semi-final against Eels to set up clash with Storm
