articles.description: Acting Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce denounces anti-vaxxers and far-right extremists who took part in this week's Melbourne protests, particularly at the Shrine of Remembrance.
articles.author: Leigh Sales, Myles Wearring, and Jenny Ky

articles.headline: Former FIFO worker speaks out as mining industry's treatment of women faces scrutiny
articles.description: The treatment of women in Australia’s mining industry is under the spotlight, and one former FIFO worker is opening up about her experience.
articles.author: Angelique Donnellan and Hannah Sinclair

articles.headline: Victoria Park psychologist guilty of murdering neighbour and her brother in frenzied stab attack
articles.description: Luke David Fawcett, who rehearsed the attack on his neighbour Marie Collins, and recorded footage on his phone, is found guilty of murdering her and her brother.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: 'Horseplay' manslaughter trial jury told to set aside 'natural' empathy for accused
articles.description: The court heard Dane McLennan, 28, was scuffling with a friend of his father's after a golf day in 2019 when "disaster" struck.
articles.author: Richard Crabtree

articles.headline: WA shire's ex-CEO says he'll pay back alleged sex worker spending: shire president
articles.description: Cash-strapped country council desperate to recover $55,000 its former chief executive allegedly paid Ms E for sexual services, says the "devastated" shire president.
articles.author: John Dobson

articles.headline: Bulldogs recall Keath, Weightman for grand final as Demons remain unchanged
articles.description: Alex Keath and Cody Weightman make expected returns to the Bulldogs' line-up for the season decider, with Ryan Gardner and Laitham Vandermeer dropped.
articles.author: John Dobson

articles.headline: New gas plan for Central Queensland could create 5,500 jobs
articles.description: But environmental activists warn the plan to open two new gas basins could impact water supplies for farmers.
articles.author: Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: Three men sentenced over their roles in deadly nightclub brawl won't spend more time in jail
articles.description: Three men caught up in a brawl at Kokomo's nightclub that claimed the life of former Canberra Comanchero commander Pitasoni Ulavalu will not spend more time in jail.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: 'It's incredibly frustrating': Mayor angry after couple flout stay-at-home orders
articles.description: Kempsey Shire Mayor Liz Campbell is urging people to obey public health orders after close contacts of a confirmed COVID-19 case are caught in a nearby council area.
articles.author: Kate Aubrey and Luisa Rubbo

articles.headline: 'We have faith that this can one day make him a better man'
articles.description: Moving scenes in a central Queensland courtroom as a family says it bears no grudge towards the man who killed their son.
articles.author: Jasmine Hines and Tobias Jurss-Lewis

articles.headline: UK woman with Down syndrome loses fight against 'discriminatory' abortion laws
articles.description: A British woman with Down syndrome loses her fight against laws that allow the abortion of a foetus with the condition or other potential disabilities up until birth.
articles.author: Jasmine Hines and Tobias Jurss-Lewis

articles.headline: NT Chief Minister labels Federal Senator an 'anti-vaxxer' for questioning mandatory COVID vaccination policy
articles.description: NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner calls the views of his federal Labor party colleague senator Malarndirri McCarthy a "disgrace", labelling her an anti-vaxxer despite her support for the coronavirus vaccine rollout.
articles.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

articles.headline: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk referred to Queensland Speaker over Doherty Institute modelling comments
articles.description: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk is referred to the Speaker by the Opposition who allege she deliberately misled Parliament over Doherty Institute modelling predicting COVID-19 deaths.
articles.author: Rachel Riga

articles.headline: SA town adorns the red and blue
articles.description: The outback town of Wudinna has decorated itself with the unlikely colours of Melbourne Football Club ahead of the grand final.
articles.author: Emma Pedler, Ian Harslett, and Evelyn Leckie

articles.headline: 'Predatory' Sydney man jailed for drugging and raping 12yo girl he lured from skate park
articles.description: An "opportunistic and predatory" sex offender who drugged and raped a 12-year-old girl he lured from a Sydney skate park is sentenced to 12 years in jail.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Which teams have had the longest wait for a VFL/AFL flag?
articles.description: This year's AFL grand final between Melbourne and the Western Bulldogs features one team looking to end a long premiership drought and another which has recently broken through. Look back and see where Melbourne's 57-year wait for a flag puts them in VFL/AFL history.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Man charged with stalking 16 women he met online appears in court
articles.description: A man charged with stalking 16 women he met online over a period of eight years appears in court.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Melbourne teens unmask themselves as COVID website creators
articles.description: Three teenagers reveal they're the creators behind a popular data collection website called CovidBase AU — much to the delight of their fans.
articles.author: Zena Chamas

articles.headline: North Korea rejects South Korea's peace offer at United Nations as a 'smokescreen'
articles.description: North Korea has tried to explain why it has rejected calls to finally end the Korean War.
articles.author: Zena Chamas

articles.headline: WA records one new COVID-19 case in NSW arrival with no G2G pass
articles.description: Western Australia has recorded one new case of COVID-19 in a woman from New South Wales, who entered WA without an approved G2G pass.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: Tasmanian Labor secretary calls for party president to resign over threats of legal action
articles.description: Tasmanian Labor is likely to further fracture with secretary Stuart Benson sensationally calling on the party president Ben McGregor to resign over his threat to take legal action against leader Rebecca White.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Kayaker feared missing in waters off Fleurieu Peninsula alive and well
articles.description: A man whose abandoned kayak sparked an extensive search in waters off South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula phones police to let them know he swam to shore.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: SA Opposition raises 'ethical questions' over data collected through Steven Marshall's Facebook page
articles.description: The SA Premier's collection of personal data from South Australians accessing COVID-19 information on his Facebook page raises ethical questions", the Opposition says.
articles.author: Isabel Dayman

articles.headline: If you're bitten by a shark, this new technique could help save your life
articles.description: Researchers say they have found a new technique that could save the lives of shark attack victims, and all it involves is applying pressure between "the hips and the bits".
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: Josh Frydenberg publicly backs 2050 net zero emissions target, Barnaby Joyce gives tacit support
articles.description: The government is inching closer to accepting a target to reach net zero carbon emissions by 2050, with its most senior Cabinet member so far publicly backing a commitment.
articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.headline: Harry Potter star Tom Felton collapses during celebrity round at the Ryder Cup
articles.description: Actor Tom Felton, known for his portrayal of Draco Malfoy in the Harry Potter films, has collapsed while playing golf at the Ryder Cup.
articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.headline: 'We don't want to go back there': Tasmanian Premier defends COVID vaccine mandate for health workers
articles.description: Premier Peter Gutwein defends the state's COVID vaccination mandate for healthcare workers in light of the north-west outbreak last year, after a Launceston doctor wrote to Members of Parliament concerned about the requirement.
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: Canberra man accused of pushing fellow nursing home resident found not guilty of manslaughter
articles.description: Mario Amato was accused of pushing an 89-year-old woman who later died from complications of a broken hip. He pleaded not guilty to the crime.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Whose NRL finals path has them best placed for the grand final qualifiers?
articles.description: South Sydney played the game of their lives in the first week of the finals, while the Storm had a routine win. Meanwhile, their preliminary final opponents have been put through the meat grinder throughout finals, so who is actually in the best shape heading into this weekend's NRL grand final qualifiers?
articles.author: Jon Healy

articles.headline: Humpback heartthrob: Gold Coast researchers capture whale love ritual
articles.description: The footage helps researchers take a peek into a day in the life of 15 male whales from different pods who all have the same love interest.
articles.author: Kimberley Bernard

articles.headline: 'A parma and a pot': Coaches and players take timeout as clock ticks down to AFL premiership decider
articles.description: Captains and coaches of the Melbourne Demons and Western Bulldogs explain how they have been escaping the pre-game hype before tomorrow's historic AFL grand final in Perth.
articles.author: Garrett Mundy

articles.headline: 'Capel will be reeling from this': Two people found dead in suspected double murder in WA's South West
articles.description: Police are investigating the suspected murder of two people in Capel, 200 kilometres south of Perth, with a 47-year-old man in custody.
articles.author: Jackson Worthington

articles.headline: Third man charged over shooting death of country club owner
articles.description: Logan man Ashton McKinley is the third man to be charged over the shooting murder of a 64-year-old country club owner on Queensland's Fraser Coast during an alleged burglary last month.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: The arguments behind the religious vaccine signs spotted at protests
articles.description: No major religions in Australia expressly prohibit vaccination, but that doesn’t mean religion doesn’t inform some people’s decision on whether to get a COVID-19 jab.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: 'BFF theatre' puts Australia in tricky position between US and China
articles.description: There are big, enduring questions hanging over the announcement of a new strategic alliance between Australia, the UK and US — and they go to the heart of Australia's sovereign capability, writes Laura Tingle.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Detained Huawei executive reaches deal with US prosecutors
articles.description: Meng Wanzhou reaches an agreement with the US government which should allow her to leave Canada after being detained in 2018 on fraud charges.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Andrew Cuomo's brother accused of historical sexual harassment of news executive
articles.description: Shelley Ross accuses Chris Cuomo in a New York Times opinion piece of squeezing her buttocks at a 2005 party in front of her husband.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: 'I'd be putting my hand up': Clarkson considers prospect of coaching a Tasmanian AFL team
articles.description: Four-time premiership coach Alastair Clarkson expresses interest in being in charge of a Tasmanian club, should the AFL give the state its own team.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: SA woman accused of threatening police during guns audit remanded in custody
articles.description: A 42-year-old woman who was arrested by heavily armed STAR group officers during a firearms audit at her Sandy Creek property has been remanded in custody.
articles.author: Eric Tlozek

articles.headline: 'It is gunshots, ma'am': Triple zero calls played in Darwin CBD shooting trial
articles.description: The jury in the trial of alleged gunman Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann hears three triple zero calls made to police on the night of an alleged shooting rampage across Darwin CBD in 2019.
articles.author: Melissa Mackay

articles.headline: Former ICAC chief 'horrified' by changes to SA's anti-corruption watchdog
articles.description: The debate continues around South Australia's Independent Commissioner Against Corruption following sweeping changes passed in Parliament.
articles.author: Melissa Mackay

articles.headline: One of Australia's longest-running native title claims now over
articles.description: The Barngarla people are granted native title over the city of Port Augusta during a ceremonial sitting of the Federal Court at one of their most significant meeting places.
articles.author: Georgia Roberts and Declan Gooch

articles.headline: Green, Marsh post Sheffield Shield centuries as jostling for Ashes berths heats up
articles.description: With the men's Ashes on the horizon, Test all-rounder Cameron Green impresses for Western Australia, while veteran Shaun Marsh also shows solid form with the bat.
articles.author: Georgia Roberts and Declan Gooch

articles.headline: Jailbreak shines light on mass incarceration of Palestinians
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of Palestinian journalists, activists and minors, along with known militants, have been prosecuted in military courts in Israel, with almost every act of opposition to Israel's rule classified as a criminal offence.
articles.author: Georgia Roberts and Declan Gooch

articles.headline: Thousands embrace AFL grand final fever in Perth's CBD for people's parade
articles.description: Thousands of Melbourne Demons and Western Bulldogs fans take to the streets of Perth's CBD for a 'people's parade' ahead of the AFL grand final at Perth stadium tomorrow.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: Pfizer promises to deliver Australia's full October quota despite global distribution problems
articles.description: The states and territories are being reassured they will receive all the Pfizer doses they were promised for October, as health authorities issue new forecasts for bolstered vaccine supplies through to the end of the year.
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: Rabbitohs first through to grand final as Bennett chases eighth premiership
articles.description: South Sydney coach Wayne Bennett has the chance to claim another premiership, after the Rabbitohs beat the Sea Eagles 36-16 to reach their first season decider since 2014.
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: Unvaccinated tradie who spent two weeks in ICU with COVID shares his guilt at spreading virus to daughters
articles.description: After a horrific ordeal in hospital with COVID-19, construction worker Nathan Chellia rues not getting vaccinated and pleas with protesting tradies to learn from his mistakes.
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: 'Discrimination in the womb': UK woman with Down syndrome loses fight against abortion laws
articles.description: A British woman with Down syndrome loses her fight against laws that allow the abortion of a foetus with the condition or other potential disabilities up until birth.
articles.author: Jasmine Hines and Tobias Jurss-Lewis

articles.headline: Live: The countdown is on in Perth — Demons, Bulldogs prepare for historic AFL grand final
articles.description: The crowd is building at Perth Stadium, as the countdown is on to this year's grand final. Will Melbourne break the drought, or will the sons of the West win in the west? Follow our AFL grand final live blog.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Rugby Championship live: All Blacks clash with Springboks ahead of Wallabies-Pumas Test
articles.description: The undefeated All Blacks face the world champions to kick off the Rugby Championship double header in Townsville, before the Wallabies take on the Pumas. Follow our live ScoreCentre.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: England's netball Test series against Australia called off due to COVID quarantine requirements
articles.description: With England's national netball side having already spent two weeks in quarantine in New Zealand, concerns over the wellbeing of players and staff forces the tour of Australia to be cancelled.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Business as usual needs more than just 'high levels' of vaccination, according to SA Health chief
articles.description: SA's public health chief has told the state's transition committee local businesses will need to "pivot their business models" rather than expect a "a return to pre-COVID conditions" even once the state reaches high levels of vaccine uptake.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: NRL live: Panthers leading Storm in race to face South Sydney in grand final
articles.description: The NRL grand final rematch comes a week earlier than expected, with both Melbourne and Penrith aiming for their second straight berth in the decider. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Prince Andrew accepts he has been served with sexual assault lawsuit
articles.description: The Duke of York accepts he has been served with a sexual assault lawsuit in the United States, after denying he was properly served a month ago in Britain.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Search for rock fisherman missing off Coffs Harbour for five days
articles.description: Police are conducting a land and water search for a Coffs Harbour man who left for a fishing trip on NSW's Mid North Coast five days ago.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: Autopsy shows The Wire actor Michael K Williams died of drug overdose
articles.description: New York City's medical examiner says the actor, who played shotgun-toting drug dealer Omar Little on The Wire, died from the combined effects of fentanyl, p-fluorofentanyl, heroin and cocaine.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: Former police officer convicted of George Floyd's murder launches appeal against conviction
articles.description: Derek Chauvin, who knelt on George Floyd's neck for more than nine minutes as he lay on the ground pleading for air, files documents showing he intends to appeal against his conviction and senten
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: France turns down meeting with Australia's Trade Minister
articles.description: Australian Trade Minister Dan Tehan pleads with his French counterpart to "work through" tensions between the nations, after France's Trade Minister turns down an offer to meet in Paris next month.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Gunmen disguised as lawyers shoot dead gangster in Indian courtroom
articles.description: Two men dressed as lawyers are killed by police after shooting dead a notorious Indian gangster inside a Delhi courtroom.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Scott Morrison focuses on new global security alliances, climate change during UN meeting
articles.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison focuses on Australia's global strategic partnerships in his speech at the United Nations General Assembly.
articles.author: Tracey Shelton

articles.headline: Hundreds mourn murdered London teacher as police release suspect
articles.description: Emotional vigils are held for a teacher who was found murdered in a London park, highlighting public anger over violence against women. Police say a suspect under investigation has been released.
articles.author: Tracey Shelton

articles.headline: Lava, smoke and ash cover Spanish island of La Palma
articles.description: Steaming streams of lava have advanced, engulfing everything in their path on the Spanish island of La Palma, destroying houses, schools and some banana plantations.
articles.author: Tracey Shelton

articles.headline: Dog-washing van hit by Mercedes driver allegedly four times the legal limit
articles.description: An Adelaide mother will face court after allegedly crashing a Mercedes into a dog-grooming vehicle and fleeing the scene with her child, before being breath tested at a nearby police station.
articles.author: Tracey Shelton

articles.headline: Stranded by the pandemic, pianist Oscar Wong now performs for hospital patients
articles.description: Classical pianist Oscar Wong swaps concert-hall stages for a hospital entrance, volunteering his time to tickle the ivories for patients.
articles.author: Tom Forbes

articles.headline: ACT records 32 new cases of COVID-19, amid concerns over outbreak in aged care home
articles.description: The ACT records 32 new locally acquired cases of COVID-19 — the "equal highest" number recorded in the territory. At least 24 of the new cases spent some time in the community while infectious.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: Hobart wakes to low-elevation snow after icy overnight showers
articles.description: Elevated areas of Tasmania were blanketed in snow overnight, but snowfalls in central Hobart that had been hoped for did not come to pass.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: Advocating for the environment matters but don't forget to enjoy it
articles.description: A change of thinking to encourage people to get out in nature, whether it's gardening or bushwalking, will help the next generation understand the environmental challenges the planet faces, the organiser of one of South Australia's newest festivals says.
articles.author: Malcolm Sutton

articles.headline: Strangers on a mission find Rosie the spaniel after three weeks
articles.description: When Rosie the spaniel went missing after a serious car accident, strangers set to work using drones and wildlife cameras to track her down.
articles.author: Samille Mitchell

articles.headline: 'We were gone for all money': Mooney says ODI heroics a huge boost for World Cup
articles.description: Beth Mooney, whose career-best knock snatched a stunning ODI win over India, says Australia believe anybody in the XI can win a game from anywhere.
articles.author: Samille Mitchell

articles.headline: In a profession that values stoicism, is a burnout crisis looming?
articles.description: Doctors are experiencing unprecedented levels of anxiety, depression and burnout amid the COVID-19 pandemic, warns a psychologist and executive coach to the profession.
articles.author: Rachael Lucas

articles.headline: NT project finds accessible homes for people with disabilities
articles.description: A lack of accessible housing forced Doris to live in a hospital for more than a year and advocates say that is unacceptable.
articles.author: Housnia Shams

articles.headline: 'They'll just eat anything': Ravenous rats rip into and write-off cars
articles.description: Rats looking for a quick bite to eat and shelter from the cold are creating headaches for car owners. Left unattended the problem can be costly, but some people are finding ingenious ways to keep the rodents at bay.
articles.author: Georgie Burgess

articles.headline: Police make handful of arrests as dozens of protesters gather at St Kilda
articles.description: Police make a small number of arrests after around 50 protesters congregate on St Kilda esplanade in inner Melbourne as part of a planned anti-lockdown rally.
articles.author: Georgie Burgess

articles.headline: Everyone differs on Melbourne’s anti-lockdown protests
articles.description: Melbourne's week of extraordinary protests highlights the growth of an anti-lockdown information silo, where the mainstream media is being drowned out by a different kind of rhetoric, writes Norman Hermant.
articles.author: Norman Hermant

articles.headline: At different ends of the country, these aged care homes share a common trait — they're small
articles.description: One is in the tropics, the other in a much cooler climate — but these two aged care facilities at either end of the country are making a difference in the lives of the elderly.
articles.author: Annah Fromberg, Laetitia Lemke, and Ros Lehman

articles.headline: China played dirty to get Huawei’s 'princess' back — too dirty to tell its own people
articles.description: Now the saga is finally over, Meng Wanzhou's release back to China this weekend is a big victory for Beijing, taken on face value, writes Bill Birtles.
articles.author: Bill Birtles

articles.headline: Lockdowns sent me to a psychiatric hospital — twice
articles.description: This wasn't my first rodeo with mental illness. I thought I knew what to do, but I felt like I was in crisis and a yawning dark hole of hopelessness had opened up beneath me.
articles.author: Bill Birtles

articles.headline: In trying to end racism by talking about race, do we risk reinforcing it?
articles.description: The program, The School That Tried to End Racism, was a reminder for me that you can't end racism just by talking about race. It is a bind — one reinforces the other, writes Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: Back from the brink of extinction, there's now one croc for every two and a half people in the NT
articles.description: Fifty years ago, crocodiles had been shot to near extinction in the Northern Territory. Now the apex predators again dominate the waterways, raising questions about their coexistence with humans.
articles.author: Emma Masters and Steve Vivian

articles.headline: These Aussie expats waited out COVID abroad. This is what their summer of freedom has looked like
articles.description: Mediterranean holidays, mask-free dance floors and a life that feels somewhat "normal". After emerging from long winter lockdowns, these Australian expats shed light on what "living with COVID" looks like and what it took to get there.
articles.author: Emma Masters and Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Generation pandemic: How do we fix the damage coronavirus inflicted on kids? This man has a plan
articles.description: For children living through a global crisis, separated from friends and trying to learn over the internet, the past 18 months have had a profound effect on their wellbeing.  Now they must try to make up for lost time.
articles.author: Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: The winner of the 2021 AFL grand final is Baker Boy's tracksuit
articles.description: There have been some legendary AFL grand final pre-game performances over the years, and some… less so, but 2021's somewhat mismatched group of Aussie talent hits the right notes.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: The five moments that stole the spotlight as Melbourne claimed the premiership
articles.description: As Melbourne clung to a six-point lead heading towards the third quarter, a bit of Christian Petracca magic broke Bulldogs hearts. Check out the five moments that stole the grand final spotlight.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: Demons star Christian Petracca claims Norm Smith Medal
articles.description: The outstanding midfielder equals the record for most disposals in a grand final to be judged best on ground in Melbourne's drought-breaking victory, joining an illustrious list of previous winners.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: It's Melbourne's flag as devastating Demons put paid to Bulldogs' dreams
articles.description: The longest active premiership drought in the AFL is over,  as the Melbourne Demons end 57 years of frustration with a brilliant victory over the Western Bulldogs at Perth Stadium.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: 'It's part of our DNA': Hundreds of thousands flock to riverbanks of Brisbane to celebrate Riverfire festival
articles.description: Brisbane is buzzing with activity this weekend with the Riverfire festival, which is back this year after a COVID hiatus.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Huge crowds at Bondi Beach 'absolutely frustrating' as police issue zero fines
articles.description: NSW Police issue no fines after a large gathering at a Bondi Beach park yesterday, where many were not wearing masks, as the mayor says she is exasperated by those putting the community at risk.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: 'We're ready': Victoria's south-west scrambles after big jump in exposure sites
articles.description: "I've been ready for this day for a long time," says a COVID-19 response coordinator as the area's list of exposure sites goes from zero to 30-plus overnight.
articles.author: Emily Bissland

articles.headline: Vanuatu asks international court to weigh in on right to be protected from climate change
articles.description: While advisory opinions by the court are not legally binding, they carry legal weight and moral authority, and they can inform the development of international law.
articles.author: Emily Bissland

articles.headline: Demons win first premiership since 1964, thumping Bulldogs by 74 points in AFL grand final — as it happened
articles.description: Melbourne's premiership drought ends with a massive win over the Bulldogs in the AFL grand final, on the back of 12 straight goals in the third and fourth quarters.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Wallabies beat Pumas after All Blacks pip Springboks to clinch Rugby Championship title
articles.description: The Wallabies record a third straight win with a 27-8 defeat of the Pumas in Townsville, while the All Blacks claim the Rugby Championship following a gripping 19-17 victory over the Springboks.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Penrith reach second straight grand final with revenge victory over Melbourne Storm
articles.description: The Penrith Panthers will face South Sydney in the NRL grand final after beating Melbourne 10-6 in their preliminary final, avenging last year's loss in the decider.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: At this rate, the NT will not reach the vaccine targets to reopen by November
articles.description: The Northern Territory is aiming for 80 per cent vaccination coverage by November. But if the current pace of the rollout in remote communities doesn't improve, that target won't be met until well after Christmas.
articles.author: Nicholas Hynes

articles.headline: Outdoor pools in NSW to reopen for vaccinated and unvaccinated residents
articles.description: From tomorrow, outdoor pools are reopening across the state for the vaccinated and unvaccinated, in areas of concern and those with stay-at-home orders.
articles.author: Nicholas Hynes

articles.headline: Alex Volkanovski retains his UFC featherweight title with epic win over Brian Ortega
articles.description: Australian Alex Volkanovski remains the UFC featherweight champion after a gruelling but unanimous victory over Brian Ortega at UFC 266.
articles.author: Nicholas Hynes

articles.headline: Queensland's Deputy Premier questions the PM's priorities during US trip after state border comments
articles.description: Queensland Deputy Premier Steven Miles questions why Scott Morrison is commenting on the state's borders while he is in the US dealing with important issues of international diplomacy.
articles.author: Nicholas Hynes

articles.headline: Rail electrification end date still unknown, 13 years after project's announcement
articles.description: Commuters in Adelaide's northern suburbs are still waiting to find out when they can catch trains again, seven weeks after it was revealed works on the Gawler rail electrification would not end this year but continue into 2022.
articles.author: Nicholas Hynes

articles.headline: The premiership drought is busted but Dees are just getting started, Goodwin warns
articles.description: As Melbourne players and fans get used to life as AFL premiers, Demons' coach Simon Goodwin warns the rest of the competition his young side will be hungry for more in 2022.
articles.author: Nicholas Hynes

articles.headline: Dees fans celebrate a day 57 years in the making
articles.description: It's something many Melbourne fans have waited their whole lives to see and they're celebrating in style.
articles.author: Nicholas Hynes

articles.headline: This is where Victoria will ease restrictions in a trial to open the economy
articles.description: The Victorian government will conduct trials in businesses and events across highly vaccinated parts of regional Victoria to help the state open progressively.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Nick Kyrgios says he won't be on the tour 'in four or five years'
articles.description: Nick Kyrgios flags the end of his playing career could be coming sooner rather than later, saying he has nothing left to prove to himself.
articles.author: Duncan Huntsdale

articles.headline: Prince Harry and Meghan lend voices to world-spanning concert for climate and vaccines
articles.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex join music stars performing around the world for Global Citizen Live, a "once-in-a-generation" 24-hour concert aimed at raising awareness on climate change, vaccine equality and famine.
articles.author: Duncan Huntsdale

articles.headline: Second Melbourne anti-lockdown protester tests positive to COVID-19
articles.description: The Geelong man in his 30s tested positive earlier in the week, COVID commander Jeroen Weimar says, and may have been infectious while at the protest.
articles.author: Duncan Huntsdale

articles.headline: Cleary avoids charge, free to play in grand final
articles.description: Cleary is free to play in the NRL grand final against South Sydney after escaping a charge for a dangerous throw on Kenny Bromwich.
articles.author: Duncan Huntsdale

articles.headline: At least three dead and multiple injured as Amtrak train derails in Montana
articles.description: All passengers who were initially trapped inside the carriages have been safely taken out, after five carriages of the train came off the rails.
articles.author: Duncan Huntsdale

articles.headline: Darren Chester taking break from Nationals' party room following frustrations with leadership
articles.description: Nationals backbencher Darren Chester confirms he is taking a break from the party and will not attend partyroom meetings because of growing frustrations with party leadership.
articles.author: Jane Norman

articles.headline: Wallabies still have cause to be 'grumpy' despite third successive win
articles.description: Australian coach Dave Rennie still sees plenty to work on after the side secured its first three-match winning streak since 2017.
articles.author: Jane Norman

articles.headline: Cyclist recreates Nirvana's famous album cover for 30th anniversary of Nevermind
articles.description: Nirvana's Nevermind is still regarded as a trailblazing album — and, three decades after its release, an Adelaide cyclist follows in its wake with a street art tribute act like few others.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska and Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Man, 47, charged with two counts of murder over deaths in WA's Capel
articles.description: A 47-year-old man is charged with two counts of murder over the deaths of two elderly people in Capel, in Western Australia's South West region.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: As Bob Hawke celebrated America's Cup win, an Australian 'spy' was inside the New York Yacht Club
articles.description: How did an elitist yachting event capture a nation's imagination and boost its shattered sporting confidence? On the 38th anniversary of Australia II's victory, Jason Dasey recalls his night inside the New York Yacht Club when the America's Cup was lost after 132 years.
articles.author: Jason Dasey

articles.headline: Could three regional hospitals be about to become Ballarat's poor cousins?
articles.description: A health policy expert says a massive shake-up of western Victoria's hospital system will benefit the region, but only if the government makes certain iron-clad commitments.
articles.author: Alexander Darling, Fatima Olumee, and Andy Burns

articles.headline: Amid attention on Gabby Petito case, Native American mum seeks justice for missing daughter
articles.description: The mother of a 27-year-old Navajo woman, missing since March 2020, is seeking justice for her daughter following the global attention afforded to the Gabby Petito case.
articles.author: Alexander Darling, Fatima Olumee, and Andy Burns

articles.headline: ACT records 25 new COVID-19 cases, at least 16 infectious in the community
articles.description: The ACT records 25 new locally acquired cases of COVID-19, with nine of those linked to a Canberra city construction site.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: US continue dominance over Europe, tighten grip on Ryder Cup
articles.description: The USA are just three-and-a-half points away from regaining the Ryder Cup after another dominant display against Europe at Whistling Straits.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: NRL Warriors' star Reece Walsh arrested on Gold Coast
articles.description: The Warriors' teenage fullback Reece Walsh, among the favourites to claim Dally M Rookie of the Year honours on Monday, has been arrested on the Gold Coast.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: NSW residents can look at November to 'plan a trip', says Gladys Berejiklian
articles.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian says the government will release the full details of its freedom roadmap this week, including how and when the unvaccinated can come out of lockdown.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: Norway lifts COVID-19 restrictions after 561 days
articles.description: The decision to no longer require social distancing will allow culture and sports venues to utilise their full capacity, while restaurants can fill up and nightclubs reopen.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: 'The community is sick of the carnage': Residents rally for action to stop wildlife becoming road kill
articles.description: Wildlife Rescue Queensland president Byron Cann said the amount of wildlife death on Bribie Island roads was increasing, particularly kangaroos and wallabies.
articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty and Sally Eeles

articles.headline: Aaron is turning 21 today, but he's hundreds of kilometers from home
articles.description: Aaron Lees says goodbye to his therapy dog as he and his mother move into an Airbnb to wait for Queensland's borders to reopen.
articles.author: Stephanie Zillman

articles.headline: China's Great Wall of Debt: can it afford a default?
articles.description: China's economy is experiencing serious growing pains. And for the first time, it must confront a future where there are no more easy gains to be had, writes Ian Verrender.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: Victorian government's 'vaccinated economy' trial welcomed but industry wants more details
articles.description: Double-dose Victorians will soon chart a path out of restrictions when six regional areas begin a vaccination economy trial in October. It may be our ticket to freedom but there are some roadblocks.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Planning an overseas holiday? You could be in for a 'rude shock'
articles.description: Australians are busting to get overseas, but there is still a lot we do not know about what travel will look like when international borders reopen.
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: No work, no food: How the pandemic is deepening hunger
articles.description: In one of Victoria's most disadvantaged suburbs, the pandemic shows hunger has become one of the defining features of the growing gulf between the wealthy and the poor.
articles.author: Rachel Clayton

articles.headline: William had his first Pfizer appointment booked for October. He ended up dying at home alone with COVID-19
articles.description: A worrying trend is emerging of people dying at home from COVID-19 — and many are being diagnosed post-mortem.
articles.author: Nadia Daly and Xanthe Kleinig

articles.headline: The foreign football powerbrokers with a big stake in Australia's soccer teams
articles.description: Links to an Indonesian executive jailed over a match-fixing scandal — and accusations of "sportswashing" by a wealthy Arab state — have been uncovered in an investigation into foreign ownership in the A-League.
articles.author: Sean Nicholls, Amy Donaldson, and Patrick Begley

articles.headline: Who will police COVID vaccine certificates — and what happens if they're not checked?
articles.description: With NSW venues preparing to re-open to the fully vaccinated, here's what we know about how the vaccine certificate system will work.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Leading parties tied in German election, meaning Merkel could remain Chancellor for months
articles.description: A new German government may not be formed for months, with exit polls showing the two leading parties tied neck-and-neck in the country's federal election.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Traditionally conservative Switzerland backs same-sex marriage by a clear margin
articles.description: Just over 64 per cent of Swiss people voted to allow same-sex couples the right to marry, in a referendum that will also allow gay couples to adopt children.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Spirit of Tasmania resumes services after COVID-19 scare strands passengers
articles.description: The two Spirit of Tasmania ferries had been stationary since Friday night after a contractor tested positive for coronavirus, with 17 people identified as close contacts, but operator TT-Line says it has been given the all-clear to resume operations.
articles.author: Manika Champ

articles.headline: 'Loved his life in Australia': Status Quo founding member Alan Lancaster dies in Sydney aged 72
articles.description: According to entertainment reporter Craig Bennett, London-born Lancaster "passed away this morning at his Sydney home, surrounded by family", having lived with Multiple Sclerosis for many years.
articles.author: Jason Dasey

articles.headline: Five Palestinians killed in shootout by Israeli forces as tensions rise in the West Bank, Israel says
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett says soldiers acted against Hamas operatives who were "about to execute terror attacks". Tensions have been high since the 11-day war between the two nations in May.
articles.author: Jason Dasey

articles.headline: WA Cricket asks for an Ashes reshuffle over border concerns
articles.description: The boss of WA Cricket says the order of Test matches for the upcoming Ashes series needs to be revisited to avoid issues around border restrictions.
articles.author: Tom Wildie

articles.headline: MP's defamation case against former mayor settles before trial
articles.description: The Member for Mildura sued the city's former mayor late last year after he published a 5,000-word post entitled "Game Of Thrones" to Facebook.
articles.author: Richard Crabtree

articles.headline: 'There's a man being killed in the car park': Jury shown CCTV of alleged murder
articles.description: A Northern Territory jury has been shown video footage of the moment Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann allegedly murdered a man in a Darwin car park.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Panthers dealing with lengthy injury list ahead of NRL grand final
articles.description: The Panthers are sweating on the scan results of several players in the build-up to the premiership decider against the Rabbitohs, with Tevita Pangai Junior in considerable doubt because of a knee injury.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Live: NRL's 2021 Dally M Awards ceremony from Brisbane
articles.description: This year's Dally M Awards ceremony is getting underway at Howard Smith Wharves in Brisbane. Follow all the action in our live blog.
articles.author: Tanisha Stanton

articles.headline: Couple spends wedding anniversary digging up vintage car
articles.description: It was going to be a romantic stroll on a remote beach but it ended in an archaeological dig for a vintage car.
articles.author: Brad Marsellos

articles.headline: Tasmania's health and education sectors may suffer under GST changes, Treasury warns
articles.description: Tasmania's Treasury Department warns essential services are at risk after new modelling shows the state's share of GST payments will decline towards the end of the decade, while WA's share is projected to boom.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: NSW Minister threatens to resign if assisted dying conscience vote denied
articles.description: Transport Minister Andrew Constance says voluntary assisted dying is an issue of compassion and he will support the bill when it is introduced to Parliament next month, but will cross the floor if a conscience vote is denied.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: The ACT now has a roadmap out of lockdown. Here's what it looks like
articles.description: The ACT will come out of lockdown on October 15. Here's how the months ahead are expected to look.
articles.author: Selby Stewart and Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: ACT to get dedicated coroner after years of lobbying by bereaved families
articles.description: Canberra will soon have a dedicated coroner after families criticise the ACT's backlogged system as difficult and expensive to navigate.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Meet the people taking 'pandemic pets' to the next level
articles.description: Millions of people have found solace during the pandemic in cuddling a dog or cat. For a few in Argentina, comfort comes in other forms — like a horse or a pig, or even a sugar glider or tarantula.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Should we be allowed to peek behind National Cabinet's curtain? A new bill will make sure it remains secret
articles.description: National Cabinet was established in response to the COVID-19 pandemic but it's only now that debate has begun on whether its deliberations should be kept secret.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Jess Fox wins world championships gold in new Olympic event
articles.description: The Olympic C1 gold medallist rescues a disappointing canoe slalom world championships in Slovakia by taking out the extreme slalom event, which will make its Olympic debut at Paris 2024.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Coal ship docks in Newcastle after crew recovers from COVID
articles.description: A coal ship with COVID-positive crew members on board docks in Newcastle after being off the east coast for two weeks.
articles.author: Giselle Wakatama

articles.headline: 'Please tell me you're lying, Linc': Actor tells appeal hearing of the moment he learnt his identity had been stolen
articles.description: A former Home and Away star takes to the witness stand at the legal appeal of a Melbourne woman who is accused of using his identity to hoodwink her alleged victims into relationships.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: 'My story in my words': A new documentary is shedding light on what happened to Simone Biles at the Olympics
articles.description: Simone Biles' withdrawal from some Olympics events sparked intense interest and now a new documentary promises to give a peek at her innermost thoughts during the Games.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: 'Unlawful non-citizen' shouldn't be treated better than Australians in sentencing, judges say
articles.description: A former Adelaide man given a suspended sentence for growing hundreds of cannabis plants will be re-sentenced after a court finds his deportation to Italy should not have been considered when deciding his punishment.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: 'She's worth it': Premiership win caps off rollercoaster two years for McDonald family
articles.description: Tom McDonald's family are the first to admit there's been "a lot of ups and downs" in the road to Melbourne's drought-breaking premiership.
articles.author: Alexander Darling

articles.headline: Moulin Rouge! hits the high note at the Tony Awards as Jagged Little Pill faces investigation
articles.description: An adaptation of Australian director Baz Luhrmann's movie Moulin Rouge wins big at the Tony Awards, while Jagged Little Pill falls short amid controversy.
articles.author: Alexander Darling

articles.headline: Everything you need to know about NSW's new COVID freedoms
articles.description: The NSW government has revealed the freedoms people who are vaccinated against COVID-19, and those who are not, will get back before the end of the year. This is what you need to know.
articles.author: Lydia Feng

articles.headline: COVID-19 outbreak worsens at Wellington as four western NSW towns record new cases after lockdown lifts
articles.description: The COVID-19 outbreak in western New South Wales moves away from Dubbo with a nearby community recording a surge in the number of daily cases.
articles.author: Joanna Woodburn, Nic Healey, and Robyn Herron

articles.headline: UK data shows 60pc of people who died of COVID had a disability, prompting warnings about opening up Australia too fast
articles.description: The disability royal commission has described moves to open up the country before all people living with disability have a chance to get vaccinated as "unconscionable".
articles.author: Nas Campanella and Celina Edmonds

articles.headline: Port Macquarie on high alert after infected Sydneysider's visit to view property
articles.description: Two local cases have been linked to the visitor, and officials fear more infections could follow.
articles.author: Kate Aubrey and Luisa Rubbo

articles.headline: London flights fall victim to WA's strict border closures as Sydney, Melbourne routes to remain restricted
articles.description: Qantas confirms it will reroute its Perth to London flight until at least April next year due to Western Australia's COVID-19 border restrictions, and flights to Sydney and Melbourne will be kept to a bare minimum.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: Batemans Bay COVID cluster grows as 'freedom day' flagged
articles.description: New cases are reported as the government announces its plan to relax restrictions in the Eurobodalla next month.
articles.author: Keira Proust

articles.headline: Harry Potter actor Tom Felton on 'road to recovery' after collapsing at golf tournament
articles.description: Tom Felton, best known for playing Draco Malfoy in the Harry Potter movies, says he is on the mend after collapsing at the 18th hole during the Ryder Cup celebrity matches.
articles.author: Keira Proust

articles.headline: Angela and her children were kicked off a train 700km from home. Now she's fighting for justice
articles.description: Two Aboriginal women allege they were forcibly removed from a train hundreds of kilometres from home, while a non-Indigenous man was allowed to stay. Now they're fighting to ensure no-one has the same experience.
articles.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

articles.headline: R Kelly found guilty of racketeering in sex trafficking case
articles.description: Singer R Kelly is found guilty of racketeering in his sex trafficking trial in New York.
articles.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

articles.headline: We hear a lot about ventilators, but there's another piece of equipment that might save your life if you get COVID-19
articles.description: Sergio's illness started with a tingle in the throat, but by the time he ended up in ICU, his lungs were so damaged by COVID-19 a ventilator wouldn't work. So doctors turned to a 'last-ditch' machine.
articles.author: Sian Johnson

articles.headline: Kiribati President says AUKUS nuclear submarine deal puts Pacific at risk
articles.description: The AUKUS alliance has come as an unwelcome surprise to at least one Pacific leader, with Kiribati President Tanati Maamau saying he was not consulted and the submarine deal puts the region at risk.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: A confidence-booster or 'regressive'? The role of deportment in an increasingly informal world
articles.description: Deportment classes teach posture, poise and presence. They're a master class in how to be a lady, so how relevant are they to young people in today's increasingly informal world of self-expression?
articles.author: Phoebe Hosier

articles.headline: Low-pressure trough springs rain, hail and strong winds on southern Queensland
articles.description: A low-pressure trough developing in the Great Australian Bight will make its way north into Queensland by Wednesday, bringing rain, possible hail and strong winds, the Bureau of Meteorology says.
articles.author: Jessica Rendall

articles.headline: The real reason why Australia's vaccination rate is one of the highest in the world
articles.description: After months spinning its wheels near the start line, Australia is now roaring towards the vaccination levels that will allow a safer re-entry into the world.
articles.author: Casey Briggs

articles.headline: In Melbourne, hospitality businesses are being caught in the COVID-19 political crossfire
articles.description: A Melbourne cafe owner is threatened by an anti-lockdown group for supporting police charity.
articles.author: Elise Kinsella

articles.headline: Last year Australia ran a real-life housing affordability experiment that produced some very odd results
articles.description: Closing the international borders was the sort of experiment economists had only ever carried out with a spreadsheet, never expecting it to actually happen. The results surprised a few, and have many questioning whether the right lessons are being learned.
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: Before you dust off the golf clubs, you'd better check the forecast
articles.description: Under a modest easing of COVID restrictions, swinging a golf club, cricket bat or tennis racquet will be again possible but that is if the weather allows it. It's looking unlikely.
articles.author: Paul Higgins

articles.headline: Residents in Sydney's hospots 'could not cope' with rules restricting family unit
articles.description: Communities in Western and south-west Sydney are likely to feel the effects of lockdown well after restrictions are eased on October 11. A new report shows distrust, mental health and definitions of family as major concerns for the area.
articles.author: Paul Higgins

articles.headline: How an office worker made $7 million while sitting on the toilet
articles.description: This is how two university mates struck a deal to use classified information in Australia’s biggest insider trading scam.
articles.author: Paul Higgins

articles.headline: 'We're faffing about here in Australia': Calls for further climate action ahead of Glasgow conference
articles.description: Advocates for action on climate change urge further commitments to reduce Australia's emissions ahead of the UN COP26 conference in a month's time, with warnings investors could move their cash elsewhere.
articles.author: Daniel Ziffer

articles.headline: Drop-eagle? Ancient Australian eagle fossil reveals it was an ambush predator
articles.description: A little smaller than a wedge-tailed eagle, this 25-million-year-old bird of prey once lurked in lush forests, swooping out of the trees and onto unsuspecting ancient koalas and possums.
articles.author: Belinda Smith

articles.headline: Australian officials kept out as Australian faces Myanmar court
articles.description: Australian embassy officials in Myanmar are kept out of the courtroom where Sydney economist Sean Turnell has appeared on charges of violating the country's official secrets act, raising more doubt about whether he will receive a fair trial.
articles.author: Mazoe Ford

articles.headline: 'Harbours evil intentions': China reacts to British warship in Taiwan Strait
articles.description: The Chinese People's Liberation Army said it had deployed air and naval forces to follow the British frigate and warn it away.
articles.author: Mazoe Ford

articles.headline: First Macron was slapped, now he's been egged
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron is attacked for a second time this year, this time with an egg in the city of Lyon.
articles.author: Mazoe Ford

articles.headline: One dead as Crete earthquake topples old churches
articles.description: Old and damaged buildings, including some churches, have already collapsed and more are threatened by aftershocks, with authorities urging those who live in those buildings to stay outdoors.
articles.author: Mazoe Ford

articles.headline: New community case of COVID detected in Brisbane, alert issued for northern suburbs and Rocklea
articles.description: A new case of COVID-19 is detected in the Brisbane community, with the source of the infection so far a mystery.
articles.author: Mazoe Ford

articles.headline: Trio convicted of animal cruelty after RSPCA finds dogs living in 'squalid' conditions
articles.description: Three people, including a registered dog breeder, are convicted of animal cruelty after RSCPA inspectors find dogs living in squalor in Adelaide's northern suburbs.
articles.author: Mazoe Ford

articles.headline: Man left 'financially devastated' and facing criminal charges after falling victim to a decade-long romance scam
articles.description: A Tasmanian man who stole more than $28,000 from his golf club believed he could pay the money back when he received a "windfall" from a woman he was in an online relationship with for 10 years, a court hears.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Detectives admit failure in inquest into death of woman in abusive relationship with NT police officer
articles.description: A coronial inquest into the 2020 death of former police officer has heard she was in an "abusive" relationship with an active police officer and that 17 reports of “domestic disturbances” were filed.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Parliament does not reflect culturally diverse Australia, says former Fowler hopeful
articles.description: A young Vietnamese-Australian lawyer who was overlooked by Labor to run in the federal election says political parties must do more to increase cultural diversity in federal parliament.
articles.author: Jason Om

articles.headline: Fair Work ruling on woman fired for refusing flu jab reveals the divide on COVID-19 vaccine mandate
articles.description: The Fair Work Commission says an aged care facility was justified in firing someone who refused her flu jab — but it has divided commissioners.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: 'No-one is ever interested': Premiership coach assesses prospects of landing another AFL senior role
articles.description: Port Adelaide's 2004 AFL premiership coach Mark Williams, who helped the Demons win this year's flag, doesn't think he will be offered a senior position again.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Accused gunman 'on a mission' during alleged shooting spree, court hears
articles.description: A regular at a Darwin pub where prosecutors allege Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann murdered his third victim tells a court he tried to wave over a police officer for help, but says the officer stayed by his car.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: How a million-year-old ice core may offer clues as to why we've seen fewer ice ages
articles.description: Scientists say an ambitious expedition starting this season will help them look a million years into the past and may provide answers to one of Antarctica's ancient mysteries.
articles.author: Sean Wales

articles.headline: Methane emissions higher than earlier estimates in CSG region
articles.description: A world-first aerial survey of Queensland's main coal seam gas region has found methane emissions considerably higher than some previous reports.
articles.author: Peter McCutcheon

articles.headline: North Korea fires missile off east coast as it calls on US, South Korea to scrap 'hostile policy'
articles.description: North Korea fires a missile towards the sea off its east coast, as Pyongyang repeats its call for the United States and South Korea to scrap their "hostile policy" to restart talks.
articles.author: Peter McCutcheon

articles.headline: Snap lockdown ordered for Port Macquarie-Hastings, Muswellbrook
articles.description: The Port Macquarie-Hastings and Muswellbrook local government areas will go into lockdown from 6:00pm tonight, while the stay-at-home order in the Kempsey area will be lifted as planned.
articles.author: Emma Siossian, Luisa Rubbo, and Michael Luu

articles.headline: Injury sees Panthers star ruled out of NRL grand final against Rabbitohs
articles.description: Penrith will be without Tevita Pangai Junior for the premiership decider against South Sydney, with the Panthers' mid-season recruit sidelined with a knee injury.
articles.author: Emma Siossian, Luisa Rubbo, and Michael Luu

articles.headline: Benji Marshall backs his body to play on in 2022
articles.description: Benji Marshall has given the strongest indication yet that he believes he can play on in 2022, discarding talk of an NRL grand-final farewell for South Sydney.
articles.author: Emma Siossian, Luisa Rubbo, and Michael Luu

articles.headline: Demons fan in custody amid probe into whether he broke COVID rules to attend AFL grand final in Perth
articles.description: Police in Western Australia are investigating whether a Melbourne man who may have attended the AFL grand final on Saturday is in breach of a COVID-19 quarantine direction.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Lincoln Lewis feared police complaint over catfishing scandal could hurt acting career, court hears
articles.description: A former Home and Away star clashes with the lawyer of a woman who stole his identity to hoodwink her stalking victims, with a court being told that he feared the catfishing scandal could affect his career.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: Daniel Craig calls time on his 15-year stint, so who will be the next James Bond?
articles.description: After a decade and a half playing the legendary British spy James Bond, Daniel Craig is making way for a new generation of actors after his fifth 007 film, No Time To Die, which has its world premiere in London this week.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: Long-running inquest into Aboriginal death in custody hears questions still unanswered
articles.description: Closing submissions have been made in the coronial inquest into the death of Aboriginal man Wayne Fella Morrison. Despite the inquest spanning three years, questions still remain over Mr Morrison's final moments.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: ATAGI doctor was 'shocked and surprised' when Prime Minister blamed them for vaccine delays
articles.description: The Prime Minister blamed advice from his expert panel on immunisation for the delay in the COVID-19 vaccine rollout. That came as a shock to the body's scientists.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Five years have passed since the power went out in SA — here's a look at what's changed
articles.description: SA's infamous statewide blackout triggered recriminations, as well as sweeping and ongoing reforms to the state's — and the nation's — approach to energy security. Here's a look at what has changed.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: New data shows phone scams are 'exploding' in Australia
articles.description: Phone-based scams are costing Australians more money each year and Indigenous people have seen a sharp increase in losses in 2021.
articles.author: Tom Williams

articles.headline: Court ruling to allow housing development will doom Sydney's koalas, critics say
articles.description: Environmentalists slam a decision to allow a 1,700-home development in a prime koala habitat.
articles.author: Nick McLaren and Tim Fernandez

articles.headline: How despair soon gave way to cuddles during COVID
articles.description: It started as a desperate idea in the drought for farmers to bring in more income. It is now an award-winning business.
articles.author: Lucy Thackray

articles.headline: Grand finals don't reward season's best team, AFLW star Ebony Marinoff says
articles.description: After a mixed record in do-or-die grand finals, Adelaide Crows AFLW star Ebony Marinoff says it is a shame that one "really bad day" should cost a team a title.
articles.author: Lucy Thackray

articles.headline: New Zealand seeks to cool scorching housing market with new law
articles.description: New Zealand moves to cool its red-hot housing market by introducing rules designed to make property speculation less appealing and to improve record-low housing affordability.
articles.author: Lucy Thackray

articles.headline: Patients put at 'high clinical risk' as ramping and patient surge hit SA health system
articles.description: There were no ambulances for 17 high-priority emergencies in Adelaide's southern suburbs last night, putting patients at "high clinical risk", the paramedics union says.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Woman jailed for acts of 'disturbing violence' on two men could soon be paroled
articles.description: Theresa Ann Coss suffered prolonged mental health conditions attributed to a "dysfunctional" and "tragic" upbringing, made worse by drug use at the time she attacked two men, the Supreme Court in Brisbane is told.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Another home loan crackdown is looming. Here's what it might look like
articles.description: The Treasurer gives a strong indication that new limits on large home loans will soon be introduced. But what will they look like and what will it mean for property prices?
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: Father allegedly fatally injured baby son in 20-minute window of time, court told
articles.description: A North Queensland court hears new details in the case of Ayden Bradshaw, who is facing a murder charge in relation to the death of his six-month-old son Beau last year.
articles.author: Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: Why is the UK experiencing a fuel shortage? It's got nothing to do with petrol and everything to do with trucks
articles.description: The UK is in the midst of a run on petrol stations that has left bowsers running dry and thousands of motorists frustrated.
articles.author: Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: Google dominance in Australian online advertising harms businesses and consumers, says regulator
articles.description: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission calls for new rules to rein in Google, which dominates the country's online advertising market.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Two more COVID-19 deaths in western NSW
articles.description: Two more men have died from COVID-19 at Dubbo in western New South Wales, taking the region's death toll to 11.
articles.author: Joanna Woodburn

articles.headline: Lockdown possibility looms for Greater Brisbane as authorities trace spread from latest COVID-19 cases
articles.description: The question of whether Greater Brisbane will go into its fifth lockdown this year depends on how many cases emerge over the next few days as Queensland authorities have, in the past, been quick to impose snap lockdowns in the past.
articles.author: Jessica Rendall

articles.headline: Victoria had more cases than NSW in past two days. Is this a good sign?
articles.description: Victoria has recorded more single daily cases than the same days in New South Wales. But what does that mean for Victoria? These leading epidemiologists weigh in.
articles.author: Zena Chamas

articles.headline: This family has worked at the same smelter for three generations — but around them the workforce has changed
articles.description: Glenn Scurrah has spent three decades working at the Nyrstar zinc works in Hobart's north, but it's far from the norm for his son and grandson to have followed in his steps.
articles.author: Lucy Shannon

articles.headline: Victoria eases some COVID restrictions from today. This is what has changed
articles.description: Victoria is easing a small number of COVID-19 restrictions today, after the state hit a key vaccination target. Here's what you can now do.
articles.author: Elise Kinsella

articles.headline: NSW sets new 2030 emissions target as federal government remains in net zero deadlock
articles.description: The NSW Coalition unites to set an ambitious emissions reduction target for 2030 as division grows within its federal counterpart over a target of net zero emissions by 2050.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper

articles.headline: A small number of fully vaccinated people with COVID-19 in NSW have died — here's why
articles.description: About 11 per cent of the people who have died of COVID-19 during NSW's Delta outbreak have been fully vaccinated — the number doesn't tell the full story.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: Veteran suicide crisis significantly worse than previously reported, new data reveals
articles.description: More than 1,200 Australian Defence Force veterans and serving personnel die by suicide in two decades — almost three times higher than the number previously reported.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Hoping to catch tonight's never-before-seen meteor shower? Look for 'The Teapot' in the sky
articles.description: If you are outside just after sunset tonight you may catch a meteor out of the corner of your eye if you are very, very lucky.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Record-breaking Qantas flight to bring Aussies home, but many can't make it to the airport
articles.description: A record-breaking 14,683-kilometre direct flight is scheduled to bring Australians desperate to return home from Buenos Aires to Darwin — but passengers say they don't know if they'll be able to make it.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: I just sold my home in Sydney's hot property market — this is what I learned
articles.description: Lesson one: The pandemic has revealed the strength of the demand for property, especially when supply is constrained, writes David Taylor.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: It'll be a campaign like no other, but when will Australians actually go to the polls?
articles.description: Anything goes in a COVID-19 election, but there are some dates that look more likely for when Australia will go to the polls.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: A culture of helping out: These Indian senior citizens have found the cure to COVID isolation
articles.description: While formal volunteer numbers have dropped during the pandemic, multicultural communities have stepped up to help those in need. It's proving to have profound benefits for the volunteers themselves.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: 'Marriage donkeys', trolls and feminist fists: Inside the Chinese feminist culture that's splitting the internet
articles.description: Chinese "feminist fists" believe women should be ashamed to be married. Beijing's crackdown on radical feminists is also ensnaring those who are fighting for women's rights.
articles.author: Bang Xiao

articles.headline: How this tiny, island nation developed homegrown COVID-19 vaccines
articles.description: Cuba expects to fully vaccinate its population against COVID-19 by the end of the year — and it's doing it using homegrown jabs.
articles.author: Lucia Stein

articles.headline: WHO directors 'horrified' as 20 staff members implicated in sexual assaults in the Congo
articles.description: Among 80 allegations of sexual abuse, nine are listed as rape as an internal WHO panel finds 20 of their own staff are implicated in sexual wrongdoing during an Ebola outbreak in Congo.
articles.author: Lucia Stein

articles.headline: New data contradicts narrative China spending up big on aid for Pacific nations
articles.description: Despite concerns about China's growing influence in the Pacific, new figures compiled by an independent Australian think-tank show Beijing is actually scaling back the amount of its aid to the region.
articles.author: Lucia Stein

articles.headline: Federal government to cut COVID support for workers in push to end widespread lockdowns
articles.description: Financial support for people who have lost work due to COVID-19 will soon be wound back, with the federal government looking to discourage states from imposing lockdowns once vaccination rates hit their targets.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: 'Stop being naive': Macron speaks for first time on cancelled Australian submarine deal
articles.description: The French President makes his first public comments about the acrimonious ending of the deal, which saw the Australian government terminate a $90bn contract with French defence company Naval Group.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Melbourne Storm players meet with NRL Integrity Unit over post-season videos
articles.description: The Storm confirm three players — including Cameron Munster and Brandon Smith — spoke with NRL officials following the circulation of videos on social media.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: COVID-19 case on plane as ship with 11 sick crew members bound for WA
articles.description: WA Police Commissioner Chris Dawson reveals authorities are dealing with a positive COVID-19 case arriving on a military plane, while a ship with half its crew sick with the virus is also sailing towards the state.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Queensland police suing their Commissioner over staff vaccination mandate
articles.description: Five serving police officers are among seven Queensland Police Service staff taking Commissioner Katarina Carroll to court over her demand that all staff be vaccinated against COVID-19.
articles.author: Paula Doneman and Alexandria Utting

articles.headline: What would a net zero emissions policy mean for agriculture?
articles.description: As the Coalition debates the idea of a zero carbon emissions policy, what would it mean for a sector that feels let down by the climate debate?
articles.author: David Claughton and Lara Webster

articles.headline: Despite deadline, 7 per cent of NSW health workers unvaccinated
articles.description: Paramedic John Larter has been vocal about refusing the jab. He has even been suspended over complaints he spread vaccine misinformation online, allegations he denies.
articles.author: Hagar Cohen and Raveen Hunjan

articles.headline: Man charged after teen alleges ordeal of abuse and intimidation
articles.description: Allegations include child sex, kidnapping, child prostitution, and pouring boiling water over the child's feet while she slept.
articles.author: Ben Millington

articles.headline: Latrobe Valley enters seven-day lockdown as more COVID cases emerge
articles.description: Victoria's public health teams have significant concerns about onward transmission in the Latrobe Valley, with more than 20 cases recorded.
articles.author: Ben Millington

articles.headline: P-plater sentenced over 'catastrophic' crash that killed two boys
articles.description: A court in Bunbury hears there were six passengers in the car, including two in the boot, when the 17-year-old failed to navigate a left-hand turn and struck a tree while returning from a 21st birthday party.
articles.author: Georgia Loney

articles.headline: Lawyer says 'extraordinary' Crows camp findings show SafeWork SA has 'no rules'
articles.description: A lawyer privy to controversial events at the Adelaide Crows infamous 2018 preseason camp slams SafeWork SA for clearing the club, claiming others would have been prosecuted.
articles.author: Georgia Loney

articles.headline: Jury hears Ben Hoffmann's call for police help after alleged shooting spree
articles.description: A Northern Territory jury has been shown body-worn footage of Benjamin Hoffmann's arrest and heard a frantic phone call from the alleged gunman, in which he can be heard asking police for help.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Inquest hears of New Year's Eve horror as Currowan fire turned deadly
articles.description: The NSW Bushfires Coronial Inquiry hears details of the desperate final moments of three men who died while defending their homes on the NSW South Coast in 2019.
articles.author: Jessica Clifford

articles.headline: Queensland man convicted over 'threatening, intimidating' video against Victorian MP
articles.description: A man who called the Victorian Premier a "communist", before threatening to shave the head of a crossbench politician and drag her "up the street naked" if she supported proposed COVID-19 laws, is handed a suspended sentence in a Queensland court.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Will the economy cope when COVID disaster payments are withdrawn?
articles.description: NSW and the ACT are quickly approaching levels of vaccination that will see federal government stimulus withdrawn, but will their economies falter without it.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Afghanistan Test to be 'indefinitely postponed' as Hobart pitches for Ashes slot
articles.description: Cricket Tasmania chief executive Dominic Baker confirms Australia will not play its Test against Afghanistan due to the Taliban's stance on women playing sport.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: China shows off advanced stealth drones, spacecraft at air show
articles.description: Using its annual Zhuhai Airshow, China has showcased its military air power amid regional tensions over Taiwan and the South China Sea.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: 'I just heard the final bell': Manny Pacquiao quits boxing to chase Philippine presidential bid
articles.description: Regarded as one of the greatest fighters in boxing history, Manny Pacquiao announces he is retiring from the sport to focus on his run for president in the 2022 Philippine elections.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Heavy hail in Adelaide Hills sparks dozens of call-outs to SES, including for baby stuck in flooded car
articles.description: Hail and heavy rain has hit the outskirts of Adelaide, temporarily closing the main road to the Adelaide Hills and whitening backyards across the city.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Victorian police officer suspended over video of violent arrest at Flinders Street Station
articles.description: Victoria Police suspends an acting sergeant and calls for witnesses as it investigates footage of a forceful arrest at Flinders Street Station which drew condemnation from lawyers last week.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Why some Tasmanians will not watch Port Arthur film, Nitram
articles.description: It's been 25 years since the Port Arthur massacre, and this week a new film will be released that depicts the gunman's life in the lead-up to the murders.
articles.author: Ellen Coulter

articles.headline: Queensland's COVID exposure site list expands to locations across Brisbane
