articles.description: Health authorities add more venues to Queensland exposure site list after a new locally acquired case of COVID-19 was detected on the Gold Coast.
articles.author: Ellen Coulter

articles.headline: Silicon Valley companies find remote work is easier to begin than end
articles.description: Technology companies that led the charge into remote work as the pandemic unfurled are confronting a new challenge as the crisis winds down: how, when and even whether they should bring long-isolated employees back to offices.
articles.author: Ellen Coulter

articles.headline: The solar system's largest storm could easily swallow Earth whole, but it's been behaving a bit strangely lately
articles.description: Winds around the outside of Jupiter's Great Red Spot have picked up over the past decade, which may help explain why the giant planet's iconic feature is changing.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Aussie comedian receives deluge of donations for world climate conference billboards
articles.description: Australian comedian Dan Ilic will display billboards in Glasgow during the COP26 climate conference, and after receiving a deluge of donations through his crowdfunding effort intends to do even more.
articles.author: Katherine Gregory and Scott Mitchell

articles.headline: 'Remember what you did to Macron?': Turnbull says submarine deal has torpedoed trust for years
articles.description: Even Australia's allies will question if it can be trusted after the Morrison Government's decision to scrap a $90 billion French submarine contract in favour of a deal with the US and UK, former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull has warned.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: Patient overcrowding sees elective surgery at Darwin's main hospital halted for fourth time this year
articles.description: A code yellow emergency has been called at Royal Darwin Hospital, causing all elective surgeries to be suspended, as the facility reaches patient capacity for the fourth time this year.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: Xi's carbon emission ambition causes massive blackouts in China
articles.description: While China is attempting to lead the narrative of tackling climate change on the global stage, local manufacturers and residents are crying out on social media as various provinces across the country experience power shortages.
articles.author: Dong Xing

articles.headline: 'I'm ready to move on': Reynolds content with Broncos move but first a premiership to win
articles.description: South Sydney Rabbitohs captain Adam Reynolds says he's ready to join the Brisbane Broncos in 2022 but hopes he'll have two premierships under his belt by then.
articles.author: Chloe Hart

articles.headline: Here are the key revelations from Netflix's new Britney Spears documentary
articles.description: The film illustrates the contentious battle for control over the singer's life and multi-million-dollar estate – and offers some new insights.
articles.author: Paul Donoughue

articles.headline: Queensland's vaccination rate casts shadow over Christmas, NSW says
articles.description: NSW Cross-border Commissioner James McTavish says the states could find themselves out of alignment if Queenslanders don't start getting the jab in greater numbers.
articles.author: Dominic Cansdale, Matt Webber, and Julie Clift

articles.headline: Richmond great joins Essendon's coaching staff
articles.description: Alex Rance, who helped the Tigers win a drought-breaking premiership in 2017, links up with the Bombers as they continue to chase their first flag in more than two decades.
articles.author: Dominic Cansdale, Matt Webber, and Julie Clift

articles.headline: Accused AFL grand final COVID breachers who allegedly faked documents to stay behind bars
articles.description: Two Victorian men accused of putting at risk more than 60,000 people by attending the grand final in Perth after falsifying documents to enter the state appear in court.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: RAAF chaplaincy program being investigated after allegations of bullying, harassment of female staff
articles.description: The Australian Air Force's chaplaincy program is facing a wide-ranging inquiry over allegations female staff suffered bullying, discrimination and sexual harassment including having packaging for a gynaecological instrument kept as a joke in a meeting area.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: Childcare centres among Victoria's latest tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites
articles.description: Childcare facilities in Narre Warren, Delahey, Kensington and Truganina have been listed as exposure sites as the state's outbreak grows.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: More than 90 per cent of them are vaccinated, but Singapore's migrant workers remain confined
articles.description: As coronavirus infections spike across the island, Singapore's migrant workers are forbidden from mingling with the general population, even though most of them are fully vaccinated.
articles.author: Jason Dasey

articles.headline: How effective are the Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines?
articles.description: Some studies published in recent weeks appear to show some COVID-19 vaccines might be slightly more effective than others, and some may have longer-lasting protection. But here's why you should be cautious before making "black and white" comparisons between vaccines.
articles.author: Leonie Thorne

articles.headline: South-east Queensland on alert as inner Brisbane COVID exposure sites emerge
articles.description: A number of new close contact exposure sites are listed across Brisbane, after CHO Jeannette Young warned she was watching the situation very closely.
articles.author: Leonie Thorne

articles.headline: Vaping crackdown as importation of nicotine e-cigarettes banned
articles.description: Australia's pharmaceutical regulator hopes an importation ban will prevent young people from taking up nicotine e-cigarettes with reports of children as young as 11 vaping.
articles.author: Tim Swanston

articles.headline: Argyle's last pink gems about to be auctioned for millions
articles.description: They have been described as Australia's "signature gem", but the very last pink diamonds from Rio Tinto's Argyle mine are about to be sold in a secret auction.
articles.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

articles.headline: Sally was 'left in a basket outside a pub' as a baby. At 61, she's found the woman who could've saved her
articles.description: At three years old, Sally Gordon entered the out-of-home care system, where she was allegedly sexually assaulted by a man sent to transport her between the homes. She thinks one woman could have stopped the violence that followed her in life. Fifty years later, she's tracked her down.
articles.author: Katri Uibu, Ros Lehman, Maren Preuss, and Kate Higgins

articles.headline: Has Elon Musk found the 'holy grail' for getting to Mars?
articles.description: Videos of his rockets exploding have captured the world's attention. Now Elon Musk's SpaceX is racing towards its first major mission — getting to the Moon.
articles.author: Katri Uibu, Ros Lehman, Maren Preuss, and Kate Higgins

articles.headline: How subsidising household batteries would kill two birds with one stone
articles.description: Australia's solar boom was driven by generous subsidies. Environment reporter Nick Kilvert questions whether batteries should be next.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: Where will Australians be able to fly when borders reopen?
articles.description: As Australia inches closer to the 80 per cent vaccination target needed for the country's borders to reopen, the picture of what the first few months of international travel will look like is becoming clearer.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: 'We've already lost our country': The Afghan scholars forced to flee a 'civil death'
articles.description: Until August, they were part of a young, educated generation of Afghan scholars and scientists pursuing their dreams. Now they're running for their lives.
articles.author: Natasha Mitchell

articles.headline: Sarah Everard's killer falsely arrested and handcuffed her, London court hears
articles.description: A London court hears how the killer of Sarah Everard falsely arrested her for breaching COVID restrictions before handcuffing her and putting her in a car.
articles.author: Natasha Mitchell

articles.headline: After receiving $100,000 a Danish artist delivered a museum nothing more than two blank canvasses
articles.description: A Danish artist loaned more than $100,000 to recreate his old artworks using banknotes has pocketed the cash and submitted blank canvasses with a new title: Take the Money and Run.
articles.author: Natasha Mitchell

articles.headline: Hong Kong passes new privacy laws that leave government critics concerned
articles.description: A new privacy law passes in Hong Kong sparking fears the government could use it to further curtail freedoms, while the state broadcaster tells staff they must act in the Chinese national interest.
articles.author: Natasha Mitchell

articles.headline: London honours Princess Diana with blue plaque at former home
articles.description: London honours the late Princess Diana with a blue plaque at the place she called home in the two years before she married Prince Charles.
articles.author: Natasha Mitchell

articles.headline: COVID-19 business support to end when vaccination rates hit 80 per cent
articles.description: Financial support for COVID-affected businesses is coming to an end, with the federal government mapping out the last payments for states and territories with lockdowns.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: WA COVID threats averted as test results for pilot and alleged border rule-breaker turn out to be false positives
articles.description: Concerns over a potential COVID-19 outbreak in Western Australia ease after a man alleged to have illegally entered the state to watch the AFL grand final and a Russian military pilot were found to have earlier received false-positive test results.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: 'Inept' and 'pretend': Doctors dissatisfied with consultation process for new Adelaide hospital
articles.description: Almost three-quarters of clinicians are either dissatisfied or very dissatisfied with engagement for Adelaide's new Women's and Children's Hospital, according to a survey.
articles.author: Rory McClaren

articles.headline: Fumio Kishida to be Japan's new prime minister
articles.description: Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) has voted in former foreign minister Fumio Kishida as its new leader, a victory that virtually ensures he will become Japan's next prime minister within days.
articles.author: Rory McClaren

articles.headline: 'Abuse of procedure': Speaker dismisses LNP referral of Palaszczuk to parliamentary committee over Doherty COVID modelling
articles.description: A referral made by the Queensland Opposition alleging Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk deliberately misled Parliament over Doherty Institute COVID modelling is dismissed by the Speaker.
articles.author: Rachel Riga

articles.headline: 'For the good of everyone': Fearnley pleads with vaccine-hesitant to get the jab and protect those with disability
articles.description: Paralympic favourite Kurt Fearnley makes an impassioned plea for Australians who have yet to get their COVID vaccine to do so, in a late push to protect the country's most vulnerable.
articles.author: James Maasdorp

articles.headline: NSW crisis cabinet signs off on earlier re-opening of schools
articles.description: The NSW government brings forward the return of face-to-face learning, allowing students to head back to classrooms one week earlier than planned.
articles.author: James Maasdorp

articles.headline: Victoria heading to a wet end to the week, as flash flooding warnings flagged in regional areas
articles.description: Victoria is in store for heavy rainfall and flash flooding warnings are in place for parts of the state as wet weather is expected over coming days.
articles.author: James Maasdorp

articles.headline: COVID would 'take off' in Tasmania at 80pc vaccinated, Premier warns
articles.description: Tasmania's Premier warns the state will not reopen its borders to all interstate travellers until it reaches a 90 per cent vaccination rate, saying modelling for an 80 per cent target shows the state could record nearly 15,000 COVID cases in six months.
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: 'The worst is still to come': Struggling businesses say there's no reason to keep borders closed
articles.description: Border businesses and community leaders on the New South Wales-Victoria border say it is time to reopen the states and align restrictions with COVID case numbers similar.
articles.author: Erin Somerville

articles.headline: Contact tracing is changing in New South Wales. Here's what you'll find now in the Service NSW app
articles.description: People in New South Wales will be alerted within the state's check-in app if they have been to a COVID-19 exposure site.
articles.author: Erin Somerville

articles.headline: Bennett hints at his plans for 2022 ahead of Rabbitohs exit after grand final
articles.description: Amid specualtion he will coach the NRL's new franchise in 2023, outgoing South Sydney mentor Wayne Bennett leaves the door open about what he will be doing next year.
articles.author: Erin Somerville

articles.headline: BOM issues warnings as wild storms with large hail whip through southern Queensland
articles.description: Severe thunderstorms sweep through southern Queensland, with 6cm hail reported on the western Darling Downs earlier this afternoon, the Bureau of Meteorology says.
articles.author: Erin Somerville

articles.headline: Three injured, properties destroyed as tornado hits regional NSW
articles.description: A wild storm cell has torn off roofs, taken down powerlines and injured people at Meadow Flat, about 170km west of Sydney.
articles.author: Mollie Gorman and Xanthe Gregory

articles.headline: South Australia records one new case of COVID-19
articles.description: South Australia has recorded one new case of COVID-19 in a truck driver who travelled to and from Melbourne.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin and Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Couple to stand trial over alleged theft of more than $400,000 from Australia Post
articles.description: The former manager of the Tennant Creek post office and her husband, a well-known livestock agent, are facing charges that include theft and money laundering.
articles.author: Hugo Rikard-Bell and Steven Schubert

articles.headline: Canberra man pleads guilty over crash death of promising Canberra Brave ice hockey player Lachlan Seary
articles.description: Peter James Loeschnauer pleads to culpable driving causing death over a crash that claimed the life of "talented" young ice hockey player Lachlan Seary. Police allege Loeschnauer initially told a passerby at the scene that he had hit a kangaroo.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Mining company TNG Limited scraps plans for Darwin Harbour processing facility
articles.description: A mining company has ditched its plans to build a mineral-processing facility on Darwin Harbour, instead proposing to co-locate it with its proposed Mount Peake project.
articles.author: Daniel Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Planning a holiday? You'll need several COVID apps to do it
articles.description: Australians will need to manage multiple check-in apps if they move between states once borders are open and consent to their medical records being shared every 12 months.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: Adelaide terror accused with 'non-existent social networks' had recently applied for passport
articles.description: A man charged with multiple terrorism offences did not appear to have a social network "past his mother", court documents reveal.
articles.author: Isabel Dayman

articles.headline: Service NSW handed out $16m in suspected fraudulent disaster grants, recovered $40k, inquiry hears
articles.description: More than 2,000 people in NSW received large sums of money from suspected fraudulent applications they submitted for COVID-19, bushfire and flood disaster relief and Service NSW has only recovered a fraction of what they are owed.
articles.author: Kathleen Calderwood

articles.headline: Troy Buswell charged with perversion of justice over phone call to ex-wife
articles.description: Troy Buswell appears in court charged with perverting the course of justice over claims he contacted his former wife amid his ongoing domestic violence trial.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: Entrepreneurs have long known you have to spend money to make money. The government is now learning it, too
articles.description: Last year's budget deficit is smaller than expected. That's because the government spent a record amount of money to keep more Australians in jobs and paying taxes.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Dogs to be fully vaxxed by AFL pre-season
articles.description: The AFL is yet to announce whether coronavirus vaccinations will be mandatory but every member of the Western Bulldogs' squad has received at least one dose.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Teenage boy critical, others in hospital after group ingested unknown substance
articles.description: Six children and teenagers are in hospital in North Queensland after ingesting an unknown substance.
articles.author: Angel Parsons

articles.headline: 'A large outbreak would be devastating': Unvaccinated Indigenous communities urged to get the jab
articles.description: A COVID-19 outbreak in an unvaccinated community would put pressure on the Alice Springs Hospital and intensive care unit, and result in a devastating death toll, the Northern Territory's Health Minister warns.
articles.author: Stewart Brash and Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Gippsland maternity ward, Indigenous clinic in lockdown after COVID-19 exposure
articles.description: A maternity and paediatric ward of an Eastern Victoria hospital is in lockdown after a COVID positive person attended yesterday.
articles.author: Emma Field

articles.headline: 'Gut-wrenching': How paedophiles are using social media to target children
articles.description: Last year, authorities received more than 20 million reports flagging online child sexual exploitation across the world.
articles.author: Ella Archibald-Binge

articles.headline: Mystery southern NSW COVID case
articles.description: The patient is being transferred to Melbourne after they presented to Deniliquin Hospital yesterday with exposure sites listed for Moama.
articles.author: Emily Doak

articles.headline: Squid Game is on track to become Netflix's most popular show ever. Here's what you need to know
articles.description: Netflix says Squid Game is on track to become the streaming service's most watched program ever.
articles.author: Max Walden

articles.headline: Three people arrested after drugs and $21,000 cash found at Adelaide property
articles.description: Three people have been arrested, including a man charged with drug trafficking and money laundering offences, after a police raid at Ottoway.
articles.author: Max Walden

articles.headline: Wallabies make selection history with 76-year first ahead of clash with Pumas
articles.description: The Wallabies make a selection move not seen since World War II, as Australia prepares for Saturday's Test against Argentina on the Gold Coast.
articles.author: Max Walden

articles.headline: 'Not been necessary' and 'never used': State and territory health officials confirm COVIDSafe app hasn't helped in current outbreaks
articles.description: Since the start of the pandemic, COVIDSafe has only identified 17 close contacts that weren't found by state officials.
articles.author: Dan Conifer

articles.headline: Queenslanders to get clarity on roadmap as state juggles four COVID-19 clusters
articles.description: Queenslanders are set to gain more clarity around the state's border restrictions today when Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk meets with National Cabinet.
articles.author: Jessica Rendall

articles.headline: 'My experience is akin to waterboarding': Elizabeth lost her son and says the delay in justice is torture
articles.description: Elizabeth turns up to court over and over again in the hope that the case against her son's alleged killer finally progresses. But she says she's instead "bearing witness to a sloppy system masquerading as being caring".
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Sima is safely in Australia, but her escape from Kabul still haunts her dreams
articles.description: Watching the Taliban storm Kabul, Afghan Australian woman Sima thought she'd never enjoy freedom again. After an incredibly difficult journey, she's rebuilding her life in Australia.
articles.author: Matt Bamford

articles.headline: Parcel delivery delays are hear to stay, logistics boss warns
articles.description: Industrial action, COVID-19 disruptions and Christmas-level parcel volumes every week mean lengthy delays to delivery times are here to stay, according to the boss of a leading logistics software firm.
articles.author: Alicia Barry

articles.headline: What Victoria's COVID-19 surge means for the roadmap
articles.description: Burnet modelling predicted COVID-19 cases in Victoria would reach between 1,400 to 2,900 by the end of October. Given the state has reached that number much earlier, what will happen now?
articles.author: Kristian Silva and Zena Chamas

articles.headline: Former planning chief says coal mine assessments lack transparency
articles.description: Former director-general of the NSW Department of Planning, Sue Holliday, believes a "clearer, simpler" criteria is needed to assess coal projects.
articles.author: Jake Lapham

articles.headline: How a tornado formed in western NSW and why it's more common than you think
articles.description: The tornado that ripped through parts of regional New South Wales yesterday injured people and left properties in ruin — this is how it formed and why we do not hear about more tornadoes in Australia.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: Morrison's career lives or dies on how he navigates the next few months
articles.description: If Scott Morrison doesn't go to the Glasgow climate conference, "his absence will send a pretty strong message", Malcolm Turnbull said during his general excoriation of the Prime Minister this week. Absolutely, it will, writes Michelle Grattan.
articles.author: Michelle Grattan

articles.headline: Julian Assange supporters want to know what Australia knew of reported CIA plot to kill WikiLeaks founder
articles.description: A group of prominent Australians have written to the Prime Minister, asking what the government knew about an alleged CIA plan to assassinate the WikiLeaks founder and whether they were caught up in the plot.
articles.author: Dylan Welch

articles.headline: Nuclear submarine deal with US and UK will send work offshore, defence suppliers fear
articles.description: Local defence suppliers fear a decision to harness American and British technology to build Australian nuclear-powered submarines will see significant amounts of work go offshore.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Australia's suicide rate has dropped to its lowest level since 2016 — but there's still much more to do
articles.description: Despite early warnings that suicides would spike during the pandemic, the most recent data suggests that hasn't been the case. The reasons why, however, are less clear.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Why the reality of 'opening up' looks different for those who are immunocompromised
articles.description: For people who are immunocompromised and at a higher risk of getting sick from COVID-19, the prospect of reopening brings a sense of fear and unease.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: Daylight saving time is just around the corner — here's when you'll spring forward into summer
articles.description: Days in Australia are getting longer and warmer as summer approaches, and the time has come for parts of the country to spring forward and take advantage of daylight savings time.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: Underneath the Himalayas, India is building kilometres of strategically important tunnels
articles.description: The tunnels will connect the flashpoint region of Ladakh, bordering China and Pakistan, with Kashmir making it India's highest and longest tunnel at over three kilometres above sea level.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: Q+A panellists issue warning on what could happen if Australia reopens too quickly
articles.description: Q+A panellists say Australia must make sure its most vulnerable citizens are fully vaccinated before the  nation reopens.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Now that Britney Spears's father has been suspended from her conservatorship, what happens next?
articles.description: The years-long battle over Britney Spears's conservatorship looks to be nearly over after her father lost his role as the controller of his daughter's business affairs. So what comes next for the singer?
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Former policeman who killed Sarah Everard gets most severe sentence, is set to die in jail
articles.description: Wayne Couzens, the former police officer who kidnapped, raped and murdered London woman Sarah Everard, will spend the rest of his life behind bars.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Former French president found guilty in second trial this year
articles.description: A Paris court hands former French president Nicolas Sarkozy a one-year prison sentence after finding him guilty of illegal campaign financing over his failed 2012 re-election bid.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Cricket Australia facing Sheffield Shield headache in Ashes build-up
articles.description: Contenders for the Australia XI to face England in the men's Ashes may not get much of a chance to play red-ball cricket before the series begins in December.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Reprisal attacks lead to lighter sentences for several people involved in fatal fight at Canberra skate park
articles.description: Several people who have pleaded guilty to their involvement in a deadly fight at a Canberra skate park receive reduced sentences because they have been the target of reprisal attacks.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: NRL won't rule out postponing grand final if COVID-19 restrictions tighten
articles.description: The league is "quietly confident" the grand final will go ahead on Sunday, but it will consider postponing the match should Queensland's COVID-19 situation worsen.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Regional Victorian schools stagger return to the classroom
articles.description: Children in prep to year 2 and year 12 students will return to school from Monday with year 11 students joining them on Wednesday.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: COVID alert at John Hunter Hospital's baby ICU and maternity ward, as six parents test positive
articles.description: Hunter New England Health confirms six parents of newborns have tested positive for the virus but says no babies have become infected.
articles.author: Giselle Wakatama

articles.headline: 'I was totally out of my mind': Hoffmann's interview with police after alleged shooting spree
articles.description: A Northern Territory jury has been shown footage of Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann being interviewed by police in the days following an alleged shooting spree.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: COVID-19 fragments in wastewater in Darwin industrial area
articles.description: Viral fragments have been found in wastewater samples at the treatment plant in Berrimah, with health authorities urging any freight and transport workers to check testing requirements.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Perth home values soar by 18.1 per cent, prices to stay strong into 2022
articles.description: The growth over the past year is even bigger in regional WA, with a 19.9 per cent increase in dwelling values over the past 12 months.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch and Michael Janda

articles.headline: Judge says woman drunkenly bashed, fatally stabbed by partner 'might still be alive' if witnesses had called police
articles.description: A Northern Territory Supreme Court judge says a Palmerston murder was a "terribly tragic happening" where no witnesses called for help, reminding bystanders that they can stop lives being taken and others ruined.
articles.author: Jacqueline Breen

articles.headline: Phantom Pfizer order causes havoc as bush GPs cancel hundreds of appointments
articles.description: Regional medical staff say they faced abuse after being forced to cancel hundreds of vaccination appointments when thousands of promised Pfizer doses failed to arrive.
articles.author: Mikaela Ortolan

articles.headline: Why Gladys had to go
articles.description: While the state was looking ahead to lockdown freedoms, Premier Gladys Berejiklian became unemployed. She is not the first premier to be brought down by corruption inquiries, ABC's state political reporter Ashleigh Raper says.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper

articles.headline: Mandatory vaccination date set for Victorian food producers, agricultural workers
articles.description: After pleading to be included earlier in the vaccine rollout, Victorian farmers now have an October 15 deadline, or two weeks, to get a COVID-19 vaccine.
articles.author: Peter Somerville and Warwick Long

articles.headline: With no code of conduct, SA politicians can't be investigated, ICAC says
articles.description: The Independent Commissioner Against Corruption raises concerns that MPs cannot be investigated for misconduct claims until they implement their own code of conduct.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Second truck driver in two days tests positive for COVID-19 after being in South Australia
articles.description: A truck driver who visited Adelaide from Victoria to buy a truck with a colleague tests positive for coronavirus.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Meet the men in the mix to take NSW's top job
articles.description: Gladys Berejiklian is gone — and who will replace her remains unclear. A long weekend in NSW could mean its several days before the state's next premier is revealed.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Dreaming of a holiday? International travel won't be quite as straightforward as before
articles.description: Australia's border has been slammed shut for 18 months, but today it became clearer the end is in sight and changes are expected to international travel next month.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: The long-lost art of walking returns to Test cricket, thanks to India's Punam Raut
articles.description: India batter Punam Raut gives herself out caught behind on day two of the Test against Australia, embodying a rarely seen part of the spirit of cricket.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Daughter of one of Canberra's COVID-19 deaths wants her dad remembered
articles.description: The daughter of one of two Canberrans who died overnight with COVID-19 wants her dad to be remembered for the well-known character that he was.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford and Tahlia Roy

articles.headline: Why Berejiklian resigned: Everything you need to know about corruption inquiry into departing Premier
articles.description: In her own words, Gladys Berejiklian says her resignation "could not happen at a worse time". So why is she doing it? It comes down to a few things and one of them is NSW's all-powerful corruption watchdog.
articles.author: Cecilia Connell

articles.headline: Wallabies chase a fourth straight win while Greg Holmes eyes off obscure piece of history
articles.description: The Wallabies are eyeing off their best-ever return in The Rugby Championship era, looking for a fourth straight win for the first time since 2017. And they've recalled a couple of players for their first taste of international rugby in just as long.
articles.author: Brett McKay

articles.headline: Victoria's construction industry is reopening. Here are the new rules
articles.description: After a string of COVID cases led to the shut down of the construction industry, the Victorian government has announced new rules for the industry once workers are allowed to return to sites next week. Here's what we know.
articles.author: Brett McKay

articles.headline: 'I'm relieved': Warrnambool avoids lockdown, but authorities warn it's not out of the woods
articles.description: The south-west Victorian city of Warrnambool records one new COVID-19 case on Friday bringing its total to 18 active cases.
articles.author: Daniel Miles and Matt Neal

articles.headline: Mothers and newborns forced apart in 'distressing' maternity ward COVID outbreak
articles.description: Health authorities renew calls for pregnant women to get vaccinated as six parents of newborns catch COVID in a Newcastle hospital.
articles.author: Ben Millington

articles.headline: Berejiklian invincible as NSW Premier until personal 'stuff up'
articles.description: Former NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian's personal approval ratings soared as she led her state through bushfires and a global pandemic, but it was during the times that she was most under pressure that she showed her inner steel.
articles.author: Sarah Gerathy and Jean Kennedy

articles.headline: School formal driver guilty of dangerous driving for ploughing into diners after burnout
articles.description: Wisam El Haouli was filmed doing a burnout in a Torana before crashing into a Sunshine Coast restaurant strip on his way to delivering teenagers to a school formal.
articles.author: Jake Kearnan and Jacqui Street

articles.headline: Victorian woman faces court after allegedly breaching quarantine in WA
articles.description: A woman who recently travelled to WA from Victoria has been remanded in custody, after she was arrested at Kalgoorlie train station for allegedly breaching quarantine.
articles.author: Jarrod Lucas and Amelia Searson

articles.headline: South Australia to scrap jumps racing from next year
articles.description: The South Australian horse racing industry announces jumps racing will not be a part of the calendar as of next year, citing declining participation levels as the reason behind the decision.
articles.author: Jarrod Lucas and Amelia Searson

articles.headline: Brumby numbers to be cut heavily under new Kosciuszko Park plan
articles.description: A highly anticipated draft plan to manage the number of wild horses in the park proposes reducing brumby numbers to a "sustainable" 3,000 from 14,000 now.
articles.author: Adriane Reardon and Keira Proust

articles.headline: All-star line up announced for NFL Super Bowl half-time show
articles.description: The NFL announces an all-star hip hop show for half-time of Super Bowl LVI, set to be held at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.
articles.author: Adriane Reardon and Keira Proust

articles.headline: Driver charged with attempted murder after cyclists hit in alleged road rage incidents
articles.description: A man faces six charges after cars and two cyclists were hit in four alleged road rage incidents on the Sunshine Coast, that left the cyclists with serious injuries.
articles.author: Jacqui Street

articles.headline: Man arrested as pro and anti vaccination protesters descend on East Perth
articles.description: One man is arrested and police are forced to briefly close a street as pro and anti-vaccination protestors rally in the same location at East Perth.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger and Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Why the Pacific has become a testing ground for blockchain and cryptocurrency projects
articles.description: Start-ups are coming to the Pacific to pilot a number of world-first blockchain and cryptocurrency projects. Some say it could revolutionise governments and banking, but critics are worried that the region is being used to test the technologies.
articles.author: Prianka Srinivasan

articles.headline: An ill-timed magazine cover, a Premier undone and the PM who races ahead with his own agenda
articles.description: Gladys Berejiklian, the woman touted last year as the one who had "saved Australia", could not save herself this week, writes Laura Tingle.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: When you'll likely be able to travel overseas, depending on which state you're in
articles.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says international travel is on the horizon. But when it will actually become a reality depends on where you live.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: Doctors call for reset on home care for COVID-19 patients
articles.description: As COVID-19 case numbers spike in Victoria, more people are expected be treated at home, but GPs are warning there needs to be urgent changes to how this healthcare is delivered.
articles.author: Elise Kinsella and Bridget Fitzgerald

articles.headline: 'I might get infected then bring it home': Woolworths accused of risking worker safety to keep stores stocked
articles.description: A Woolworths worker says changes to how the supermarket giant handles COVID contacts in its NSW distribution centres, aimed at avoiding disruptions to food supplies, have left staff feeling exposed to the virus.
articles.author: Pat McGrath and Alison McClymont

articles.headline: China flexes military muscles on National Day with two sorties over Taiwan
articles.description: People's Liberation Army fighter jets make the largest display of fighter jets and bombers near Taiwan this year, as China takes aim at Taiwan's foreign minister for promoting the island's independence.
articles.author: Pat McGrath and Alison McClymont

articles.headline: Russia 'concerned' that Australia will have nuclear-powered submarines
articles.description: Russia's deputy foreign minister Sergei Ryabkov says the AUKUS announcement poses a "great challenge" to the international nuclear non-proliferation regime.
articles.author: Pat McGrath and Alison McClymont

articles.headline: How London is stuck in a 'bad dream' of violence against women
articles.description: Sabina Nessa's case has made headlines around the world. But in the days following her death, social media users criticised the lack of media coverage over her death compared to cases with white victims.
articles.author: Lucia Stein and Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: DNA and death note show former French police officer to be serial killer
articles.description: A serial killer suspected in some of France's oldest unsolved cases is found dead after 35 years on the run after being sent a summons by a magistrate who reopened the case.
articles.author: Lucia Stein and Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: Japan's Princess Mako, commoner fiance set wedding date
articles.description: Later this month, Japanese Princess Mako will marry her former college classmate fiance, after years of intense scrutiny and criticism that cast her engagement in an unflattering light, and when she does, she will leave the royal family.
articles.author: Lucia Stein and Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: How Victorians have reacted to vaccine mandates set to affect around a million workers
articles.description: Industry heads across Victoria react to recent news of a vaccine mandate for authorized workers, affecting around a million people.
articles.author: Rachel Clayton and Zena Chamas

articles.headline: Darwin Turf Club's new board to push ahead with ICAC legal challenge
articles.description: Darwin Turf Club's new board will fight findings made by the anti-corruption watchdog that found improper conduct in relation to a taxpayer-funded grandstand.
articles.author: Isaac Nowroozi and Jano Gibson

articles.headline: Severe thunderstorms pelt south-east Queensland, hail hits Western and Darling Downs
articles.description: Severe thunderstorms are pelting parts of south-east Queensland, with large hail recorded in the Western and Darling Downs.
articles.author: Stephanie Zillman

articles.headline: San Diego Synagogue shooter sentenced to life without parole
articles.description: The man who killed one woman and injured three other worshippers in a synagogue hears of the pain he caused as he is sentenced to life without the possibility of parole.
articles.author: Stephanie Zillman

articles.headline: Greater Shepparton entering seven-day lockdown
articles.description: Victoria's Acting Chief Health Officer has declared the City of Greater Shepparton will enter a seven-day lockdown starting at 11:59pm on Friday.
articles.author: Stephanie Zillman

articles.headline: WA Premier Mark McGowan holds firm setting overseas travel date, baulks at home quarantine
articles.description: The WA Premier says he won't be rushed into welcoming international travellers back into the state, and would set a date once WA reached a vaccination rate between 80 and 90 per cent.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch and Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: Moorabool enters lockdown as cases seep into region from city
articles.description: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews says a snap seven-day lockdown in Moorabool is "unavoidable" due to the region's increasing coronavirus cases.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch and Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: Jury hears accused Darwin shooter 'erratic', 'agitated' before alleged shooting spree
articles.description: Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann's former workmates say the accused murderer spoke about getting a gun and wanting to "hurt" someone called Alex prior to the alleged shooting spree, a court has been told.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Super Netball grand finalists fined for failing to report links to COVID-19 exposure sites
articles.description: In a year where Netball NSW is already struggling financially due to loss of income with the competition's constant relocation, the state sporting body is fined after an investigation shows the Swifts and Giants breached COVID-19 reporting protocols.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Why Gladys Berejiklian left herself no option but to resign
articles.description: While the state was looking ahead to lockdown freedoms, Premier Gladys Berejiklian became unemployed. She is not the first premier to be brought down by corruption inquiries, ABC's state political reporter Ashleigh Raper says.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper

articles.headline: Pair in clown masks invade home north of Brisbane looking for drugs, man wounded in face
articles.description: Two men in clown masks are reported to have invaded a house at Bray Park, north of Brisbane, and shot a man in the face with what police described as "an unknown firearm".
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Chinese tech giants roll out more courier robots as demand grows for contactless services
articles.description: More than a thousand robots are set to join the delivery services of Chinese tech giants Alibaba, Meituan and JD.com over the next year, as the continuing COVID-19 pandemic fuels demand for contactless services and the cost of making robots drops.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: UFC fighter shakes, almost collapses on stage after 'miserable' weight cut
articles.description: Macy Chiasson pulls out of the UFC bantamweight bout with Aspen Ladd after Ladd misses weight for the fourth time in her professional career.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Rugby Championship live: Wallabies take on Argentina
articles.description: The Wallabies end their 2021 Rugby Championship campaign against a depleted Argentina side on the Gold Coast, Later, the Springboks take on the grand slam-chasing All Blacks. Follow live.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Victorian police arrest protesters at rally against vaccine mandates
articles.description: Police make several arrests and disperse a protest against Victoria's COVID-19 vaccination rules, a day after the state government announces mandatory coverage for around 1 million workers.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: South Australia records two new cases of COVID-19
articles.description: A woman who returned to South Australia on a flight from Victoria on Friday afternoon and a man in an Adelaide medi-hotel are the state's two new cases of COVID-19.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Mango season boosted by arrival of Pacific workers
articles.description: Meet the seasonal workers from Pacific nations who are helping boost the Northern Territory's mango industry
articles.author: Housnia Shams

articles.headline: 'A success story rarely replicated': McGowan touts WA's COVID success in speech to Labor faithful ahead of federal campaign
articles.description: Western Australia's premier, Mark McGowan, says the state has become a global success story amid its handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, in a speech to Labor party members at the ALP's state conference.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: 'Never thought we'd have to do this': Britons pushed to food banks as government winds up COVID-19 pandemic aid
articles.description: Charity food banks in Britain say they are already near full capacity as winter closes in, and are gearing up for a surge in demand.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: Queensland Premier visits Gold Coast cafe, reportedly one hour after a COVID case was there
articles.description: Annastacia Palaszczuk attended the same location as a COVID-infected person earlier this week, reportedly missing them by an hour. Nearly a week on, the cafe was only just added to the exposure site list after a mix-up.
articles.author: Tara Cassidy and Kimberley Bernard

articles.headline: Gladys Berejiklian has resigned — this is what will happen next
articles.description: An hour after the corruption watchdog announced an investigation into NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian, she resigned. Now that the dust has settled, Australia's most populous state is looking for a new leader.
articles.author: Cecilia Connell

articles.headline: Victoria 'very unhappy' Commonwealth isn't matching support for shut-down construction industry
articles.description: Tim Pallas launches an attack on the federal government over what he calls an "unfair" lack of financial support for the state's shut-down construction sector.
articles.author: Cecilia Connell

articles.headline: New Brisbane and Gold Coast locations added to COVID contact list
articles.description: Queensland Health authorities have issued a new public health alert, adding several new venues to the state's exposure sites list at suburbs in northern Brisbane and the southern Gold Coast.
articles.author: Cecilia Connell

articles.headline: 'We are all doing well': Princess Beatrice names daughter Sienna Elizabeth
articles.description: Princess Beatrice honours her grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II, by naming her first child Sienna Elizabeth.
articles.author: Cecilia Connell

articles.headline: South Korea broadband firm sues Netflix following traffic surge from 'Squid Game'
articles.description: The popularity of the hit series Squid Game and other offerings underscores Netflix's status as South Korea's second-largest data traffic generator after YouTube, but the two are the only content providers not to pay network usage fees.
articles.author: Cecilia Connell

articles.headline: Live: India declares on 8-377 on penultimate day of Test against Australia
articles.description: The standalone women's Test looks destined for a draw as India builds a big total on day three before finally sending Australia in to bat. Follow all the updates in our live blog.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: 11-year-old Georgie's farm is bursting with 'Billy buttons'. Now she's sending the 'little balls of sunshine' all over Australia
articles.description: At first, Georgie planned to set up a roadside stall to sell the native wildflowers growing on her family's farm — but then an Instagram post went viral.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Colourful Sydney NRL fans swept up in grand final fever
articles.description: The NRL grand final might be taking place almost 1,000km away to the north in Brisbane, but that's not stopping diehard South Sydney Rabbitohs and Penrith Panthers fans showing their colours.
articles.author: Chloe Hart

articles.headline: 'Powerful' emotions as victims of crime and families of young offenders meet to try and heal a community
articles.description: Days after the funeral of a girl, 12, killed in a stolen car crash, Fitzroy Crossing leaders try to bring together a town splintered by escalating youth crime.
articles.author: Jacqueline Lynch

articles.headline: No changes to NSW's COVID lockdown exit if Stokes becomes Premier
articles.description: Planning Minister Rob Stokes says he won't change the state's COVID-19 lockdown exit blueprint if he becomes NSW's next Premier when a ballot is held next week.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper and Riley Stuart

articles.headline: Indigenous leaders celebrate as 40th anniversary of APY land rights act is marked
articles.description: Indigenous leaders say today is a day for reflection, marking 40 years since the Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Land Rights Act granted traditional owners freehold title of the APY Lands.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper and Riley Stuart

articles.headline: More than 1,000km from Sydney, one of NSW's most precious ecosystems is blossoming, but how easy is it to visit?
articles.description: As Menindee Lakes brim with life, having filled with water for the first time in nine years, attention is turning to one of the biggest hurdles for tourists wanting to visit — the dirt roads.
articles.author: Bill Ormonde

articles.headline: ACT records 52 new COVID-19 cases, 13 people in hospital with the virus
articles.description: At least 29 of the 52 new COVID-19 cases in the ACT were infectious in the community, as the territory records its highest daily number of cases since the pandemic began.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: Junior doctors at NT hospitals told they face a 12-month employment ban if they resign early
articles.description: Junior medical officers employed by NT Health are warned they will not be hired again for at least a year if they resign before completing their contract, following a spate of early resignations.
articles.author: Isaac Nowroozi

articles.headline: New research suggests COVID vaccine in pregnant women could give newborns extra protection
articles.description: Researchers are learning more and more about how COVID vaccines share protection from a pregnant mother to her unborn child.
articles.author: Stephanie Boltje

articles.headline: Phoebe told the doctors she was fleeing domestic violence. They diagnosed her as 'delusional'
articles.description: When the beatings and the verbal abuse became too much, Phoebe sought refuge at her local hospital. What came next almost cost the mother of two everything.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Europe-Japan spacecraft captures its first picture of Mercury
articles.description: The BepiColombo spacecraft gets its first glimpse of Mercury as it swings by the solar system's innermost planet while on a mission to deliver two probes into orbit in 2025.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Hopes high strangest-ever NRL grand final will go ahead in Brisbane with no COVID-19 curve ball
articles.description: Brisbane scored the NRL grand final because of the explosion of COVID-19 cases in Sydney, but hours before kick-off there is still a chance the pandemic will throw a curve ball into the mix and prompt Queensland authorities to enact a lockdown.
articles.author: Rachel McGhee

articles.headline: Nayran spent a year in immigration detention. Now she's providing life-changing support to new arrivals
articles.description: Adapting to life in Australia was not easy for these award-winning refugees, but all of them are now leaders within their communities.
articles.author: Rachel McGhee

articles.headline: Greater Sydney hits 100 days in lockdown as residents look forward to simple things once its over
articles.description: A COVID-19 outbreak on June 16 plunged millions of residents into a state-wide lockdown. What was meant to last for two weeks has drawn out into 100 days of being separated from family and friends. There's "great relief" as we get closer to the finish line.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham, Catherine Hanrahan, Alison Xiao, and Rani Hayman

articles.headline: 'It doesn’t care how popular the person is':  ICAC insider defends timing of Berejiklian probe
articles.description: ICAC insider Geoffrey Watson SC describes the NSW corruption watchdog's mid-pandemic scrutiny of Premier Gladys Berejiklian as "a great moment", as debate rages about the timing of its investigation.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham, Catherine Hanrahan, Alison Xiao, and Rani Hayman

articles.headline: Things to watch in the grand final if it's the only NRL game you see each year
articles.description: It can be hard to keep up with the NRL from week to week, so here are five things that will help you enjoy tonight's grand final a little more.
articles.author: Jack Snape

articles.headline: Gen Z's premature mid-life crisis may be a tale of hope and resilience
articles.description: Topped off with a global pandemic, Gen Z's crisis bucket list seems short of only a zombie apocalypse. But their collective exposure to multiple extraordinary events may be creating a more resilient, shock-proof generation, writes Intifar Chowdhury.
articles.author: Jack Snape

articles.headline: How France and Europe see China holds a lesson for Australia
articles.description: If we want a more stable region, France must be at the table. Rather than alienate France, Australia should be getting closer to it, writes Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: At 45, Brett Farmer was diagnosed with testicular cancer. He says his life as a 'smoke chewer' is to blame
articles.description: After the flames go out Australia's volunteers and firefighters are fighting a new battle: the risk of cancer.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: Jingxian is fully vaccinated but Australia didn't recognise it — until now
articles.description: Law student Xu Jingxian was fully vaccinated in China, but there was a problem — Australia did not recognise her Sinovac vaccine. Now the TGA has given it the thumbs-up, along with India's Covishield, international students hope it will open a door for their return to Australia.
articles.author: Dong Xing and Erin Handley

articles.headline: How an obscure shooting association grant brought down Berejiklian
articles.description: Situated on the outskirts of the regional town of Wagga Wagga, just behind a truck rental lot, is a hulking clubhouse and convention centre that has unexpectedly ended the career of one of the most powerful political leaders in Australia.
articles.author: Paul Farrell

articles.headline: Tasmania records new case of COVID-19 in quarantine
articles.description: The new case is a teenage boy who was quarantining after flying from Melbourne to Launceston on Friday.
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: Donald Trump asks US judge to force Twitter to restart his account
articles.description: Mr Trump files a request for a preliminary injunction against Twitter in the US District Court for the Southern District of Florida, with his lawyers arguing that his absence from the social media platform is "profoundly dangerous to open democratic debate".
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: Deaths of four young people in Melbourne car crash leaves 'a gaping wound in the community'
articles.description: A community leader from Truganina in Melbourne's west says a crash that killed four people and left another two in hospital has left others affected by the tragedy confronting their own mortality.
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: Philippine president Duterte announces retirement from politics
articles.description: The Philippine president, Rodrigo Duterte, has backed out of next year's national election, amid speculation he was clearing the way for his daughter to run to succeed him.
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: 'She looked like a corpse': UFC fighter almost collapses after missing weight for fourth time in career
articles.description: Macy Chiasson pulls out of the UFC bantamweight bout with Aspen Ladd after Ladd misses weight for the fourth time in her professional career.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Wallabies beat Argentina, South Africa upset New Zeland in Rugby Championship
articles.description: The Wallabies wrap up their Rugby Championship with a fourth straight victory, beating Argentina 32-17 on the Gold Coast, while New Zealand suffer their first defeat, stunned 31-29 by South Africa.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Live: Countdown is on for Panthers and Rabbitohs facing off in NRL grand final
articles.description: The Penrith Panthers are looking for grand final revenge after coming so close last year, while Wayne Bennett's South Sydney Rabbitohs are out to cause an upset in Brisbane. Follow live.
articles.author: Jon Healy

articles.headline: Dominic Perrottet set to be new Premier of NSW
articles.description: Dominic Perrottet is set to become NSW's next Premier. Even though Liberal MPs are set to vote for a new leader on Tuesday, the ABC understands the current deputy has struck a deal that will see him take the state's top job.
articles.author: Jon Healy

articles.headline: China sends fighter jets into Taiwanese airspace for second time in two days
articles.description: China has flown 39 fighter jets into Taiwan's air defence zone, according to the island's defence ministry, another show of force after Beijing's record incursion on Friday.
articles.author: Jon Healy

articles.headline: South Australian border bubble with Victoria to shrink after positive COVID case identified
articles.description: South Australian authorities will reduce the state's border bubble with Victoria after a woman from the south-east returns home and tests positive to COVID-19.
articles.author: Alice Dempster and Sarah Mullins

articles.headline: Inside an Afghan madrassa as the economy withers under Taliban rule
articles.description: Madrassas offer Afghan boys, usually from poor families, a religious education. But even their future is uncertain following the Taliban's return.
articles.author: Alice Dempster and Sarah Mullins

articles.headline: Diplomat in Perth tests positive for COVID-19, but WA Premier says he is 'low risk' to community
articles.description: A fully vaccinated Australian diplomat has tested positive for COVID-19 after arriving in Perth, and authorities say 12 crew members from an oil tanker docked in Fremantle are also positive for the virus.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: Air New Zealand to require full COVID-19 vaccination for international travellers
articles.description: Passengers on Air New Zealand's international flights will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, the airline announces, in a move the company says reflects the "new reality of international travel".
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: 'We have a right to this resource': Alaska salmon ban outrages First Nations
articles.description: Alaska salmon populations dwindle after the state bans salmon fishing on the Yukon river, leaving Indigenous tribes in crisis.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: World number two Sabalenka tests positive to COVID-19, pulls out of Indian Wells WTA tournament
articles.description: Top seed Aryna Sabalenka — who earlier this year said she didn't "trust" coronavirus vaccinations — withdraws from the prestigious tournament in California.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: Alex Jones loses defamation cases over Sandy Hook shooting 'hoax' conspiracy
articles.description: The Infowars host and conspiracy theorist is now liable for damages in the three defamation lawsuits brought by the parents of two children killed in the Sandy Hook school massacre.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: Live: Australia declares 136 behind India as final day of Test heats up
articles.description: An aggressive declaration from Meg Lanning raises the spectre of an unlikely result on the last day of Australia's Test match against India on the Gold Coast. Follow live.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: COVID-19 patients 'begging' for vaccines before being put on life support, Melbourne nurses say
articles.description: Two senior nurses say patients with COVID-19 are arriving at hospital unvaccinated and requesting a shot once it's too late.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: New isolation requirements and greater business flexibility: Here's what's changing in NSW
articles.description: Businesses won't have to take an "enforcement" role if unvaccinated people enter their premises, and fully vaccinated people will have their isolation time halved if they become a close contact. Here's what will change in just over a week.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Women's March protesters rally outside US Supreme Court amid fears for abortion rights
articles.description: The first Women's March of the Biden administration rallies outside the US Supreme Court in Washington DC, as part of nationwide protests demanding continued access to abortion.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Nadifa is the first Somali writer to be short-listed for the Booker Prize. She doesn't want to be the last
articles.description: Almost two decades ago, when Somali-British author Nadifa Mohamed was interning for a film company in London, she didn't realise a discovery that would change her life was just around the corner.
articles.author: Ahmed Yussuf

articles.headline: Aussie golfer in contention ahead of final round at New Jersey LPGA event
articles.description: Su Oh, one of Australia's brightest golfing talents, is four shots off the lead after two rounds, as she chases her first LPGA Tour title.
articles.author: Ahmed Yussuf

articles.headline: ACT records another 38 COVID-19 cases, with 16 infectious in the community
articles.description: The ACT records 38 new locally acquired cases of COVID-19, with Chief Health Officer Kerryn Coleman saying numbers are unlikely to drop back below 20.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: Injury puts Wallabies star in doubt for spring tour
articles.description: The Wallabies' confidence is growing following four straight wins, but an injury to one of their best players in the Rugby Championship may dampen their mood ahead of their overseas tour.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: London police battle loss of trust after officer kills woman
articles.description: London police are desperately trying to regain the trust of women after a serving officer used his position to abduct, rape and murder 33-year-old Sarah Everard.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: NSW records 'dramatic drop' in cases as self-quarantine rules for vaccinated people change
articles.description: New South Wales records a "dramatic drop" in COVID-19 cases, with 667 infections and 10 deaths as the state announces an easing of self-quarantine rules for the fully vaccinated.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: NRL grand final going ahead in Brisbane as Queensland records no new community cases
articles.description: Queensland records no new community cases of COVID-19, clearing the way for the NRL grand final to go ahead at Lang Park tonight.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: Orchid hunting is growing in popularity but there are fears the flowers are being 'loved to death'
articles.description: Mark Wapstra has spent his whole life documenting Tasmania's native orchids and now he fears the increasing popularity of "orchid hunting" might be taking its toll on the rare and mysterious flowers.
articles.author: Georgie Burgess

articles.headline: Why do we love the stomach-churning terror of thrill rides?
articles.description: An amusement academic says the rides create a sensation of cheating death in a totally safe environment, and we're attracted to them essentially because we're bored.
articles.author: Emma Wynne

articles.headline: NSW Transport Minister Andrew Constance quits state politics for federal tilt
articles.description: The Transport Minister confirms he is quitting state politics and that he is not contesting the NSW Liberal leadership, as he says it was heartbreaking to see what happened to Gladys Berejiklian.
articles.author: Emma Wynne

articles.headline: When Peter Brock's last racing car was to be sold off in parts his mate stepped in
articles.description: It's been 15 years since racing legend Peter Brock was killed at the Targa West Rally in Western Australia. His good mate Peter Champion once held Australia's largest collection of Brock's race cars, but now only one remains – the Daytona Coupe from his fatal crash.
articles.author: Guy Williams

articles.headline: Potentially lifesaving COVID-19 treatment may be out of reach if you don't live in a city
articles.description: Authorities say sotrovimab can reduce hospitalisation and the risk of death by almost 80 per cent for adults, but the logistics of administering it could severely limit its availability.
articles.author: Owen Jacques

articles.headline: Surge in doctors seeking mental health help just 'tip of the iceberg', says medical director
articles.description: There is a renewed push for better support services for doctors as increasing numbers reach out for help over chronic stress and other mental health issues.
articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

articles.headline: Aimless Dockers and ageing Eagles look to crucial AFL trade season
articles.description: The immediate future of both West Coast and Fremantle could depend on the next eight days — and how they attack the AFL trade period — with both clubs facing unique recruitment challenges ahead of the 2022 season.
articles.author: Tom Wildie

articles.headline: 'Should I pull the plug?' What do the new defamation laws mean for your Facebook group?
articles.description: A High Court ruling means the administrators of community-run Facebook pages can be sued for what people write in the comments. What's the legal risk, who's willing to take it, and will the pages survive?
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Why is it that wild winds spring up with the daffodils in Tasmania?
articles.description: Spring has sprung and Tasmanians are enjoying the blossoms. But on some days people may also be reaching for something to tether to. Why does the prettiest season often bring destructive gale-force winds?
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Cinema, gym listed as tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in regional Victoria
articles.description: New COVID-19 exposure sites have been added to Victoria's list, including a cinema in Morwell, and a gym in Shepparton.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Taiwan asks Australia for help to prepare for war with China
articles.description: Joseph Wu urges Australia to increase intelligence sharing and security cooperation with Taiwan and says the island is ready to defend itself if China launches a strike.
articles.author: Andrew Greene and Stan Grant

articles.headline: When the reef fell 'silent', Charlie made his own 'coral ark'
articles.description: Charlie Veron has spent his career studying the corals of the Great Barrier Reef. Now he's using his skills to build a "coral ark", collecting and preserving the 400 species before it's too late.
articles.author: Susan Chenery and Rebecca Armstrong

articles.headline: Dakota's doctors thought she might have COVID, but it was vaping that put her in ICU
articles.description: When 15-year-old Dakota Stephenson first started vaping with friends after school she never imagined it could have potentially deadly consequences. But the Sydney teen ended up in intensive care.
articles.author: Sophie Scott and Alison Branley

articles.headline: Light plane crashes into a Milan building, killing all eight passengers
articles.description: The aircraft was flying to the island of Sardinia when it crashed into a Milan suburb. Italian officials say the pilot did not send a distress call and are trying to determine the cause of the crash.
articles.author: Sophie Scott and Alison Branley

articles.headline: Victorian COVID outbreak's 'devastating' spread into more of Melbourne
articles.description: Victoria's Delta outbreak continues its spread into new parts of Melbourne and the state, with increased concern about the city's south-east.
articles.author: Sophie Scott and Alison Branley

articles.headline: He made a $62m fortune keeping his rich clients' secrets. Now they are spilling out
articles.description: A leak of 11.9 million files reveals how the rich and powerful disguise and move their money offshore.
articles.author: Elise Worthington and Benjamin Sveen

articles.headline: Bigger, faster, stronger and simply the best. Penrith make amends for fluffing their lines in 2020
articles.description: The Panthers were ambushed in the 2020 NRL grand final, but they've probably been the best team for two straight years, and now we can finally say as much.
articles.author: Jon Healy

articles.headline: As someone with OCD,  when the pandemic hit, I thrived. But in lockdown six, I've finally cracked
articles.description: Confusingly, I can no longer tell whether my fears are fuelled by OCD or whether they are within the normal range of responses to a disease which has caused millions of deaths, writes Eliana Horn.
articles.author: Jon Healy

articles.headline: Buckle up because global markets are in for a bumpy ride
articles.description: While September is usually the worst-performing month for stocks, October has the distinction of hosting some of the greatest market collapses in modern history, and the 10th month of this year is also looking shaky, writes Ian Verrender.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: 'Provocative and destabilising': US calls for China to stop sorties into Taiwan airspace
articles.description: The US State Department says it is "very concerned" about continued incursions into Taiwan's air defence zone by Chinese fighter jets, after a record 39 planes entered the island's airspace on Saturday.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: 'Sad to go out that way': Adam Reynolds deserved better in his final game as a Rabbitoh
articles.description: Adam Reynolds missed two shots to tie the grand final in the dying minutes of the game, but his legacy at South Sydney is so much more than that.
articles.author: Jon Healy

articles.headline: Five civilians dead as bomb explodes outside Kabul mosque attended by Taliban members
articles.description: The bomb targeted the Eidgah Mosque in the Afghanistan capital where a memorial service was being held for the mother of Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid.
articles.author: Jon Healy

articles.headline: To'o celebrates NRL grand final win with sideline proposal
articles.description: Panthers winger Brian To'o has softened the hearts of even the most hardened footy fans by proposing to his partner just minutes after winning the NRL grand final with the Panthers.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: Nathan Cleary wins Clive Churchill Medal
articles.description: Penrith co-captain Nathan Cleary claims the Clive Churchill Medal after leading the Panthers to a 14-12 victory over South Sydney to take the 2021 NRL premiership.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: The NRL's pre-show entertainment showed that it knows its target market — and it worked
articles.description: On-field entertainment can make or break how a grand final is remembered for years to come — the NRL showed that it knows its audience.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: The five moments that stole the spotlight as Penrith claim the premiership
articles.description: With scores tied halfway through the second half, some Stephen Crichton magic broke the NRL grand final open. Check out the five moments that stole the grand final spotlight.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: 'I'm pinching myself': Cleary hails extraordinary Panthers after grand final thriller
articles.description: Penrith Panthers have won a historic NRL grand final at Brisbane's Lang Park, beating South Sydney Rabbitohs 14-12.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Meet Dom Perrottet — the conservative Catholic and father-of-six about to take NSW's top job
articles.description: A man with a big family and strong ideals around freedom — NSW's next Premier once called for a "conservative spring" and credits his religious beliefs as having a fundamental influence on his work in politics.
articles.author: Maryanne Taouk and Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Spanish volcano gets 'much more aggressive' as new fissures burst open
articles.description: Lava is spewing from the Cumbre Vieja volcano in the Canary Islands, showing increased activity two weeks after its initial eruption.
articles.author: Maryanne Taouk and Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: As Australian Test stars benefit from Cricket Australia's paternity leave, a former international remembers how it used to be
articles.description: In a far cry from what previous generations of women cricketers faced, Cricket Australia's policy is allowing players to spend time on the sidelines for family reasons.
articles.author: Kate O'Halloran

articles.headline: Why Beijing has sent a record number of fighter jets into Taiwan's defence zone
articles.description: The People's Liberation Army of China has sent warplanes into Taiwanese airspace on 198 days this year. Here's why.
articles.author: Max Walden and Joyce Cheng

articles.headline: Brisbane sizzles on its hottest October day since 2004
articles.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says temperatures across the south-east were between five and 10 degrees above average.
articles.author: Rebecca Hyam

articles.headline: Furious response to 'poisonous' letter from Darwin hospital bosses sent to 'burnt out' frontline staff
articles.description: Senior doctors say bosses at Darwin's main hospital have worsened already low morale and damaged the facility's reputation with a letter warning junior doctors they would be blacklisted if they left before their contracts were up.
articles.author: Steve Vivian and Isaac Nowroozi

articles.headline: Major holiday firm snaps up $60m worth of NT caravan parks
articles.description: The purchases have helped breathe some positivity into the NT's devastated tourism sector.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Panthers 'sad' to see premiership-winning star leave club after grand final
articles.description: Penrith prepares to say goodbye to one of their grand-final heroes, as the club continues to celebrate their first premiership victory in 18 years.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Tough COVID-19 restrictions imposed in three SA council areas
articles.description: Fresh COVID-19 restrictions are imposed in three council areas in South Australia's south-east, while authorities investigate the movements of a Mount Gambier resident who has tested positive to the virus.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Geelong College to pay $2.7 million over historical child sex abuse
articles.description: A 46-year-old Victorian man has been awarded the highest amount of damages in an institutional abuse case in Australia, with a court ordering his former school pay him more than $2.7 million.
articles.author: Erin Cooper

articles.headline: Facebook rushed to ditch misinformation safeguards after US election, whistleblower alleges
articles.description: Facebook rushed to turn off misinformation safeguards after the US presidential election, and has internal research that its platform magnifies hate and misinformation, a whistleblower alleges.
articles.author: Erin Cooper

articles.headline: Didn't keep up with COVID news today? Here's what you need to know in bite-sized pieces
articles.description: Too busy to follow the COVID-19 blog? Or is there just too much of it to get into? You've come to the right place. Here's all the COVID-19 news from Australia that you need to know.
articles.author: Erin Cooper

articles.headline: Masks, capacity limits flagged for COVID-free WA once state borders come down
articles.description: WA's health minister has painted a picture of life in WA once state borders come down, which could include mask wearing and a return to capacity limits on hospitality venues.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: COVID-positive teen in Launceston left home quarantine to visit an IGA
articles.description: A 15-year-old Tasmanian boy who was positive for COVID-19 left home quarantine on Saturday and visited an IGA in Newnham with his cousin, Acting Premier Jeremy Rockliff says.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: Remote Aboriginal communities not on board with 'vaccination strategy' could stay locked for longer
articles.description: Remote Aboriginal communities could remain locked off for longer than the rest of WA as the Health Minister concedes some communities were not on board the "vaccination strategy".
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: 'Return to zero incredibly difficult': New Zealand abandons COVID-19 elimination strategy
articles.description: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says the "tentacle" of the Delta variant is "incredibly hard to shake", as she extends the Auckland lockdown ahead of an easing of some restrictions.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: Antony Green explains everything you need know about NSW politics' wild weekend
articles.description: Election analyst Antony Green breaks down how the sudden resignations of the NSW government's upper echelons are likely to play out at state and federal levels.
articles.author: Antony Green

articles.headline: St Kilda looks to 2022 after re-signing two-time best and fairest winner
articles.description: After a disappointing season, the Saints receive another boost with one of their most consistent players signing a new, two-year deal with the club.
articles.author: Antony Green

articles.headline: Japan's incoming PM Kishida to call snap election for lower house on October 31
articles.description: Japan's incoming Prime Minister Fumio Kishida plans to call a general election for the Lower House of parliament, which he is expected to win given his party's majority.
articles.author: Antony Green

articles.headline: Someone leaked nearly 12 million financial documents to journalists. What's inside them?
