articles.description: The leak of nearly 12 million documents exposes the secret offshore tax havens where world leaders and the super-rich park their fortunes.
articles.author: Elise Worthington

articles.headline: Candidate Stokes out to stop 'factional heavyweights' deciding next NSW premier
articles.description: Planning Minister Rob Stokes confirms he will stay in the race to be NSW's next premier as he believes there should be "a choice" and "factional heavyweights" shouldn't decide the future of the Liberals.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: 'Barra' the bush warrior will be remembered for his friendly fire — just ask Malcolm Turnbull
articles.description: NSW Deputy Premier John Barilaro once told a Liberal prime minister to resign and was involved in a very public civil war with a Coalition colleague — and while these moments grabbed headlines, he was also an effective and energetic advocate for regional areas.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham and Cecilia Connell

articles.headline: Remembering the unionist who fought for livelihoods on Christmas Island
articles.description: This year marks the 30th anniversary of Gordon Bennett's death, a man who put an end to 100 years worth of injustice on Christmas Island.
articles.author: James Liveris

articles.headline: North and South Korea restore communication hotline, despite missile tests
articles.description: Liaison officials from the two Koreas exchange messages over a cross-border communication channel for the first time in months.
articles.author: James Liveris

articles.headline: Wang Wang and Fu Ni fail to mate during short breeding season, Adelaide Zoo staff say
articles.description: Adelaide Zoo keepers are disappointed after another failed breeding season between giant pandas Wang Wang and Fu Ni, but remain optimistic the duo may produce a cub in future years.
articles.author: James Liveris

articles.headline: 15,000 doses of life-saving COVID drug sotrovimab arrive
articles.description: Supplies of a life-saving COVID-19 treatment that also keeps people with the disease out of hospital have landed in Australia, with the government confident it may also secure a promising new COVID-19 tablet.
articles.author: Jake Evans

articles.headline: Man jailed over violent pub siege in Melbourne's north
articles.description: John Lindrea, 59, has been sentenced to 11-and-a-half years in jail after he and an accomplice held a woman captive during a pub robbery last year.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: 'A true gentleman': Tributes flow for top public servant Paul Barratt who died aged 77
articles.description: Paul Barratt's role as secretary for the Department of Defence did not stop him from becoming one of the harshest critics of the war in Iraq. Tributes have been flowing in for the "true gentleman" who died on Sunday, aged 77.
articles.author: Kate Christian

articles.headline: Depressed, down and hopeless: One-third of business owners on Sunshine Coast facing 'impending mental health crisis'
articles.description: A university study finds a third of business owners on the Sunshine Coast frequently feel depressed, down, or hopeless because of the impact of the pandemic.
articles.author: Amy Sheehan

articles.headline: Cafe, service station and gym among new COVID-19 exposure sites in regional Victoria
articles.description: Health authorities have listed new tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in Woodend, Barnawartha, New Gisborne and Hastings overnight.
articles.author: Amy Sheehan

articles.headline: Low vaccination rates spark fears for regional Queensland in the 'little window' before widespread COVID transmission
articles.description: Parts of regional Queensland have some of the lowest COVID-19 vaccination rates in the country with only around a third of residents having received both injections.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: Teen removed from Allan Brahminy's controversial program amid 'verbally abusive' exchange
articles.description: A Tasmanian teenager has been removed from a controversial Northern Territory program for at-risk children, after the man who runs it pocket-dialled a child protection worker during a "verbally abusive" exchange.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Woman who ditched isolation after eight minutes fined an extra $6k for 'vanity'
articles.description: NSW woman Shannai Reid had already been fined $2,500 for breaching public health directions in WA, but faced more charges after CCTV and social media images of her time in Broome emerged.
articles.author: Hannah Barry

articles.headline: Can red seaweed lead to greener climate pastures? Science award finalists think so
articles.description: Scientists investigating if a red seaweed additive in cattle feed can dramatically cut methane emissions reach the finals of the prestigious Eureka awards.
articles.author: Fiona Breen and Tom Major

articles.headline: Former elite swimmers come forward to accuse their coach of abusing them as boys
articles.description: After an Olympic swimmer took his own life, the ABC uncovered stories of two more men who allege they were sexually abused by the same coach, at the same pool. This is their story.
articles.author: Lorna Knowles and Nikki Tugwell

articles.headline: Margaret cried at the chemist before receiving her AstraZeneca vaccine. She says misinformation is to blame
articles.description: A new report from Plan International finds young women and girls are facing a barrage of misinformation on everything from vaccines to tampons.
articles.author: Erin Handley

articles.headline: 'Lockdown leave' has helped people survive COVID-19. Experts say it should remain
articles.description: Extra leave for workers in COVID-19 lockdown has been a blessing for many. The Black Dog Institute says it should be extended to all workers as Australia prepares for post-pandemic life.
articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.headline: Ballot for NSW Premier has two candidates, but three outcomes
articles.description: After a wild week on Macquarie Street, today's Liberal leadership ballot is supposed to be the easy bit — but things may not be so straightforward for Dominic Perrottet, write Riley Stuart and Kathleen Calderwood.
articles.author: Kathleen Calderwood and Riley Stuart

articles.headline: 1000 hectares of prime Tasmanian farmland was bought with foreign money linked to a controversial business
articles.description: Australian properties — including Tasmanian dairy farms, Sydney CBD apartments and even a Hilton Hotel — have been secretly purchased by wealthy, sometimes controversial foreign figures, an ABC investigation has discovered.
articles.author: Echo Hui, Elise Worthington, and Patrick Begley

articles.headline: Drone delivery promises a service that is quick, contactless and COVID-safe — but there's a catch
articles.description: Drone delivery service Wing can drop products on your door step in under 10 minutes, but it could lead to unrealistic expectations and punishing deadlines for human workers.
articles.author: Echo Hui, Elise Worthington, and Patrick Begley

articles.headline: Will America's 'porcupine strategy' work against China on Taiwan? Australia is arming itself for the worst
articles.description: When Taiwan's foreign minister warns of a fight to the end in a looming war with China, we should pay attention, writes Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: International flights restart soon, but there are at least four reasons why some can't fly
articles.description: International travel has always been out of reach for some Australians due to the hefty cost of flight and time it takes to get across the world. But with a slew of new restrictions necessitated by the COVID-19 pandemic, hopping on a plane may become even more inaccessible.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: 'Nervous' VCE students return to campus for GAT
articles.description: There is a mix of nerves and excitement today, as final year VCE students prepare to return to school for the first time in two months to complete the General Achievement Test.
articles.author: Matilda Marozzi

articles.headline: How this young woman smuggled 10 orphans out of Afghanistan and got them to Australia
articles.description: An Australian-run orphanage knew its children and staff were in danger the moment Kabul fell. They've been working to get them out ever since.
articles.author: Emily Clark

articles.headline: Courtney thought an unsolicited text was a 'scam'. She ended up recouping $500 in insurance refunds
articles.description: Scores of people nationally are clawing back hundreds of millions in cash from the finance sector after paying for so-called "junk" insurance. It comes as new federal reforms are implemented to curtail the sale of the controversial financial product.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: Why the federal government has bought 300,000 doses of a COVID-treating pill that hasn't been approved yet
articles.description: Merck's COVID treatment drug, Molnupiravir, has only passed the first hurdle towards approval in Australia but the federal government has bought 300,000 doses after some promising preliminary results.
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram suffer global outage
articles.description: Major social media platforms Facebook and Instagram suffer a global outage as does encrypted messaging service WhatsApp.
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: Lars Vilks, cartoonist infamous for Prophet Mohammed drawing, dies in car crash
articles.description: The 75-year-old Swedish cartoonist, who stirred worldwide controversy with drawings depicting the Prophet Mohammed with the body of a dog, was under police protection when his car collided with a truck.
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: Ashes fate could be known this week, with English cricket board meeting two months before scheduled start
articles.description: The England and Wales Cricket Board will meet this week "to decide whether the conditions in place are sufficient for the Tour to go ahead", as players continue to express doubts over isolation requirements.
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: Teacher launches Supreme Court challenge to Victorian government's COVID-19 vaccine mandate
articles.description: A casual relief teacher from Victoria claims the vaccine mandate that will require all authorised workers to be fully vaccinated over the coming weeks is not "legally or ethically justified".
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine goes to US scientists for sensor discoveries
articles.description: David Julius used capsaicin, the active component in chilli, to identify sensors that allow the skin to respond to heat, while Ardem Patapoutian discovered pressure-sensitive receptors in the human body.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: 'Beaten to death': Eight people die with minister's son accused in Indian farm protests
articles.description: Indian authorities suspend internet services and tell political leaders to stay away after eight people die in Uttar Pradesh in an alarming escalation of a year-long demonstration against agriculture laws.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: Woman tried to end 'toxic' relationship the night partner allegedly set her on fire, court hears
articles.description: A Tasmanian man accused of attempting to murder his partner by setting her on fire would allegedly threaten to burn her to illustrate his dominance, a court has heard.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Moment an Aboriginal woman was shot dead shown in WA police officer's murder trial
articles.description: A police officer accused of murder shot a WA woman within seconds of arriving at the scene where other officers were present, the prosecution in the high profile case at WA's Supreme Court has argued.  WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised that this article contains an image of a person who has died.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: ‘Stop whinging’: Mark McGowan scolds Dominic Perrottet over GST stoush
articles.description: Freshly sworn-in New South Wales Premier Dominic Perrottet has indicated he will fight Western Australia over the GST carve up, after once calling Mark McGowan the "Gollum of Australian politics".
articles.author: Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: Alexander died from a pill he bought on Snapchat. Now his mother is taking on big tech
articles.description: California teenager Alexander Neville ordered what he thought was oxycodone pills through social media app Snapchat. What he did not know was they were laced with a deadly dose of fentanyl. Australian experts say users and authorities should be alert for drugs sold on social media.
articles.author: Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: Teen who downloaded extremist material wants to be a history teacher, court told
articles.description: A 16-year-old boy pleads guilty in the Adelaide Youth Court to terror-related offences after he downloaded extremist material, including videos and images that "promoted and glorified" the perpetrator of the 2019 Christchurch Mosque shootings.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: Hockey Australia appoints its new CEO
articles.description: Following a turbulent period, Hockey Australia is hoping fresh leadership in its front office will help the sport and its national teams thrive.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: Britney Spears thanks fans behind #FreeBritney movement
articles.description: Pop star Britney Spears thanks her fans for "freeing me" after her father is removed from her conservatorship.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: MPs in mad vax row over 'irresponsible' petition against 'heavy-handed' mandate
articles.description: The Member for Mildura has slammed her federal counterpart Anne Webster over a petition she's launched opposing Victoria's latest vaccine policy.
articles.author: Richard Crabtree

articles.headline: Two men jailed for killing 'good and honourable' Brisbane doctor in robbery gone wrong
articles.description: Dr Luping Zeng was fatally shot in the abdomen in the garage of his home in 2019 after being confronted by three males who were trying to rob him.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: The Eagles' back-to-back triumph given 'replica' honours on alternative SANFL chimney
articles.description: Windy weather at the new location for the SANFL's 67-year-old grand final ceremony means a replica chimney is used as a backdrop for Woodville-West Torrens' celebrations.
articles.author: Malcolm Sutton

articles.headline: The challenges facing NSW's new Premier as Berejiklian's shadow looms
articles.description: Dominic Perrottet will have to juggle the beginning of the end of lockdown, Delta's ongoing spread and at least three looming by-elections while in the immediate shadow of Gladys Berejiklian.
articles.author: Tim Swanston

articles.headline: States demand 'immediate' extra health funding as country prepares to reopen
articles.description: The country's health ministers call for immediate crisis funding for hospitals before COVID-19 restrictions are eased, fearing the system will buckle under increased pressure.
articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.headline: Kreuger traded: Who won deal between Cats and Magpies?
articles.description: The 2021 AFL trade period steps up a gear, as Cody Atkinson analyses who came out on top with Geelong tall Nathan Kreuger's move to Collingwood.
articles.author: Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson

articles.headline: 'BHP and Rio Tinto should be embarrassed': Fortescue Metals pledges to eradicate customer emissions
articles.description: When Andrew Forrest announced Fortescue Metals Group wanted to achieve net zero operational emissions last year, critics wondered how this could be achieved.
articles.author: Daniel Mercer and Eliza Borrello

articles.headline: Mandatory COVID-19 jabs for WA FIFO and mining workers
articles.description: From December 1, a mandatory COVID-19 vaccine policy will be enforced for all WA resource sector workers.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Understanding more about what the Pandora Papers exposed
articles.description: The Pandora Papers expose more details about the secretive world of offshore finance, but how do people set up these shell companies and trusts and what exactly are they used for?
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: Sydney woman avoids prison after crashing car into classroom, killing two boys
articles.description: A woman who drove her car into a Sydney school, killing two children, has avoided prison after a judge described the incident as a "freakish accident".
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: COVID catch-up: The important stuff from today you need to know (and one piece of good news)
articles.description: Too busy to follow the COVID-19 blog? Or is there just too much of it to get into? You've come to the right place. Here's all the COVID-19 news from Australia that you need to know.
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: 'It's been a really wonderful time in our lives': Rachael Haynes on juggling IVF and professional cricket
articles.description: Australian vice-captain Rachael Haynes shares her story of going through same-sex IVF fertility, after welcoming a baby into the world.
articles.author: Brittany Carter

articles.headline: Kangaroos boss Ben Amarfio explains the hurdle keeping Tasmania out of the AFL
articles.description: North Melbourne CEO Ben Amarfio is adamant his club will never move to Tasmania, and while he wants to see a Tassie team, he explains why it may not happen soon.
articles.author: Brittany Carter

articles.headline: Pregnant mother of three found dead at Perth house, sparking homicide probe
articles.description: A large crime scene is established in Dayton after the body of a 36-year-old woman is found at a house, with police treating her death as suspicious.
articles.author: Brittany Carter

articles.headline: Netflix is editing a Squid Game scene because a real person is getting random phone calls
articles.description: Netflix says it is working to fix the issue, which involves a close-up shot of the card that clearly shows an eight-digit number beginning with eight.
articles.author: Brittany Carter

articles.headline: How tech giant Facebook may have been brought down by one engineer
articles.description: The outage that took down Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp for about six hours, affecting billions of people around the world, may have been due to a tiny human error.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: 'Lagging way behind': Hunter region vulnerable to COVID with slow vaccination rollout
articles.description: Thwarted by "inadequate supply", many in the Hunter region will still be vulnerable to COVID as restrictions ease next week.
articles.author: Ben Millington

articles.headline: Portugal is running out of people to vaccinate. Here's how
articles.description: Like Australia, Portugal put a military man at the head of its vaccination program but, to date, it has had greater success in inoculating its population against COVID-19.
articles.author: Ben Millington

articles.headline: China's power crisis shocks Australia's wool industry. Can an outback town save it?
articles.description: Chinese government restrictions on electricity use have halted processing of Australian wool, highlighting how vulnerable the industry is.
articles.author: Ellie Grounds

articles.headline: Endometriosis can derail fertility treatment if left undiagnosed, study finds
articles.description: One in three women using fertility treatment to get pregnant are being held back by undiagnosed endometriosis that reduces the chances of having a baby, according to a new study in the journal Human Reproduction.
articles.author: Emma Pollard

articles.headline: Another alleged teen victim of swim coach reported abuse a decade ago
articles.description: After leaving his job as an elite junior swimming coach at a Brisbane pool, an alleged child sexual abuse predator went onto train at another Queensland pool.
articles.author: Lorna Knowles and Nikki Tugwell

articles.headline: Trans-Tasman legal brawl over manuka honey continues in New Zealand
articles.description: After fighting legal battles over who can use the word "manuka" in Australia, the US, and the UK, a new trans-Tasman honey fight starts in New Zealand this week.
articles.author: Clint Jasper

articles.headline: Awkward France trip shows how far Australia has fallen in the world's favour
articles.description: France is showing Australia a new face this week — gone is the blazing anger over a broken promise, replaced by a series of cold, dismissive snubs levelled at our federal trade minister.
articles.author: Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: Barry was held as a 'human shield' hostage in Iraq. Now he's friends with his captor
articles.description: He was flying to Malaysia for a holiday, but Barry Manners unexpectedly found himself in a war zone in Kuwait.
articles.author: Nick Baker

articles.headline: Peta says she wants to be vaccinated, but has no way of getting to the clinic
articles.description: Last week, Launceston in Tasmania's north recorded its second COVID-19 case for the year. Some locals say it "may well be the jolt" the region needs to boost vaccination rates.
articles.author: Manika Champ and Jessica Moran

articles.headline: Child care centres, cafes, library listed as tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in Victoria
articles.description: Health authorities add new tier 1 venues in Camberwell, Derrimut, Nathalia, and Macedon overnight.
articles.author: Manika Champ and Jessica Moran

articles.headline: The COVID-19 question Dominic Perrottet hasn't answered
articles.description: The new NSW Premier has promised to work through the issues around the state's COVID-19 exit plan, but has so far failed to commit to the current roadmap championed by his predecessor, writes Ashleigh Raper.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper

articles.headline: NSW Premier urged to 'make real change' for women despite conservative views
articles.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet, who opposed a law decriminalising abortion in 2019, is being challenged to guarantee his religious views will not affect policymaking on women's health.
articles.author: Ursula Malone

articles.headline: Generic COVID-19 vaccines could be key to jabbing the world, and Australia is backing a push to make it happen
articles.description: More than 100 nations, including Australia and the US, want patent rights for COVID-19 vaccines waived, so poorer nations can have easier access to the jab. Here's what you need to know.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Emails show Sydney art dealer negotiating with suspected antiquities trafficker
articles.description: Emails seen by the ABC show a Sydney antiquities dealer bargaining with Douglas Latchford, a notorious collector of Cambodian art who was accused of selling looted items. The dealer says he never had a business relationship with Mr Latchford.
articles.author: Mario Christodoulou and Dunja Karagic

articles.headline: How the lines between 'privacy' and 'secrecy' get blurred: Post Pandora Papers, call for governments to name and shame tax evaders
articles.description: The Lux Leaks, The Panama Papers, The Paradise Papers and the latest Pandora Papers have all had one ingredient in common: they out the people behind secret shell companies, Nassim Khadem writes.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: Brittany Higgins to be visiting fellow at Global Institute for Women's Leadership
articles.description: Former political staffer Brittany Higgins has been appointed the inaugural visiting fellow of the women's leadership group established by Julia Gillard.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: First comes a strange sound. Then headaches and nausea. But could Havana syndrome be mass panic?
articles.description: Hundreds of US personnel stationed overseas have reported the same mysterious symptoms. But as America investigates the possibility of a new sonic weapon, some experts insist it's all in their minds.
articles.author: Peter Jones

articles.headline: Bronwyn's power bills went from $231 to $114 thanks to an energy assistance program
articles.description: A report assessing the economic impact of a multi-billion-dollar proposal to improve energy efficiency in more than 1 million homes says the program will create thousands of jobs, boost Australia's GDP and improve the quality of life for the country's most financially disadvantaged people.
articles.author: Norman Hermant and Lucy Kent

articles.headline: Faced with a devastating COVID-19 outbreak, these residents are rushing to get vaccinated
articles.description: With some of the lowest vaccination rates in the state, Melbourne's northern suburbs have been hit hard by COVID-19. But now its residents are banding together to turn the tide.
articles.author: Erwin Renaldi

articles.headline: The NRL is set to announce its new expansion team. Here's what you need to know
articles.description: The NRL will announce that one of the Brisbane Firehawks, Brisbane Jets or Redcliffe Dolphins will be the 17th team in the competition. Here's what you need to know about the NRL expansion.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Fantasia Holdings is not the size of Evergrande Group but it has missed a huge payment and asked for a halt to trading
articles.description: Chinese real estate developer Fantasia Holdings Group fails to make a $280 million payment due to bondholders, adding to worries over the country's property sector as Evergrande teeters on the brink of collapse.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Russia's COVID death toll is rising fast as authorities blame vaccine hesitancy
articles.description: The COVID-19 death toll in Russia continues to reach record highs as uptake in the Russian-made vaccines remains low.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Ebony was 'on the fence' about vaccinations, but mandate swayed her
articles.description: As Victoria's broad vaccine mandate for authorised workers concerns some and is applauded by others, with one woman who has been suspended from her job without pay explaining her rationale for refusing to comply.
articles.author: Oliver Gordon, Bridget Rollason, and Sian Johnson

articles.headline: Tony Abbott flies to Taiwan for keynote speech as tensions rise with China
articles.description: The former prime minister lands in Taiwan, which has appealed for Australian support against intimidation from the Chinese military.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Scientists whose work allowed for 'reliably predicting' climate change awarded Nobel Prize in Physics
articles.description: The Nobel Prize in Physics is jointly awarded to three scientists whose groundbreaking discoveries have shaped our understanding of the Earth's climate.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: India could run out of coal soon. So why is a country with such big reserves facing shortages?
articles.description: More than half of India's coal plants will run out of energy by the end of the week, according to government sources, leaving the world's second-most populous country in crisis. We explain the factors leading to India's alarming coal shortage.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Police officer's stalker thought his explosives were 'worth some money', lawyer tells court
articles.description: A stalker who harassed a police officer who had earlier investigated him for explosives offences believed the incendiary devices "were worth some money" and would help him recover from a Centrelink dispute, an Adelaide court hears.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: NSW hits 70 per cent vaccination target, bringing state closer to 'proper summer'
articles.description: Premier Dominic Perrottet announces 70 per cent of people aged 16 and over are now fully vaccinated against COVID-19, describing it as "great news" and taking NSW closer to a "proper summer".
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: 'Tell them I'm delusional': Accused gunman's instructions prior to alleged murders
articles.description: A witness in the Benjamin Hoffmann murder trial has told the court the accused was drinking water mixed with the drug ice and driving at speeds of up to 180 kilometres on the morning of an alleged shooting spree.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Shattered family says new search for Gordon Copeland comes months too late
articles.description: Gordon Copeland went missing on July 10 and police say they've tried their best to find him, but his family members fear the worst and believe more should have been done.
articles.author: Kemii Maguire

articles.headline: Aboriginal woman shot dead by police was 'angry, upset' in last phone call to mother
articles.description: The behaviour and emotional state of an Aboriginal woman shot dead by police have been unveiled in an historic WA murder trial. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains an image of a person who has died.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Lawyer claims substance client allegedly imported can be bought locally over the counter
articles.description: A Darwin man was arrested at his home last month for allegedly importing 30 kilograms of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA), which the AFP claims is a substance structurally similar to gamma-hydroxybutyrate (GHB).
articles.author: Kate Ashton

articles.headline: Patient called sleep clinic 'creepy' before alleged indecent assault by doctor, court told
articles.description: A patient at a Sydney sleep clinic texted her boyfriend describing the facility as "creepy" before she was allegedly indecently assaulted by a technician as she slept, a court has heard.
articles.author: Kate Ashton

articles.headline: Joe Biden says Xi Jinping has agreed to abide by 'Taiwan agreement'
articles.description: The US President's conversation with his Chinese counterpart follows Beijing sending 148 military aircraft into Taiwan's air-defence zone over four days, leading Taiwan's Defence Minister to say tensions are the "most serious" in more than 40 years.
articles.author: Kate Ashton

articles.headline: Here are the winners and losers of the ACT Budget
articles.description: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr hands down his second budget of the COVID-19 era, which has once more decimated the territory's economy. Here's what's new, and who stands to benefit.
articles.author: Selby Stewart

articles.headline: New guidance tool could see some aged care sexual assaults unreported for a month, advocates say
articles.description: When Dr Catherine Barrett began to explore a new tool for aged care providers, she said she became extremely worried that it was sending the wrong message on the reporting of sexual assaults.
articles.author: Sally Sara and Scott Mitchell

articles.headline: Five key takeaways from the ACT Budget
articles.description: In February of this year, Chief Minister Andrew Barr promised a strong financial recovery, as long as there were no more outbreaks of COVID-19. Today, he unveiled a budget based on the "downside scenario".
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: NBA star misses team training during New York's COVID vaccination restrictions
articles.description: Kyrie Irving, who has not confirmed if he has been vaccinated against COVID-19, stays away from a Brooklyn Nets' practice session as doubt surrounds his availability to play in New York.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: New Deputy Premier will battle for the bush
articles.description: NSW Nationals leader Paul Toole says he will fight for what's important in regional communities and look to open up the state through the COVID road map.
articles.author: Emma Siossian, Kelly Fuller, David Claughton, and Michael Condon

articles.headline: Perrottet to discuss 'small changes' to roadmap out of lockdown at crisis cabinet meeting
articles.description: On his first full day in the job, NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet says potential changes to the roadmap out of the state's lockdown will be discussed by the state's crisis cabinet this evening.
articles.author: Emma Siossian, Kelly Fuller, David Claughton, and Michael Condon

articles.headline: China turns to stranded Australian coal to combat power crunch
articles.description: After sitting in warehouses on China's coast since Beijing's unofficial ban began last October, an estimated 1 million tonnes of Australian coal is now being put to use, according to traders.
articles.author: Emma Siossian, Kelly Fuller, David Claughton, and Michael Condon

articles.headline: Coroner says police could have prevented Alva Beach stabbing deaths
articles.description: Deputy State Coroner Jane Bentley says police in north Queensland treated a 2018 incident at Alva Beach as non-urgent, but could have prevented the deaths of two men had they acted more quickly by following advice from the Queensland Ambulance Service that the matter was urgent.
articles.author: Heidi Sheehan

articles.headline: Peter Dutton defends decision to sue over 'rape apologist' tweet
articles.description: Defence Minister Peter Dutton has defended his decision to sue refugee advocate Shane Bazzi for a tweet accusing him of being "a rape apologist", saying the comment "went to a different level".
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: This state's wastewater testing is so good that other parts of the world are following suit
articles.description: Wastewater testing has been a critical part of South Australia's response to the COVID-19 pandemic, and the state is now exporting its strategy. But how does it work?
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: Are you watching Squid Game wrong? Well, not quite
articles.description: Western audiences of Squid Game are missing out on the richness of the original dialogue and key aspects of character development, according to some Korean-speaking people.
articles.author: Max Walden

articles.headline: Woman recognised nephew during 'utterly terrifying' break-in over contentious will
articles.description: A Melbourne man, 32, has pleaded guilty to aggravated burglary and blackmail after violently confronting his aunt and uncle at their farmhouse, near Lakes Entrance, and forcing his aunt to sign documents.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: Driver says he has no answers for sons of couple killed in crash near Naracoorte
articles.description: The son of a couple killed in a fiery crash on "the most notorious bend" in South Australia's south-east tells an Adelaide court he is still angry and searching for answers.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Witness K lawyer Bernard Collaery wins latest round in battle to prevent secret trial
articles.description: Witness K lawyer Bernard Collaery's appeal against key information being kept secret in his trial is upheld as the Court of Appeal cites a "very real risk of damage to public confidence" in the justice system if the evidence is not publicly disclosed.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: AstraZeneca develops long-lasting preventative COVID treatment for people who can't be vaccinated
articles.description: AstraZeneca asks US authorities to allow emergency use of an antibody treatment to prevent COVID-19, with an Australian specialist calling it an "important" but "niche" drug.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: US President Joe Biden not 'fully aware' of anger over Australia's submarine decision, John Kerry tells French media
articles.description: The United States government is distancing itself from Australia's decision to cancel a $90 billion contract with France to build several submarines, with a diplomat telling French media President Joe Biden had been unaware of France's backlash over the decision.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: 'Point of no return': Pacific leaders call to halve emissions by 2030 to prevent climate catastrophe
articles.description: Pacific leaders warn that time is running out to address climate change and urge all nations, including Australia, to halve their emissions in the next decade.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: Daycare centres are exposing children to risky play, and there are unexpected results
articles.description: Teachers and parents are finding a way to be hands off when their children look like they're in a bind, instead giving them space to challenge themselves and succeed and fail.
articles.author: Kym Agius

articles.headline: No kidding: Miniature goats bring in the bucks for high school student
articles.description: Meet the high school student who is catering to a growing demand for a trending pet — and building his own thriving business along the way.
articles.author: Jane McNaughton and Emily Bissland

articles.headline: Australian hip hop stars march to DatsGrinny beats
articles.description: Five years ago Egrinye Adie looked for "how to produce" electronic music tutorials online. Now he's selling backing tracks to some of Australia's hottest up-and-coming rappers.
articles.author: Anthony Scully

articles.headline: What can Australia learn from the UK's return to school during the COVID-19 pandemic?
articles.description: As students in Australia's most populous states prepare to go back to school, experts say there are things to learn from England, where there has been a large increase in children being kept home due to COVID-19.
articles.author: Mary Lloyd and Leonie Thorne

articles.headline: Foxtel Australia launches review into anti-vax Christian TV channel
articles.description: Foxtel says its is reviewing the content in one of its American Christian TV channels that broadcasts anti-vaccination messages, after it received complaints from Australian viewers.
articles.author: Dale Drinkwater

articles.headline: More child care centres listed as tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in Victoria
articles.description: Health authorities have added new tier 1 exposure sites overnight in Mooroolbark, Clyde North, Thomastown, Altona Meadows, and Caulfield North.
articles.author: Dale Drinkwater

articles.headline: Top storytellers on the shows, books and films that helped them feel 'seen'
articles.description: From pop-culture behemoths to Australian poetry — these affirming works are kicking goals when it comes to diverse characters and representation.
articles.author: Dale Drinkwater

articles.headline: 'There isn't an infinite supply of resources.' These experts say sustainable development is a flawed concept
articles.description: Some experts say the concept of sustainable development has been hijacked by corporate interests and inconsistent standards has allowed many to game the system.
articles.author: Antony Funnell

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: COVID-19 briefings scrapped completely, lockdown extended for some regions
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Dominic Perrottet's new crisis cabinet will have a much bigger focus on the economy and the daily COVID-19 briefings will be scrapped entirely, while Oberon, Snowy Monaro, Menindee and Sunset Strip face longer lockdowns.
articles.author: Antony Funnell

articles.headline: COVID meant Imogen has missed out on work for 18 months — but now she's returning to the stage
articles.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has hit Australia's performing arts industry hard, but Tasmania's first locally produced professional musical is giving home-grown performers the chance to work again.
articles.author: Selina Ross

articles.headline: Business was booming for Sydney's Little India, within 11 days it ground to a halt
articles.description: With international borders closed, businesses in Little India in the Western Sydney suburb of Harris Park were booming. The lockdown took a heavy toll, but it was the hotspot tag that hit the hardest.
articles.author: Selina Ross

articles.headline: States are stressed about how hospitals will cope with COVID reopening – but 'tough talk' won't fix the problem
articles.description: There are concerns that hospitals won't be able to cope when locked down states reopen — and the response has been a return to pre-COVID levels of political bickering over who's to blame, writes David Speers.
articles.author: David Speers

articles.headline: Government accused of turning its back on elderly victims of collapsed housing scheme
articles.description: Retirees Pam and Michael Hellen were devastated to find they would be excluded from a federal government proposal for a long-awaited compensation scheme for victims of companies that go broke.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: 'You don't bring politics to the family dinner table': How China-Taiwan tensions are being felt in Australia
articles.description: Tensions between Taiwan and China have dominated headlines in recent days. But how is the war-like rhetoric impacting Asian Australians?
articles.author: Dong Xing and Erin Handley

articles.headline: Rylee and Saman thought stars weren't real. Now, after radical therapy, they can see them
articles.description: Doctors told Rylee and Saman their vision would narrow and they would eventually lose their sight. Then they were accepted to take part in a new gene therapy.
articles.author: Penny Timms and Sophie Scott

articles.headline: Own shares? Here's how you can influence company climate policies
articles.description: From the fringe to the mainstream, calls for climate action are garnering more and more support at annual general meetings and you can use your shares to have your say. Here's how.
articles.author: Stephanie Chalmers

articles.headline: British court finds Dubai's ruler had ex-wife's phone hacked as 'intimidation'
articles.description: England's High Court found Sheikh Mohammed used the sophisticated Pegasus software to hack the phones of his ex-wife and people closely connected to her.
articles.author: Stephanie Chalmers

articles.headline: Boris Johnson hails AUKUS during party conference speech full of jokes but short on policy
articles.description: Boris Johnson has hailed the new AUKUS security pact during a speech at the Conservative party's conference that was filled with jokes but has been criticised for being short on detail.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Sweden and Denmark pause Moderna vaccine use for young adults, teens
articles.description: Citing an ongoing study by Nordic nations and out of an abundance of caution Denmark and Sweden pause Moderna COVID vaccine use for younger citizens.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: YouTube drops R Kelly's official accounts after sex trafficking conviction
articles.description: YouTube removes R&B singer R Kelly's official channels after he was convicted of sex trafficking.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Brazilian soccer player charged with attempted murder after attacking a referee
articles.description: A player in a Brazilian soccer league is charged with attempted murder after he kicked a referee in the back of the head.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Nobel Prize in Chemistry awarded for advances in building molecules
articles.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry is awarded to two scientists who developed a cheaper and cleaner way to build molecules for anything ranging from medicines to solar panels.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Principal of Fitzroy North school who flouted lockdown rules handed interim suspension
articles.description: Timothy Berryman is defending his decision to allow students to come to school in breach of lockdown rules and says he will fight to stay on in his position.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: 'Spitting on the graves of the dead': Ferdinand Marcos Jr's presidential run sparks anger in Philippines
articles.description: The announcement that the son of Ferdinand Marcos, the dictator whose brutal rule of the Philippines lasted decades, is met with fury from protesters and human rights advocates.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: New Year's Eve deadline for WA to reach 80 per cent COVID-19 vaccination
articles.description: Despite a slow start in vaccination take-up, Western Australia's vaccine commander says the state is on track to reach its 80 per cent fully vaccinated target by December 31.
articles.author: Briana Shepherd

articles.headline: Prime Minister says social media 'cowards' should be held responsible, as he promises more action
articles.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says social media is a "coward's palace" where people are able to bully without consequence, and he intends to take further action to stop it.
articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.headline: Farmers can't cherry-pick workers for harvest — because there aren't any
articles.description: As growers face their second harvest without enough seasonal workers, some states are considering on-farm quarantine as a solution — but is the cost too high?
articles.author: David Claughton

articles.headline: 'Every woman's worst nightmare': Judge sentences rapist over 'terrifying' 2012 attacks
articles.description: County Court judge says the 2012 rapes of two women by Justin Mathieson in Melbourne's south as they were walking home had a profound and enduring impact on their lives.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: Woman armed with knife 'lunged' at officer, witness says
articles.description: WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains an image of a person who has died. Calls from police officers before and after the fatal shooting of an Aboriginal woman in a regional WA town are played in court.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Young girl killed in quad bike rollover at Maroochy River
articles.description: Paramedics did all they could to save the girl, but she was pronounced dead after being rushed to hospital.
articles.author: Amy Sheehan and Tom Major

articles.headline: Broken Heel tripped up by COVID — again
articles.description: Broken Hill's massive celebration of drag, music and LGBTQIA+ culture will hold two separate events in 2022, after cancelling its amended December date.
articles.author: Jonathon Poulson

articles.headline: Victoria 'stepping in' to boost vaccination rates among people with disability
articles.description: The Victorian government says it has been forced to step in and fund targeted hubs after failing to get a response from the Commonwealth on low vaccination rates among people with a disability.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: After 100-plus days in lockdown, Sydneysiders warned to be aware of 're-entry anxiety'
articles.description: We are days away from the easing of restrictions and, while many people will be busy filling their social calendar, experts warn going back to social settings may not be as easy as expected.
articles.author: Ruby Cornish

articles.headline: International travel isn't far away — but will your insurance cover COVID?
articles.description: COVID-19 has brought new risks that could impact you when you travel abroad — here's what you need to know about how travel insurance has changed since the start of the pandemic.
articles.author: Ruby Cornish

articles.headline: 'Facts may not be popular': Gina Rinehart's speech to Perth private school draws criticism from leading climate scientist
articles.description: A leading climate scientist has called Gina Rinehart's comments on global warming 'misinformation' after a speech she gave to an exclusive Perth private school was heavily edited.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: 'NSW, Victoria are dealing with it': PM warns other states to prepare for COVID impact on hospitals
articles.description: The Prime Minister has flatly rejected a call for more hospital funding, saying the states and territories have had enough money and time to prepare for the end of COVID-19 restrictions.
articles.author: Jake Evans

articles.headline: Workers caught in deadly mine collapse as earthquake rocks south-west Pakistan
articles.description: A magnitude-5.9 earthquake hits in a mountainous area of southern Pakistan, destroying homes and collapsing a coal mine, with authorities warning the death toll is likely to rise.
articles.author: Jake Evans

articles.headline: Victoria and NSW are in different places with COVID. But a comparison offers 'glimmers of hope'
articles.description: For Victorians still glued to the daily COVID-19 figures, it has been a grim week. But amidst the bad news, there is some cause for optimism — with vaccination rates seeming to slow the number of people ending up in hospitals.
articles.author: Yara Murray-Atfield

articles.headline: 'Bans do not work': New national guidelines say education is key to managing food allergies
articles.description: A new set of guidelines will bring national consistency for schools and child care centres in their management of allergies
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: Afghan brothers killed in road crash 'came to Australia for a safe haven', mum tells court told
articles.description: A widowed mother tells an Adelaide court she moved to Australia to provide a safe haven for her children, only to lose two sons in a crash caused by a "selfish" driver high on meth.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Wagga Wagga records first COVID case in a year, sparking school closure
articles.description: Kildare Catholic College has been closed for deep cleaning and contact tracing is underway.
articles.author: Shannon Corvo and Emily Doak

articles.headline: How much do top video game streamers earn? Twitch data breach lets the cat out of the bag
articles.description: A massive data breach has exposed the earnings of thousands of Twitch streamers. So how do you make millions from playing computer games?
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Body found in river during search near Moree
articles.description: Police say a body has been recovered from the Gwydir River by searchers looking for Gomeroi man Gordon Copeland.
articles.author: Caitlin Furlong and Kemii Maguire

articles.headline: Toby Greene now out for six games for making contact with umpire
articles.description: GWS Giants' Toby Greene will miss more than a month of the 2022 AFL season after an appeal upgraded his suspension for bumping an umpire from three to six weeks.
articles.author: Peter Lusted

articles.headline: Could there be a new suspect in the infamous Zodiac killings?
articles.description: A group of unofficial investigators are claiming they have a "very strong suspect" for the notorious Zodiac killings that terrorised the San Francisco area in the 1960s.
articles.author: Peter Lusted

articles.headline: After weathering the pandemic's storm so far, 'Teflon Dan' could face his biggest test next week
articles.description: In its short history, Victoria's anti-corruption watchdog is yet to land a big political fish. But next week looms as its biggest political hearing to date, and a test for the Andrews government, writes state political reporter Richard Willingham.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: 'I believe this is people's choice': Threshold for full reopening of Queensland's borders remains unclear
articles.description: The Chief Health Officer says she wouldn't be comfortable re-opening the state's borders until every Queenslander aged 12 years and over has had the opportunity to be vaccinated.
articles.author: Kym Agius

articles.headline: Boar war as feral pests threaten crops, livestock and emus
articles.description: Recent rain has led to an explosion of feral pigs in pockets of NSW's North Coast, causing havoc for farmers.
articles.author: Kim Honan

articles.headline: Prince Andrew given leave to review settlement he hopes shields him from abuse suit
articles.description: A United States judge gives Prince Andrew permission to review a 2009 settlement agreement that the prince believes absolves him of "any and all liability" against claims he forced Virginia Giuffre to have sex with him when she was under age.
articles.author: Kim Honan

articles.headline: Tasmanian minister retracts mining lease after admitting it was incorrectly approved
articles.description: Resources Minister Guy Barnett says a "lodging error" found in a newly granted mining lease on a road on Tasmania's west coast means it is not valid, as environmentalists claim the lease is aimed at stopping them from reaching a protest site.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: 'Otherworldy' stroke of luck as COVID jab leads to 26yo's early cancer diagnosis
articles.description: Getting her shot set off a series of events that led to Alison Fane's very early diagnosis of cancer.
articles.author: Madi Chwasta

articles.headline: Consent law overhaul: ACT criminalises 'stealthing' in Australian first
articles.description: The ACT becomes the first Australian jurisdiction to criminalise stealthing – the act of removing a condom without consent during sex – in an Australian first.
articles.author: Kate Christian

articles.headline: Teacher bashed by student makes $750k claim against education department
articles.description: The bashing of a Townsville school teacher in north Queensland was "foreseeable" as his student attacker was known for his aggression and "behavioural disturbances," court documents reveal.
articles.author: Paula Doneman and Melanie Vujkovic

articles.headline: This outback town is 'riddled' with deadly snakes — and Rex is not unhappy about it
articles.description: Alice Springs snake catcher Rex Neindorf says he is unusually busy at this time of year removing high numbers of venomous snakes from residential properties in the region.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Where in the world can I travel if I am vaccinated against COVID-19?
articles.description: Visiting family members or taking a holiday overseas won't be as simple as booking a plane ticket once Australia's border opens up.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Zoey was told her baby had Down syndrome and a termination had been booked
articles.description: Zoey O'Hehir was told her unborn child had tested positive for Down syndrome, and that the doctor had booked her in for a termination. Research shows she is not alone.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Jacinda Ardern gave up on the dream of COVID-zero. It may be the biggest gamble of her political career
articles.description: New Zealand's elimination strategy drove Jacinda Ardern's huge election victory last year. Now, as she moves away from the policy, analysts say the Prime Minister is facing a significant political risk.
articles.author: Emily Clark

articles.headline: When he signed his kids up for nippers, he didn't expect to undergo his own 'mid-life metamorphosis'
articles.description: Damien Cave thought moving to Australia would be an easy transition but his new home country demanded more from this former foreign correspondent than he expected.
articles.author: Bec Zajac

articles.headline: More venues listed as tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in Victoria
articles.description: Health authorities list tier 1 venues in Drouin, Airport West, Queenscliff, Bendigo and North Geelong as Victoria continues to battle a Delta outbreak.
articles.author: Bec Zajac

articles.headline: Tourism businesses fear closure in the next three months, as sector prepares for slow recovery
articles.description: Australia's tourism industry say it needs more support from governments, even as the nation prepares to reop
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: A fight over water rights and sacred sites is coming to a head
articles.description: The NT has granted its largest ever groundwater extraction licence to a company that will eventually use 40,000ML a year for free. It has traditional owners and environmental groups questioning the science behind the decision and the effectiveness of water laws.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher and Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: WWI badge found buried in Tasmania's highlands reveals a mother's 'tragic' story
articles.description: The discovery of a World War I badge by a metal detectorist unearths the heartbreaking story of a single mother who lost two sons in the conflict.
articles.author: Fiona Blackwood

articles.headline: Aria's parents say their daughter gets more out of one hour learning at home with them than a week at school
articles.description: Thousands of Australian families have left the mainstream school system in the past 18 months and alternative education advocates say mainstream schools need to change.
articles.author: Manika Champ

articles.headline: Live: Socceroos and Oman all square at the break
articles.description: The Socceroos chase history against Oman in Doha. Follow all the action from Doha's Khalifa International Stadium in our live blog.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Serco call centre workers raise safety concerns after colleague's COVID-19 death
articles.description: Former colleagues of a man who died with COVID-19 after his call centre workplace became an exposure site say his death could have been avoided if Serco took the virus more seriously.
articles.author: Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: The Sydney cosmetic clinics doing lockdown liposuction, botox and breast enlargements
articles.description: Vaccines aren't the only injections on offer in Sydney's COVID-19 lockdown — some cosmetic clinics are offering treatments like botox, fillers and liposuction. And, what the state's health orders allow depend on who you ask.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: How hunting animals for meat could actually help save threatened ecosystems
articles.description: Consumption of wild animal meat by Amazonian and Afrotropical communities can result in lower greenhouse gas emissions than if it was replaced with beef or poultry, researchers say. What does this mean for Australia?
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: There's no telling how much damage an Evergrande collapse could to do Australia
articles.description: There are fresh questions about the health of the Chinese property sector and what that means for countries — like Australia — that are heavily dependent on robust Chinese economic growth, writes David Taylor.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: At this Thai restaurant people pay for the experience to dine in the water
articles.description: Thailand's floods are a hazard for most riverside businesses but not for this restaurant near Bangkok where diners flock to eat amid the rising tide.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: America's CIA announces new focus on China
articles.description: The CIA is creating a top-level working group on China as part of a broad US government effort focused on countering Beijing's influence.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: 'Drives me crazy': Tanya Plibersek uses Q+A appearance to rail against COVID misinformation from fellow MPs
articles.description: Q+A saw social media giants torn down for misinformation spreading on their platforms but Tanya Plibersek wants the PM to do the same to two well-known politicians
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Tanzanian author wins Nobel Prize in Literature for novel exploring colonialism
articles.description: Tanzanian novelist Abdulrazak Gurnah wins the Nobel Prize in Literature for his "uncompromising and compassionate penetration of the effects of colonialism".
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Tony Abbott's 'unnecessary' Taiwan visit causes ructions inside Morrison government
articles.description: The former Australian prime minister speaks out about Taiwan's isolation on the world stage and about China's recent incursions into the island's air defence zone.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Sydney day trips 'a disaster waiting to happen', South Coast officials say
articles.description: Fully vaccinated people from Greater Sydney will be permitted to visit regional areas when restrictions ease in NSW and some local leaders are fearing the worst.
articles.author: Jessica Clifford

articles.headline: Teachers accuse Premier Perrottet of 'disrespect' over return-to-school changes
articles.description: NSW teachers are complaining they were not consulted about changes made to the dates for students to return to school and say they found out about the new timetable when they heard about it on the morning news.
articles.author: Ursula Malone

articles.headline: 'I was trying to talk to her': Officer tells court he did not draw firearm prior to Aboriginal woman's fatal shooting
articles.description: One of the officers who was present when a colleague fatally shot a woman on a suburban Geraldton street tells the WA Supreme Court he did not draw a firearm himself. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains an image of a person who has died.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: Adelaide man who assaulted flight attendant in drunken outburst pleads guilty
articles.description: South Australian man Timothy Kenneth Hawkes has pleaded guilty to assaulting a flight attendant and disorderly behaviour over a drunken outburst onboard a flight from Melbourne to Adelaide in May.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Mildura enters lockdown as Shepparton and Moorabool exit
articles.description: The Rural City of Mildura will enter a seven-day lockdown from 11:59pm tonight in response to a concerning rise in cases, while the regional areas of Moorabool and Shepparton will have their restrictions ease.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Parks Australia denies it caused Kakadu National Park sacred site damage
articles.description: A court battle over alleged damage to a sacred site in Kakadu National Park is most likely heading to the Northern Territory Supreme Court, with Parks Australia today pleading not guilty to the charge laid against it.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Insurance companies overwhelmingly win crucial test case on COVID payouts
articles.description: Small businesses are dealt a blow by a court ruling that finds a range of insurance policies do not cover them for financial losses during COVID.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: Police separate Nick Kyrgios and girlfriend after argument in Adelaide hotel quarantine
articles.description: Tennis star Nick Kyrgios and his girlfriend have had to be separated into different rooms after a heated argument in hotel quarantine in Adelaide.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: WA's Health Minister says hospitals already under pressure from COVID-19 amid calls for more funding
articles.description: Western Australia's Health Minister lashes out at the federal government, saying the state's hospitals need more funding due to pressure from the COVID-19 pandemic, a day after Prime Minister Scott Morrison rejected calls for more spending.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: These girls named 'Sleek Geeks' in impressive field of 2021 Eureka science winners
articles.description: Two schoolgirls named Scarlett have been dubbed Sleek Geeks for their film of volcanoes, and are among a field of smart winners in this year's Eureka prize for science.
articles.author: Nick McLaren

articles.headline: Man accused of breaching COVID-19 restrictions to enter WA faces court
articles.description: A man who is accused of concealing he came to Western Australia via COVID-ravaged Victoria has indicated he will plead guilty to three charges.
articles.author: Herlyn Kaur

articles.headline: 'How dare they?': Outrage as request to allow voluntary assisted dying laws in the territories denied by Commonwealth
articles.description: The Australian Capital Territory and Northern Territory governments express their frustration and disappointment after their plea to have a ban overturned on their ability to legislate for voluntary assisted dying was rejected by Attorney-General Michaelia Cash.
articles.author: Isaac Nowroozi and Niki Burnside

articles.headline: Open space almost halved around Western Sydney Aerotropolis
articles.description: The New South Wales government dramatically reduces the amount of land set aside as "open space" around the Western Sydney Aerotropolis, after concerns that landholders would be left with worthless properties.
articles.author: Tim Swanston

articles.headline: No new COVID cases after Wagga Wagga testing blitz
articles.description: About 100 casual contacts and 90 close contacts are in isolation after a COVID-19 case was detected in Wagga Wagga earlier this week.
articles.author: Shannon Corvo

articles.headline: Victoria's sporting clubs face race to meet vaccination mandates
articles.description: Professional athletes and their clubs in Victoria are preparing to adhere to government vaccination mandates ahead of their summer seasons, despite some players publicly opposing inoculations.
articles.author: Peter Lusted

articles.headline: Tony Abbott calls China a 'bully' and calls for more global support for Taiwan during visit to island
articles.description: Tony Abbott says says as prime minister he did not want to offend China by travelling to a conference in Taiwan, but now he is out of office and travelling in an unofficial capacity, he is stressing the importance of solidarity with the territory.
articles.author: Peter Lusted

articles.headline: 'A month's worth of rain' set to drench parts of outback Queensland in the coming days
articles.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says parts of outback Queensland are set to be drenched with a month's worth of rain over the weekend as a trough and cloud band move across the state.
articles.author: Peter Lusted

articles.headline: 'I'm a lucky boy': Aged care resident vaccinated alongside Scott Morrison survives COVID
articles.description: Six months after being invited to be among the first 20 people in the country to receive a COVID-19 vaccine alongside the Prime Minister,  Paul Russell tested positive for the virus.
articles.author: Alison Xiao

articles.headline: Victoria's new $500m property scheme will see the government own part of homes
articles.description: The Victorian Homebuyer Fund is expected to help about 3,000 people get into the property market, with the government getting up to a 25 per cent stake in the home.
articles.author: Alison Xiao

articles.headline: Truck driver tests positive for COVID-19 in SA, after earlier negative test in NSW
articles.description: The driver aged in his 60s arrived in South Australia from New South Wales last night and was tested at Yamba in the Riverland.
articles.author: Alison Xiao

articles.headline: Hard lesson for concreters over front-end loader spill
articles.description: A Gold Coast concreting company has been $500,000 fined and one of its directors sentenced over an incident in 2019.
articles.author: Jake Kearnan

articles.headline: 1,000-bed Wellcamp quarantine hub to take travellers by year's end
articles.description: The controversial quarantine facility just outside Toowoomba is beginning to take shape, but will it be needed with home quarantine trials to begin in Queensland next week?
articles.author: Georgie Hewson and Lucy Robinson

articles.headline: This could be the 'luckiest penguin in the world'
articles.description: Two wildlife carers find a New Zealand Fiordland penguin injured and emaciated far from home and hope it will make a full recovery in Tasmania.
articles.author: Monte Bovill

articles.headline: Perfect stranger honoured after breaking bones to save collapsed woman from deadly tide
articles.description: A woman who suffered a brain aneurysm and collapsed on a rock shelf says the man who saved her is a "complete hero". Royal Life Saving WA agrees.
articles.author: Verity Gorman

articles.headline: Sailors on US nuclear sub injured after collision in South China Sea
articles.description: The United States Navy says the submarine's nuclear propulsion system was not damaged in the incident.
articles.author: Verity Gorman

articles.headline: Man accused of torture, murder of teen told police he was losing his mind, Gold Coast court hears
articles.description: Police allege Cian English, 19, was trying to flee a violent robbery when he fell to his death from the balcony of a Surfers Paradise resort.
articles.author: Alexandria Utting

articles.headline: NRL wants answers as Penrith appear to celebrate with broken premiership trophy
articles.description: The NRL asks Penrith for an explanation over images showing players partying with a broken premiership trophy, including one part of it in a pram.
articles.author: Alexandria Utting

articles.headline: 'Asking for it': Construction company told female workers to dress less 'provocatively'
articles.description: Female FIFO workers speak out after facing daily harassment on site, then told their clothing was the problem.
articles.author: Charlotte King

articles.headline: No Time To Die will gives cinemas a boost, but what happens after that?
articles.description: The film is an essential data point in a long-running argument about the future of the cinema experience.
articles.author: Paul Donoughue

articles.headline: Lebanon's skilled workers flee country's 'economic war'
articles.description: Lebanon's best and brightest flee a broken homeland and political system brought to its knees by an economic collapse.
articles.author: Paul Donoughue

articles.headline: Parents worry about school clusters after Indonesia's experience
articles.description: COVID-19 cases are being detected in schools as Indonesia resumes face-to-face learning and this is what Australian states can learn as their students return to school.
articles.author: Hellena Souisa and Natasya Salim

articles.headline: Princess Mako and Kei Komuro's perfect fairytale captured a nation. Until a scandal threatened it all
articles.description: Japan's Princess Mako plans to give up her imperial title and money to be with commoner Kei Komuro. But their wedding will take place against a backdrop of tabloid obsession and a cloud of uncertainty over the imperial line's lasting legacy.
articles.author: Lucia Stein and Lucy Sweeney

articles.headline: Victorian mother struggling to get son with severe autism vaccinated ahead of state reopening
articles.description: When Victoria opens up later this month, Janine Terry is scared her only son will be locked up at home forever.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Emma waited hours in agony for an ambulance, but forgives overworked paramedics
articles.description: As Melbourne's COVID-19 outbreak grows, pressure is mounting on health services, with lengthy ambulance delays and a probe into two deaths after triple-0 calls went unanswered for five minutes.
articles.author: Richard Willingham and Jean Edwards

articles.headline: Twenty-one seconds to understand NSW's Delta disaster
articles.description: Four months ago, people in NSW were enjoying COVID zero — now, many are preparing to take their first steps out of a lengthy lockdown. This is where the virus spread, and how it changed everything.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: 'Older parishioners can't live forever': The young Catholics calling for change
articles.description: Australia's most important Catholic meeting since 1937 is on right now. Here are the changes young Catholics are hoping to see from it.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: Mizuki married his wife almost two years ago. COVID border restrictions mean he hasn't seen her since
articles.description: Last week's announcement that Australia's travel ban will be lifted in November had many separated families rejoicing. But for temporary residents, the ordeal is far from over.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: With a federal election only months away, the political shakedown is alive and well in Canberra
articles.description: Scott Morrison is celebrating as NSW residents prepare to exit lockdown with high double vaccination rates. But the news isn't so good around the country and a federal integrity commission, climate change and structural problems in the health system have left the PM with a very long to-do list, writes Laura Tingle.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Suicide bombing in Afghan mosque kills at least 55
articles.description: At least 55 people are dead and more than 100 are injured after a suicide bombing attack in a mosque in northern Afghanistan.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Qantas confirms Darwin as new transit hub for direct Australia-London flights
articles.description: Qantas confirms it will operate its flagship direct Australia-to-London route via Darwin when international flights resume next month.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Elon Musk will move Tesla's headquarters to Texas in another blow for California business
articles.description: Housing affordability is mentioned by the company's chief executive as a big problem for operating in the Bay Area.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: China calls for huge boost in coal output to fight power crunch
articles.description: Seventy-two mines in Inner Mongolia are given approval to boost production as China grapples with a major shortage.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Journalists awarded 2021 Nobel Peace Prize for efforts to safeguard freedom of expression
articles.description: Two journalists whose work has angered the authorities in Russia and the Philippines have been awarded the 2021 Nobel Peace Prize.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: MP defector takes parting shot at SA Liberals, promising to 'buy the Premier a pizza'
articles.description: The SA government is dealt a major blow less than six months out from the March election, with Adelaide Hills MP Dan Cregan quitting the Liberal Party and announcing his intention to run as an independent.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Police investigate man's suspicious death on Brisbane's eastside
articles.description: Police investigate the suspicious death of a 59-year-old man after he was found unresponsive with significant injuries at a property at Cannon Hill in Brisbane's east.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Farmers say they'll stick with homegrown Roundup advice as Bayer wins US court case
articles.description: Australian farmers say a decision by a US court in favour of Roundup maker Bayer has no bearing on their use of the weedkiller.
articles.author: Kath Sullivan

articles.headline: Parks Australia pleads 'not guilty' in battle over sacred site damage at Kakadu National Park
articles.description: A court battle over alleged damage to a sacred site in Kakadu National Park is most likely heading to the Northern Territory Supreme Court, with Parks Australia today pleading not guilty to the charge laid against it.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Business owners vow to fight as insurance giants claim COVID test case victory
articles.description: Small businesses are dealt a blow by a court ruling that finds a range of insurance policies do not cover them for financial losses during COVID.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: Beleaguered WA Liberals urged to embrace 'rock bottom' and move on
articles.description: Senior federal Liberal figures urge the beleaguered WA party to embrace "rock bottom" and fight for a return of the Morrison government at next year's federal poll.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: England great suggests Australia may win Ashes series '5-0'
articles.description: Retired Ashes-winning captain Michael Vaughan says England risks facing a men's series whitewash if it makes a poor start to the upcoming tour of Australia.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: More than 100 countries reach global deal for minimum corporate tax rate. What will it mean?
articles.description: The historic agreement ensures big companies pay a minimum tax rate of 15 per cent, making it harder for them to stash profits in low-tax countries and could raise government tax incomes by $200 billion annually. This is what the deal looks like.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: Chris Minns pledges to redirect funds from Beaches Link tunnel to Western Sydney
articles.description: NSW Labor leader Chris Minns tells the party faithful that Western Sydney has been left behind, pledging to axe plans for a $10 billion toll road tunnel linking Sydney's Northern Beaches to the city's north-east.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: Victorian truck driver tests positive for COVID-19 at Riverland testing site
articles.description: SA Health says a Victorian truck driver has tested positive for COVID-19 at the border testing site at Yamba today.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: Raducanu stumbles in first match since US Open triumph
articles.description: Emma Raducanu, the 18-year-old Briton who sensationally won the US Open as a qualifier, makes an early exit at the prestigious India Wells tournament.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: US reveals plan to sell Australia 12 military helicopters in $1.3b deal
articles.description: The Royal Australian Navy is set to dump its troubled fleet of European-made MRH 90 Taipan helicopters, replacing them with 12 US-made Seahawks in a deal worth around $1.3 billion.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: NSW reaches 90 per cent first dose COVID-19 vaccination milestone
articles.description: More than 90 per cent of people in the state aged 16 and over have now had at least one shot of a COVID vaccine, as Premier Dominic Perrottet says 80 per cent double vaccination is just around the corner,.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Business Council changes position on climate outlook, pushes for ambitious carbon targets
articles.description: A new report by the Business Council of Australia predicts an $890 billion boost to economic activity and the creation of 195,000 jobs over the next five decades as a result of dramatically cutting carbon emissions.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Facebook apologises for second outage in a week
articles.description: The company confirms another faulty configuration change disrupted Facebook, Instagram and Messenger for two hours, just days after billions of users worldwide were affected by a major global outage.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Surge in Indigenous COVID-19 cases in the Hunter region 'staggering', says prominent surgeon
articles.description: Australia's first Aboriginal surgeon, Dr Kelvin Kong, says he is shocked at the jump in COVID-19 cases among First Nations people in the Hunter New England region this week.
articles.author: Carly Cook

articles.headline: 'We want a school': The push for a classroom inside Howard Springs
