articles.description: Boarding school students have spent almost two months inside the Howard Springs quarantine facility while returning home for school holidays. Despite the difficulties, students, families and teachers are determined to make sure they're still learning.
articles.author: Carly Cook

articles.headline: SA hospital workers directed away from COVID-19 patients as vaccination rates revealed
articles.description: New SA Health data shows 47 Central Adelaide Local Health Network staff members have been reassigned to duties where they will not have contact with patients with COVID-19.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Desolation row: A week ago Mildura had one COVID case. Today it's in lockdown with 37
articles.description: With 20 new cases today and six more just across the Murray River, Mildura is a city on edge, with official concerns there are many more undetected cases in the community.
articles.author: Kellie Hollingworth and Matt Tribe

articles.headline: How effective is Moderna and can I get it as a booster shot?
articles.description: One of the pharmacists administering the vaccine takes the time to answer your questions about Moderna.
articles.author: Matilda Marozzi

articles.headline: Indian-owned Australian coal mine suffers 'another nail in the coffin' after big legal loss
articles.description: An Indian-owned coal mine believed to be more than $1 billion in the red is teetering after a Federal Court judge ordered the company to pay an aggrieved creditor more than $5 million in costs.
articles.author: Daniel Mercer

articles.headline: Canberra 'becoming one of the most vaccinated cities in the world' as the ACT records 25 new COVID-19 cases
articles.description: The ACT records 25 new cases of COVID-19, with 12 of those linked to known cases or ongoing clusters.
articles.author: Charlotte Gore

articles.headline: 'The house was a bit of a jungle': When bushfires raged, animals returned to these wildlife carers
articles.description: As bushfires tore through the small farming community of Birdwood in 2019, native animals made tracks towards Colleen Werner and Doug McNeill's farm to seek shelter. The furry friends had been there before.
articles.author: Keely Johnson

articles.headline: Sam Kerr nominated for Ballon d'Or and title of best footballer in the world
articles.description: Australia's Sam Kerr is among the 20 nominees for the Women's Ballon d'Or as the Chelsea and Matildas superstar is honoured for her stellar year.
articles.author: Keely Johnson

articles.headline: GPs make 'surprise' exit from aged care homes over vaccination
articles.description: Patients are being encouraged to ask if their GP is vaccinated after two doctors quit aged care work in the WA's Mid West region.
articles.author: Cecile O'Connor

articles.headline: Russia labels reporters 'foreign agents' after journalist Dmitry Muratov's Nobel win
articles.description: Hours after Russian journalist Dmitry Muratov was jointly awarded the 2021 Nobel Peace Prize, Russian authorities label nine more journalists and three media organisations "foreign agents".
articles.author: Cecile O'Connor

articles.headline: Queensland records zero new local cases of COVID-19, Young 'perplexed' at state's ability to dodge outbreaks
articles.description: A day after easing COVID-19 restrictions, Queensland again records no new locally acquired cases in the state.
articles.author: Dan Colasimone

articles.headline: US and UK begin jostling to supply Australia with nuclear submarine fleet
articles.description: The Australian Defence Force is again considering what role the Royal Navy could play in developing its next submarines, or whether it will focus on American technology, writes Andrew Greene.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: What happened after Princess Diana wore a jumper designed by Australia's Jenny Kee
articles.description: Clothes created by pioneering Australian designers Jenny Kee and Linda Jackson have been worn by royalty and rock stars. In a new documentary, explores their artistic contribution and their colourful lives.
articles.author: Natasha Johnson

articles.headline: 'Grave' concerns for what's to come as COVID spreads to more Indigenous communities in Victoria
articles.description: As Aboriginal families in Victoria grapple with Delta and those in NSW struggle to contain the spread, experts urge caution about opening up as only 35 per cent of Indigenous people are fully vaccinated.
articles.author: Jedda Costa and Bridget Brennan

articles.headline: A Pulitzer Prize winner, a surprising biography, history reimagined: October’s best books
articles.description: The follow-up to Pulitzer Prize-winner All The Light We Cannot See is among our book critics’ top picks for the month.
articles.author: Kate Evans, Claire Nichols, Sarah L'Estrange, Declan Fry, and Khalid Warsame

articles.headline: Inside the unequal burden of Victoria's COVID-19 deaths
articles.description: Experts warn the burden of Victoria's COVID-19 deaths do not appear to be falling equally, as the pandemic thrusts the health inequalities experienced by culturally and linguistically diverse communities into the spotlight.
articles.author: Ahmed Yussuf and Jessica Longbottom

articles.headline: Hidden notepad sheds light on former Aussie Rules star Darren Millane 30 years after his tragic death
articles.description: Millane lost his life in a car accident 30 years ago last week. The Aussie Rules community is still coming to terms with the loss.
articles.author: Paul Kennedy

articles.headline: 'You think we're joking, we're not': Deputy PM warns social media platforms that regulation is coming
articles.description: Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce says the message to social media giants from governments around the world is that threats of regulation are no joke.
articles.author: Alexia Attwood

articles.headline: Crocodiles are killing divers who harvest sea cucumbers, but plenty still risk their lives for this delicacy
articles.description: The deaths of two divers from crocodile attacks come less than a month after Solomon Islands lifted its ban on harvesting sea cucumbers in an effort to boost the pandemic-stricken economy.
articles.author: Tahlea Aualiitia

articles.headline: In this city, a positive COVID test is followed by a knock at the door and a van to take you away
articles.description: Anyone who tests positive for COVID-19 in South Korea is immediately whisked away from their homes and put into 10 days of mandatory quarantine. As Australia looks to the future of living with the virus, experts say it could be the key to keeping transmission down.
articles.author: Carrington Clarke

articles.headline: GPs face harassment from anti-vaxxers amid 'cease and desist' letter campaign
articles.description: GPs and pharmacists have been receiving fake legal letters ordering them to stop vaccinating amid a rise in harassment from campaigners.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: 'It's not a religion. It's not an organisation. It's a cult'
articles.description: Emma's mum was drawn to the idea that her life had a deeper spiritual meaning. But her search for answers led to her a community with dangerous beliefs.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Getting mental health help when you're deaf is harder than it should be
articles.description: When Catherine needed mental health support she couldn't find a counsellor she could speak to because so few speak her language of Auslan.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: For Xi Jinping, Taiwan is unfinished business – but attacking it is not strategic
articles.description: Why is Xi Jinping seemingly so obsessed with controlling Taiwan – at the risk of a war that could shatter all China has built, asks Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: Daniel Ricciardo starts down the grid after horror qualifying in Turkey
articles.description: Australia's Daniel Ricciardo has it all to do during Sunday's Turkish Grand Prix after an early exit from qualifying.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Republicans applaud US court decision to restore Texas abortion ban
articles.description: The reversal reinstates the United States' strictest ban on abortion — forbidding them once a heartbeat is detected — and making no exemptions in cases of rape or incest.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: US and Taliban to hold first talks since military withdrawl from Afghanistan
articles.description: Officials from the United States and the Taliban will meet this weekend to discuss the growing threat of terrorism and human rights.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Oliver ends 31-year drought between Caulfield Guineas wins
articles.description: Damien Oliver scores his first Caulfield Guineas win as a jockey since 1990, after riding favourite Anamoe to victory.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Aussies beat India in tense T20 finish to clinch series win
articles.description: There were nervous moments in the run chase, but Australia defeats India by four wickets with five balls to spare on the Gold Coast to secure victory in the multi-format series.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Aussie Millman involved in verbal stoush after Indian Wells win
articles.description: John Millman has a heated exchange with his opponent Jack Sock after advancing to the second round of the ATP event with a gritty three-set victory.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Xi Jinping vows Taiwan's 'reunification' with China will be realised
articles.description: The Chinese leader says reunification with Taiwan must happen and will happen peacefully, despite a ratcheting-up of China's threats to attack the island.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: WA COVID-19 exposure sites listed after visit from potentially infectious truck driver
articles.description: A Victorian truck driver was potentially infectious with COVID-19 during his stay in Western Australia between September 30 and October 3.
articles.author: Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: Queensland takes swipe at Tasmania after Sheffield Shield draw
articles.description: Bulls captain Usman Khawaja is left unimpressed after the Tigers opt against making a sporting declaration in their second innings in the hope of getting a result in Adelaide.
articles.author: Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: Teen tests positive to COVID-19 in Adelaide after Virgin Australia flight
articles.description: A teenager tests positive to COVID-19 while in hotel quarantine after being on the same plane as a flight attendant with the virus who also travelled to Newcastle, Sydney and Melbourne.
articles.author: Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: 'It'll look fantastic': Crowds back for Melbourne Cup for first time since COVID hit
articles.description: The Melbourne Cup racing carnival will be used to trial new technology as part of Victoria's move towards its "vaccinated economy".
articles.author: Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: Taiwan will not be forced to bow to China, President says
articles.description: President Tsai Ing-wen says Taiwan will keep bolstering its defences to ensure nobody can force the island to accept the path China has laid down that offers neither freedom nor democracy.
articles.author: Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: Cheaper childcare is coming earlier than expected. But not everyone will be eligible
articles.description: Changes making childcare cheaper are being brought forward to March so that families can access the support earlier — a plan that will cost the government $1.7 billion over three years — but what does it all mean for your family?
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Annastacia Palaszczuk announces fifth day of zero COVID-19 cases
articles.description: Queensland has recorded its fifth consecutive day of zero locally acquired COVID-19 cases.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Independent MP Frances Bedford to run in Newland at next year's state election
articles.description: South Australia's Liberal government is facing another serious challenge from a well-known independent MP, this time in the state's most marginal electorate.
articles.author: Eric Tlozek

articles.headline: Australia will soon be home to the world's largest green energy hydrogen manufacturing facility
articles.description: Australian mining billionaire Andrew "Twiggy" Forrest unveils plans to build the world's largest green energy hydrogen manufacturing facility in Central Queensland.
articles.author: Phoebe Hosier

articles.headline: Actor dies on stage during opera at Bolshoi theatre
articles.description: A male 37-year-old performer was killed during a set change in a performance of the opera Sadko at one of Russia's most prestigious theatres.
articles.author: Phoebe Hosier

articles.headline: As greenhouse gas levels rise globally, just how much extra carbon dioxide can trees absorb?
articles.description: Scientists in Australia and the UK are trying to determine which trees can soak up the most carbon out of the atmosphere with some surprising results.
articles.author: David Claughton

articles.headline: Newcastle, Melbourne, Adelaide, Sydney flyers alerted to positive crew member on flights
articles.description: NSW Health says Virgin flight VA1593 departing Melbourne on October 6 for Newcastle is linked with a COVID-19 case impacting five other flights, with one passenger already infected from an Adelaide flight.
articles.author: Giselle Wakatama

articles.headline: Autumn is getting greener every year, and it's a huge concern to environmentalists
articles.description: As the jacaranda trees bloom in Australia, the autumn leaves fall in the US. But this culturally significant marker of the passage of time is in serious danger of disappearing.
articles.author: Giselle Wakatama

articles.headline: Tyson Fury knocks out Deontay Wilder in heavyweight classic
articles.description: British boxer Tyson Fury has beaten American Deontay Wilder in a heavyweight title fight for the ages, knocking his opponent out in the 11th round of a seesawing battle royale.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: ACT records another 30 COVID-19 cases as two southern NSW men die from the virus
articles.description: The ACT has recorded 30 new locally acquired cases of COVID-19. Meanwhile, a Queanbeyan man and Murrumbateman man have died from the virus.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: Former fighter pilot student Zahra among Afghan women welcomed to Adelaide at special dinner
articles.description: Now in Adelaide, Zahra Samar hopes to again take to the air as a pilot after fleeing the Taliban when they violently targeted the academy she was training at in Afghanistan.
articles.author: Gabriella Marchant

articles.headline: A top economist says two main theories of inflation have lost credibility. So is this anything to worry about?
articles.description: If economists don't understand inflation very well, how can they prepare us for the future?
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: 'You've earned it': Premier looks forward to reopening as NSW records 477 COVID cases
articles.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet says Monday will be an "exciting day" as the state prepares to open up after months of being in lockdown. But he warned residents to be safe.
articles.author: David Hirst

articles.headline: How a survivor of the horrors of Neerkol orphanage walked out of the darkness and into the light
articles.description: More than half a million children were raised in institutions in the 20th century and many experienced horrific abuse. These survivors are dealing with their trauma through art.
articles.author: Inga Stünzner

articles.headline: Austria's Kurz steps down over corruption probe to save coalition
articles.description: Austria's Chancellor Sebastian Kurz resigns to pull his coalition government back from the brink of collapse after being placed under investigation on suspicion of corruption.
articles.author: Inga Stünzner

articles.headline: 'Nothing has changed': Call to action over Indigenous suicide
articles.description: It has been 18 months since the WA government vowed to improve mental health services in the state's north, but Aboriginal health experts say more needs to be done.
articles.author: Jacqueline Lynch

articles.headline: Former NRL stars lead St Helens to third straight Super League title
articles.description: Former NRL luminaries Kevin Naiqama and Lachlan Coote play starring roles in St Helens' third straight Super League grand final triumph, ending Catalans Dragons' bid for history.
articles.author: Jacqueline Lynch

articles.headline: Is this Queensland's hidden paradise? These locals think so, and word is getting out
articles.description: Southern visitors are choosing to stay on in central Queensland's coastal twin towns Agnes Water and 1770, as housing demand and population growth reportedly boom.
articles.author: Lucy Loram

articles.headline: How chest binders are proving to be a 'phenomenal gift' for gender diverse people like Andrew
articles.description: Without binders many people resort to using tape and bandages to compress their chests, which can cause safety issues. A project in Far North Queensland hopes to help.
articles.author: Holly Richardson

articles.headline: Queensland will soon be a "renewable energy superpower". What could that mean?
articles.description: Queensland is soon to be home to the world's largest hydrogen manufacturing facility. So what actually is green hydrogen? And how does it work?
articles.author: Phoebe Hosier

articles.headline: Son of India minister arrested, accused of killing farmers
articles.description: A senior Indian police official says Ashish Mishra, son of junior home minister Ajay Mishra Teni, is in custody,  questioned for more than 10 hours, after farmers and a journalist were run over by a car last week.
articles.author: Phoebe Hosier

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: Sydney's hotspots 'let out of jail'
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Canterbury-Bankstown mayor Khal Asfour says his community is thrilled to be coming out of lockdown at the same time as the rest of Greater Sydney.
articles.author: Phoebe Hosier

articles.headline: 'Critical in saving lives': Quad bike rollover protection now mandatory
articles.description: Farmers and machinery dealers have mixed feelings as quad bike rollover protection becomes mandatory, following 24 deaths in accidents involving the vehicles last year.
articles.author: Fiona Breen, Luke Radford, and Lachlan Bennett

articles.headline: 1,000 people lie in rest on the Isle of the Dead. One 'historical detective' is revealing their stories
articles.description: On a tiny island off Tasmania's historic Port Arthur, lie the bodies of 1,000 people. Tammy Reardon has taken it upon herself to delve deeper into the lives of some of the people who ended up there.
articles.author: Liz Gwynn

articles.headline: More tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites listed in Victoria
articles.description: Victorian health authorities have added new tier 1 venues in Woodend, Altona Meadows, Thornbury, Ballarat and Mildura overnight.
articles.author: Liz Gwynn

articles.headline: Valtteri Bottas takes victory in Turkey as Max Verstappen snatches championship lead after Hamilton bungle
articles.description: A late pit stop costs Lewis Hamilton vital points in the championship, while Mercedes driver Valtteri Bottas takes his first victory of the season at the Turkish GP.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Pop stars have sung his praises, but for Sony Music's staff his abuse was traumatising
articles.description: Senior insiders break their silence to expose what they endured at Sony Music under the reign of Denis Handlin — decades where appalling behaviour was normalised and ignored.
articles.author: Grace Tobin, Ali Russell, and Lucy Carter

articles.headline: COP26 in Glasgow gets the headlines, but another summit kicks off in China today —and it's tackling a different crisis
articles.description: Where the Paris Agreement seeks to stop climate change, the Kunming Declaration, kicking off in China today, aspires to halt and reverse biodiversity loss.
articles.author: Michael Slezak and Penny Timms

articles.headline: NSW is about to offer the rest of the nation a lesson in living with COVID. Will other states pay attention?
articles.description: It may not feel like it yet, but life for millions of Australians is about to return to normal, or at least something close to it, as Sydney exits more than a hundred days of lockdown. But what will 'living with COVID' really look like?
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: 'Transition wobble' predicted as disaster payments wound back
articles.description: Disaster was predicted when JobKeeper ended. Now disaster payments are going to stop. What's going to happen? We ask the experts.
articles.author: Daniel Ziffer

articles.headline: Siki found her 'perfect boyfriend' during the COVID-19 pandemic. But he isn't real
articles.description: China's dating scene is booming, with young adults flocking to AI chatbots and dating apps to find love. While the concept of romance is being reshaped by technologies, there's a catch.
articles.author: Samuel Yang

articles.headline: ‘No-one’s going to give me $100 million to make a movie’ – How writer Matthew Reilly found a way to crack Hollywood.
articles.description: Matthew Reilly already has millions glued to the pages of his books. Now he’s hoping to replicate that success with his debut as a director for a new Netflix action movie.
articles.author: Greg Hassall

articles.headline: Double vaccinated? Here's what you can do in NSW from today
articles.description: While it is not quite Freedom Day, New South Wales shops, pubs and restaurants are reopening and, if you are fully vaccinated, here is a guide to what's changing as the state passes its 70 per cent double-vaccination target.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: COVID-19 gave these homeless Victorians a glimpse of security, but they are about to be evicted
articles.description: The COVID-19 pandemic prompted the state government to house homeless people in hotels and now advocates say those people must not be abandoned as lockdowns come to an end.
articles.author: Mary Gearin

articles.headline: We shed about a teaspoon of skin each week. And this creature eats it
articles.description: Before you launch your spring-cleaning mission, let's get down and dirty with what we do — and don't — know about dust mites.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Archibald winner Nora Heysen nearly came to blows with men who said women couldn't paint
articles.description: Nora Heysen was the first woman to win the Archibald Prize, but was devastated by the stinging criticisms of men who told her that women couldn't make art.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Farmers demand compensation for 'festering sore' left by Kyoto climate targets
articles.description: The president of the National Farmers' Federation will tell the Nationals there needs to be redress for those affected by land-clearing laws.
articles.author: Kath Sullivan

articles.headline: Passenger who entered Queensland without valid border pass tests positive to COVID-19
articles.description: Queensland Health declares Gate 24 at Brisbane's domestic airport a close contact exposure site after an infectious person was there on Saturday.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: England names 'strongest available squad' for Ashes tour
articles.description: Despite the likes of Ben Stokes and Jofra Archer being ruled out, England is confident captain Joe Root has an experienced squad under his leadership for the upcoming men's Ashes series.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Gypsy King Tyson Fury reigns supreme over heavyweight division
articles.description: Tyson Fury has confirmed his dominance over the heavyweight division after his sensational knockout victory over Deontay Wilder. Next stop for the Gypsy King? The undisputed crown.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Plane crashes in central Russia, killing 16 people
articles.description: Russian news agencies are reporting that a Let L-410 Turbolet plane carrying a group of parachute jumpers crashed near a city in Russia's Tatarstan region killing 16 people and injuring seven.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Impressive Aussies defeat India in final T20 international
articles.description: Australia completes its multi-format series against India with a 14-run victory in the third Twenty20 international on the Gold Coast.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: NT says it won't wait for 'abysmally low' remote vax rates to improve before reopening
articles.description: The NT's Health Minister says the plan to reopen will not be delayed despite deep concerns about vaccination rates in vulnerable communities — and a dispute about the figures overall.
articles.author: Emma Haskin and Stewart Brash

articles.headline: More police testify in murder trial of officer who shot woman on suburban street
articles.description: The most junior officer at the scene of the death of an  Aboriginal woman — known as JC — said he only wielded his taser in the confrontation. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains an image of a person who has died.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Accused AFL grand final COVID breachers, who allegedly faked documents, to face Darwin court
articles.description: Two Melbourne men accused of falsifying documents to enter WA to attend the AFL grand final are ordered to face court in the Northern Territory.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Western Sydney residents enjoy freedoms after months of harshest lockdown restrictions
articles.description: After months of harsh restrictions, many in Western Sydney were keen for some retail therapy, waiting in line as shops reopened on the stroke of midnight.
articles.author: Mridula Amin

articles.headline: 'Increasingly interested': Taliban scrutinise departing Australians and permanent residents from Afghanistan
articles.description: A parliamentary hearing in Canberra reveals that more than 280 Australian citizens or permanent residents remain stranded in Afghanistan almost two months after the Taliban seized power in Kabul, with around 26,000 Afghans applying for humanitarian visas.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: 'There will be pain', but WA Nationals back net zero carbon target
articles.description: While the federal Nationals remain divided on net zero, the party's WA branch has nailed its colours to the mast and backed a 2050 target.
articles.author: Eliza Borrello and Belinda Varischetti

articles.headline: Dairy, beef industries hatch plan to stop slaughter of unwanted calves
articles.description: Half of all calves born on Australian dairy farms live less than a month and farmers think there's a better option.
articles.author: Lachlan Bennett

articles.headline: WA's first tropical cyclone could hit before Christmas in earlier than usual cyclone season
articles.description: It is not just people in WA's north who need to be prepare for cyclones this season, as BoM predicts the damaging windstorms could reach further south once again.
articles.author: Herlyn Kaur

articles.headline: Canberra developer rescinds more contracts for off-the-plan properties, sparking possible law change
articles.description: Sheridan Burnett purchased an off-the-plan apartment from 3 Property Group's Allegro development. The developer has now pulled out of the deal, leaving Ms Burnett and others like her angry at being left high and dry.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford, Elizabeth Byrne, and Michael Inman

articles.headline: New technology kept a donated heart healthy for seven hours and transformed Andrew's life
articles.description: Researchers hope a "heart in a box" system being trialled at the Alfred Hospital in Melbourne could lead to a 15 per cent increase in heart transplants in Australia.
articles.author: Erin Cooper

articles.headline: Man with 'grandiose ideas' of being head of IS in Australia jailed for seven years
articles.description: A judge says Sydney man Isaac El Matari "did a lot of talking" and there was a "low" chance of him launching a terrorism attack in Australia, as the 22-year-old is jailed for seven years.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Brisbane Roar young gun reveals he has been battling leukaemia
articles.description: Exciting Brisbane Roar youngster Izaack Powell reveals on social media he has been battling leukaemia since June.
articles.author: Dan Colasimone

articles.headline: ‘Sometimes a language is held by one or two people’: Fears for Indigenous culture if COVID spreads
articles.description: Indigenous artists and major arts organisations join forces to call for special measures to protect First Nations people living in remote communities, fearing the loss of culture if COVID-19 reaches vulnerable people, including Indigenous artists and elders.
articles.author: Sue Lannin

articles.headline: 'Very infectious' female miner tests positive for COVID-19 after arriving in SA from Melbourne
articles.description: A fly-in fly-out mine worker tests positive for COVID-19 after arriving in Adelaide from Melbourne, then going to a hotel in a taxi, with SA Health now urgently seeking to identify close contacts.
articles.author: Sue Lannin

articles.headline: Young man cleared of friend's manslaughter at small-town golf club
articles.description: Dane McLennan has been found not guilty over the 2019 death of his long-time family friend and former neighbour John Durie.
articles.author: Richard Crabtree

articles.headline: 'Record breaking performances' at GFG's Australian operations help lift international empire out of debt
articles.description: GFG Alliance's restructuring update reveals strong profits from its Australian operations have helped to repay creditors and secure a funding agreement for Sanjeev Gupta's international empire.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: France fights back to win Nations League with late goal from Mbappe
articles.description: World champions France have won the UEFA Nations League final with a 2-1 comeback victory over Spain in Milan.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: The Taliban says US will provide humanitarian aid to Afghanistan
articles.description: American and Taliban officials have held talks in Doha, with a spokesman for the militant group saying the US will provide aid but is refusing to recognise Afghanistan's new rulers.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: SA Health chief pours doubt on Premier's Christmas reopening push
articles.description: South Australia's top health bureaucrat is distancing himself from a proposal to remove quarantining requirements for fully vaccinated interstate travellers by Christmas, saying such a deadline "hasn't come from me".
articles.author: Daniel Keane and Leah MacLennan

articles.headline: NFL player celebrates missed kick, goes on to lose game
articles.description: Cincinnati Bengals kicker Evan McPherson had already kicked two match-winning goals in his rookie NFL season but missed twice against the Green Bay Packers on a torrid day for the kickers.
articles.author: Daniel Keane and Leah MacLennan

articles.headline: Cricket Australia 'likely' to postpone Afghanistan Test
articles.description: Cricket Australia expects the men's Test in Hobart will be put on hold, as it waits for more clarity from the federal government about the "situation on the ground" in Afghanistan.
articles.author: David Mark

articles.headline: Adelaide woman who killed two brothers in crash sentenced to nine years' jail
articles.description: The sentence given to an Adelaide woman whose "drug-fuelled dangerous driving" killed two "innocent" and much-loved brothers is described as not long enough by some of those closest to them.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Treasury confirms it knew government was paying out billions in JobKeeper to firms that 'may not need support'
articles.description: Treasury says $27 billion in JobKeeper payments went to businesses whose turnover either increased or did not decline as much as required, but rejects calls to introduce a clawback mechanism and defends the scheme's design.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: Hunter records 82 new COVID cases as 'Freedom Day' caution urged
articles.description: The region is posting some the highest numbers in NSW and business owners, politicians and health officials are reminding people that we're not out of the woods just yet.
articles.author: Liz Farquhar, Madeline Lewis, and Jenny Marchant

articles.headline: Why did only 407 stranded Queenslanders apply for the home quarantine trial?
articles.description: Thousands of Queenslanders stranded in interstate hotspots have been invited to take part in a trial allowing them to return and quarantine at home — but with the scheme beginning today, only 407 people have signed up.
articles.author: Baz Ruddick

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: Premier Perrottet avoids fine after breaching COVID rules during photo op
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Premier Dominic Perrottet avoids a fine from NSW Police after he was spotted breaching the public health orders at a media press conference yesterday.
articles.author: Baz Ruddick

articles.headline: 'The flower of joy and hope': Sunflowers get community sowing
articles.description: The Liverpool Plains community plants sunflower seeds now in the hope they will be ready for selfies by Christmas and the new year.
articles.author: Jennifer Ingall

articles.headline: Chopper Read described it as a 'madhouse' that 'breeds psychopaths'. Today your kids can play there
articles.description: When the notorious 150-year-old Pentridge prison closed down in Melbourne, it left a difficult question: what to do with it. It's one that divides opinions and not everyone's happy about what's happening on site.
articles.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg

articles.headline: New tier 1 sites added to Victoria's list of COVID-19 exposure sites
articles.description: Health authorities list new tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites overnight in Geelong, Bendigo, Drouin West, and Mooroolbark.
articles.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg

articles.headline: 'Banks believe they are the moral arbiter': Sex industry and gun shops denied financial services, advocates say
articles.description: Legally operating businesses in the sex, adult and firearms industries say they are being denied services from banks and other financial companies.
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: 'Fiji instead of Queensland': Aussies are opting for tropical holidays overseas
articles.description: With Fiji welcoming tourists from a select number of countries, including Australia, the US and New Zealand from November 11, Sydney mother Lisa Thwaite wasted no time in booking an international family vacation, instead of risking interstate border closures with a domestic holiday.
articles.author: Marian Faa

articles.headline: Indian shop assistants finally win the right to sit down, after years of standing up
articles.description: Unions in India hail a law change allowing retail workers to sit, but warn their fight for better working conditions continues.
articles.author: Marian Faa

articles.headline: Are you a young, aspiring journalist?
articles.description: ABC News welcomes your ideas that explore the issues young people are facing — and possible solutions — as we find a path forward from the challenges of COVID-19.
articles.author: Marian Faa

articles.headline: Scottish Socceroos lead Australia's World Cup charge
articles.description: They may know more about haggis than Harold Holt, but Scotland-born Socceroos Harry Souttar and Martin Boyle are leading Australia's charge to the 2022 World Cup.
articles.author: Marian Faa

articles.headline: Anti-pokies lobby urges action as 50-year monopoly nears end in Tasmania
articles.description: With an almost 50-year monopoly on gambling in Tasmania about to end, critics of the industry say those who are about to frame new laws must "seize upon the opportunity to put in place better harm minimisation measures".
articles.author: Alexandra Humphries

articles.headline: As millions in NSW celebrate freedoms, Bernadette faces six more weeks in lockdown
articles.description: Thousands of cancer patients and organ transplant recipients will have to wait weeks or even months before they can get a third booster shot that will allow them to enjoy the same freedoms as everyone else.
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: As Melbourne gears up to exit lockdown, suburbs in the south-east are struggling to curb COVID
articles.description: The local government area of Casey is recording the most new COVID cases while its rate of fully vaccinated adults falls behind the state average.
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: COVID vaccine effectiveness is waning. But by how much?
articles.description: COVID-19 vaccines are working remarkably well to reduce rates of severe disease and death. But a growing number of studies suggest their protection against infection is waning over time.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: 'Someone had to pay, and I'm the one that copped it': Fired Sony music exec speaks out
articles.description: A former vice-president of Sony Music Australia sacked over sexual harassment and bullying claims he was a "scapegoat" for toxic behaviour at the company and says he doesn't recall alleged incidents of inappropriate touching because it's possible he was drunk.
articles.author: Grace Tobin, Ali Russell, and Lucy Carter

articles.headline: Bulletproof glass and 24-hour surveillance: The life of an American abortion doctor
articles.description: For almost 50 years, Dr Warren Hern has performed abortions in Colorado, a liberal safe haven for the women of Texas and other conservative states. But it doesn't shield him from the anti-abortion extremists.
articles.author: Kathryn Diss

articles.headline: Iraqi forces capture senior Islamic State finance manager
articles.description: Sami Jasim, who has a $US5 million bounty on his head, is only the second IS leader to be taken alive.
articles.author: Kathryn Diss

articles.headline: 'Is that what he says?': Prince Charles urges Scott Morrison and other leaders to attend COP26
articles.description: World leaders including Joe Biden, Boris Johnson, the Queen and the Pope will be at the UN Climate Change Conference, but Mr Morrison has not yet made a decision on whether he will attend.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: 'Immoral and irresponsible': China takes second swipe at former prime minister Tony Abbott's recent comments
articles.description: China's Foreign Ministry spokesperson says the nation has lodged a complaint with the Australian government over remarks made by former prime minister Tony Abbott in Taiwan.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Ambulance crash leaves two men dead in central Queensland
articles.description: Two men are killed after the ambulance they were travelling in was hit by a truck in central Queensland.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: How the government plans to help half of kids with mental health issues
articles.description: A new strategy by the federal government is hoping to cut down lengthy wait times and reduce out-of-pocket costs for professional help for children with mental health issues.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: UK police drop investigation into Prince Andrew in Virginia Giuffre case
articles.description: After a review of evidence relating to sex crime allegations against Prince Andrew and the late US financier Jeffrey Epstein, UK police drops its investigation.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Relative of Hoffmann's alleged murder victim takes the stand
articles.description: Benjamin Hoffmann is accused of killing four men during an alleged shooting spree in Darwin in 2019.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Man spared jail after assaulting attendant on flight from Melbourne to Adelaide
articles.description: A drunk and disorderly passenger who assaulted a flight attendant and threatened to "smash" another passenger on a Virgin Australia flight has been spared jail.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: How to prove your vaccination status as Victoria prepares to reopen
articles.description: The government will test its proof of vaccination systems in the coming weeks ahead of a statewide jab requirement at many venues.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Alleged murder victim sustained 69 separate injuries during ‘struggle’, court hears
articles.description: Benjamin Hoffmann’s fourth and final alleged victim sustained 69 injuries across his body, including dozens of “stab or slicing" injuries in a "struggle" that led to his death, a court has heard.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: 'Invincible military': Kim Jong Un vows to bolster North Korea's ability to fight
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un uses an anniversary event to accuse the US of not taking action to prove it has no hostile intent toward his country, vowing to build his country's military capacity.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Ajla Tomljanovic defeats another seed to reach Indian Wells fourth round
articles.description: Having already beaten Garbine Muguruza in California, the Australian scores a straight-sets win over number 26 seed Tamara Zidansek to set up a clash with former world number one Angelique Kerber.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Daughter of man charged over COVID breach taken into state care, as SA records no new cases
articles.description: A father is arrested and charged with allegedly breaching SA's COVID-19 directions at a city medi-hotel this afternoon, with his young daughter taken into SA Health's care.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: International students fear 'second culture shock' as return to Australia looms
articles.description: Nearly 60,000 international students are itching to get on Australian soil to begin or resume their studies, but many are anxious about what life will look like once they arrive.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: BOM declares La Niña alert as the east braces for storms this week
articles.description: Central Australia and parts of Queensland have already received a deluge this week, and more wild weather is on the way for the south-east in what's shaping up to be a soggy season.
articles.author: Kate Doyle

articles.headline: Wildlife officers complete two-year quest to remove tyre from elk's neck
articles.description: A years-long quest to free a bull elk ends with US authorities sedating the animal and removing a tyre from around its neck.
articles.author: Kate Doyle

articles.headline: Canberra woman who was shot in neck 'will never forgive' man responsible
articles.description: A man who shot a woman in the neck in a random attack as she sat in her car in Canberra's inner south has been sentenced to more than a decade in jail.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne and Holly Tregenza

articles.headline: Holocaust survivor who called himself 'the happiest man on Earth'  dies aged 101
articles.description: Having narrowly survived the Buchenwald and Auschwitz concentration camps under the Nazis, Eddie Jaku dedicated his life to teaching others about the perils of hatred and intolerance.
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: Frontline workers granted extension of stay on penalties for refusing COVID vaccine
articles.description: More than a dozen frontline workers, including police officers and paramedics who are challenging their workplace COVID-19 vaccine mandate, are granted further reprieve from disciplinary action for refusing to comply with the directives.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Why do some Nationals still fear signing on to net zero by 2050?
articles.description: Not for the first time, the 21 members of the Nationals party-room find themselves as the centre of Australia's climate change debate, with some adamant to refuse a net zero target regardless of what policy is behind it.
articles.author: Kath Sullivan and Jane Norman

articles.headline: Inquiry launched into Attorney-General’s decision to reject deep-water port on Kangaroo Island
articles.description: Days after the defection of Liberal MP Dan Cregan, South Australia's government has lost a number of votes in Parliament, including one to stop an investigation into the conduct of the Deputy Premier.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: British government criticised for following scientists' COVID-19 advice without question
articles.description: The British government waited too long to impose a lockdown in the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic, missing a chance to contain the disease and leading to thousands of unnecessary deaths, a parliamentary report has concluded.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Break-in at heritage-listed hotel has guest hiding in wardrobe
articles.description: A guest has told of hiding in a wardrobe when a group of people forced their way into an historic Kalgoorlie hotel, causing more than $30,000 worth of damage.
articles.author: Amelia Searson and Elsa Silberstein

articles.headline: Man who allegedly murdered colleague at Pilbara mine site ruled fit to stand trial
articles.description: A man accused of murdering his co-worker on a Pilbara mine will stand trial in February, despite earlier showing signs of psychosis.
articles.author: David Weber

articles.headline: New budget airline Bonza eyes a hungry cut price domestic market with planned 2022 launch
articles.description: A major US investment firm is planning to launch an Australian low-cost carrier by the name of Bonza to compete with Qantas, Jetstar, Virgin and Rex in the domestic aviation market.
articles.author: Samuel Yang and Peter Ryan

articles.headline: Melbourne man who stormed aunt's home with crossbow sentenced to five-and-a-half years' jail
articles.description: Zach De Visser, 32, charged with blackmailing his terrified aunt so she would make him the executor of a family will, is sentenced to five-and-a-half years behind bars.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: 'I never meant to hurt anyone': NFL coach resigns over racist, homophobic comments in emails
articles.description: Jon Gruden steps down as Las Vegas Raiders head coach following media reports he used racist, misogynistic and homophobic language in emails over several years.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: PETA files lawsuit against Australian jockey, racing body, in a bid to ban horse whipping
articles.description: The animal rights organisation hopes to prove that standard whipping, as allowed by Australian racing rules, contravenes Tasmania's Animal Welfare Act.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Alzheimer's patient was missing for 90 minutes on 39C day before staff noticed, inquest hears
articles.description: An Adelaide man with Alzheimer's disease attending a Commonwealth-funded respite program went missing for up to 90 minutes on a 39-degree day before staff noticed, a coronial inquest has heard.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Some people think Dave Chappelle's special should be pulled from Netflix. Netflix doesn't think so
articles.description: Critics say The Closer attacks the transgender community, but Netflix says the stand-up act is "an important part of our content offering".
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Support floods in for small Sydney coffee shop targeted by anti-vaxxer in online video
articles.description: A small coffee shop in Sydney's inner west has been buoyed by the support of the local community in the wake of an anti-vaxxer attack over the government vaccination rules.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn and Mark Reddie

articles.headline: Mitch Marsh eyeing off key role at T20 World Cup
articles.description: Mitch Marsh is ready for the T20 World Cup, on the back of a breakout year, including big performances up the order for Australia in the West Indies and Bangladesh, and the "happiest day of his life" off the pitch.
articles.author: Duncan Huntsdale

articles.headline: 'Gordon's life mattered': Coronial inquest ordered into death of Indigenous man in floodwaters
articles.description: Lawyers for the family of an Aboriginal man who died in floodwaters near Moree say his death should be treated with the same gravity as a death in custody.
articles.author: Duncan Huntsdale

articles.headline: Andrews says he has always followed the rules as branch-stacking scandal engulfs Victorian Labor
articles.description: Premier Daniel Andrews declares he has always followed the Labor Party's rules, as the state's anti-corruption watchdog says branch stacking appears to have been "endemic within the Labor Party for at least the last 20 years".
articles.author: Richard Willingham and Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: Lou was bored in lockdown. So they trolled conspiracy groups for a laugh
articles.description: Most people in lockdown tried out new hobbies like baking or learning a language. Comedian Lou Walls tried infiltrating the Illuminati.
articles.author: Ahmed Yussuf

articles.headline: The healthcare sector's plastic addiction is spiralling during COVID. There's a business case for tackling it
articles.description: Frustrated doctors and nurses workers are speaking out about their sector's reliance on single-use plastics. They're fighting back to save both the environment and money.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: 'My dad is a victim of vaccine misinformation': How the Muslim community is debunking COVID myths
articles.description: Ella Zain's father isn't an anti-vaxxer, but like many in his community he had doubts about the COVID-19 vaccine. Now he's in a coma in ICU, and Ella is urging others to get the jab.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: Ian Chappell leads cricket greats in Afghanistan fundraising campaign
articles.description: With the future of cricket in Afghanistan in doubt due to the Taliban's stance against female participation, Ian Chappell leads a team of sporting greats in a campaign encouraging Australians to "go into bat for Afghanistan".
articles.author: Daniela Intili

articles.headline: Spring soaking on the way for Melbourne, with a month's worth of rain due over a few days
articles.description: A complex low shifting into Victoria today and tomorrow is likely to bring thunderstorms, heavy rainfall and the possibility of minor flash flooding to some areas.
articles.author: Paul Higgins

articles.headline: Super-cell thunderstorms, 'giant hail' set to batter south-east Queensland
articles.description: South-east Queensland should prepare for a battering on Thursday, with several super-cell storms set to sweep the state bringing "giant hail" and destructive winds.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: Next stage of reopening could arrive next week, Premier says
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: New South Wales Premier Dominic Perrottet suggests the next stage of reopening could be brought forward if the state hits its 80 per double-dose vaccination target this weekend.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: Queensland coal city 'moving fast' to become global hydrogen hub
articles.description: Despite the tension within the coalition government about committing to a net-zero carbon target, in the centre of the Queensland coal belt leaders are already planning for a low carbon future.
articles.author: Nathan Morris and Guy Williams

articles.headline: Construction of bridges, roads, railways at threat due to worst skilled labour shortage in decades
articles.description: Government investment in bridges, roads and railways is expected to double in coming years, but a new report warns the spending blitz could be undermined by one of the worst skills shortages in decades.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: New tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites listed in Victoria
articles.description: Health authorities list new tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in Wangaratta, Trafalgar, Kotupna, Bendigo and Torquay.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: JobMaker was meant to support 450,000 jobs. The real figure is just 1 per cent of that
articles.description: One of the key elements touted in the October 2020 federal budget, JobMaker promised $4 billion over two years in taxpayer funds to pay employers to hire workers under the age of 30. But fewer than 5,300 workers have been signed up.
articles.author: Daniel Ziffer

articles.headline: Taxpayer-funded $250,000 legal effort helps keep original French submarine price secret
articles.description: Defence and the French company Naval Group spends almost a quarter of a million dollars on taxpayer-funded lawyers trying to keep hidden the original proposed cost of Australia's future submarine.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: It was meant to be here months ago, so when is the Novavax vaccine coming to Australia?
articles.description: Australia initially expected Novavax to start arriving here in mid-2021, but the vaccine could end up playing a key role in our booster shot program.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Jon thought his solar panels were a good deal. Then he discovered he'd paid double the price
articles.description: Vulnerable Australians — including pensioners — are being signed up to overpriced solar deals, with some being charged almost double what their system is worth.
articles.author: Amy Bainbridge and Lucy Kent

articles.headline: What would it cost Australia's poorest state to help a mining magnate launch a hydrogen hub?
articles.description: Mining magnate Andrew Forrest has pledged to spend "well over" $500 million on a 250-megawatt green hydrogen plant. What hasn't been discussed is how much the plan could cost the state, writes Emily Baker.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: An assault left Beth with a broken nose, months later she's still struggling with the trauma
articles.description: After a violent assault in Melbourne's south-east, Beth was left suffering "severe" anxiety. With Victorian victims of crime waiting up to four years for decisions on their compensation claims, she doesn't know when she'll be able to afford help.
articles.author: Elise Kinsella

articles.headline: Churches and mosques delay reopening to avoid having to turn away the unvaccinated
articles.description: Places of worship have been allowed to reopen but many are choosing to wait until NSW reaches 80 per cent fully vaccinated, with religious leaders saying they are uncomfortable with having to tell people they are not welcome.
articles.author: Lydia Feng

articles.headline: IBAC vs ICAC: What are these anti-corruption commissions and how do they compare?
articles.description: What are anti-corruption commissions? How do ICAC in NSW and IBAC in Victoria differ? And why is a federal integrity commission being proposed? Yee-Fui Ng explains.
articles.author: Lydia Feng

articles.headline: Victoria may hit its vaccination targets ahead of schedule, but that doesn't mean restrictions will ease earlier
articles.description: Victoria is on track to beat targeted vaccination dates by several days, but the government is not budging on when restrictions will be eased statewide.
articles.author: Lydia Feng

articles.headline: Soaring house prices leave us with three urgent questions. Here's why an inquiry into the problem won't answer them
articles.description: Never has an inquiry into the skyrocketing price of homes been more urgent. Rarely has one been as ill-suited as the one underway right now, writes Peter Martin.
articles.author: Lydia Feng

articles.headline: What's causing this strange radio signal from the centre of the Milky Way?
articles.description: Astronomers are baffled by a mysterious radio signal coming from near the centre of our galaxy that appears and disappears randomly.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: One of the biggest stars in the NBA has been stood down by his team
articles.description: The NBA isn't forcing players to have a COVID vaccine, but it will not pay those who are unable to play due to COVID vaccine rules in cities where games are scheduled.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: In this country, you get two power bills: One from the electric company, the other from the 'Mafia'
articles.description: Years of corruption and warlord rule has seen Lebanon slowly sink into economic collapse. But who keeps the wi-fi going and the hospital lights on when the government can't? Enter the 'Generator Mafia'.
articles.author: Tom Joyner

articles.headline: 'It is pretty serious now': China's property sector wary of Evergrande default
articles.description: A wave of developers face payment deadlines before the end of the year and with Evergrande's fate looking increasingly bleak, fears mount of a wider crisis.
articles.author: Tom Joyner

articles.headline: Most Australians support a net zero target via renewables, Australia Institute reveals
articles.description: As the federal Coalition negotiates a climate policy ahead of the Glasgow COP26 summit, a new report says the majority of Australians support a target to achieve net zero.
articles.author: Jess Davis and Jake Lapham

articles.headline: Tasmania announces state target of net zero emissions from 2030
articles.description: Tasmania has announced it will mandate a state target of net zero emissions from 2030 — a feat it has already achieved in six of the last seven years.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Travis Head goes ballistic with record-breaking double century
articles.description: Travis Head has smashed a stunning 230 off just 127 balls in a devastating knock in the one-day cup for South Australia against Queensland.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Painted amongst the desert spinifex 40 years ago, this art is finally about to be unveiled
articles.description: 'It is a story with most of the early pages torn out.' Missing artworks to go on display in Adelaide for the first time after decades stashed in a shipping container.
articles.author: Vanessa Mills

articles.headline: What do you do when you reach 100 years old? Play golf of course
articles.description: John Skipper turned 100 years old today, and even with a variety of appointments and official functions to attend his priority was his weekly golf round, a constant in 77 years playing the game.
articles.author: Malcolm Sutton

articles.headline: Scathing report says Victoria can't show if, or how, it's halting species decline
articles.description: The auditor-general says government reporting on biodiversity protection lacks detail and accountability, as about a third of the state's flora and fauna are believed to be facing extinction.
articles.author: Rhiannon Stevens and Christopher Testa

articles.headline: Nurse killed in ambulance crash was a new grandad who touched 'thousands of lives'
articles.description: Ray Wyeth, 65, was approaching retirement when tragedy struck. His friends and family say the world has lost "one of the most genuinely great people you would ever meet".
articles.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis and Lucy Loram

articles.headline: Coates rules out IOC pressure on China over human rights ahead of Winter Olympics
articles.description: With Beijing set to stage the Winter Games early next year, International Olympic Committee vice-president John Coates says the governing body cannot interfere in humanitarian issues in a host country.
articles.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis and Lucy Loram

articles.headline: 'They say we live in a lucky country. I beg to differ': Inside the Aboriginal housing divide
articles.description: Aboriginal housing tenants in one regional community are locked in a tense standoff with their local land council over what they describe as years of neglect.
articles.author: Ella Archibald-Binge

articles.headline: Brother of missing boy heard 'cry for help' after WA waterfall kayaking accident
articles.description: Police say they are now searching for the body of an eight-year-old boy believed to have drowned after a kayaking incident in Western Australia's south.
articles.author: Kyle Pauletto, Tom Edwards, and John Dobson

articles.headline: 'It will come, it will infect, and it will kill': Stark warning to the COVID unvaccinated in WA
articles.description: WA's Vaccine Commander issues a 'sobering' message to the unvaccinated, saying COVID-19 can not be kept out of the state, and people will be infected and die.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: There were plenty of fireworks as SA experienced its own 'Independents' Day': Here's how it unfolded
articles.description: This time last week, Dan Cregan was a little-known first-term Liberal backbencher representing a blue-ribbon Adelaide Hills seat. Now he is Speaker. Here's how the unprecedented coup unfolded.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Korean-language series Squid Game is Netflix's biggest original show debut
articles.description: Hit series Squid Game is Netflix's biggest ever debut of an original show, outpacing Bridgerton in just 27 days.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: NT government warns 'mass mortuaries' could be needed if COVID enters remote areas with low vaccination
articles.description: The Northern Territory's Chief Health Officer has warned shipping containers and cold storage facilities may be used as mass mortuaries in a worst-case COVID outbreak scenario.
articles.author: Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: Police confirm bone found in Mossy Point garden bed is human
articles.description: DNA and radiocarbon testing was undertaken after the discovery on the NSW far south coast, with an investigation now underway through the Missing Persons Unit.
articles.author: Adriane Reardon

articles.headline: How the AFL favours clubs who lose their stars to free agency
articles.description: There have been a lot of changes to the AFL in recent years, but few are bigger than the reintroduction of free agency. Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson look at the impacts.
articles.author: Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson

articles.headline: Andy Murray supports restrictions on unvaccinated players at Australian Open
articles.description: The former men's world number one says it's understandable if unvaccinated players are subject to "different" rules at the season-opening major in Melbourne.
articles.author: Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson

articles.headline: US set to reopen land borders for fully vaccinated travellers
articles.description: Following months of urging by Mexican and Canadian officials, the US will reopen its land borders next month, ending a 19-month closure prompted by the pandemic.
articles.author: Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson

articles.headline: The pressure is growing on Queensland and WA to explain what living with COVID-19 will look like
articles.description: Queensland and Western Australia have mostly escaped COVID-19, but there's mounting pressure on the state governments to spell out how they will reopen their borders and what that will mean for their health systems.
articles.author: Peter McCutcheon

articles.headline: Former NSW premier Mike Baird to give evidence at Berejiklian corruption inquiry
articles.description: The state's corruption watchdog's inquiry into former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian will begin on Monday with her predecessor Mike Baird expected to give evidence on Wednesday.
articles.author: Ursula Malone

articles.headline: Call for more jail time as 'selfish' AFL grand final border breachers plead guilty
articles.description: The prosecution is calling for an immediate jail term for the two Victorian men after risking turning the AFL grand final into a 'super spreader event'.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: After childbirth, a season off and two weeks' quarantine, a Melbourne Renegades star re-emerges
articles.description: Cross-code star Jess Duffin takes to the cricket pitch for the WBBL opening round this weekend confident her teammates will step in as honorary nannies for her young daughter Georgie.
articles.author: Tom Maddocks

articles.headline: Businesses will soon be forced to report when they are held to ransom through cyber attacks
articles.description: Despite the devastating consequences of ransomware attacks, some businesses would prefer to quietly pay millions than face the hit to their reputation, so Australia's Home Affairs Minister is making reporting mandatory.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: 'Biggest dog act': Liberals fuming following SA speakership coup as Premier avoids swearing in
articles.description: South Australia's political landscape is currently in disarray in the wake of a Liberal defector's shock ascendancy to the speakership, with a former colleague describing the manoeuvring as the "biggest dog act" he has seen in politics.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin and Daniel Keane

articles.headline: 'A good start': Researchers say quad bike regulations should go further
articles.description: A leading safety expert says studies into quad bike accidents have not found a fatality where a roll bar was fitted.
articles.author: Michael Condon

articles.headline: Skippers shocked by influx of Indonesian fishing boats in protected waters close to Australian mainland
articles.description: Footage and photos obtained by the ABC show an Indonesian fishing crew waving at tourists as they illegally operate within a pristine marine sanctuary.
articles.author: Erin Parke

articles.headline: Risk of giant hail, destructive wind gusts and intense rainfall for south-east Queensland today
articles.description: The atmosphere is "very much primed" for storm activity throughout south-east Queensland today, with the potential risk of severe storms and supercell activity.
articles.author: Erin Parke

articles.headline: What does outspoken professor Peter Ridd's High Court loss mean for free speech on campus?
articles.description: A university researchers says outspoken professor Peter Ridd's High Court loss poses important questions around free speech and academic freedoms on university campuses.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: Woman charged under new Queensland laws for allegedly failing to report child sex abuse
articles.description: A woman in her 50s becomes the first person to be charged under new Queensland laws that require all adults to report suspected child sexual abuse to police.
articles.author: Kate McKenna

articles.headline: New tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites listed by Victorian health authorities
articles.description: New tier 1 exposure sites have been listed in Warrnambool, Geelong, Warragul, Stawell, Halls Gap and Bendigo overnight.
articles.author: Kate McKenna

articles.headline: Penny lived with OCD for 23 years before being diagnosed
articles.description: At least 500,000 Australians experience Obsessive Compulsive Disorder each year, yet it can take over a decade to receive a diagnosis.
articles.author: Kate McKenna

articles.headline: Sydney is opening up. But some can't prove they're already vaccinated
articles.description: Some temporary visa holders are unable to get Medicare. They can still get the vaccine, but getting a record of their vaccination status is proving difficult.
articles.author: Bang Xiao and Iris Zhao

articles.headline: Deaf games on hold but 2022 looks brighter for cricket's extended family
articles.description: Australia's deaf cricket team has not played since the 2018 World Cup in India but hopes 2022 will see the team return to action and its quest to produce a player capable of playing in the BBL or WBBL.
articles.author: Paul Kennedy

articles.headline: 'More confident' and on track to 'good jobs': How teaching Indigenous students about culture is turning lives around
articles.description: Groundbreaking research supplied exclusively to the ABC shows a path to closing the gap for Indigenous students in attaining a year 12 qualification. And at schools already doing it, students are happier and more engaged.
articles.author: Paul Kennedy

articles.headline: Ombudsman calling fresh air a 'human right' led to changes in SA medi-hotel system, report reveals
articles.description: Complaints about a lack of fresh air prompted an overhaul of South Australia's hotel quarantine system, the state's ombudsman reveals in his annual report.
articles.author: Nick Harmsen

articles.headline: 'Enjoy the gallows, b***h': Racism and sexism feed into threats directed at COVID experts
articles.description: A survey of scientists around the world finds 15 per cent of them received death threats after speaking about COVID-19 — and it's having a chilling effect on their work.
articles.author: Anna Salleh

articles.headline: Tasmania's COVID-free status on the brink after NSW man's hotel runner
articles.description: The news that a COVID-positive traveller from NSW bolted from hotel quarantine in Tasmania has caused anger in the community, with the Premier conceding hotels are not "prisons". But questions remain about how the 31-year-old was able to escape into the suburbs, writes Emily Baker.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: How the gambling industry cashed in on political donations
articles.description: Over $80 million in legal gambling-related payments — at least double what was previously identified — have flowed into the coffers of political parties during the past 22 years, an ABC News investigation can reveal.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: This NSW town felt protected from the pandemic — then COVID-19 arrived
articles.description: MPs in northern NSW are calling on the government to keep regional areas closed to holidaymakers from Sydney until vaccination rates catch up with those in the cities.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: As Melburnians like Olivia and Daniel buy cheaper land in Geelong, supply is close to running out
articles.description: The Cranbourne couple decided to build their future in Geelong after realising land was half the price, and they are not alone. There are concerns a serious supply shortage is looming.
articles.author: Erin Cooper

articles.headline: Waking up around 3am plagued with fear and self-doubt? You're not alone
articles.description: The thoughts are often distressing and punitive. Then they vaporise in the daylight, proving that the 3am thinking was completely irrational. So, why do we do it? Greg Murray explains.
articles.author: Erin Cooper

articles.headline: Plenty of thought bubbles but no clear demands: What do the Nationals want from a climate deal?
articles.description: Beyond demanding more detail over a net zero emissions target, it's still unclear precisely what the Nationals want as part of any grand climate bargain, writes David Speers.
articles.author: David Speers

articles.headline: Australia 'the dumping ground' for worst emitting cars as government delays signing on to international standards
articles.description: More than 80 per cent of the global car market now follows 'Euro 6' emissions standards — but Australia's resistance to signing on is leaving the country with less efficient, less safe and higher polluting cars, experts warn.
articles.author: Jake Evans

articles.headline: 'Our last chance': WHO assembles new team to determine origins of COVID-19
articles.description: The WHO says the newly formed advisory group could be the last chance to find out how the pandemic began. China has repeatedly denied that it originated in its laboratories and says no more visits are needed.
articles.author: Jake Evans

articles.headline: You could build a Great Wall of China from the extra amount of e-waste we dumped this year
articles.description: Less than one fifth of e-waste is effectively recycled, despite it containing anything from gold and silver to valuable glass and rare earth elements. Experts say a circular economy is the solution.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: At 90, and after many years acting as the captain of a spaceship, William Shatner has ventured into space
articles.description: At age 90 William Shatner becomes the oldest person ever to go into space aboard Blue Origin's second crewed space flight.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: Kenyan Olympian stabbed to death in her home
articles.description: Just a few months ago Agnes Tirop ran fourth in the final of the 5,000 metres at the Tokyo Olympics, she has now been found dead in her home and local police say her missing husband is a suspect.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: 'Follow New South Wales's lead': Perrottet's advice for PM on emissions
articles.description: NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet urges the Morrison government to follow NSW on targets for carbon emissions by 2030.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Gold Coast woman charged over allegedly issuing hundreds of fake COVID-19 medical exemptions
articles.description: It will be alleged that the woman told police she has issued approximately 600 false COVID certificates.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Queensland landlords lose automatic refusal on pets in rental properties
articles.description: A new housing bill strips Queensland landlords of the right of refusal on pets in rental properties. The bill also offers greater protections to tenants experiencing domestic violence and enforces minimum housing standards.
articles.author: Jessica Rendall

articles.headline: Will Pucovski suffers another concussion as men's Ashes series approaches
articles.description: The rising star of Australian men's cricket — who made his Test debut last summer — is again recovering from concussion symptoms.
articles.author: Jessica Rendall

articles.headline: Coroner identifies ex-partner as person of interest in 40 year old case
articles.description: The former partner of a Tasmanian woman who went missing more than 40 years ago was in court as it is announced he is a person of interest in her disappearance for the upcoming inquest.
articles.author: Manika Champ

articles.headline: More than 1,000 ordered to evacuate as La Palma volcano threatens more homes
articles.description: Residents in several towns on the western coast of La Palma town hastily pack up their belongings, after being given just hours to evacuate their homes.
articles.author: Manika Champ

articles.headline: Calls to move Tooborac out of Mitchell Shire to avoid 'Melbourne' lockdowns
articles.description: As the Mitchell Shire comes out of its ninth lockdown, Tooborac, a country town of 300 people, is calling to be moved out of the council zone.
articles.author: Sarah Lawrence

articles.headline: Woman told she will likely go to jail over quarantine breaches
articles.description: A 22-year-old woman who skipped out on hotel quarantine in WA after returning from locked-down Victoria, and was arrested after catching a train from Perth to Kalgoorlie, has been told she is likely facing a term of imprisonment.
articles.author: Jarrod Lucas

articles.headline: 'Give this man a movie deal asap': Actor's impression of Robin Williams stuns fans
articles.description: Relatively unknown actor Jamie Costa gives an uncanny performance as Robin Williams in a five-minute YouTube video that has gone viral.
articles.author: Jarrod Lucas

articles.headline: Sydney storm dumps giant hail and rain, BOM cancels tornado risk warning
articles.description: A severe thunderstorm in Sydney and coastal NSW brings thunder, lightning, heavy rain and hail, following a severe weather warning that included possible tornado activity was issued late this afternoon.
articles.author: Jarrod Lucas

articles.headline: Police 'utterly failed' own policy in high-speed chase that killed teen, inquest finds
articles.description: A Queensland Coroner has ruled police "utterly failed" their duties which led to the death of a teenager on the Gold Coast.
articles.author: Heidi Sheehan and Kimberley Bernard

articles.headline: 'Don't make people suffer': Mark's death 'without dignity' haunts his widow
articles.description: Two people share their heart-breaking stories of terminal cancer and explain what it would mean for them if NSW's assisted dying bill is passed.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: 'Bewildering': Australia plans to stop AstraZeneca production — but how will it affect our neighbours?
articles.description: CSL's Melbourne plant is making about a million doses a week and up to 800,000 are being sent overseas to bolster vaccine rollouts in the Pacific and South-East Asia. But the company is expected to wind up production of AstraZeneca in Australia early next year.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic and Liam Fox

articles.headline: Severe storms have hit Sydney. Much of eastern Australia remains in the firing line
articles.description: The BOM is warning that destructive winds, giant hail and flooding are possible with severe storms stretching from Gippsland to Rockhampton.
articles.author: Kate Doyle

articles.headline: Woman charged with pretending to be doctor, issuing hundreds of fake vaccine exemptions 'doesn't believe she's done anything wrong'
articles.description: Police are trying to track down people who received a fake "medical exemption" from the Toowoomba woman, who was charging up to $150 per document.
articles.author: Kate Doyle

articles.headline: Three dead as truck and sedan collide at major Gold Coast intersection
articles.description: Twelve ambulances called to treat nine people, three of whom died, after a multi-vehicle crash that spread debris for almost a kilometre, the ambulance service says.
articles.author: Dominic Cansdale

articles.headline: Confused about the latest changes to Victorian schools? We've got you covered
articles.description: After another lockdown sent Victoria's 1 million students in and out of remote learning, classrooms are beginning to open up again. Here's what we know about the return to school, exams, masks and ventilation.
articles.author: Yara Murray-Atfield

articles.headline: Much at stake for NSW regions as new Perrottet-Toole leadership team takes control
articles.description: Two new party leaders with very different backgrounds, styles, and history are at the helm of the NSW government. What does that look like for the regions?
articles.author: Kelly Fuller

articles.headline: Westpac, CBA make COVID-19 vaccines mandatory for all staff
articles.description: Westpac and the Commonwealth Bank will require all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in the coming months.
articles.author: Samuel Yang

articles.headline: 'I had gone up in flames': Burns victim gives harrowing evidence at trial
