articles.description: A Tasmanian woman who was allegedly set on fire by her partner tells a jury he threatened to kill her — and force her to write her own suicide note beforehand  — if she ever left him.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: US Olympic Committee defends handling of Nassar case after gymnasts send letter to Congress
articles.description: Gymnasts who suffered sexual abuse under former team doctor Larry Nassar send a letter to Congress calling for the US Olympic and Paralympic Committee to be dissolved.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Puppy farm rejected after 400k objections; council braces for legal fight
articles.description: A Queensland council ignores the advice of staff to reject a major dog-breeding facility, even while noting it could spark costly legal action.
articles.author: Owen Jacques

articles.headline: McGowan offers glimpse into life with COVID in WA
articles.description: Having enjoyed life with barely any restrictions this year, WA's Premier has outlined what 'living with the virus' will look like.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: 'There is a lot of fear': Pete Murray tells federal government to help secure live music events
articles.description: The continuing uncertainty about the need for snap lockdowns or border closures means live music event organisers cannot get insurance to cover their losses.
articles.author: Paul Donoughue

articles.headline: The WBBL returns, full of home-grown stars and world-class imports
articles.description: The seventh season of the Women's Big Bash League has arrived. Get up to speed on all you need to know ahead of the first ball.
articles.author: Brittany Carter

articles.headline: Ever dreamt of having a hobby farm in Tasmania? You're not alone
articles.description: Help is at hand for Tasmanian hobby farm enthusiasts who are new to the land.
articles.author: Brittany Carter

articles.headline: Lockdown has ended in the ACT — here's what you can and can't do
articles.description: After more than two months, lockdown has ended in the ACT and restrictions around household visits, restaurant operations and businesses have eased. Here's what you need to know.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: Police close cold case investigation into Queenie Hart murder years after only suspect dies
articles.description: Nearly 50 years after she was murdered in Rockhampton, Aboriginal woman Queenie Hart will finally rest in peace when her remains are exhumed from an unmarked grave.
articles.author: Paula Doneman

articles.headline: Nurse reveals details of Canberra Hospital patient's fatal fall at inquest
articles.description: A nurse has told a coronial inquiry she heard a 'bang', before finding an elderly patient critically injured at Canberra Hospital.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: Regional travel postponed despite state vaccination milestone
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Regional travel in NSW was meant to be among the restrictions lifted at the 80 per cent vaccination milestone — expected to happen on Monday — but will now be delayed.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: What are the vaccine rules for rural workers?
articles.description: It's confusing keeping up with different rules across states and industries — so what are the COVID-19 vaccine rules for rural workers?
articles.author: Jess Davis, Olivia Calver, and Angus Verley

articles.headline: As Victoria nears its vaccination target, who will be left behind when the state reopens?
articles.description: Multicultural groups have called on the state government to continue a key outreach program that's been helping hard-to-reach communities get vaccinated.
articles.author: Jess Davis, Olivia Calver, and Angus Verley

articles.headline: Family awarded life insurance after dying woman was sent cancellation warning to old work email
articles.description: While Carolyn Burns was dying, AMP cancelled her life insurance because she never responded to emails to a work address from five years earlier. Now, her family has won a court case against AMP to claim the payout.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Eddie Mabo's daughter 'honoured' to share his stories through art, as 2021 Tarnanthi Festival launches
articles.description: More than 1,000 Indigenous artists from across the country will showcase their work at Tarnanthi Festival 2021, which launches its popular art fair online today.
articles.author: Sarah Mullins

articles.headline: Will our public hospitals cope with opening up? This modelling says they won't
articles.description: Hundreds of beds in public hospitals nationally could permanently full of COVID-19 patients once restrictions are eased, under multiple scenarios put forward by the Australian Medical Association.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Push for NDIS to fund private swimming lessons for children with autism
articles.description: Families of children like Liam Archer, who has autism, are worried their kids will be missing out on vital water safety skills, with the National Disability Insurance Scheme refusing to fund one-on-one swimming lessons.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: 'It's just a flesh wound': Australia's jobs market looks set for another remarkable rebound as lockdowns lift
articles.description: Like Monty Python's Black Knight, Australia's jobs market keeps taking blow after blow from COVID-19 lockdowns but somehow bounces back.
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: The world is running low on everything, your online orders are at sea, and Christmas will be tricky
articles.description: Around the world, ships are lined up waiting to enter port and companies can't find containers or truck drivers to take their goods to their final destination. Meanwhile, you're still waiting for that delivery. What's going on with the global supply chain?
articles.author: Lucy Sweeney

articles.headline: 'What’s wrong with mum?': This is what it feels like to live with long COVID
articles.description: As Australia comes to grips with the idea of living with COVID-19, Freya, Judy and Adam already know what that's like. They're part of a growing number of people with long COVID and they want to help you understand what it feels like.
articles.author: Emily Sakzewski, Georgina Piper, and Colin Gourlay

articles.headline: The women who sewed to save themselves from the gas chambers of Auschwitz
articles.description: Historian Lucy Adlington was inspired to write a novel about the women forced to make clothes at Auschwitz. Then she discovered the truth was more riveting than the fiction.
articles.author: Julie Street

articles.headline: Three in four aged care deaths in NSW's Delta outbreak were fully vaccinated, data shows
articles.description: Government data provided to the ABC reveals for the first time the vaccination status of aged care residents who died from COVID-19.
articles.author: Julie Street

articles.headline: 'We're robbing from our children's future': Prince William blasts billionaire space race
articles.description: Prince William suggests entrepreneurs focus their resources on solving environmental problems on Earth, rather than competing in a commercial space race.
articles.author: Julie Street

articles.headline: Vaccine mandate leaving some employers 'between a rock and a hard place' as workers refuse jabs
articles.description: The deadline for Victoria's essential workers to receive at least one COVID-19 vaccination has arrived, but for some workers and employers, the mandate is already causing issues.
articles.author: Zena Chamas and Yara Murray-Atfield

articles.headline: 'Rabble of a government': Climate change policy flayed on Q+A
articles.description: The federal government comes under attack on several fronts over emissions policy, accused of being held to ransom by the Nationals over getting to net zero by the year 2050.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Truck driver tests positive for COVID-19 after visiting Adelaide Big W
articles.description: SA Health says a truck driver has tested positive for COVID-19 after visiting three exposure sites in South Australia, including a Big W store.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Bali reopens to international travel, but Australians are still locked out
articles.description: Bali is reopened for international travelers for the first time in more than a year. But no international flights were expected after the island was opened to travellers from 19 approved countries, authorities say.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: 'Extremely fierce': 46 dead in southern Taiwan highrise fire
articles.description: A fire that engulfs a building in southern Taiwan kills 46 people, according to local officials who expect the death toll to rise.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: The aged care industry insists the sector is in a 'better place' to manage COVID-19 outbreaks, but concerns remain
articles.description: This week, residents in aged care facilities across New South Wales finally welcomed back visitors as restrictions eased.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: Man arrested in Riverland and three others at Adelaide hotel after alleged border breach
articles.description: Three people arrested at an Adelaide medi-hotel were among four stopped after allegedly trying to get into South Australia from NSW and Victoria, police say.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: NT opposition labels mandatory vaccines for workers 'draconian'
articles.description: The CLP Opposition has slammed the NT government's vaccine mandate for workers, saying it's a "sad indictment on the government and its vaccine rollout to date".
articles.author: Steve Vivian, Myles Houlbrook-Walk, Samantha Dick, and Housnia Shams

articles.headline: Sunshine Coast man caught filming women in toilet using hidden phone
articles.description: A Sunshine Coast man has admitted to planting his phone to record members of his church group using the toilet at his house.
articles.author: Jacqui Street

articles.headline: Rebecca doesn't want to be vaccinated, but the Victorian schools' mandate forced her hand
articles.description: For some Victorian education workers, Monday's state vaccination mandate will be a choice between a jab or a job.
articles.author: Alexander Darling

articles.headline: NRL hands former Parramatta Eels star three-year ban
articles.description: Michael Jennings, who had already been released from his Eels contract, accepts the three-year sanction for breaching the league's anti-doping protocols.
articles.author: Alexander Darling

articles.headline: 'Genuinely frustrating': Mildura to stay in lockdown seven more days
articles.description: Mildura remains in lockdown with 188 active cases in the community and a low vaccination rate.
articles.author: Richard Crabtree

articles.headline: Police investigating murder of pregnant mother search park after tip-off
articles.description: Homicide detectives and forensic officers investigating the murder of heavily-pregnant Perth mother Janet Dweh search a park after receiving a tip-off.
articles.author: Herlyn Kaur

articles.headline: Preliminary report suggests powerline dropped significantly before pineapple farm death
articles.description: Initial findings say it appears a powerline dropped 3.6 metres from its original height before it came into close contact with a harvester on a pineapple farm in July.
articles.author: Katrina Beavan

articles.headline: Students across the country rally for climate change action
articles.description: Thousands of students rally across the country to demand stronger action on climate change, as Prime Minister Scott Morrison confirms his attendance at the upcoming global climate summit.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin, Shamsiya Mohammadi, Nicholas Hynes, and James Carmody

articles.headline: WBBL hopes to play on amid Hobart lockdown
articles.description: Cricket Australia is hopeful it will be able to play four Women's Big Bash League games in Hobart this weekend despite a snap three-day lockdown in the city.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin, Shamsiya Mohammadi, Nicholas Hynes, and James Carmody

articles.headline: Elephant kills elderly tourist in front of his son while on a morning walk in Zimbabwe
articles.description: A "tuskless" female elephant at Mana Pools National Park kills a South African tourist while he and his adult son took a morning walk in the park.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin, Shamsiya Mohammadi, Nicholas Hynes, and James Carmody

articles.headline: 'Overworked, fatigued, stressed': Doctors demand more help to care for sick kids
articles.description: Nearly 40 doctors sign a letter calling on the South Australian government to provide more staff at the Women's and Children's Hospital, warning a "preventable tragedy" could occur if urgent action is not taken.
articles.author: Tom Fedorowytsch

articles.headline: Boeing 787 Dreamliner production hits another hurdle with defects found in parts
articles.description: The parts include fittings that help secure the floor beam in one fuselage section, as well as other fittings, spacers, brackets, and clips within other assemblies.
articles.author: Tom Fedorowytsch

articles.headline: NSW parliamentary report questions models used to justify kangaroo culls
articles.description: A state parliamentary inquiry has raised serious questions about the kangaroo harvest industry in New South Wales and highlighted welfare failings in how joeys are killed.
articles.author: Kelly Fuller, Michael Condon, and David Claughton

articles.headline: Morrison, derided as the Prime Minister for NSW, is being stalked by a man fast becoming the Premier for Australia
articles.description: Labor likes to dub Scott Morrison the "Prime Minister for NSW". But Dominic Perrottet is fast earning the reputation of "Premier for Australia" — and that's likely to give Morrison headaches.
articles.author: Brett Worthington

articles.headline: Qantas to fly Sydneysiders overseas from November 1, while Virgin brings forward its Fiji flights
articles.description: Qantas will resume international flights earlier than expected, after the NSW Premier allowed quarantine-free vaccinated arrivals from November 1, while Virgin will offer flights to Fiji from December 16.
articles.author: David Chau and Samuel Yang

articles.headline: Search ends in tragedy as man's body found off coast north of Perth
articles.description: An air and sea search launched after a dinghy capsized off the coast north of Perth ends in tragedy with the discovery of a man's bo
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: Tasmania's 'snap' lockdown restrictions explained
articles.description: People in south Tasmania have entered a "snap" lockdown due to a traveller's quarantine breach. Here are the rules people have to follow.
articles.author: James Dunlevie

articles.headline: 'No-one should go through this': Border application to see dying mother exposes flaw
articles.description: A Queensland family learnt the devastating news their beloved wife and mother had just weeks to live this week, but faced a frustrating battle applying for a border exemption.
articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty and Steve Austin

articles.headline: Sonny Bill Williams is facing up to the man in the mirror
articles.description: He had talent, money and fame, but Sonny Bill Williams was "extremely unhappy". The star sportsman opens up about his career highs and lows, the off-field drama, his mental health struggle and what’s driving him now.
articles.author: Tracey Holmes

articles.headline: Jail for man who used scissors to stab Adelaide nightclub security guard
articles.description: A man who stabbed a security guard with a pair of scissors during a heated brawl on Adelaide's Hindley Street nightclub strip is taken into custody ahead of his sentencing.
articles.author: Candice Prosser

articles.headline: Disgraced former Sony Music boss stripped of award days after Four Corners reveals toxic work culture
articles.description: The Australian Recording Industry Association says it is stripping disgraced former Sony Music Australia chief executive Denis Handlin of a lifetime achievement award, just days after a Four Corners report revealed detailed allegations of systemic bullying and discrimination under Mr Handlin.
articles.author: Grace Tobin, Ali Russell, and Lucy Carter

articles.headline: Mixed reaction to delay in NSW regional travel as vaccination rates fall behind
articles.description: Some are relieved the health of regional communities is being put first; others say businesses are in dire need of more tourism dollars.
articles.author: Emma Siossian and Luisa Rubbo

articles.headline: Man arrested after allegedly trying to deliver heroin in food delivery bags to Adelaide medi-hotel
articles.description: A man who allegedly attempted to deliver heroin and other drugs concealed in food delivery bags to an Adelaide medi-hotel is arrested.
articles.author: Emma Siossian and Luisa Rubbo

articles.headline: Woman jailed over SA border breach 'no stranger to the court system'
articles.description: A woman with an extensive criminal history is jailed for breaching SA's border rules, while another four people are charged after doing the same, including a truck driver who allegedly spat and pushed police officers at a border checkpoint in the state's South East.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: Scott Morrison to attend COP26 climate change conference in Glasgow, no decision on net zero
articles.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison confirms he will attend an international climate conference in Glasgow, but he has not yet reached a deal about whether Australia will sign up to a net zero emissions by 2050 target.
articles.author: Georgia Hitch

articles.headline: Authorities catch 101 illegal fishing vessels off northern Australia since July
articles.description: The Australian government confirms it is no longer detaining illegal foreign fishing crews due to COVID-19 safety concerns, amid a spike in boats close to the mainland.
articles.author: Erin Parke and Sam Tomlin

articles.headline: Australians with parents stuck overseas relieved they are now classed 'immediate family' for COVID travel
articles.description: The decision to allow parents of Australian citizens to be classified as "immediate family" for them to travel to the country brings relief to many.
articles.author: Zalika Rizmal

articles.headline: One man's 'outrageous' behaviour enough for half a state to grind to a halt
articles.description: Tasmania's Premier has always said it was "inevitable" coronavirus would return to Tasmania; while few would disagree, the manner it which it has done so has angered and dismayed many, writes Emily Baker.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: 'Kylie and Dannii are the same person': The great social media misinformation quiz
articles.description: From a Kylie and Dannii bombshell to a Satanic shout-out, can you sort the real news from the fake?
articles.author: Nick Baker and Richard Aedy

articles.headline: 'My goal is to represent Australia in the Olympics': From a tough childhood to boxing glory
articles.description: Ali Gawhari had never boxed before moving to Tasmania in 2017. Now his coach says world titles could be his for the taking.
articles.author: Damian McIntyre

articles.headline: Tasmania wakes up to a weekend of lockdown
articles.description: People in southern Tasmania are waking to the first day of a snap three-day lockdown — with health advocates warning the hospital system won't cope if a COVID outbreak takes hold.
articles.author: Laura Beavis

articles.headline: Want a slice of tropical paradise? Here's when Pacific countries are likely to reopen to tourists
articles.description: While Fiji prepares to welcome Australian tourists back to its beaches for Christmas, other Pacific countries aren't rushing to follow suit.
articles.author: Marian Faa

articles.headline: Squid Game aired South Korea's dirty laundry: Eyewatering debts, loan sharks and wild house prices
articles.description: With its technicolour sets, outlandish plot and wild costumes, Squid Game might seem like just another dystopian fantasy. But for Koreans who live with crippling debt, it hits closer to home.
articles.author: Carrington Clarke

articles.headline: Bushfires spared Rebekah's house, but the smoke wreaked havoc on her lungs
articles.description: As climate change brings more protracted and severe bushfire seasons, protecting vulnerable people from smoke exposure will be a major challenge for health authorities.
articles.author: Alison Branley

articles.headline: The 'national plan' has been torn up and it looks for all the world like a state government is running the joint
articles.description: A couple of weeks ago Scott Morrison announced he would reopen international borders without mentioning it to the states. He could hardly complain yesterday when NSW premier Dominic Perrottet returned the favour, writes Laura Tingle.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Victoria is making dramatic changes to its border policy. Here's what it all means
articles.description: Victoria will remove many of the restrictions barring interstate travel from NSW on October 19. Here's what you need to know.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Conservative British MP Sir David Amess stabbed to death in a church, leaving behind large family
articles.description: Sir David Amess, a Conservative MP in Boris Johnson's UK government dies after being stabbed by a man while he was meeting with local constituents.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Suicide bomber kills 37, injures dozens more  at Shiite mosque in Afghanistan
articles.description: At least 37 people are killed and dozens injured in an explosion during Friday prayers at a Shiite mosque in southern Afghanistan.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: ADF may use ageing submarines for another 30 years while waiting for nuclear replacements
articles.description: Australia's ageing Collins Class submarines could be kept in the water for another 30 years as Defence works to acquire a new fleet of nuclear-powered boats.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: COVID restrictions may start soft when WA reopens, but may not stay that way for long
articles.description: Western Australia's COVID-19 restrictions will be beefed up and eased as many times as necessary once the state reopens its borders, Premier Mark McGowan says.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Fake COVID-positive text message no joke as community on high alert
articles.description: A practical joke causes unnecessary strain on the local health department and anxiety within the community.
articles.author: Mikaela Ortolan

articles.headline: Confidential child protection documents dumped at Darwin tip
articles.description: Confidential documents including child protection information is dumped at a Darwin tip after the Northern Territory Families department throws out old filing cabinets.
articles.author: Samantha Dick and Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: Judge dismisses workers' legal challenge to mandatory COVID-19 vaccinations
articles.description: The cases before the Supreme Court were initiated by unvaccinated workers from health, aged care, construction and education sectors arguing there was insufficient long-term data on COVID-19 vaccine safety and side effects.
articles.author: Samantha Dick and Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: What's within 5km of my home? See how the Hobart lockdown rules apply
articles.description: You can only exercise or shop for essential goods within a 5km radius of your home. Use our tool to find out what's within your radius.
articles.author: Samantha Dick and Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: No decision on Justin Langer's future until after the Ashes, new CA boss says
articles.description: Cricket Australia insists Justin Langer is the right person to lead the men's national team this summer, but won't commit to re-signing him before the end of the Ashes series.
articles.author: Tom Wildie

articles.headline: 'Look out Melbourne Cup': jockey Brett Prebble puts Incentivise rivals on notice after Caulfield Cup win
articles.description: The first of the big three races in Melbourne's Spring Carnival is run and won, with superstar Incentivise taking out the Caulfield Cup for trainer Peter Moody — and winning jockey Brett Prebble is in no doubt what's next.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Teenager missing for days in remote Northern Territory outback found, but search for companion continues
articles.description: A teenage boy who was missing for at least four days in the remote Northern Territory outback has been found alive, but his companion in still missing.
articles.author: Isaac Nowroozi

articles.headline: Magnitude-4.8 earthquake strikes Bali, kills three injures seven
articles.description: A magnitude-4.8 earthquake strikes Indonesia's Bali island, killing at least three people, and injuring seven.
articles.author: Isaac Nowroozi

articles.headline: WA's ICU bed count ranks lowest in nation based on population: report
articles.description: Western Australia has the lowest number of intensive care unit (ICU) beds on a per capita basis in the nation, with just six beds available for every 100,000 people according to a medical journal report.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: Jason Horne-Francis is the AFL's hottest draft prospect — and he's ready to become a Kangaroo
articles.description: Jason Horne-Francis has rocketed to the top of many experts' draft boards, and has already started imagining his future AFL life in the blue and white of North Melbourne.
articles.author: Matthew Smith

articles.headline: Chris Waller-trained Nature Strip wins $15m The Everest at Royal Randwick
articles.description: Crowds are back at the track in Sydney as the Chris Waller-trained Nature Strip wins the $15 million feature race The Everest at Royal Randwick.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: NSW hits 80 per cent double vaccination target
articles.description: NSW has become the first state with 80 per cent of its eligible adult population fully inoculated against COVID-19.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Eleven students drowned and 10 rescued during river cleanup in Indonesia's West Java Province
articles.description: Eleven students drown and 10 others were rescued during a school outing in Indonesia's West Java Province.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: WBBL live: The show goes on as Renegades play Hurricanes and Thunder face Strikers
articles.description: WBBL07 continues in Tasmania, as the Sydney Thunder take on the Adelaide Strikers in their opening clash of the season. Follow the live score.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Race day 'breaks hibernation' as NSW hosts first big event out of lockdown
articles.description: Thousands spend Greater Sydney's first weekend out of lockdown at the races as the government increases the crowd capacity for upcoming racing events including Melbourne Cup Day.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Golden Globes still on despite US network dropping the awards show
articles.description: The Hollywood Foreign Press Association says the awards will go ahead in January despite US television network NBC deciding not to televise the event following criticism of the association's ethical conduct and lack of racial diversity.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Missing girl, 4, last seen in family's tent at campsite north of Carnarvon sparks major WA police search
articles.description: Police are conducting a major search for a 4-year-old girl missing from a campsite in Western Australia's North West.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: Man bitten by shark offshore in north Queensland
articles.description: A man is bitten by a shark on the leg while swimming about 45 minutes offshore in the Whitsundays.
articles.author: Nibir Khan and Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: For 10 minutes, a Times Square billboard shamed Australia on climate
articles.description: With Prime Minister Scott Morrison bound for Glasgow for next month’s COP26 climate summit, Australian comic Dan Ilic shines the bright lights of Times Square on the federal government's contentious environmental policies.
articles.author: Nibir Khan and Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: Healing an outback town with a dark past
articles.description: In a town where historic racial tensions were high, pastoralists and First Nations people have forged a brighter path towards reconciliation.
articles.author: Evelyn Leckie

articles.headline: Sing us a song, you're the pianola man: Meet the teenager who restores vintage self-playing pianos
articles.description: Lloyd Baker took up the hobby of restoring self-playing pianos after buying one from his music teacher. Next, he acquired one from the local plumber.
articles.author: Andrew Kelso

articles.headline: WBBL matches to go ahead in Hobart amid COVID lockdown
articles.description: The new WBBL season will continue as planned in Hobart despite a three-day COVID lockdown, but crowds will not be allowed in for four matches to be played this weekend.
articles.author: Andrew Kelso

articles.headline: Snake catcher finds more than 90 venomous rattlesnakes hibernating under woman's home in California
articles.description: Al Wolf is used to clearing one or two snakes from under houses but recently was called by a woman who had seen more than 90 rattlesnakes under her house in Northern California.
articles.author: Andrew Kelso

articles.headline: China off Formula 1 calendar for 2022, Australian GP set to return
articles.description: Motor racing fans can put April 10, 2022 in their diaries, as next season's F1 calendar reveals the Australian Grand Prix is down for round three — but China will miss out again due to COVID conditions.
articles.author: Andrew Kelso

articles.headline: Hannah Gadsby slams Netflix executive for dragging her name into Chappelle defence
articles.description: Taking to Instagram, Australian comedian Hannah Gadsby launches a scathing attack on a Netflix executive who cited her comedy specials in a defence of the streaming platform's support for US comedian Dave Chappelle.
articles.author: Andrew Kelso

articles.headline: Man arrested three days after fatal hit and run in Darwin
articles.description: Northern Territory Police charge a 32-year-old man and seized a white Toyota Camry after a 52-year-old man was allegedly hit by a vehicle earlier this week.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Swimming integrity reforms a chance to 'right wrongs of the past,' says Olympian Michelle Ford
articles.description: Former Australian swimmer Michelle Ford has been part of athlete activism for 40 years — now integrity reforms to world swimming may result in the two-time Olympian receiving two more gold medals from the Moscow Games.
articles.author: Tracey Holmes

articles.headline: MP spoke out on 'such senseless murders' months before being killed
articles.description: A British MP is stabbed to death just months after standing in the UK Parliament to ask Boris Johnson what he planned to do about the escalating problem of "senseless" knife murders.
articles.author: Tracey Holmes

articles.headline: Why are millions of unemployed people excluded from our monthly 'unemployment' data?
articles.description: Millions of Australians aren't employed, but they're not counted in the official unemployment data. Why is that?
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: The powerful Murdaugh family held deep ties in South Carolina. Then a double murder exposed a web of secrets
articles.description: The violent murders of a mother and son killed at their family's hunting lodge attracted widespread attention in the US, setting off a chain of events that culminated in the family being linked to a number of other crimes. Here's what we know about the Murdaughs.
articles.author: Lucia Stein

articles.headline: Millions of Australians may be exposed to COVID. But these experts say there's a new number to focus on
articles.description: Australia is in the midst of a state-by-state pandemic, but when the nation comes back together for the "living with COVID" phase, these experts say major transitions need to be made.
articles.author: Nick Sas

articles.headline: 'It has literally changed lives': How the efforts of Australian women saved Afghan female footballers
articles.description: Australian football referee Joanna Charaktis just wanted to help her friend escape Afghanistan. What followed was a story of close calls, emotional reunions and a community rallying together to change lives, writes Samantha Lewis.
articles.author: Nick Sas

articles.headline: 'I can't change what was done to me': Noah was operated on without his consent. He wants things to be different
articles.description: Noah underwent surgeries to make him more typically male when he was just a baby. Now advocates are pushing to stop unnecessary procedures until intersex children are old enough to consent.
articles.author: Oliver Gordon and Jessica Longbottom

articles.headline: Booker Prize reading guide: What to know about this year’s surprising shortlist
articles.description: Books about a real-life miscarriage of justice and a fictional aviatrix are among those vying for one of the world's most prestigious literary prizes.
articles.author: Kate Evans, Claire Nichols, and Sarah L'Estrange

articles.headline: When this diver saw more rubbish than fish in the ocean she took action
articles.description: A growing number of young Indonesians are feeling "eco-anxiety". But they're channelling that panic into practical actions to tackle pollution and educate the next generation.
articles.author: Erwin Renaldi and Mariah Papadopoulos

articles.headline: Snake oil was cheap, widely available and had some curative benefits. But what was actually in it?
articles.description: Snake oil has become the byword for dodgy treatments while those who spruik them are dubbed 'snake oil salesmen'. But the traditional medicine has a long and exotic history.
articles.author: Sophie Kesteven and Isabelle Summerson

articles.headline: When Peter began tracing family history, he wasn't expecting to find a trove from Sydney's 1913 lockdown
articles.description: For many Australians, COVID has been an opportunity to trace their family histories — with some making surprising discoveries from lockdowns past.
articles.author: Emma Myers

articles.headline: Ringo Starr pays tribute to Lennon as NASA's asteroid-chasing rocket Lucy blasts into the sky with diamonds
articles.description: The NASA spacecraft aims to explore the asteroids sharing Jupiter's orbit, which are thought to be the untouched remnants of planetary formation.
articles.author: Emma Myers

articles.headline: Myanmar's military leader to be left out of ASEAN summit
articles.description: South-East Asian foreign ministers agree to downgrade Myanmar's participation in an upcoming summit in their sharpest rebuke yet of the nation's military leaders following their February 1 takeover.
articles.author: Emma Myers

articles.headline: British PM lays flowers at site of slain MP amid calls for pause on meetings with voters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson lays flowers at the church where fellow Conservative Party MP David Amess was stabbed to death, prompting renewed anxiety over politicians' safety.
articles.author: Emma Myers

articles.headline: Woman fined $4,135 for alleged Queensland border breach
articles.description: Police say a 21-year-old woman who failed to stop at the M1 vehicle checkpoint before colliding with another car at Elanora on the Gold Coast faces several charges, including driving an unregistered vehicle.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: US offers payments, relocation to families of Afghans killed in botched drone attack
articles.description: The Pentagon offers unspecified condolence payments to the family of 10 civilians killed in a botched US drone attack in Afghanistan during the final days before coalition troops withdrew from the country.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Islamic State claims responsibility for mosque bombing in Afghanistan
articles.description: In a statement on social media, IS says two of its group's members shot and killed security guards manning the entrance of the Fatimiya mosque for Friday prayers in Kandahar province.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: AMA rebukes protesters rallying against mandatory vaccinations in Perth's CBD
articles.description: The president of the Australian Medical Association in WA hits out at a group of hundreds opposed to mandatory COVID-19 vaccines who rallied in the Perth CBD.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: NSW Nationals pick Nichole Overall to contest Barilaro's seat in by-election
articles.description: If the journalist, author and social historian wins the seat of Monaro, vacated after former leader John Barilaro resigned, she would be the first woman to hold the seat in its 165-year history.
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: Double vaccinated? Here's what you can do in NSW from Monday
articles.description: NSW reaches another milestone in the COVID-19 roadmap, with 80 per cent of the population aged over 16 now double-vaxed. Here's what you can do from Monday now that restrictions have further eased.
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: 'Look out Melbourne Cup': Jockey Brett Prebble puts Incentivise rivals on notice after Caulfield Cup win
articles.description: The first of the big three races in Melbourne's Spring Carnival is run and won, with superstar Incentivise taking out the Caulfield Cup for trainer Peter Moody — and winning jockey Brett Prebble is in no doubt about what's next.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Teenager missing for days in remote NT outback found, but search for his companion continues
articles.description: A teenage boy who was missing for at least four days in the remote Northern Territory outback has been found alive, but his companion in still missing.
articles.author: Isaac Nowroozi

articles.headline: Magnitude-4.8 earthquake strikes Bali, kills three and injures seven
articles.description: A magnitude-4.8 earthquake strikes Indonesia's Bali island, killing at least three people, and injuring seven.
articles.author: Isaac Nowroozi

articles.headline: Joyce says Nationals 'highly unlikely' to back doubling of short-term emissions target
articles.description: Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce insists the Nationals will not be bullied into backing a target of net zero carbon emissions by 2050, as he rules out supporting more ambitious short-term climate targets.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: 'We are gravely concerned': Police find no sign of missing 4yo girl at WA campsite
articles.description: Police say resources are being ramped up in the search for a 4-year-old girl missing from a campsite in Western Australia's north-west since the early hours of Saturday morning.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: Rockets cut Dante Exum loose ahead of NBA season
articles.description: Dante Exum is on the hunt for a new NBA team, just days before the season tip-off, after being waived by the Houston Rockets.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: 'I always felt this would be my destiny': Golfer Casey Martin has leg amputated
articles.description: Casey Martin's US Supreme Court battle with the PGA resulted in a ruling to allow him to use a golf cart in competition due to his rare circulatory disease. Twenty years on, the golfer turned coach has his leg amputated.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: Some of Victoria's lockdown restrictions are set to lift — here's what you will be able to do
articles.description: Victoria's Premier Daniel Andrews says the state's lockdown will lift at 11:59pm on Thursday, when 70 per cent of eligible adults are expected to be fully vaccinated.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: ACT records another 33 COVID-19 cases, as differing cross-border restrictions leave retailers frustrated
articles.description: Canberrans can cross the border to shop at non-essential retailers with relative freedom. But in the ACT, they still have to use click-and-collect or book an appointment for private shopping, much to the frustration of Canberra retailers.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: Cats out of the bag: Feral animals targeted near NT national park
articles.description: Feral cats kill billions of Australia's native animals each year, experts say, and a pilot program in a small Northern Territory town may be the answer to the problem.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: 'Freedom' pub shut down by police over defiance of COVID rules
articles.description: Hunter Valley pub is forced to close its doors after "repeated and continued" breaches of public health orders.
articles.author: Ben Millington

articles.headline: Premier 'hopeful' southern Tasmania will exit lockdown as no new cases recorded
articles.description: Premier Peter Gutwein is "hopeful" Tasmania's snap lockdown will end as planned tomorrow after no new COVID-19 cases were detected in Tasmania at the halfway point.
articles.author: Alexandra Alvaro

articles.headline: New COVID-19 exposure sites in regional SA after truck driver tests positive
articles.description: SA Health has identified three new exposure sites in Bordertown and Waikerie after another Victorian truck driver tested positive to COVID-19.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Mid-century architect's 'mischievous nature' still surprises today
articles.description: When Iwan Iwanoff designed a home he focused on every detail including custom furniture, fit-outs and light switches in hard-to-find places to ensure form and functionality. Decades after his death, his work is now the focus of an exhibition and upcoming book.
articles.author: Emma Wynne

articles.headline: Queensland records zero COVID-19 cases as CHO warns it's 'becoming too late' for those who aren't vaccinated
articles.description: Queensland records zero COVID-19 cases, with 56 per cent of the eligible population now fully vaccinated.
articles.author: Melanie Vujkovic

articles.headline: Australia purchases breakthrough COVID drug Ronapreve
articles.description: Early results indicate Ronapreve has a 70 per cent reduction in the likelihood of hospitalisation or loss of life for people who contract the virus.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Australia to accept travellers from NZ South Island without need to quarantine
articles.description: Australian Chief Medical Officer Paul Kelly says New South Wales and Victoria had both agreed to accept arrivals from the southern part of the country.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Ray of light as scientists, rangers fight to save the sawfish
articles.description: Local rangers and a leading conservation group say the discovery of a rare sawfish should warrant greater protection of river systems.
articles.author: Carli Willis

articles.headline: Second person missing for days in remote NT outback found alive
articles.description: A second person who went missing in the remote Northern Territory outback has been found alive, ending a three-day police search.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Russia's daily COVID-19 deaths top 1,000 for first time
articles.description: Russia’s daily death toll from COVID-19 exceeds 1,000 for the first time as the country faces a sustained wave of rising infections.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Kylie Sterry loves her Tesla, but 'range anxiety' is holding others back when it comes to electric vehicles
articles.description: Dr Kylie Sterry hopes that soon she will be able to make the 450 kilometre trip to Perth without any notice as the West Australian government plans to bolster electric vehicle charging stations in the 2.6 million square-kilometre state.
articles.author: Pamela Medlen

articles.headline: Pandemic takes 'huge toll' on mental health, as government pledges millions to tackle suicide
articles.description: The NSW government pledges $130 million in support for mental health to reduce the pandemic's toll, as the state records 301 cases of COVID-19 and ten deaths.
articles.author: Sue Daniel

articles.headline: No closure for private schoolboy allegedly sexually abused by rugby teammates
articles.description: Another chapter in the sorry tale of a schoolboy allegedly sexually abused by his Trinity College rugby teammates appears to close, but one glaring injustice continues to stand out.
articles.author: Rebecca Turner

articles.headline: Geraldine returns to outback cinema in the role of screen saver
articles.description: Historic outback cinemas don't always have the new-release films, but troops of loyal volunteers are making sure they can still offer a big screen experience.
articles.author: Danielle O'Neal

articles.headline: 'We're in the home stretch': Thousands of Queenslanders hold the key to opening borders by Christmas
articles.description: Queensland's tourism industry is "hanging on by its fingernails" and wants state borders opened by December 1. That will require some forward planning — and not just for Queensland Health.
articles.author: Hilary Whiteman

articles.headline: The energy crisis and how it could cost us all
articles.description: The world appears to be staring down an energy crisis that would deliver ammunition to those wishing to slow the pace of climate change reforms and could see the dreaded return of stagflation, writes Ian Verrender.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: 'No kind of forever home': Long-term renters despair as house and rental prices soar
articles.description: It's hasn't been this expensive to rent in Australia since 2008. As house prices climbed twice as fast as rent during the pandemic, the dream of owning a home is now beyond reach for many long-term renters.
articles.author: Widia Jalal

articles.headline: Massive drought followed by torrential rain tests the survival of Taiwan’s tea farms
articles.description: A Taiwanese farmer says his tea output will be halved this year after horrid weather conditions decimated the industry.
articles.author: Widia Jalal

articles.headline: Shattered by blindness and family tragedy, Maurice still found a way to create 'a wonderful life'
articles.description: Changes and challenges are always with us, says Maurice Gleeson, who's had his share of low points. The important thing is how you deal with them, says the winner of the highest disability awards honour.
articles.author: Madi Chwasta

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: More freedom from today as NSW passes 80 per cent vaccination target
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Masks are no longer mandatory in offices and community sport can be played once again as New South Wales passes its 80 per cent double-vaccination target earlier than expected.
articles.author: Madi Chwasta

articles.headline: At least 18 dead, more missing as torrential rain floods southern India
articles.description: Officials in the southern Indian state of Kerala said rescuers recovered the bodies in two of the worst-hit districts, where the heavy downpours triggered massive landslides.
articles.author: Madi Chwasta

articles.headline: Transition from child protection to adulthood eased with apartment program
articles.description: Felicity Graham was worried about becoming homeless after leaving the out-of-home care system in South Australia, but she was lucky to be offered a spot in a special apartment block with support workers available 24 hours a day.
articles.author: Gabriella Marchant

articles.headline: Premier has focused attention on the man who breached Tasmania's hotel quarantine system, glossing over the security bungle
articles.description: Southern Tasmanians will find out today whether they'll be out of lockdown on schedule. If stay at home orders are extended, the state's Premier could face scrutiny he's long avoided.
articles.author: Adam Langenberg

articles.headline: Funnyman Max Gillies thought he'd never discover the truth about his father. Then an Aussie billionaire called
articles.description: In the 1980s, no politician could escape the withering satire of Max Gillies. His Gillies Report parodies of prime ministers including Bob Hawke were legendary. For the first time, Max reveals the family secrets that shaped his brilliance.
articles.author: Cheryl Hall and Belinda Hawkins

articles.headline: It's back to school for some students but parents still worry about COVID-19
articles.description: After months of home learning, students in kindergarten, year 1 and year 12 return to face-to-face learning today but, while parents are glad their children are getting back to some normality, they know the virus is still out there.
articles.author: Rani Hayman

articles.headline: Photographs capture Sydney coming back to life
articles.description: One week after lockdown restrictions eased for the fully vaccinated in NSW, Sydney is beginning to come back to life. Here's a snapshot of what that looks like.
articles.author: Rani Hayman

articles.headline: How parents are grieving the loss of babies they never had the chance to know
articles.description: Australia is in the midst of a public health campaign to reduce the number of preventable stillbirth deaths by up to 20 per cent over the next four years. But addressing the cause of stillbirth is only one piece of the puzzle.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: Victorians divided over lockdown lifting as businesses miss out on freedoms
articles.description: All of Victoria is due to leave lockdown from 11:59pm on Thursday, but some business owners are calling the government's easing of restrictions both confusing and conservative.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: 'Back to the future': Classic car lovers are converting their beloved autos to EVs
articles.description: Converting classic cars to electric vehicles is booming in popularity. Here's what it costs, how long it takes, and what cars are the most suitable.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Long COVID is ruining lives, but it also presents Australia with an opportunity
articles.description: The pandemic has taken so much, but it has also given us an opportunity to better support all people with post-viral illnesses. Will we take it?
articles.author: Emily Sakzewski

articles.headline: 'US and Canada colluding to provoke': China objects after Western warships sail through Taiwan Strait
articles.description: The Chinese military has condemned the United States and Canada for each sending a warship through the Taiwan Strait last week as tensions rose between Beijing and Taipei.
articles.author: Emily Sakzewski

articles.headline: Seventeen US missionaries kidnapped in Haiti as gang violence surges
articles.description: Kidnappers in Haiti are getting bolder as gang violence worsens after a lull that followed the president's assassination in July.
articles.author: Emily Sakzewski

articles.headline: ABC announces independent review of complaints handling processes
articles.description: The review will examine how well the ABC manages external complaints and feedback about compliance with its own editorial standards, while considering factors such as training, remedies and actions taken.
articles.author: Emily Sakzewski

articles.headline: International travel certificates to be available on MyGov from Tuesday
articles.description: International COVID-19 Vaccination Certificates will become available from Tuesday morning as proof to border authorities around the world that the holder has been vaccinated against the virus.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Father of suspect in British MP's fatal stabbing 'traumatised'
articles.description: The father of a man arrested over the fatal stabbing of a British MP during a meeting with local voters has told media he is shocked and "traumatised" by his son's arrest, as police continue to question the 25-year-old under terrorism laws.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Usman Khawaja goes big in Sheffield Shield ton with Ashes opening spot potentially up for grabs
articles.description: As Will Pucovski's concussion threatens to rule him out of this summer's Ashes series, Usman Khawaja makes a statement in the Sheffield Shield, reaching 158 not out on day three against South Australia.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Scorchers pull off super-over win over Brisbane Heat in their WBBL opener
articles.description: Sophie Devine's big hitting gets Perth over the line in their Women's Big Bash season opener against Brisbane in a super over that probably should never have happened.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Judge describes attack as 'violent and terrifying'
articles.description: A man who stabbed a young woman in the face with either a knife or scissors has been sentenced to eight years in jail.
articles.author: Sean Wales

articles.headline: Melbourne Cup favourite hit with weight penalty
articles.description: Boom horse Incentivise will carry an extra 1.5 kilograms when it bids to complete the Caulfield Cup-Melbourne Cup double at Flemington on November 2.
articles.author: Sean Wales

articles.headline: Cricket Australia appoints new men's selector ahead of Ashes series
articles.description: Retired Test all-rounder Tony Dodemaide joins the three-person national selection panel as Trevor Hohns's replacement, as Australia continues its preparations for the men's Ashes beginning in December.
articles.author: Sean Wales

articles.headline: PM's pick for Gilmore, Andrew Constance, faces pre-election showdown
articles.description: The Prime Minister's endorsed candidate for the federal seat of Gilmore is expected to have a contest on his hands for Liberal preselection with local lawyer Paul Ell set to nominate.
articles.author: Kelly Fuller

articles.headline: Can I travel to Queensland for Christmas? How will the state reopen to COVID hotspots?
articles.description: Queensland finally unveils its deadlines and vaccine targets for borders to reopen to COVID-19 hotspots, so what does it mean for you and your loved ones this Christmas? Here's a quick guide.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Darwin shooting trial paused while defence seeks 'very late' psychiatric report
articles.description: The nine-week murder trial will take a six-day break as Benjamin Hoffmann's defence lawyers seek out a new expert report.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Tornado, snow-like hail slam into Queensland towns 'like a freight train'
articles.description: The BOM says there are "clear signs" that a tornado formed in a Darling Downs town this morning as Queensland's south-east was lashed by a raging storm.
articles.author: Lucy Robinson, Lucy Cooper, and Georgie Hewson

articles.headline: Police investigate rock-throwing after truck crashes into house
articles.description: A man in his 70's was sleeping in his bed when a 16-tonne tip truck came crashing into his suburban bedroom.
articles.author: Sarah Jane Bell

articles.headline: 'Incredibly stupid': AFL grand final border breacher gets $7,000 fine — and he didn't even make it to the game
articles.description: A Melbourne man who falsified documents to get into WA for the AFL grand final gets a $7,000 fine — and he did not even get to watch the game.
articles.author: David Weber

articles.headline: Convicted murderer Robert Durst COVID-19 positive, on ventilator
articles.description: Real estate heir Robert Durst requires ventilation in hospital following a positive COVID-19 test, days after his murder sentencing.
articles.author: David Weber

articles.headline: 'You don't do that to a dead child': Morcombes outraged at 'bizarre' graffiti attack
articles.description: CCTV footage shows the moment an elderly man defaces Daniel Morcombe's image on posters outside a school, an act described as "sinister vandalism".
articles.author: Amy Sheehan and Meg Bolton

articles.headline: When is international travel to and from Australia allowed? Can non-residents enter the country?
articles.description: International travel taking off from next month — here are your questions answered.
articles.author: Amy Sheehan and Meg Bolton

articles.headline: 'Inconceivable': Inquiry says Australia needs new laws to avoid another Juukan Gorge disaster
articles.description: A parliamentary inquiry into the destruction of the Juukan Gorge rock shelters recommends new laws to protect thousands of sacred sites across Australia.
articles.author: Shahni Wellington, Kirstie Wellauer, and Bridget Brennan

articles.headline: SA MP Troy Bell's trial on theft charges delayed by another eight months
articles.description: South Australia's District Court has delayed the trial of independent MP Troy Bell by eight months while his appeal is heard by the High Court.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: AFLW Tiger tests positive for COVID-19
articles.description: Richmond confirm one of their AFLW players returned a positive result from a pre-training COVID-19 rapid antigen test on Saturday.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Adelaide paedophile to plead guilty to 142 more offences
articles.description: The lawyer for an HIV-positive paedophile who talked about infecting children with the virus tells an Adelaide court his client will admit to committing a total of more than 180 child exploitation crimes.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: 'Part of the culture for the Labor Party': Melbourne council Mayor admits branch stacking
articles.description: Banyule City Council Mayor Rick Garotti tells IBAC he spent at least $15,000 of his own money on other people's party memberships, and says there is a culture of branch stacking within the Labor Party.
articles.author: Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: Māori All Blacks and Chiefs rugby player dies in car crash
articles.description: New Zealand rugby is mourning the death of Sean Wainui after the 25-year-old was involved in a single-vehicle accident on Monday morning.
articles.author: Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: China tests nuclear-capable missile, surprising US with 'astounding progress on hypersonic weapons'
articles.description: The Chinese military launched a rocket carrying a hypersonic glide vehicle that flew through low-orbit space, circling the globe before cruising towards its target, a report says.
articles.author: Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: 'I have concerns': Around 15 per cent of West Australians still hesitant to get COVID jab
articles.description: Internal research finds about 15 per cent of West Australians remain hesitant about getting vaccinated as a decision looms about WA's hard border with NSW.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: Queensland announces plan to reopen borders as state records zero new local COVID-19 cases
articles.description: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk outlines a roadmap to reopen the state's borders to COVID-19 hotspots for fully vaccinated people by Christmas.
articles.author: Stephanie Zillman

articles.headline: Law expert questions suspension of Victorian MP from parliament for refusing to show vaccination proof
articles.description: An advocate for constitutional reform in Australia warns a northern Victorian MP has potentially had his political freedoms impeded, after he was suspended from parliament for refusing to show proof of vaccination.
articles.author: Sandra Moon and Erin Somerville

articles.headline: Police not ruling out abduction as hunt continues for missing four-year-old girl in WA
articles.description: Police are not ruling out the possibility that missing four-year-old Cleo Smith, who disappeared from a WA campsite on Saturday, was taken.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield and Lana Taranto

articles.headline: Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane petrol prices are going through the roof. This is why
articles.description: Motorists in Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane are facing record high petrol prices at the start of this week, thanks to strong global oil demand and stubbornly low production levels.
articles.author: Samuel Yang

articles.headline: Bodybuilder turned prison guard smuggler avoids jail after guilty plea
articles.description: Wesley Newell will be forced to pay $40,000 in fines after confessing to smuggling in contraband to the correction facility he worked at.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: Queensland regions falling behind on vaccinations could face targeted lockdowns after reopening
articles.description: Queensland's already busy hospitals and intensive care units can manage the worst-case scenario of up to 1,200 COVID-19 cases a day, Chief Health Officer Jeannette Young says.
articles.author: Emma Pollard

articles.headline: Young Queenslanders urged to get vaccinated because COVID-19 will 'find people who aren't'
articles.description: A slow uptake of COVID-19 vaccines by young people could see Queensland struggle to hit the 80 per cent vaccination rate by the December 17 date, a leading infection control specialists warns.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: What will living in Queensland be like when the borders reopen?
articles.description: Queensland is set to enjoy a lot more freedoms by mid-December now that authorities have set in motion a plan to reopen its borders. So what will life look like and what restrictions will be eased?
articles.author: Stephanie Zillman

articles.headline: Katter's seat wins big but he says Coalition just 'saving own skin'
articles.description: Bob Katter's vast electorate has been awarded millions of dollars in the latest round of regional grant funding from the federal government, but he's far from grateful.
articles.author: Owen Jacques

articles.headline: Live music bouncing back as COVID-19 lockdowns end, but damage is lasting
articles.description: The live music industry and those who have devoted their lives to it have been among those hardest hit by the pandemic. As lockdowns lift and borders reopen, musicians and venue owners are calling for government support to revive the music scene.
articles.author: Sue Lannin and Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: 'Fruit nerd' on a mission to save backyard loquats from rot
articles.description: Thanh Truong says many households have amazing fruit that is going to waste. He is launching the Great Backyard Fruit Salvage to try to save valuable produce.
articles.author: Matilda Marozzi

articles.headline: As a cop, Dorinda Cox says she saw 'the worst of the worst'. Today, she's Australia's newest senator
articles.description: Dorinda Cox visited Canberra as a teenager. Today, she officially becomes the first Aboriginal woman from Western Australia to serve in federal Parliament.
articles.author: Bridget Brennan

articles.headline: Shots fired in Liberal-National climate showdown at 'last chance saloon'
articles.description: If the Glasgow climate change conference is the "last chance saloon" to save the planet, the Prime Minister's Liberals will have to survive a shootout with his deputy to get there, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
articles.author: Brett Worthington

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now:  Women bore the economic brunt of the lockdown,  report finds
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING:  More than 60 per cent of those who lost jobs during the latest lockdown were women and job losses were concentrated in western Sydney, the state's peak social welfare group has reporte
articles.author: Brett Worthington

articles.headline: Why the fashion industry is turning to Aussie-grown cotton
articles.description: The Australian cotton industry could clothe up to half a billion people next year — but is it sustainable?
articles.author: Ashleigh Bagshaw

articles.headline: COVID-19 could soon be endemic in India, but doctors worry about pregnant women
articles.description: As India's devastating second wave of COVID-19 infections is studied, doctors find dramatic increases in miscarriages and maternal deaths.
articles.author: Emily Clark and Som Patidar

articles.headline: Pandemic pooches at risk of missing puppy preschool
articles.description: Pet ownership is higher than ever, but new puppy owners in Melbourne have been cut off from crucial developmental classes by COVID-19 lockdowns.
articles.author: Dana Morse

articles.headline: A homeless man who died after being severely burned is being remembered as a gentle soul
articles.description: A homeless Launceston man will be remembered at a service in his honour
articles.author: Dana Morse

articles.headline: Experts warn maintaining a drop in NSW's COVID-positive numbers is 'not possible'
articles.description: As the state reopens, epidemiologists are welcoming the drop in COVID cases across NSW. But they warn anyone expecting the state to return to zero will be disappointed.
articles.author: Maryanne Taouk and Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: 'You are going to perform in this': How Callan Purcell made his Hamilton musical dreams come true
articles.description: Callan Purcell's first chance to perform the lead role in Hamilton the musical was "abysmal" when he slipped and fell during a key moment. But after lockdown cancelled 133 shows he's excited to be heading back to the stage in the "essential yet hidden" role as an understudy, writes Gary Nunn.
articles.author: Gary Nunn

articles.headline: Tributes flow for 'towering figure' Colin Powell
articles.description: General Colin Powell, the first black US secretary of state, is being remembered as a "phenomenal leader", "superb soldier" and "great man".
articles.author: Gary Nunn

articles.headline: People get nude in bid to help artist save the Dead Sea
articles.description: Spencer Tunick stages another art installation of a mass gathering of naked people, this time attempting to raise awareness of the importance of preserving the Dead Sea.
articles.author: Gary Nunn

articles.headline: Regional Liberals make case for Nationals to back net zero emissions target
articles.description: Regional Liberals are urging the Nationals to back a target of net zero carbon emissions by 2050, with some expressing frustration the junior Coalition partner is presenting itself as the sole voice of country communities.
articles.author: Nour Haydar and Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Ireland's Curtis Campher gets rare double hat-trick in T20 World Cup opener
articles.description: In just his fifth Twenty20 for his country, Curtis Campher becomes the third man to take four wickets in four balls, during Ireland's World Cup opener against the Netherlands.
articles.author: Nour Haydar and Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Colin Powell dies of COVID-19 complications, aged 84
articles.description: Colin Powell, the soldier who rose to become the first black US secretary of state and serve three presidents, but whose reputation was tainted when he used spurious intelligence to make the case for war with Iraq, has died at the age of 84.
articles.author: Nour Haydar and Matthew Doran

articles.headline: In China, parents of misbehaving children could be punished under a proposed law
articles.description: The so-called family education promotion law would force guardians to go through education programs if prosecutors found very bad or criminal behaviour under their care.
articles.author: Nour Haydar and Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Building order finds 'hazard to human life': Awning in new Sydney development in danger of collapse
articles.description: Government inspectors find potential "serious defects" in the 15-storey Baulkham Hills Modena complex in Sydney's north-west, including an awning in danger of collapse, according to a building work rectification order.
articles.author: Amy Greenbank

articles.headline: Vaccinated AFL premiership star says mandatory COVID jabs 'ethically wrong' as AFLW player tests positive
articles.description: Vaccinated Melbourne premiership star Tom McDonald says forcing players to get inoculated against COVID-19 is "ethically wrong", and an AFLW player reportedly tells her club she is not getting the shot.
articles.author: Amy Greenbank

articles.headline: Severe weather set to hit 'fair whack' of WA including Perth, as farmers race to harvest record crops
articles.description: Farmers in the Mid West scramble to get record crops harvested ahead of a major cold front set to bring wet and windy weather to large parts of WA.
articles.author: Tyne Logan and Chris Lewis

articles.headline: Queensland MP's son charged over child exploitation material
articles.description: The son of a north Queensland politician is allegedly caught with child exploitation material while on probation.
articles.author: Chloe Chomicki

articles.headline: Businesswoman Jan Cameron's first day in court facing charges laid by ASIC
articles.description: Businesswoman Jan Cameron appears in court for the first day of her hearings into criminal charges laid by ASIC
articles.author: Alexandra Humphries

articles.headline: After unprecedented snub by Asian neighbours, Myanmar frees political prisoners
articles.description: State media announces more than 5,600 people arrested or wanted over their roles in anti-coup protests — including Aung San Suu Kyi's party spokesman and a famous comedian — are being released.
articles.author: Alexandra Humphries

articles.headline: 200 Queenslanders may die of COVID-19 when borders reopen, modelling predicts
articles.description: COVID-19 modelling suggests about 200 people in Queensland could die in the three months after borders reopen to New South Wales, Victoria and the ACT.
articles.author: Kate McKenna

articles.headline: 'Little me would be over the moon': Meet new yellow wiggle, Tsehay Hawkins
articles.description: Fifteen-year-old Latin dance champion, Tsehay Hawkins, takes over as Yellow Wiggle after trailblazer Emma Watkins calls time on her 11-year stint.
articles.author: Michael Doyle and Melissa Maykin

articles.headline: Albury aged care cluster claims life, officials 'expect more cases'
articles.description: A resident at the Mercy Place aged care facility in Albury has died after testing positive to COVID-19 and at least five other residents have the virus.
articles.author: Mikaela Ortolan and Erin Somerville

articles.headline: Wine exports to China down 77 per cent, but Hong Kong develops raging thirst
articles.description: Hong Kong's demand for Australian wine lifted by 135 per cent and South-East Asia by 43 per cent in the 12 months to September, showing Australian winemakers are diversifying away from their former key market.
articles.author: Sarina Locke and Cassandra Hough

articles.headline: 'The zip was open, Cleo was gone': Mother recalls last time she saw missing four-year-old daughter
articles.description: Ellie Smith says she has 'no idea' what happened to her daughter Cleo Smith as she recalls the last time she saw the four-year-old, who has been missing in WA's Gascoyne region since Saturday.
articles.author: James Carmody and Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Woman raped, assaulted by ex-partner in Darwin says attacks 'changed the way I live'
articles.description: A woman who was physically and sexually assaulted by her ex-partner over the course of several days in May last year tells the NT Supreme Court the incident left her scarred and afraid.
articles.author: Melissa Mackay

articles.headline: Injured Boomers star ruled out of entire NBA season
articles.description: Australian centre Aron Baynes is still hopeful of continuing his NBA career, despite being sidelined for the upcoming season with a serious neck injury sustained during the Tokyo Olympics.
articles.author: Melissa Mackay

articles.headline: Young Aussie prospect chases Major League Baseball career after dreaming of playing in the AFL
articles.description: Adelaide's Curtis Mead wanted to be an AFL player as a teenager, but he is now laying the foundations of a promising professional baseball career in the United States.
articles.author: Neil Cross

articles.headline: Geraldton police officer accused of murder fights back tears as he recounts day of fatal shooting
articles.description: WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains an image of a person who has died. A police officer accused of murdering an Indigenous woman tells a court he thought she was going to stab him when he pulled the trigger and fatally shot her.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Tasmanian college apologises over skirt-length incident
articles.description: A Tasmanian principal has apologised after year 8 female students were asked to kneel to have their skirts measured
articles.author: Loretta Lohberger

articles.headline: Queensland holiday bookings are surging, but will international airlines stay away?
articles.description: Flight bookings and Christmas holiday inquiries are surging since the Queensland government announced its road map to reopen the state once double-dose vaccinations hit 80 per cent, but Brisbane Airport Corporation says the plan is too strict for overseas visitors.
articles.author: Nibir Khan

articles.headline: What the future will look like: SA's 'COVID-ready' plan to be released within days
articles.description: South Australia's Police Commissioner says the state's plan for how it will cope when the wave of COVID-19 enters the state will soon be released.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Search for missing fisher suspended after mask, spear gun and flippers found
articles.description: The 26-year-old went missing on Sunday afternoon, triggering a huge search operation. While there is no sign of the man, police say they've confirmed articles found on the ocean floor belonged to him.
articles.author: Jemima Burt

articles.headline: This 4yo called police — hear what happened next
articles.description: When you're four, the meaning of "emergency" can be flexible — in one New Zealand boy's case, he just really wanted to show police his toys.
articles.author: Jemima Burt

articles.headline: May stood down, NRL fines Panthers trio
articles.description: Tyrone May is stood down, while Nathan Cleary and Stephen Crichton are fined over their behaviour during Penrith's NRL grand final celebrations.
articles.author: Jemima Burt

articles.headline: Chief Minister's family fled home after address disclosed at anti-vaccine protest
articles.description: Michael Gunner says his wife and infant son had to leave their home address after it was disclosed in front of a large contingent of anti-vaccine protestors at the weekend.
articles.author: Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: Supreme Court dismisses challenges by unions, MP, in the wake of branch stacking scandal
articles.description: A group of 10 powerful unions and MP Marlene Kairouz have lost their legal challenges against the federal ALP's intervention in the Victorian branch after serious allegations emerged.
articles.author: Danny Tran and Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Qantas charged for standing down cleaner who had COVID-19 concerns about planes from China
articles.description: Qantas is facing criminal action for standing down a health and safety representative who spoke up about COVID-19 risks and instructed some workers to stop cleaning planes from China at the start of the pandemic.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Suspect in Norway attack used 'stabbing weapon' not bow and arrow to kill, say police
articles.description: Police say five people killed in a small Norwegian town last week were all stabbed to death and not shot with a bow and arrows as initially suspected.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: SA public servant took advantage of children's poverty to exploit them sexually, court hears
articles.description: A retired senior public servant of 45 years preyed on the economic disadvantage of young children in the Philippines, forcing them to perform sex acts for him online, or starve, an Adelaide court hears.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: WA will not ease COVID-19 hard border with NSW and Victoria before Christmas
articles.description: WA stands firm on its hard border with Victoria and NSW, refusing to open to those states before Christmas, as other jurisdictions roll out clear roadmaps for reopening. But travellers from Queensland will no longer need to quarantine from Friday.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: Melbourne community group received $75,000 of taxpayer funds, which its leader pocketed most of, IBAC hears
articles.description: A corruption inquiry hears the Mayor of a Melbourne council successfully lobbied for state government grants to be given to the Somali Australian Council Of Victoria, a "recruiting ground" for the Labor Party.
articles.author: Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: Waiting for a new car? Blame the 'devastating' invasive stink bug
articles.description: Australians waiting months for new cars in the midst of a global parts shortage may have to wait even longer as cargo ships are fumigated offshore to kill an invasive stink bug.
articles.author: Lucy Stone and Rebecca Levingston

articles.headline: More wild weather brewing for Queensland as authorities brace for 'state of extremes'
articles.description: Large hail, damaging winds and heavy rain are expected across parts of central and south-east Queensland again today, while other parts of the state experiences heatwave conditions.
articles.author: Jessica Rendall

articles.headline: What happens when a community bands together to fight childhood obesity?
articles.description: Childhood obesity affects one in four Australian children. Now, a team of researchers believe they have found a way to help bring that number down
articles.author: Daniel Miles

articles.headline: 'I actually got quite emotional': Canberrans excited to reunite with family members across NSW
articles.description: Catherine Gill's children haven't seen their grandparents in three years, but following yesterday's announcement easing travel restrictions with NSW, that will soon change.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford and Harry Frost

articles.headline: Fears hospitality staff could become 'COVID cops', face spike in abuse in plan for vaccine-only venues
articles.description: A plan to require Queensland venues to check if patrons are vaccinated against COVID-19 sparks concern that hospitality staff could become "COVID cops" and face increased abuse.
articles.author: Phoebe Hosier

articles.headline: Massage parlour operators who threatened to kill families of underpaid staff breached workplace laws, court finds
articles.description: Operators of a Canberra massage parlour who threatened to kill family members of workers if they complained are found to have breached workplace laws.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: Train strike in Sydney expected to cause long delays
