articles.description: Police allege the former head of the National COVID-19 Commission Advisory Board, and a 36-year-old man, failed to complete G2G passes before flying into WA on October 9.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Are real guns necessary as props? Film industry mulls question after death on set of Alec Baldwin film
articles.description: Crew members on set had raised concerns about the safety conditions earlier this month. Members of the film industry are now rethinking safety standards in light of the shooting.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Self-driving race cars reach blistering speed at inaugural race
articles.description: A team of computer programmers and engineers from a German university are crowned the inaugural champions of self-driving cars around one of the world's most famous racetracks.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Jin Young Ko set to become world number one again following Ladies Championship win
articles.description: Ko is projected to return to the top ranking in women's golf after beating fellow South Korean Hee Jeong Lim in a playoff, while Australia's  Minjee Lee finishes tied for 12th place.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: WA Premier Mark McGowan unveils plan for vaccination clinics at Bunnings stores
articles.description: West Australians will soon be able to receive COVID-19 vaccinations at some Bunnings stores, as the WA government sets up pop-up clinics across the state.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: COVID breacher attended AFL grand final to support 'close footballer friend', court told
articles.description: A Melbourne man who breached COVID travel rules to get into the AFL grand final remains behind bars after claiming he attended the game to support a 'close friend', who was one of the players.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: Tasmanian salmon company set for Brazilian ownership
articles.description: Salmon giant Huon Aquaculture appears almost certain to become foreign controlled, after Australia's Foreign Investment Review Board green-lit a takeover plan from Brazilian meat-processor JBS.
articles.author: Alexandra Humphries

articles.headline: Hold on — our new rodeo queen wants to empower rural women
articles.description: Australia's latest rodeo queen is using her platform to inspire other women, mothers, and young families to get involved in the sport and community of rodeo.
articles.author: Keely Johnson

articles.headline: Barossa Fine Foods recalls ham products sold across Australia due to listeria contamination
articles.description: The prominent South Australian food producer is forced to recall two more of its products because of a second bacteria contamination scare in less than three weeks.
articles.author: Keely Johnson

articles.headline: Radar detection useless against small rock falls, mine death inquest told
articles.description: An inquest into the death of a former British Royal Marine, who was killed at a Tasmanian mine, is told radar meant to warn of rock falls could only pick up objects weighing 250 tonnes or more.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Split opinions over green credentials of Woodside's new Kwinana hydrogen hub
articles.description: Gas giant Woodside says a $1 billion hydrogen and ammonia plant will set WA up as a global clean energy powerhouse, as the Conservation Council of WA questions the project's green credentials.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: 'I'm very proud of them all': Jockeys make history with all-female wins
articles.description: Five female jockeys have made history by winning all seven races on the card at a single meet in Toowoomba.
articles.author: Lucy Robinson and Belinda Sanders

articles.headline: NZ reports second-highest daily COVID-19 cases in pandemic
articles.description: Once the poster child for stamping out COVID-19, New Zealand has been unable to beat a Delta outbreak centred on Auckland.
articles.author: Lucy Robinson and Belinda Sanders

articles.headline: 'Victoria is back and open for business': Melbourne Cup Carnival marks return of major events, says Racing Minister
articles.description: Crowds are returning to racing earlier than expected, with confirmation at the Melbourne Cup Carnival launch that 5,500 people will be able to be at Flemington Racecourse for Derby Day this weekend.
articles.author: Leanne Wong

articles.headline: Expert says Alec Baldwin should 'never' have been handed loaded gun that killed Halyna Hutchins
articles.description: A Hollywood weapons expert and others in the film industry are raising questions about the events leading up to the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on a film set last week, as court documents reveal more details about the accident.
articles.author: Leanne Wong

articles.headline: Canberra bikie convicted over fiery shoot-out has jail sentence reduced again
articles.description: Canberra man Axel Sidaros could be out of jail by mid-2022 after a further charge against him was dropped today.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Facebook dragging its feet on hate speech and misinformation in India, say leaked internal documents
articles.description: While Facebook acknowledged India as one of the most "at-risk" countries for hate speech and violence, internal records show there were not enough local language moderators in place to review content.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: NRL investigate Tedesco over alleged racial slur
articles.description: Sydney Roosters and NSW State of Origin captain James Tedesco is being investigated by the NRL after a complaint was made over an alleged slur.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: A mother's nightmare — not knowing why your child is suffering
articles.description: At the beginning of the year, three-year-old Everly started having unexplained seizures, and now her 18-month-old brother is too. Their mother is still waiting for a diagnosis.
articles.author: Emma Pedler and Georgia Roberts

articles.headline: Beachside boom to push housing costs higher than Brisbane
articles.description: Lockdown-fatigued buyers wanting to escape the city are pushing up house prices on the Sunshine and Gold coasts, now forecast to overtake Brisbane prices within three years.
articles.author: Owen Jacques and Amy Sheehan

articles.headline: 'Where are you baby?': Mum's heartbreaking plea for Cleo's safe return 10 days after disappearance
articles.description: The mother of missing WA girl Cleo Smith makes an emotional plea for her safe return as police issue another call-out for people who camped at the Blowholes site on the night of her disappearance to come forward.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: 'This violence was extreme': Man who used rare defence in wife's killing jailed for 16 years
articles.description: A Queensland man who was originally handed a life sentence for repeatedly stabbing his wife before bashing her in the head with a concrete bollard is sentenced to 16 years for her manslaughter.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: 'Certain ambition and seriousness' on display as hirsute Germans flock to 'Beard Olympics'
articles.description: An expert panel of judges in the German town of Eging am See combs through 100 finely sculpted beards and moustaches in a bid to crown their 2021 'Beard Olympics' champion.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Berejiklian's secret boyfriend a 'pain in the arse', Barilaro tells corruption watchdog
articles.description: Former NSW deputy premier John Barilaro describes ex-Wagga Wagga MP Daryl Maguire as being like a "dog with a bone"' in pursuit of local projects like the grant proposal for a shooting club, ICAC hears.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Fashion's kaleidoscope celebrated in colourful and unique catwalk show
articles.description: A groundbreaking Perth fashion show highlights the rich diversity of talent among designers from a variety of backgrounds in an industry where people of colour have often been overlooked.
articles.author: Herlyn Kaur

articles.headline: Queensland contact tracers have identified new COVID-19 exposure sites. See the list
articles.description: New venues are added to the list of COVID-19 exposure sites by Queensland Health contract tracers, including locations where members of the public are deemed to be close contacts in Brisbane's south.
articles.author: Herlyn Kaur

articles.headline: Social media companies could soon be forced to ask for parents' permission before accessing children's data
articles.description: Laws that could change the way social media companies handle young people's data could be introduced as early as next year, according to the federal government.
articles.author: Katherine Gregory and Claudia Long

articles.headline: COVID spike could 'overwhelm' crucial ICU, doctor warns
articles.description: A specialist says a major Northern Rivers hospital's ICU is operating at "100 per cent capacity all the time". With others tipping COVID cases in the region to run into "at least" the hundreds during summer, she fears the worst.
articles.author: Bronwyn Herbert and Joanne Shoebridge

articles.headline: Telstra secures deal to buy largest telecommunications company in the Pacific with Canberra's support
articles.description: The $2.1 billion deal to acquire and run Digicel Pacific will be largely funded by the Australian government, in a move widely seen as an attempt to counter China's influence in the region.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic, Annika Burgess, and Marian Faa

articles.headline: 'I don't hold Alec Baldwin responsible': Father of cinematographer accidentally killed on set defends actor
articles.description: Actor Alec Baldwin consoles the husband and son of slain cinematographer Halyna Hutchins, as more reports of troubling on-set practices emerge and investigators focus attention on the film's armourer and assistant director.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic, Annika Burgess, and Marian Faa

articles.headline: Nothing like a roadmap deadline to lift Queensland's COVID-10 vaccinations
articles.description: It has been just over a week since Queensland's roadmap out of COVID-19 restrictions and border closures was announced and, with the inevitable influx of positive cases, the race to get vaccinated is stepping up.
articles.author: Elizabeth Cramsie

articles.headline: Renewables rollout bolstered by system 'shock absorbers' in South Australia
articles.description: Five years on from South Australia's statewide blackout, technology to further stabilise the energy grid has been successfully installed at two sites in the state's north.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Not enough Indigenous Queenslanders are fully vaccinated, but there is hope
articles.description: With fewer than half of all Indigenous people in regional areas fully vaccinated, Queensland health officials are rushing to protect lives before the border reopens.
articles.author: Owen Jacques and Annie Gaffney

articles.headline: Murder of man that led to decriminalisation of homosexuality to be told in debut Adelaide Festival show
articles.description: The murder of lecturer George Duncan in 1972 prompted the decriminalisation of homosexuality in South Australia — and later across the country. A debut show, Watershed, at the 2022 Adelaide Festival will tell his story.
articles.author: Owen Jacques and Annie Gaffney

articles.headline: Malignant is unhinged, nasty and a little bit stupid – just as a great, camp horror film should be
articles.description: The latest film from Australian director James Wan (The Conjuring, Aquaman, Saw) will gross you out and make you laugh.
articles.author: Luke Goodsell

articles.headline: Walking is about more than getting fit. It helped me process my grief and reach a state of flow
articles.description: When I headed off on a five-month walk through the Himalayas, I didn't know how the experience would impact me. I learnt that walking literally changes the mind
articles.author: Luke Goodsell

articles.headline: Extraterrestrial life? No, say researchers, who find 'weird' radio signal comes from human technology
articles.description: At the end of last year, the internet was buzzing with leaked reports that a team of astronomers hunting for signs of extraterrestrial life had detected a strange signal. Now the verdict is in.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Heath authorities list new tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in Victoria
articles.description: New tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites have been listed in Benalla, Wodonga, Yackandandah, Wangaratta, Mildura, and Shepparton.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Answers desperately needed over how predators were able to roam free
articles.description: Today marks the first day of an attempt to find answers as to how a well-liked nurse who worked in a children's hospital ward — and others like him — were able to prey on young victims for so long in Tasmania, writes Emily Baker.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Here's what we know (and don't) about the Nationals net zero deal
articles.description: The deal between the Nationals and the Liberals to secure a net zero emissions by 2050 target is mostly under wraps, but this is what we know about it so far and when we'll know more.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: American-dominated panel advising government on submarines as Defence eyes options for future nuclear fleet
articles.description: Three senior American shipbuilding executives are being paid to advise Australia on submarines, but the defence department is so far refusing to say what their work involves or how much they’re costing.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Marcus Bontempelli and the Bulldogs grand final loss: 'We can't carry the burden'
articles.description: Marcus Bontempelli is keen to put the Western Bulldogs' grand final loss in the rear view mirror and while he waits for a chance for his team's next AFL campaign, he's added another string to his bow — children's author.
articles.author: David Mark

articles.headline: Victim of serial killer John Wayne Gacy identified 40 years after his death
articles.description: Authorities in the United States identify the remains one of the victims of serial killer John Wayne Gacy, more than 40 years after he was killed.
articles.author: David Mark

articles.headline: The international education crisis will linger long after students return to Australia. Here's why
articles.description: More than 145,000 international student visa holders are stuck overseas and it is still unclear when and how these students may be able to enter Australia. But even when they do return disruptions to the flow of new students over the past two years will have a long-term impact.
articles.author: David Mark

articles.headline: How your beer could lower methane emissions, slow global warming
articles.description: Young Henrys craft brewery, nestled in the heart of the hip suburb of Newtown, have teamed up with scientists to investigate if micro-algae can be used reduce methane emissions from cattle.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: 'The accessible parking spot was blocked by dumpster bins': The reality of parking when you have a disability
articles.description: Easy access to parking is desirable in most cases for people wanting to use daily services such as doctors or grocers. For those living with disability however, easy access to accessible parking is not only desirable but essential.
articles.author: Emma Myers

articles.headline: Women 'disappearing' from Afghan media as journalists face Taliban threats and beatings
articles.description: The Taliban promised the Afghan people a "free and independent" media, but the country's once flourishing media sector is now "dying" and women are paying the highest price.
articles.author: Tracey Shelton

articles.headline: How quarantines, lockdowns and dissent link Australians in pandemics more than 100 years apart
articles.description: Australia knew about the threat of the deadly Spanish flu months before it arrived. Much of what happened then, from quarantine policies, federal edicts and state-based border controls, are mirrored in the nation's response to the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Houston police find malnourished children and skeletal remains in apartment
articles.description: The skeletal remains of a child, and three surviving siblings who appear to have been abandoned, are found inside an apartment in the Houston area in the United States.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: 'We are way off track': Greenhouse gas concentrations hit record high in 2020
articles.description: A report by the United Nations World Meteorological Organization showed carbon dioxide levels surged in 2020, despite a temporary dip in emissions during COVID-19 lockdowns.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Annabel is deaf. But there are no Auslan interpreters in the NT to assist her
articles.description: For Darwin local Annabel Bishop, trying to access an Auslan interpreter to assist her with everyday tasks has been frustrating.
articles.author: Housnia Shams

articles.headline: Victorian Premier to get 'huge sweep of power' to declare lockdowns under new bill
articles.description: The Victorian Premier will be given the authority to declare pandemics and have public health orders enforced for three months at a time, under proposed new laws.
articles.author: Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: Xi Jinping says China will uphold world peace and international law
articles.description: China's President is calling for member states of the United Nations to work together to solve international issues.
articles.author: Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: Video shows doctors laughing, dancing to 'Jolene' while performing liposuction on unconscious patient
articles.description: Videos and photos uncovered in an investigation into one of Australia's leading cosmetic surgery clinics show practices that plastic surgeons have described as "dangerous" and "staggering".
articles.author: Lauren Day

articles.headline: Amnesty International closes Hong Kong offices citing national security law
articles.description: Amnesty International says a China-imposed national security law in Hong Kong makes it "effectively impossible" for rights groups to operate.
articles.author: Lauren Day

articles.headline: Victoria’s proposed pandemic laws are drawing strong reactions. Here’s what the changes will really mean
articles.description: Premier Daniel Andrews is defending the proposed pandemic laws, which have drawn the ire of some and been welcomed by others. So how will these proposed laws work? And why are some critics concerned?
articles.author: Elise Kinsella and Mary Gearin

articles.headline: Denis Pagan throws his hat into the ring for Melbourne Cup with Johnny Get Angry
articles.description: A suggestion by a champion jockey helps convince trainer Denis Pagan his Melbourne Cup dream isn't over with Johnny Get Angry.
articles.author: Tom Maddocks

articles.headline: Daughter-in-law found not guilty of murder after smart watch case retrial
articles.description: Adelaide woman Caroline Dela Rose Nilsson, who was accused of murdering her mother-in-law, is acquitted by a Supreme Court jury.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Reaching net zero carbon emissions to require Herculean effort
articles.description: Ordinary Australians and impatient business leaders years ago abandoned all hope of any kind of coherent energy and climate policy and went it alone. Now the government is stepping in with its plan to take us to net zero, writes Ian Verrender.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: Net zero by 2050? Here's what should be on the government's 'to do' list
articles.description: Electricity should be a main focus, but big improvements are also needed in transport, industry, agriculture and buildings.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: Greens fire up over rocket-launch complex 'bang in the middle' of sensitive site
articles.description: Senator Sarah Hanson-Young grills SA government officials in a Senate estimates hearing over the location of Southern Launch's controversial blast-off development.
articles.author: Emma Pedler and Evelyn Leckie

articles.headline: Japanese Princess Mako marries boyfriend Kei Komuro and renounces her royal status
articles.description: Princess Mako marries commoner Kei Komuro without a wedding ceremony following a financial dispute that attracted negative media attention.
articles.author: Emma Pedler and Evelyn Leckie

articles.headline: Victoria Police to pay quadriplegic man more than $11 million following alleged use of excessive force
articles.description: Victoria Police will pay $11.75 million to a man left paralysed after police officers allegedly used excessive force while responding to a noise complaint.
articles.author: Emma Pedler and Evelyn Leckie

articles.headline: Expect a plan for booster shots soon — here's what we know
articles.description: The federal government will soon make an announcement on COVID-19 vaccine booster shots, with authorities saying it's likely they'll be offered six months after someone has been double-dosed.
articles.author: Emma Pedler and Evelyn Leckie

articles.headline: 'Culture of cover-up': Sex abuse inquiry on a mission to expose predators
articles.description: The opening day of a new child sexual abuse inquiry is told there may have been an "active culture of cover-up or minimisation to protect reputations and institutional interests" in Tasmania.
articles.author: Loretta Lohberger

articles.headline: Aussie summer tennis calendar beginning to take shape
articles.description: As the vaccination debate rages on, those tennis stars who do travel for the Australian Open are set to be playing lead-up events around the country again.
articles.author: Loretta Lohberger

articles.headline: Have astronomers really just discovered an alien planet in another galaxy?
articles.description: Astronomers say they may have detected a potential planet outside of our galaxy — although no-one will really know for sure for at least another 70 years.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Investigation finds US police officers use harsh tactics on children
articles.description: From putting handcuffs onto a boy aged eight to leaving a teenage girl frightened, stories from a US investigation find troubling methods used by police on children.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: 'Not looking good': Sudan coup leaves Sudanese Australians unable to contact relatives
articles.description: Telephone and internet blackouts in Sudan leave community members in Australia cut off from relatives, as Monday's coup is widely condemned by international leaders.
articles.author: Kristian Silva

articles.headline: Do pets need a COVID vaccine?
articles.description: Can I give my pet COVID? And do they need to be vaccinated against the virus? We find out how you can protect your pets from COVID-19.
articles.author: Matilda Marozzi

articles.headline: Sydney man allegedly cut tracking device off his ankle after being bailed over $270m cocaine plot
articles.description: NSW Police say they will move to seize the $4 million Sydney home that Mostafa Baluch put up as surety after the 33-year-old went missing days after being bailed over an alleged plot to import cocaine into the state.
articles.author: Tim Swanston

articles.headline: Tasmanian alleged COVID quarantine breacher charged
articles.description: A New South Wales man who caused a three-day snap lockdown in southern Tasmania has been charged over allegedly leaving hotel quarantine without permission as well as breaching a domestic violence order.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: 'A bit of a scary time': South Australia plans to drop border restrictions on November 23
articles.description: South Australia's COVID-Ready roadmap will include a significant repeal of border restrictions for double-vaccinated people from November 23, while international travellers will have quarantine requirements halved.
articles.author: Daniel Keane and Jessica Haynes

articles.headline: What is the government's plan to reach net zero?
articles.description: The government has committed to reaching net zero by 2050, and says it is on track to beat its 2030 emissions targets. But what will it take to turn Australia green?
articles.author: Jake Evans

articles.headline: Massive NSW outback stations turned into national parks to save flora and fauna
articles.description: The 120,000-hectare Avenel Station north of Broken Hill is the latest in a series of acquisitions by the state government designed to reshape the state's far west.
articles.author: Bill Ormonde and Callum Marshall

articles.headline: Former head of Victoria Police's ethics unit used multiple aliases for 'offensive' trolling, IBAC reveals
articles.description: Victoria's anti-corruption watchdog finds Brett Guerin used pseudonyms to publish dozens of offensive comments on social media, as it urges Victoria Police to ensure its employees understand their duty to behave ethically on and off duty.
articles.author: Leanne Wong

articles.headline: Quarantine for domestic and international arrivals to NT could end in January
articles.description: Yesterday the NT government announced the introduction of a home quarantine program for hotspot arrivals into some parts of the NT by November 23. But that could be abolished for no quarantine at all by January 18.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: 'Inconvenient to remain unvaccinated': US reveals COVID-19 travel policy
articles.description: The US outlines its new international COVID-19 travel policy which — with a limited number of exemptions — make it mandatory for travellers entering the country to be vaccinated against the virus.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: In dispute with the ATO over a tax debt? The onus shouldn't be on you to prove it's wrong, federal inquiry finds
articles.description: A parliamentary inquiry suggests sweeping changes to the law to better protect vulnerable taxpayers, including reversing the onus of proof for cases of fraud and evasion.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: Travel agents 'coming into their own' as Australia set to use $8b of pandemic travel credits
articles.description: As international borders slowly reopen, Australians are being urged to use a travel agent to rebook their cancelled holidays to ensure they don't lose out.
articles.author: Lucy Stone

articles.headline: Ben Stokes' return is a boost, but Australia is a grim destination for fast-bowling all-rounders
articles.description: Cricket lovers will be delighted with the Ashes comeback of England's Ben Stokes, but history shows that Australia is a tough battleground for Test all-rounders.
articles.author: Russell Jackson

articles.headline: Aboriginal AFL star pleads with First Nations people to get vaccinated
articles.description: Charlie Cameron returns home to north-west Queensland to help break down trust issues stopping some Indigenous people from getting the COVID-19 jab.
articles.author: Larissa Waterson and Andrew Saunders

articles.headline: Devastated fishers 'tearing their hair out' over seals as cull calls go national
articles.description: Pressure mounts on South Australia to consider a seal cull in the Coorong, where the livelihood of fishers has been devastated since the animals arrived in 2007.
articles.author: Larissa Waterson and Andrew Saunders

articles.headline: Scott Morrison’s net zero by 2050 plan leaves ‘plenty’ of space for ‘miracles’
articles.description: Australia has finally joined 130 countries committing to net zero by 2050, but some experts say our plan to get there looks murky, at best.
articles.author: Michael Slezak

articles.headline: PNG health services struggling to cope with Delta outbreak
articles.description: COVID-19 cases are surging across Papua New Guinea, prompting a renewed focus on increasing the country's vaccination rate, which is the lowest in the region.
articles.author: Natalie Whiting

articles.headline: After working on the COVID-19 front line, nurse Annie cries at night at prospect of leaving Australia
articles.description: Annie is one of 11,200 people who have signed a petition urging Australia to introduce a one-off migration policy for temporary visa holders who have helped the country through the pandemic.
articles.author: Bang Xiao

articles.headline: 'It fills both our hearts': Romaya, 8, makes it her business to cuddle your pets
articles.description: Romaya Gilbert had a "lot of love" left to give after the death of her rat, Nibbles. Now the young entrepreneur is making money by caring for other people's pets.
articles.author: Rick Eaves

articles.headline: 'You can't just have white bread all the time': OzAsia Festival director pushes for change
articles.description: Annette Shun Wah, the first Asian Australian to lead Adelaide's OzAsia Festival, has shaped her first program around works by Asian Australian artists, incubating the next generation of talent in the process.
articles.author: Hannah Story

articles.headline: Claims soldiers nearly drowned during army training exercise in Queensland pool
articles.description: A soldier was taken to hospital and others had to be rescued after sinking to the bottom of a pool in heavy gear, in what witnesses described as near-drownings.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Patients return to elective surgery tables — many with conditions deteriorating during COVID lockdowns
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Australians are on a growing elective surgery waitlist. But as surgeries resume post-lockdown, there are fears the worst backlog hasn't even hit us yet.
articles.author: Alison Branley

articles.headline: Crown's conduct was 'illegal, dishonest, unethical and exploitative' but it's still allowed to run a casino
articles.description: Crown's Melbourne casino licence is effectively on a two-year probation, but the fallout from its wrongdoing could have been so much more severe if it didn't wield such a great deal of power.
articles.author: Daniel Ziffer

articles.headline: COVID-19 cases are falling across NSW but new infections emerging in Indigenous communities
articles.description: Around 30 to 40 cases in New South Wales are being recorded each day among Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, accounting for up to 10 per cent of new cases.
articles.author: Nakari Thorpe

articles.headline: Most common COVID-19 offences revealed — from not wearing a mask to leaving your LGA
articles.description: It's New South Wales's COVID-19 lockdown like you've never seen it before, a story not told by the number of cases, vaccines or venues of concern, but a new metric: fines.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: Elgin didn't have permission to take the marbles, says Geoffrey Robertson. It's time to take them back
articles.description: Many have called for the Parthenon marbles to be returned to Athens. Marc Fennell meets the Greek-Australians pushing for their return, for the ABC RN podcast, Stuff the British Stole.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: Forensic police return to Cleo Smith's family home in search for clues
articles.description: WA Police Minister Paul Papalia says every resource is being utilised in the search to find four-year-old Cleo Smith, who has been missing for 12 days.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger and James Carmody

articles.headline: 'Net zero' is a political win, but it has entrenched a climate policy stalemate
articles.description: The Prime Minister stared down a multitude of requests for cash and concessions from the Nationals in return for support of a plan to turn the country carbon neutral by 2050. But he has also entrenched a stalemate on climate change.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: The West is running out of magnesium – all because of China’s power crunch
articles.description: European industry groups fear that the remaining magnesium stocks will run out by the end of November as China's power crisis has affected the global supply.
articles.author: Samuel Yang

articles.headline: 'COVID has bought us three weeks': The grim reality of our global warming situation
articles.description: The world is on track to hit 2.7 degrees Celsius of warming by 2100 despite stronger emissions reduction target, says the United Nations on the eve of global climate talks.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: Sudan's military leader says PM's arrest in coup is to avoid civil war
articles.description: Sudan's top general Abdel Fattah al-Burhan defends the army's seizure of power, saying he ousted the government of Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok to avoid civil war.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: The Queen cancels plans to travel to Glasgow climate summit on doctors' advice
articles.description: The announcement comes after The Queen held virtual audiences at Windsor Castle, the first since revelations that her doctors ordered her to rest last week.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: 'Maybe one day we’ll be under water': Pabai and Paul fear they'll be Australia's first climate refugees
articles.description: In a case never before seen in Australia, Paul Kabai and Pabai Pabai's legal team will argue the Federal Court should require Australia to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to a level that will prevent Torres Strait Islanders from harm.
articles.author: Bridget Brennan and Kirstie Wellauer

articles.headline: Proteas star Quinton de Kock refuses team directive to 'take the knee', withdraws from T20 World Cup match
articles.description: The South African Cricket Board instructed all players they must "take the knee" in a united stand against racism but one of their biggest stars refused and withdrew from their latest match over it.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Australia urged to condemn Israeli designation of Palestinian organisations as 'terrorist' groups
articles.description: Six Palestinian civil rights groups were outlawed by Israel after it designated them "terrorist organisations". Human rights organisations and unions in Australia say the decision should be condemned.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Singapore to reopen to Australia for travel from November 8
articles.description: Australians who return a negative COVID-19 test will be able to enter Singapore from November 8 and unvaccinated children aged under 12 years will also be allowed in.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Daughter accused of smothering mother 'can't explain' location of phone
articles.description: A court hears a woman who has pleaded not guilty to murdering her mother two years ago deny withdrawing thousands of dollars from her mother's account after her death.
articles.author: Damian McIntyre

articles.headline: Meet Dennis Kunoth, Central Australian cattleman and Stolen Generations survivor
articles.description: As a child, Dennis Kunoth didn't think he would ever see the sun rise over his homelands again — but he's since returned to Alice Springs to fulfil his dream to one day run his own cattle on the country his ancestors called home.
articles.author: Hugo Rikard-Bell

articles.headline: Government concedes defence ship it promised to build will now be bought from overseas
articles.description: Defence admits it won't be building a ship promised to be constructed locally, as more details on Australia's nuclear submarine fleet are also revealed
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Million-dollar reward for Cleo Smith information attracts bounty hunters to remote campsite
articles.description: Police say a $1 million reward offered for information to find missing four-year-old Cleo Smith has led to a flurry of activity at the Blowholes campsite, including the arrival of bounty hunters.
articles.author: Andrea Mayes

articles.headline: Border closures leave 'gutted' Sixers star locked out of WBBL
articles.description: Cricket NSW vent their frustrations at state governments after border closures all but rule out former Australian allrounder Erin Burns from the Women's Big Bash League.
articles.author: Andrea Mayes

articles.headline: Where you can travel to soon without having to quarantine — if you're fully vaccinated
articles.description: Seven countries are welcoming fully vaccinated Australian travellers without any need to quarantine, and three more will soon join the list.
articles.author: Jane Norman

articles.headline: Atlanta's Charlie Morton throws 16 pitches on a broken leg in World Series opener
articles.description: Atlanta Braves pitcher Charlie Morton gets hit by a 164kph drive, then goes on to throw another 16 pitches before leaving Game One of the World Series against his former team Houston with a broken leg.
articles.author: Jane Norman

articles.headline: SA Premier says he hasn't read all of the COVID modelling, as Health Minister says he didn't understand it
articles.description: As South Australia prepares to lower the drawbridge to coronavirus cases from the eastern states, the Premier admits that not all of the modelling underpinning the state's COVID-19 roadmap has been "finalised".
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Where you can buy at-home COVID-19 tests from next week
articles.description: Some Australians will be able test themselves for COVID-19 at home from next week as rapid antigen tests are allowed onto store shelves. Here's what we know.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Brazilian Senate approves call for President Jair Bolsonaro to be indicted over pandemic's handling
articles.description: Senate committee approves 1,300-page report calling for Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro to be indicted for nine crimes relating to his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic — including crimes against humanity — but it is unlikely he will face formal charges.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: May's Panthers career hangs in the balance after being issued with show-cause notice
articles.description: Tyrone May is set to face the Penrith board next week in a bid to save his Panthers career, following his conduct on social media in the wake of the club's NRL grand-final win.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Nadia Mitsopoulos pays tribute to 'bear hugging friend to all' and 'outrageously talented' ABC colleague Russell Woolf
articles.description: ABC Radio Perth's Mornings presenter Nadia Mitsopoulos pays tribute to 'outrageously talented colleague and supremely loyal friend' Russell Woolf.
articles.author: Nadia Mitsopoulos

articles.headline: 'We will get him soon': Photos provide breakthrough in hunt for alleged Sydney drug smuggler
articles.description: NSW Police say photos of Mostafa Baluch apparently showing him hiding in the back of a black Range Rover with a Queensland licence plate have provided a "welcome breakthrough" in the hunt for the alleged drug smuggler.
articles.author: Mark Reddie

articles.headline: More changes to ACT COVID restrictions, including eased quarantine requirements for people who are fully vaccinated
articles.description: The ACT government announces further changes to COVID-19 restrictions which will come into effect in the coming days, including changes to quarantine requirements for vaccinated people, and restrictions for unvaccinated visitors entering the ACT.
articles.author: Kate Midena

articles.headline: Treasury officials had little input on the economic modelling behind the government's net zero by 2050 plan
articles.description: Treasury secretary Steven Kennedy says his department had very little input into the modelling underpinning the federal government's plan to achieve net zero emissions by 2050.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Ballarat hits vaccination milestone as it braces for tourist influx
articles.description: Most of the Ballarat and south-west region has passed the 80 per cent full vaccination target, days before regional Victoria and Melbourne become reunite.
articles.author: Matt Neal

articles.headline: Adelaide United midfielder Josh Cavallo publicly announces he's gay in emotional video
articles.description: Adelaide United's Josh Cavallo publicly announces he is gay, becoming the first footballer to open up about their sexuality while playing in the A-League Men competition.
articles.author: Matt Neal

articles.headline: Man charged over Bridgewater stabbing of woman, 18yo man and with breaching family violence orders
articles.description: A man who allegedly stabbed a 42-year-old woman and an 18-year-old man after entering a house north of Hobart yesterday breached a family violence order against him 18 times, police say.
articles.author: James Dunlevie

articles.headline: Legal action possible after fatal shooting on Baldwin set, lawyers say
articles.description: US lawyers say criminal charges cannot be ruled out as investigations into a fatal accidental shooting involving actor Alec Baldwin continue.
articles.author: James Dunlevie

articles.headline: Can you get a Pfizer vaccine after AstraZeneca? When can you get boosters? Your questions answered
articles.description: When can you get your booster shot, can you get Pfizer if you've already had AstraZeneca or Moderna, and will you need more boosters down the track? Here's what we know.
articles.author: Penny Timms and Lori Youmshajekian

articles.headline: Storm drenches Perth as October rainfall records tumble
articles.description: Perth records its wettest October in more than 50 years after heavy downfalls and hail bucket the south-west of the state.
articles.author: Tyne Logan

articles.headline: Missing COVID records causing delays with vaccine certificates
articles.description: As Victoria reopens and many venues and workplaces require proof of vaccination to operate in the new "vaccinated economy", some people are being locked out due to inaccurate immunisation records.
articles.author: Rhiannon Stevens

articles.headline: Halloween 'zombie' in NSW backyard taken down after multiple calls to police
articles.description: Renée Ryan says she "completely understands" that some people were "unintentionally triggered" by the decoration she made with her son. Warning: This story contains an image readers may find distressing.
articles.author: Arianna Levy

articles.headline: Homicide investigation launched after toddler's death deemed 'inconsistent with drowning'
articles.description: Queensland police say they are now treating the death of four-year-old Tarrin-Macen O’Sullivan, who was initially reported to have drowned, as suspicious.
articles.author: Angel Parsons

articles.headline: Hobart cracks million-dollar median house price barrier
articles.description: The median house price of Hobart's innermost suburbs has surpassed $1 million for the first time, with one real estate agent saying seven-figure price tags are on the way to "becoming the new normal" in Tasmania.
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: Received a large electricity bill during Canberra's lockdown? It might not be due to the costs of working from home
articles.description: The ACT's lockdown led to an increase in the number of electricity usage estimations, but some Canberrans are reporting their initial invoices were significantly different to their actual energy usage.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: Dozens of stolen cars unlawfully registered, sold for several years without police realising
articles.description: Compensation claims from unwitting buyers are expected over a situation Queensland police blame on "issues" involving the state's records and the National Vehicles of Interest register.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: In search of a home fit for Princess, a Surfers Paradise 'icon'
articles.description: Princess is a well-known homeless person who lives around the Gold Coast's famous Cavill Avenue. Now a Facebook campaign aims to find a secure home for the 61-year-old.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: Meet a family at the centre of the homelessness crisis in Queensland's fastest growing region
articles.description: One of Queensland's fastest growing council areas has just one person working with locals to combat a growing homelessness crisis that leaves thousands feeling hopeless and shut out.
articles.author: Baz Ruddick

articles.headline: Meat industry seeks booster shot priority for workers to keep supply chains running
articles.description: Meatworkers were eligible for their first dose under Phase 1B of the vaccine rollout, and the peak body wants them at the front of the queue for their third jab.
articles.author: Jane McNaughton

articles.headline: Halloween Kills, the latest in the Halloween franchise, nails the comedy rather than the scares
articles.description: Jamie Lee Curtis and director David Gordon Green re-team for sequel about mob violence.
articles.author: Luke Goodsell

articles.headline: Soils can't hold enough carbon to offset Australian emissions, experts say
articles.description: Australia's plan for net zero includes "dangerous" soil carbon assumptions, relies on farmers to "bail out the fossil fuel industry", and could be too expensive, experts say.
articles.author: Michael Condon and Joshua Becker

articles.headline: I don't want to believe: Defence declines to investigate UFO sightings
articles.description: The truth may be out there, but Australia's Department of Defence is not interested in following its US counterpart in trying to discover what's behind unexplained UFO sightings.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: Daryl Maguire fronts ICAC
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Disgraced ex-MP for Wagga Wagga Daryl Maguire will today front the corruption inquiry into whether Gladys Berejiklian breached public trust.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: 'I made the mistake of trusting my employer because the superannuation was on my pay slip'
articles.description: Thousands of employers are failing to pay their staff superannuation, and it's costing workers billions of dollars every year.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: The tourist rush is coming — but is Tasmania ready for them?
articles.description: Bookings are going "ballistic" ahead of the reopening of Tasmania's borders, but as hospitality venues prepare for the influx it could be a case of "be careful what you wish for", with staff shortages causing problems.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald and Fiona Blackwood

articles.headline: Confusion is rife over Victoria's vaccinated economy. Here are answers to some common questions
articles.description: If you've got some questions about what the next phase of Victoria's COVID-19 roadmap will look like, we've tried to simplify some of the issues sparking the most queries.
articles.author: Sian Johnson

articles.headline: Not so long ago the PM was skewering Labor's carbon credits for Kazakhstan. Now, he has a net zero 'plan'
articles.description: This week's long-anticipated net zero "plan" may be slender on new policy ideas, but still represents a significant departure from the Coalition's pre-election posture, writes David Speers.
articles.author: David Speers

articles.headline: How opening a window can stop COVID spreading in classrooms
articles.description: New South Wales students have gone back to school this week with the wind blowing through open classroom windows in a bid to contain the spread of COVID-19. And, these experts say that's a crucial step.
articles.author: David Speers

articles.headline: 'Our opinion was never considered at that table as a valued opinion': Wilcannia speaks out
articles.description: Leaked documents reveal a litany of failures in the system to protect Aboriginal communities, which left the remote town of Wilcannia exposed despite high-level warnings stretching back up to 18 months.
articles.author: Sean Rubinsztein-Dunlop, John Stewart, Tynan King, Clare Blumer, and Jack Fisher

articles.headline: Forensics officers return to remote Blowholes campsite in search for Cleo Smith
articles.description: WA Police forensics officers return to the remote Blowholes campsite where four-year-old Cleo Smith was last seen.
articles.author: David Weber

articles.headline: 'There was some complacency on this set': Police speak on fatal shooting on Alec Baldwin film Rust
articles.description: Santa Fe's sheriff casts further doubt on safety standards on the film set of Alec Baldwin film Rust as the District Attorney says it is too early to say if the actor will face any criminal charges.
articles.author: David Weber

articles.headline: England tune up for Australia by belting Bangladesh at Twenty20 World Cup
articles.description: England cruise to an emphatic Twenty20 World Cup victory over Bangladesh that serves as a warning shot to Australia.
articles.author: David Weber

articles.headline: US government lawyers say Assange could serve sentence in Australia if extradited
articles.description: Lawyers for the United States say any sentence imposed on WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange could be served in an Australian prison if he is extradited to the US to face charges.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Fair Work Commission deputy president who likened vaccine mandates to 'medical apartheid' on restricted duties
articles.description: Lyndall Dean will be excluded from full bench work until she completes training after likening vaccine mandates to "medical apartheid".
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Taiwan has no right to join the United Nations, China says
articles.description: China says Taiwan has no right to join the United Nations, after calls from the United States for the island to have greater involvement in the world body.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Mother and boyfriend charged after police find eight-year-old dead in Texas
articles.description: Following an autopsy, investigators say the boy was killed by "multiple blunt force injuries".
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Sudan arrests three activists as pressure mounts on military after coup
articles.description: Arrests in the capital Khartoum are reported by family members and pro-democracy groups as tens of thousands of Sudanese take to the streets to demand the return of the democratically elected government.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: NT Police charge man with attempted murder over alleged assault of a woman
articles.description: Northern Territory Police have charged a 33-year-old man with attempted murder after an alleged assault in Mataranka, 420 kilometres south-east of Darwin.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: De Kock issues apology, says he'll take a knee in future
articles.description: Quinton de Kock apologises for rejecting a Cricket South Africa directive that players must "take a knee" in support of the Black Lives Matter movement.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Gynaecologist invents the world's first unisex condom using wound-dressing material
articles.description: The inventor of a unisex condom hopes it will empower people to take control of their sexual health, regardless of their sex or sexual orientation.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: 'Drug-addled negligence': Cairns mother sentenced over death of infant son who ate her meth
articles.description: The mother of a 13-month-old boy who died after eating methamphetamine left in his bedroom has been sentenced to eight years' jail.
articles.author: Jemima Burt

articles.headline: Electric car taxes 'inevitable' in Australia as SA joins the charge
articles.description: Buyers of electric cars in South Australia will soon be charged for every kilometre they drive, after an electric vehicle tax was passed.
articles.author: Nick Harmsen

articles.headline: One of Australia's worst drink drivers jailed after two-hour trial
articles.description: WA man Paul Anthony Hepworth, who's been labelled a "risk to the public", is jailed for his 11th drink-driving conviction.
articles.author: Kyle Pauletto

articles.headline: How mother-of-pearl could be a game-changer for bone surgery
articles.description: The abundance of pearl shells off WA's Kimberley coast may have some life-changing medical applications, as researchers investigate mother-of-pearl's potential as a synthetic bone substitute.
articles.author: Courtney Fowler

articles.headline: Court hears details of how former Canberra football coach groomed and molested boy
articles.description: The ACT Supreme Court hears graphic details of how former junior Ainslie Football Club coach Stephen Porter groomed and later molested a young boy.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Labor shocked by size of golden handshakes for power execs
articles.description: Golden handshakes worth almost $2.4 million for departing Tasmanian power company executives are defended as being "reflective of the nature and tenure of these senior roles".
articles.author: Alexandra Humphries

articles.headline: Fake rideshare driver 'targeting' young women charged with sexual assault
articles.description: Police say the man has been acting alone and targeting young women clearly waiting for a rideshare pick-up. Officers believe he was intending to hit the road again this weekend.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Filmmaker and 'true hero' who exposed Indonesian atrocities in Timor-Leste dies after illness
articles.description: Max Stahl, the filmmaker and war correspondent who risked his life to film Indonesian soldiers firing on a crowd of mourners in Timor-Leste in 1991, dies in Brisbane, aged 66.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Future of Crown Perth up in the air as James Packer prepares to testify at royal commission
articles.description: Billionaire James Packer once viewed his Perth casino as the jewel in his plans for a global Crown empire — but his reputation is now in tatters as he prepares to testify at the WA royal commission tomorrow.
articles.author: Rebecca Turner

articles.headline: The US, Russia, North Korea and now China – why are nuclear powers vying for hypersonic capability?
articles.description: The latest test of a hypersonic nuclear-capable weapon has been by China, but recent months have seen an arms race for stealthier long-range weapons.
articles.author: Rebecca Turner

articles.headline: Marise Payne labels alleged censorship at OzAsia Festival 'unacceptable' after canning of Hong Kong group's performance
articles.description: The future of government funding for Adelaide's OzAsia Festival is under threat, after claims that Hong Kong's strict national security laws have extended to Australia's biggest Asian festival.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: Anyone with a mortgage warned to brace for faster rising interest rates
articles.description: There are warnings the cost of borrowing is marching upwards, and much faster than many experts had been forecasting.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: Giddey fires in shock Oklahoma win over Lakers
articles.description: Australia's number six draft pick Josh Giddey makes history as Oklahoma City secures their first win of the NBA season by beating LeBron James' Los Angeles Lakers.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: Fugitive who escaped prison 30 years ago facing deportation after turning himself in
articles.description: Darko Desic, who was at large for nearly three decades, is facing deportation after being sentenced to two months in jail for his historical escape from a NSW prison.
articles.author: Mridula Amin

articles.headline: Doctors warn of horror eye risks in ghastly Halloween trend
articles.description: Trick-or-treat enthusiasts are being warned to do their research before attempting cosmetic trends that could lead to blindness overnight.
articles.author: Zilla Gordon

articles.headline: Fiji welcomes Australia's net zero by 2050 target, but other Pacific countries are sceptical
articles.description: Fiji's Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama says he does not want any more excuses on climate action from big emitters, including Australia, when they gather for talks at COP26.
articles.author: Evan Wasuka, Tahlea Aualiitia, and Caroline Tiriman

articles.headline: Former lawyer who ripped off elderly clients walks from court after defrauding WWII refugee
articles.description: Tracey-Anne Smith has been struck off as a lawyer in two states for defrauding elderly clients of a total of $175,000. A magistrate gives her a suspended jail sentence, saying her declining mental health meant she had an "altered level of moral culpability".
articles.author: Paula Doneman and Heidi Sheehan

articles.headline: Protesters voice frustration after police officer cleared of Yamatji woman's murder in Geraldton
articles.description: Red hands are daubed on the steps of WA Parliament House days after a police officer was cleared of murder for shooting dead an Aboriginal woman in Geraldt
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger and Natasha Harradine

articles.headline: Doctor selected as Queensland's next chief health officer declines job days before taking over
articles.description: Dr Krispin Hajkowicz tells the Queensland government he cannot accept the job of chief health officer for personal reasons. Jeannette Young is finishing up in the job this Sunday and her deputy Peter Aitken will act in the role until a replacement is found.
articles.author: Rachel Riga

articles.headline: Minnie Alex Pullin makes her entrance, as Olympian's widow welcomes 'a little piece of Chumpy'
articles.description: Ellidy Pullin gives birth to Alex "Chumpy" Pullin's daughter 15 months after he died, following successful IVF treatment using the snowboarding champion's sperm.
articles.author: Kimberley Bernard

articles.headline: Voter ID laws could be in place before the next federal election. Here's why it's controversial
articles.description: You don't need to prove your identity to vote in federal elections. Here's why the government wants to change that, and why Labor thinks it's "racist and discriminatory".
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: Dam site better: farmers hail increase to harvestable water limit
articles.description: Coastal farmers in NSW will soon be able to capture 30 per cent of the rain that falls on their properties, in what the state government is calling a "historic step".
articles.author: Keely Johnson and Kim Honan

articles.headline: Liberal politician pushes for Australia to drop 'One China' policy and recognise Taiwan
articles.description: The head of the Senate’s foreign affairs committee says Australia should break its longstanding 'One China' policy, by establishing full diplomatic relations with Taiwan.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: $300 million 'free' water windfall for Murray-Darling irrigators
articles.description: The water has been saved from irrigation system upgrades dating back to 2007 and is being gifted to irrigators to keep and use or sell on the open market.
articles.author: Warwick Long

articles.headline: She walked out of prison and three weeks later was shot dead. What happened to JC?
articles.description: About three weeks after leaving prison, a 29-year-old woman is shot dead by a police officer, sparking a historic trial for her murder. What took her from the prison gates to lying dead on a suburban street?
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger, Bridget Brennan, and Kirsten Robb

articles.headline: When Ambulance Victoria didn't answer this woman's calls, this is the box that saved her life
articles.description: Diana Schumacher reached out to the emergency services for help. Then she had to treat herself.
articles.author: Dana Morse and Margaret Paul

articles.headline: How Sydney woman 'Gabz' created a black market for unproven COVID treatments sourced from India
articles.description: An ABC investigation has uncovered a black market trade for Ivermectin on encrypted social media platform Telegram.
articles.author: Ahmed Yussuf and Pat McGrath

articles.headline: Canberrans can now take masks off outside as most COVID-19 restrictions ease
articles.description: The lockdown caused by the Delta outbreak is effectively over, but ACT life isn't quite returning to what it was like before the pandemic. Here's what you can and can't do from today.
articles.author: Markus Mannheim

articles.headline: 'You feel like you can live again': New Parkinson's treatment lets doctors manipulate brains remotely
articles.description: Parkinson's patient Clive Couperthwaite routinely travelled for hours to Brisbane for a simple and quick tweak to a life-changing device implanted in his brain, but now new technology means those adjustments can be made remotely, opening new doors for him and thousands of Australians living with the disease.
articles.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

articles.headline: Researchers develop glass to make phone screens 'unbreakable' and devices self-recharging
articles.description: Researchers at the University of Queensland join with scientists across the world to develop a new form of composite glass that is virtually unbreakable, and could even turn phone screens into mini solar panels.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: 'We're one country after all': Why can some Australians fly overseas but not drive to Queensland?
articles.description: In just a few days, many Australians living in NSW or Victoria will be able to fly to London or Los Angeles – but not drive across the Queensland border. Here's how the state's COVID-19 travel rules will work.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: It's going to be another day of whack-a-mole weather warnings as storm risk moves north
articles.description: A trough and complex low are expected to bring supercell storms to northern NSW and southern Queensland today, after SA and Victoria got a battering yesterday.
articles.author: Kate Doyle and Cassandra Hough

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: Trains slow for industrial strike
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Sydney trains are running slow on purpose this morning, as industrial action continues for the second week.
articles.author: Kate Doyle and Cassandra Hough

articles.headline: Facebook rebrands as Meta as it chases 'metaverse' vision
articles.description: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg says his company is rebranding itself as Meta in an effort to encompass its virtual-reality vision for the future.
articles.author: Kate Doyle and Cassandra Hough

articles.headline: Most workers can't just borrow cash from their employer's till. Why can bosses get away with doing it to employees' super?
articles.description: Millions of Australians are counting on tougher action against employers who don't pay their workers' superannuation, writes Nassim Khadem.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: Australians keen to set sail as government suggests cruises could return this summer
articles.description: Cruises were linked to serious COVID-19 outbreaks early in the pandemic, but that has not dampened enthusiasm of some Australians who are keen to get back to sea.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: Quinton de Kock's  apology a mirror to us all
articles.description: The Quinton de Kock story which was portrayed never added up and the aftermath has shown many were far too quick to judge, writes Tracey Holmes.
articles.author: Tracey Holmes

articles.headline: Why has Beijing censored an Australian's song about glass hearts, pink costumes and pineapples?
articles.description: Australian singer Kimberley Chen, who has millions of fans in China, has been censored on Chinese social media and music streaming platforms after releasing a song mocking Beijing's controversial policies.
articles.author: Bang Xiao

articles.headline: How Japan reduced its daily COVID cases from 26,000 to hundreds in six weeks
articles.description: Japan experiences a sharp decline in coronavirus cases after the Olympic host country suffers its most severe outbreak of the pandemic. Health experts say public compliance, mask wearing and vaccine uptake have helped flatten the curve.
articles.author: Joshua Boscaini

articles.headline: Xi Jinping is bingeing coal and avoiding a climate summit. Is he giving up on the green China dream?
articles.description: China's president Xi Jinping must somehow fuel the nation's economic growth, keep the lights on, and break its addiction to coal before it's too late.
articles.author: Bill Birtles

articles.headline: Macron delivers precise torpedo strike to Morrison
articles.description: The French President's fury does not seem to have cooled with the Australian government, writes Andrew Probyn.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn

articles.headline: 'For Chinese Australians, it's really our origin story in many ways': New show breaks ground
articles.description: SBS's ambitious Gold Rush murder mystery New Gold Mountain brings an important part of Australian history to the screen, with a steely Chinese cowboy as the protagonist.
articles.author: Hannah Reich

articles.headline: The missing puzzle piece in the global supply chain crisis is large, metallic and lost at sea
articles.description: Almost every product in our daily lives travels in a shipping container. But now there's a shortage, partly thanks to Covid, which has contributed to supply chain issues.
articles.author: Nick Baker

articles.headline: The ins and outs of the Novavax COVID vaccine
articles.description: When is the Novavax COVID vaccine coming to Australia, and how does it work? Here's what we know.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: New COVID hotspot emerges in NSW — and it's not in Sydney
articles.description: After months of soaring case numbers in south-west Sydney, the hotspot mantle has now been passed to regional New South Wales.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: Police seize 55 million meth pills smuggled in beer truck, in Asia's largest ever drug bust
articles.description: More than 55 million methamphetamine tablets and over 1.5 tonnes of crystal methamphetamine are intercepted by Lao police, who stopped a truck carrying beer crates.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: 'I didn't want to exist': Nakkiah Lui reveals hurt in wake of social media abuse
articles.description: Nakkiah Lui says she never imagined the level of abuse she would receive for suggesting Jessica Rowe might want to review a podcast she did with Pauline Hanson, as the Q+A panel discuss cancel culture and comedian Dave Chapelle.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: NAIF boss resigns hours before Senate Estimates hearing
articles.description: The head of the Northern Australia Infrastructure Facility resigns less than 24 hours before he was due to appear before the Senate Estimates Committee.
articles.author: Daniel Fitzgerald and Matt Brann

articles.headline: Alice Springs financial advisor found guilty of drug trafficking
articles.description: High profile Alice Springs financial advisor Harris Shortland has been found guilty smuggling cocaine into Alice Springs.
articles.author: Saskia Mabin

articles.headline: Disgraced WA politician likened to Walter Mitty after lying about police and military service
articles.description: Former Labor MP Barry Urban is likened to fictional character Walter Mitty after misleading parliament about his education and police service. He remains behind bars as he awaits sentencing.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: 'They could be taping our conversation right now': Three crucial ICAC calls explained
articles.description: The NSW corruption watchdog has played several tapped several calls between former premier Gladys Berejiklian and her ex-boyfriend Daryl Maguire. Here are three it highlighted.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: Concerns raised over quality of care at SA childcare centres operating below staff ratios
articles.description: The state opposition says more than a fifth of South Australia's childcare centres have been granted exemptions to staffing ratio rules, raising concerns about the level of care.
articles.author: Leah MacLennan

articles.headline: Minutes after this SES volunteer set out to help others, a tree crushed his home, trapping his family
articles.description: Ben Owen had gone to check on his neighbours in the Dandenongs this morning when his wife rang and told him an enormous pine tree had come crashing down on their home.
articles.author: Leah MacLennan

articles.headline: BlueScope Steel and Rio Tinto announce 'green steel' partnership
articles.description: Australia's largest steel producer unites with mining giant Rio Tinto to explore decarbonising the steel-making process, signalling a move away from coal.
articles.author: Tim Fernandez

articles.headline: 'What happens to the people out here?': Pastoralists concerned by massive national parks property purchase
articles.description: Far West graziers say an enormous land acquisition by the NSW government is turfing out generations of families who have called the land home.
articles.author: Jonathon Poulson, Bill Ormonde, and Callum Marshall

articles.headline: 'Monitor their reactions': School warns parents of children who've seen Squid Game
articles.description: The Netflix hit show may have captured the attention of millions, but its lurid depictions of death and dissection prompt an Adelaide primary school to write to parents, suggesting they "monitor" the reactions of children who have seen it.
articles.author: Daniel Keane and Matthew Smith

articles.headline: Police searching for Cleo Smith examine reports of predatory behaviour dating back 10 years
articles.description: The WA detective tasked with finding missing four-year-old Cleo Smith says investigators are reviewing reports of past approaches to children in the area where she disappeared from her family's tent a fortnight ago.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: US woman who helped kill her mother in Bali is released from prison
articles.description: Heather Mack is released from an Indonesian jail after serving seven years of her 10-year sentence for helping kill her mother, Sheila von Wiese-Mack, alongside her then-boyfriend Tommy Schaefer.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Why is Facebook changing its name, and what does meta mean?
articles.description: Mark Zuckerberg says the rebranding is part of the company's plan to develop a virtual world but critics argue it's an attempt to shift focus from recent controversies. Here's what we know about Facebook going Meta.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Packer tells royal commission he should have 'resigned or attended' Burswood board meetings
articles.description: Australian billionaire James Packer tells a royal commission that he did not attend board meetings of Burswood Limited — the company overseeing Crown Perth — between 2013 and 2016, despite being its chair.
articles.author: Rebecca Turner

articles.headline: 'Great for ducks': Tasmania gets a bucketing, but spared damaging winds
articles.description: It has been a very wet day in Tasmania, with authorities watching river catchments closely — but the threat of damaging winds has passed.
articles.author: Adam Langenberg

articles.headline: Vegetable growers count the cost of damaged glasshouses and crops after hailstorm
articles.description: Lettuces, tomatoes, cucumbers and zucchinis are among the crops badly damaged in storms that swung through South Australia yesterday.
articles.author: Adam Langenberg

articles.headline: Inside the 'historic' tunnels under Sydney Harbour which will slash travel times for commuters
articles.description: Work is completed on tunnels that will allow commuters to travel deep under Sydney Harbour, with NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet saying the project will "transform the way we travel around our great city".
articles.author: Maryanne Taouk

articles.headline: Former ABC camera operator sentenced for historical sex offences in Alice Springs
articles.description: Former ABC camera operator Alan Dowler has been sentenced in the Northern Territory Supreme Court to four years and six months in prison for historical sex offences against two girls under the age of 14.
articles.author: Isaac Nowroozi

articles.headline: The Reserve Bank delivered a 'significant surprise' and it could affect your mortgage
articles.description: The Reserve Bank again fails to defend its 0.1 per cent bond yield target and that means official interest rates, as well as variable mortgage rates, could be rising sooner than previously expected.
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: 'Keeping this species going': Largest ever NSW release of critically endangered birds
articles.description: There are only about 300 regent honeyeaters left in the wild and, in a bid to save them from extinction, a large number of captive-bred birds have just been released on Wonnarua Country in the Hunter Valley.
articles.author: Emma Siossian

articles.headline: Jupiter's Great Red Spot not just wide but surprisingly deep
articles.description: Jupiter's Great Red Spot, a storm so big it could swallow Earth, extends deep beneath the planet's cloud tops.
articles.author: Emma Siossian

articles.headline: Australians are facing record petrol prices and a decision by John Howard 43 years ago begins the story
articles.description: Why are Australian petrol prices hitting record highs? Part of the reason has to do with a government decision made in the 1970s.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Man and woman allegedly caught in same room of COVID-19 medi-hotel arrested
articles.description: Police arrest an 18-year-old woman and 22-year-old man at an Adelaide COVID-19 quarantine hotel, after being caught in the same room.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Doctors being abused for refusing to give COVID vaccine exemptions
articles.description: Rural Doctors and the AMA are encouraging people to 'have an open conversation' with their GPs as they are most likely not medically exempt from getting the vaccine.
articles.author: Guy Williams

articles.headline: Wallabies game plan to change as Japan-based trio pulls out of spring tour
articles.description: The Wallabies will have to adjust their strategy for their upcoming three Tests, following the withdrawal of key personnel — Samu Kerevi, Quade Cooper and Sean McMahon — from their squad, writes Brett McKay.
articles.author: Brett McKay

articles.headline: ACT records 10 new COVID-19 cases as Canberrans enjoy significantly eased restrictions
articles.description: The ACT records 10 new cases of COVID-19 as Canberrans enjoy new freedoms. Most ACT businesses can reopen today, and residents no longer have to wear masks while outside.
articles.author: Charlotte Gore

articles.headline: How Gladys Berejiklian's ICAC media blitz backfired
articles.description: Painful questions about the status of Gladys Berejiklian's relationship with Daryl Maguire bordered on the Shakespearean, as the former premier remains defiant.
articles.author: Paul Farrell and Alex McDonald

articles.headline: Experts examine who could be held legally responsible for the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins
articles.description: Alec Baldwin is unlikely to face charges for holding the gun that fired the fatal shot into cinematographer Halyna Hutchins while filming a scene, but he may have to front court as one of the producers of the movie, according to legal experts.
articles.author: Paul Farrell and Alex McDonald

articles.headline: Tiger King 2 is coming. This will help you get up to speed
articles.description: The sequel to the 2020 Netflix series will premiere in November. Here's what has happened in the real lives of the key characters over the past 18 months.
articles.author: Paul Donoughue

articles.headline: We'll live with COVID for years to come. But Israel's tactics show how we can tame the virus
articles.description: Just six weeks after the peak of its worst wave of COVID yet, life in Israel is returning to normal thanks to a combination of booster shots, vaccine passports and mask-wearing. Their turnaround could offer a way forward for Australia.
articles.author: Tom Joyner

articles.headline: China's male idols are undergoing masculine makeovers
articles.description: After Beijing's call to put an end to 'sissy' men, a number of China's most popular male idols have undergone conspicuous image makeovers to adopt a more masculine look. However, not everyone is as willing to take Beijing's fashion advice.
articles.author: Joyce Cheng, Jordyn Butler, and Will Jackson

articles.headline: As COP26 tries to shape the future, Australians are dealing with climate change now
articles.description: Summer temperatures are soaring, those burnt out in the Black Summer are rebuilding, and water flows have been down for decades. As leaders gather in Glasgow, Australians are already dealing with the impacts of a warming planet.
articles.author: Ben Deacon, Kate Doyle, Jarrod Lucas, Ruslan Kulski, and Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: The pandemic inspired Tara to redesign her life and she's never been happier
articles.description: Workers all over the world are increasingly retreating from pre-pandemic work patterns and pursuing new passions – or just a slower, more sustainable pace. So, what does the Great Resignation look like in Australia?
articles.author: Ben Deacon, Kate Doyle, Jarrod Lucas, Ruslan Kulski, and Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: Skin in the game: Needle-free COVID vaccine patches a step closer
articles.description: Australian biotech firm Vaxxas will start clinical trials of its tiny vaccine-administering patches next year — which is good news for kids and people with a fear of needles.
articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

articles.headline: So let's talk about another plan that was released this week but received very little attention
articles.description: The government is to be applauded for having a national strategy for preventing and responding to child sexual abuse. As with all such things, though, the question is how effectively it addresses the problem, writes Laura Tingle.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Thinking about learning a language? Here are some reasons to consider studying Bahasa Indonesia
articles.description: There is a shrinking cohort of Australian students choosing to learn Indonesian at high school. That's why academics have renewed calls for more students to study Bahasa Indonesia.
articles.author: Mariah Papadopoulos

articles.headline: The Queen told to rest for 'at least the next two weeks'
articles.description: Buckingham Palace says the Queen is advised by her doctors to rest for at least the next fortnight.
articles.author: Mariah Papadopoulos

articles.headline: Spotlight falls on home and mystery car as search for Cleo Smith continues
