articles.description: Little Cleo Smith has been missing for more than two weeks now and with few leads to go on, the detectives putting together the puzzle revisit the locations which are central to her disappearance.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Biden tells Macron he thought French knew about 'clumsy' AUKUS deal
articles.description: US President Joe Biden tells French President Emmanuel Macron he was "under the impression" France had been informed about the AUKUS submarine deal long before it was announced.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Heroics from big guns Holder, Russell and Pooran keep West Indies alive at T20 World Cup
articles.description: Winning doesn't always have to be pretty and for the West Indies it was not but their biggest guns fired when it mattered most to see them defeat Bangladesh in dramatic fashion at the T20 World Cup.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Armourer on Alec Baldwin film breaks her silence after fatal shooting on set
articles.description: Lawyers for the 24-year-old Hannah Gutierrez Reed say she doesn't know where the live rounds found there came from, and blamed producers for unsafe working conditions.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: This idyllic Pacific nation has just now recorded its first COVID case
articles.description: Tonga is among the few remaining nations in the world that have avoided outbreaks of the virus.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Trump's business empire slumps after years of divisive politics, figures show
articles.description: The slashing rhetorical style and divisive politics that inspired fierce political loyalty for Donald Trump are undermining a business built around real estate development and branding deals.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Victoria's COVID cases and hospitalisations are stabilising. But the rollercoaster ride is not over
articles.description: As Victorians enjoy a weekend of emotional reunions and further eased restrictions, hopeful trends are firming up on several fronts in the state's battle against COVID-19. These are the figures to watch in the next few months.
articles.author: Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: Sweden acted too slowly on COVID pandemic, commission finds
articles.description: Sweden's early strategy, shunning lockdowns and measures such as face masks and only gradually tightening curbs, made the country an outlier in the first year of the pandemic.
articles.author: Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: Australian Test great Ashley Mallett dies aged 76
articles.description: Australian spin bowling great Ashley Mallett, who played 38 Tests and took 132 wickets at an average of 29.84, dies aged 76 after battling cancer.
articles.author: Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: Senior aide to Aung San Suu Kyi sentenced to 20 years' jail in Myanmar
articles.description: Myanmar's military junta has sentenced Win Htein — a close aide of ousted civilian leader Aung San Suu Kyi — to 20 years in prison for treason, according to his lawyer.
articles.author: Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: In Denmark's capital, a social experiment that started as a prank has been running for 50 years
articles.description: After a half-century, the "flower-power" aura of Copenhagen's semi-autonomous Christiania neighbourhood hasn't wilted.
articles.author: Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: 'Complete' Harris shines in Ashes audition, Labuschagne continues solid form
articles.description: Incumbent Test opener Marcus Harris scores a ton for Victoria to put his name in front of national selectors, while Marnus Labuschagne adds a Sheffield Shield half-century to his tally for Queensland.
articles.author: Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: Pope tells world leaders 'radical' action on climate change needed
articles.description: Ahead of the COP26 climate conference in Glasgow, Pope Francis says world leaders must give hope to future generations.
articles.author: Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: Regions brace for COVID spike as Melburnians escape for long weekend
articles.description: While regional businesses nervously look forward to a boom in trade as Melbourne visitors arrive for the long weekend, hospitals prepare for a surge in COVID cases.
articles.author: Sarah Lawrence, Katherine Smyrk, Rosanne Maloney, and Daniel Miles

articles.headline: WA to require travellers from states with COVID transmission to be fully vaccinated
articles.description: The WA government has announced a major change to its border rules, effectively requiring travellers from states with COVID-19 transmission to be fully vaccinated in order to enter.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: The field for the Melbourne Cup is out. Can they beat racing's rising star?
articles.description: Incentivise is set to run a hot favourite in Tuesday's great race, but who will be the toughest to beat? Explore our interactive form guide to the horses set to line up in the 161st Melbourne Cup.
articles.author: Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: Severe storms heading towards Brisbane's CBD, expected to bring damaging winds and hail
articles.description: A number of severe storm cells have formed in southern and south-east Queensland, with half a dozen regions warned they could be hit by damaging winds and large hailstones.
articles.author: Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: Ancient Mayan canoe found in Mexican freshwater pool
articles.description: A wooden, almost completely intact canoe used by ancient Mayans and believed to be more than 1,000 years old has turned up in the southern Mexico state of Yucatán.
articles.author: Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: Not spooked by Halloween ghost stories? You may have aphantasia
articles.description: When some people listen to a story they automatically conjure up the scene in their mind’s eye, while a small proportion cannot visualise images at all. This inability to visualise is known as aphantasia.
articles.author: Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: From ‘unknown’ to ‘ancestor’: Indigenous artists honoured in groundbreaking new exhibition
articles.description: WILAM BIIK - or ‘Home Country’ - at TarraWarra Museum of Art, puts Wurundjeri people in full control of the curatorial process, breaking down centuries of museum protocol.
articles.author: Maddee Clark

articles.headline: Scuba diver drowns in Sydney's south despite efforts of bystanders and paramedics
articles.description: Just after noon today, paramedics responded to reports a scuba diver had been pulled from the water unconscious near Cape Solander at Kurnell.
articles.author: Maddee Clark

articles.headline: Twelve Republican-led US states sue Biden administration over vaccine mandate
articles.description: US states launch a legal challenge against US President Joe Biden's executive orders requiring federal contractors to be vaccinated, describing the mandate as "unconstitutional and unlawful".
articles.author: Maddee Clark

articles.headline: 'Extremely unlikely' missing man could have survived, police say, as boat search ends
articles.description: The search for a man missing in waters off Tasmania's north-west is called off 11 days after he was last seen and more than week after the bodies of two of his friends washed ashore.
articles.author: Maddee Clark

articles.headline: 'A colossal figure': Australian cricket mourns death of Alan Davidson
articles.description: Regarded as one of Australia's greatest all-rounders, Alan Davidson — who played in the famous tied Test against West Indies — has died at age 92.
articles.author: Maddee Clark

articles.headline: Man arrested over cocaine bust is 'co-conspirator' of fugitive Mostafa Baluch, police allege
articles.description: Police link a man arrested over large quantities of cocaine,  heroin and methamphetamine brought in by air cargo to alleged drug smuggler Mostafa Baluch, who is being sought by police.
articles.author: Sue Daniel and Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: Kyle Chalmers breaks 13-year-old world record
articles.description: The Australian adds a world record to his lengthy list of accomplishments in the pool, setting a new mark in the men's 100 metres freestyle short-course event in Russia.
articles.author: Sue Daniel and Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: Mass of pumice pebbles cover beaches, damage boats in Japan
articles.description: Massive amounts of volcanic pumice pebbles spewed from an undersea volcano in the Pacific Ocean have been piling up on southern Japanese coasts.
articles.author: Sue Daniel and Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: WA's largest mango orchard on track for best season in years
articles.description: Despite severe labour shortages plaguing Australia's agriculture sector, WA's largest mango packing shed springs back to life in the Ord and is on target to pack up to 200,000 trays of fruit this season.
articles.author: Courtney Fowler

articles.headline: How a water-ski show became a theme park that's 'part of our fabric'
articles.description: One of the Gold Coast's best known theme parks celebrates a major milestone — turning 50.
articles.author: Courtney Fowler

articles.headline: Christian Eriksen banned from football in Italy due to pacemaker
articles.description: Christian Eriksen, who collapsed on the pitch at Euro 2020, can no longer play football in Italy due to his pacemaking device.
articles.author: Courtney Fowler

articles.headline: Live: Hitotsu wins Victoria Derby following storming finish, field finalised for the Melbourne Cup
articles.description: Jockey John Allen guides Hitotsu to an outstanding win in the Victoria Derby at Flemington Racecourse, and Incentivise will race from barrier 16 as the final field is set for Tuesday's Melbourne Cup. Follow all the action live.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Police search for man after hold-up east of Adelaide, as three teens arrested over alleged Range Rover theft
articles.description: Police are searching for a man following an attempted hold-up east of Adelaide on Saturday morning. Three teenage boys were also arrested following a police pursuit of a stolen car overnight.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Can I still go trick-or-treating this year? Here's how to have a COVID-safe Halloween in your state
articles.description: Whether you're gathering at a haunted house for a monster mash, or taking to the streets to trick-or-treat, here are the COVID-safe Halloween rules for your state.
articles.author: Jessica Riga

articles.headline: The price of 'the Australian Dream': What these skilled migrants gave up for life down under
articles.description: Vietnam's former foreign press officer Uyen Vu talks about stepping out of her comfort zone and the challenges she faced in migrating to Australia.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: 'Delightful' find of tiny marsupial that sucks out prey's brains, but is itself threatened
articles.description: A group of rangers, researchers and schoolkids were thrilled to discover a threatened brush-tailed mulgara during a fauna survey at Uluru Kata-Tjuta National Park in the heart of Australia.
articles.author: Eliza Goetze

articles.headline: Queensland authorities expecting 'hundreds' of daily cases once borders open
articles.description: On what the government is calling "last-chance weekend", Queensland sees another day with no new coronavirus cases detected.
articles.author: Nibir Khan

articles.headline: The ACT has recorded nine new COVID-19 cases
articles.description: The ACT has recorded nine new locally acquired COVID-19 cases.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: Cosmetic surgeon Daniel Lanzer agrees to stop practising medicine, days after Four Corners investigation
articles.description: The shock announcement comes days after an investigation uncovered allegations of disturbing practices at the dermatologist's clinics including hygiene and safety breaches and procedures that had left patients with ongoing physical and psychological issues.
articles.author: Adele Ferguson and Lauren Day

articles.headline: Victorians warned they could remain without power into next week after violent storms
articles.description: More than 100,000 Victorian homes and businesses spend a cold night without power after severe storms ripped through the state.
articles.author: Adele Ferguson and Lauren Day

articles.headline: The new Japanese PM is facing an early election test, but will voters even turn up?
articles.description: Just 53.7 per cent of eligible voters took part in the last Japanese general election, with turnout particularly low among people in their 20s. Here are four things to look out for in today's vote.
articles.author: Liam Butterworth

articles.headline: How phone taps shed light on Berejiklian and Maguire's undeclared relationship
articles.description: On her first day in the witness box at the Independent Commission Against Corruption's inquiry into her conduct, former premier Gladys Berejiklian has been confronted with an extraordinary catalogue of intercepted calls between her and her former secret boyfriend, Daryl Maguire.
articles.author: Liam Butterworth

articles.headline: Afghan girls learning to code 'underground' to bypass Taliban curbs on education
articles.description: Some Afghan girls and women log on to secret online lessons each day, but there are fears of increased surveillance by the Taliban.
articles.author: Liam Butterworth

articles.headline: Our best chance to stop global warming is approaching. Here's what it means if it fails
articles.description: On our current trajectory, we will heat the world by 1.5C in less than a decade, the United Nation's climate change panel has found. And if we don't act now, cooling the world will be increasingly hard.
articles.author: Michael Slezak

articles.headline: 'Best feeling in the world': Australians returning home after being locked out for 20 months
articles.description: Australians describe the feeling of being able to travel again as "surreal" but those who spoke to the ABC say they remain uneasy about changing rules and regulations as international borders to NSW and Victoria reopen.
articles.author: Sarah Gerathy and Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: Morrison on the defensive over French subs deal, after brief tête-à-tête with Macron
articles.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison and French President Emmanuel Macron cross paths for the first time since Australia tore up its $90 billion submarine contract with French shipbuilder Naval Group.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn and Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Two serial killers struck fear in a traumatised nation. But was one woman the real target of their crimes?
articles.description: They were the two serial killers who plagued America's capital in a post-911 world. But terror fears and racism in the case of the Beltway snipers have confused their place in history.
articles.author: Lucia Stein and Rebecca Armitage

articles.headline: This Icelandic priestess practises a Viking-era religion, and it's on the rise
articles.description: Iceland's parliament tried to ban the nation's "first religion" 1000 years ago. But this pagan belief system is making a comeback.
articles.author: Siobhan Marin

articles.headline: Should we judge Shakespeare by today's standards? These questions are not easily answered
articles.description: Does pluralism, liberalism, democracy, freedom of expression and rule of law shine a way forward or obscure a dark past that still haunts us today, asks Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: Cleo Smith's anguished parents face court of public opinion
articles.description: The shocking disappearance of a vivacious four-year-old in the Australian outback is an ongoing source of trauma for her anguished parents, writes Andrea Mayes, and being subject to social media commentary isn't helping.
articles.author: Andrea Mayes

articles.headline: After a year of darkness, Australia's Hindu community prepares to celebrate its 'festival of lights'
articles.description: After a difficult year, Australia's Hindu community is preparing to observe Diwali, the "festival of lights" that celebrates new beginnings and the triumph of light over darkness.
articles.author: Dong Xing

articles.headline: Xiaohe went through China's hotel quarantine system. Here's what that looked like
articles.description: China is adhering to its COVID-zero policy and that could leave many Chinese Australians who are eager to go back facing a tough choice.
articles.author: Kai Feng

articles.headline: From coal hero to net zero: How does a leader do it?
articles.description: Scott Morrison's climate 'plan' reveals a spectacular new model of political leadership in Australia — and our next election is going to look very different from the last, writes Annabel Crabb.
articles.author: Annabel Crabb

articles.headline: Two demonstrators shot dead as thousands protest military takeover in Sudan
articles.description: Protesters carried Sudanese flags and chanted "military rule can't be praised" and "this country is ours, and our government is civilian" as they marched in neighbourhoods across Khartoum.
articles.author: Annabel Crabb

articles.headline: 'On very good form': UK PM Johnson looks to allay fears about Queen's health
articles.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson says despite doctor's orders to rest, the Queen is "on good form" amid concerns about her health.
articles.author: Annabel Crabb

articles.headline: England hand Australia humiliating Twenty20 World Cup loss
articles.description: England give Australia a lesson in Twenty20 cricket at the World Cup as a top order collapse triggers a loss that could have lasting implications on Australia's tournament.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Bert Newton's wedding to Patti was so popular police had to hold back the crowds
articles.description: It was Melbourne's own Berti-mania as television personalities Bert Newton and Patti McGrath tied the knot in Camberwell on November 9, 1974.
articles.author: Sarah Motherwell

articles.headline: Tributes flow for 'ultimate entertainer' Bert Newton
articles.description: Television icon Bert Newton is being remembered as a "giant of the industry" and the "ultimate entertainer" after he died in Melbourne on Saturday at the age of 83.
articles.author: Dan Smith and Jason Dasey

articles.headline: Bert Newton, Gold Logie-winning entertainer and television star, dead at 83
articles.description: Bert Newton, the colourful mainstay of Australian television who graced the nation's screens for more than 50 years, is dead aged 83.
articles.author: Dan Smith and Jason Dasey

articles.headline: Green helps WA to Shield triumph as Qld, Victoria also post wins
articles.description: Cameron Green is again amongst the runs in Western Australia's Sheffield Shield win over South Australia, as the men's Ashes fast approach.
articles.author: Dan Smith and Jason Dasey

articles.headline: Incoming Paralympics Australia boss targets top spot on Brisbane 2032 medal tally
articles.description: Catherine Clark won't begin as Paralympics Australia chief executive until January, but she has already set the organisation's sights on preparing for the Brisbane Paralympic Games.
articles.author: Daniela Intili

articles.headline: Brisbane pummelled with hail as 'mini-cyclone' lashes Muckadilla
articles.description: Brisbane is pummelled by hail and hit with winds of up to 100 kilometres per hour as a fast-moving storm barrels through, while a "mini-cyclone" hits the small town of Muckadilla.
articles.author: Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: Two Canberra men jailed for confining, attacking man owing $75 drug debt
articles.description: One of the men filmed the other bashing the victim with a tyre iron in the boot of a stolen car, before leaving him stranded with no shoes or phone.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: G20 endorses global corporate minimum tax at Rome summit
articles.description: The agreement aims to discourage multinationals from stashing profits in countries where they pay little or no taxes, but a critic says the rate is only "a little more" than those in tax havens.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: 'I've got one last request': Outgoing CHO's final message as Queensland records zero new cases of COVID-19
articles.description: Queensland has recorded no new cases of COVID-19 as the deadline looms to be fully vaccinated by the time the state's borders reopen.
articles.author: Ashleigh Stevenson

articles.headline: Horse euthanased after falling from float on Adelaide's South Eastern Freeway
articles.description: Adelaide's South Eastern Freeway was closed to outbound traffic after a horse fell off its float onto the road on Sunday afternoon.
articles.author: Ashleigh Stevenson

articles.headline: McGowan says COVID-19 booster vaccines available in Western Australia from Monday
articles.description: West Australian Premier Mark McGowan says booster shots of COVID-19 vaccines will be available from Monday, with no requirement to book an appointment.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: Tim Smith MP resigns from Victorian shadow cabinet after drink driving car crash
articles.description: Tim Smith apologises for the "serious error of judgement" after his licence was suspended for crashing his car while more than twice over the legal blood-alcohol limit.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: Vaxxed families in NSW no longer need to isolate if their child is a COVID close contact at school
articles.description: Parents and siblings will no longer need to stay at home for a fortnight if a child is identified as a close contact of a COVID case a school, the education minister has announced.
articles.author: Cecilia Connell

articles.headline: Angus Taylor refuses to detail cost to taxpayers of 2050 climate plan
articles.description: The federal Energy Minister says funding for the government's plan for net zero emissions by 2050 only stretches as far as 2030, saying what future governments do in the 2040s "is a matter for them".
articles.author: Matthew Doran and Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Ash Gentle wins Noosa Tri, puts Olympic disappointment behind her
articles.description: Ashleigh Gentle secures an eighth Noosa Triathlon title, putting a tough Olympics behind her to extend her dominance at the event, while Luke Willian won it for the first time.
articles.author: Matthew Doran and Nour Haydar

articles.headline: 'I just threw up': Severe weather triggers terrified residents
articles.description: When Luise Manning heard what sounded like her new roofing rattle during a recent storm, she found herself hunched over, vomiting, and dry retching from stress.
articles.author: Edwina Seselja and Craig Zonca

articles.headline: Dev Patel is a reluctant knight pitted against a supernatural foe in the Green Knight
articles.description: This subversive take on the Arthurian ‘quest’ skewers any romantic notions and instead probes at the cost of ‘great deeds’.
articles.author: Keva York

articles.headline: Tasmania starts standing aside health workers as 99pc meet COVID vaccine mandate
articles.description: A total of 170 health staff in Tasmania fail to provide the required vaccination evidence by the deadline, with almost 40 permanent nurses being stood aside.
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: Barcelona star Sergio Agüero sent to hospital after suffering chest pains
articles.description: Barcelona star Sergio Agüero is sent to hospital after suffering chest pains in his side's 1-1 LaLiga draw with Alavés.
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: One person dead, three in critical condition after boat accident off Wollongong coast
articles.description: Emergency crews raced to Sandon Point Beach, near Bulli, about 10:20am today after reports of a boat with seven males onboard had capsized.
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: Meet the millions of people who aren't employed, who aren't considered 'unemployed'
articles.description: These are the reasons why hundreds of thousands of people who want to work, don't actively look for work.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Gold Coast police probe bikie links after weekend shooting, multiple stabbings
articles.description: Gold Coast police are investigating possible bikie links after two men suffered critical injuries during a fight near a popular beachside restaurant precinct.
articles.author: Sarah Cumming

articles.headline: How vets decide whether a horse is fit enough to run in the Cup
articles.description: As Australia's most famous race approaches, the focus is on equine safety and the processes to make sure horses are fit. Check out what vets look for when deciding if racehorses can be cleared to race in the Melbourne Cup.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: ACT records another seven COVID-19 cases, with nine people in hospital with the virus
articles.description: The ACT records nine new locally acquired cases of COVID-19, with five people in intensive care requiring ventilation.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: Bert Newton will be farewelled in Victorian state funeral
articles.description: Television icon Bert Newton will receive a state funeral, Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews confirms, calling the personality "an icon, a larrikin and a born entertainer".
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: Fowl play after egg farmer adopts rescue dogs to protect flock
articles.description: Four Maremmas have left their city homes to get to work in the country, where they earn their keep guarding chickens from predators.
articles.author: Jane McNaughton

articles.headline: 'She was my friend': Alec Baldwin breaks silence on death of Halyna Hutchins for first time on camera
articles.description: Actor Alec Baldwin speaks publicly for the first time on camera about the accidental shooting that killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins, in a video released by TMZ.
articles.author: Jane McNaughton

articles.headline: It's not too late to have your COVID-19 vaccine in Queensland
articles.description: As the days tick over towards December 17, a key vaccination milestone for family and friends entering the state in time for Christmas, pressure is mounting to get Queenslanders fully vaccinated.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: Former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian faces a second day of questioning at the state's anti-corruption watchdog
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING:  Ms Berejiklian returns to the stand for a second day of evidence as the anti-corruption commission examines whether she breached the ministerial code by failing to declare her relationship with fellow MP Daryl Maguire.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: This week is Diwali. Here's how you can celebrate The Festival of Lights
articles.description: The five days of Diwali are celebrated as faith, food, fireworks, family and charity come together during the festive season.
articles.author: Widia Jalal

articles.headline: Do I need a mask, how many visitors can I have? Here are the rules this Melbourne Cup Day
articles.description: However you're planning to enjoy the public holiday, here's a quick reminder of what you will and will not be able to do as life in Victoria slowly begins to resemble pre-COVID times.
articles.author: Widia Jalal

articles.headline: 'Humanity faces stark but clear choices': COP26 climate kicks off in Glasgow
articles.description: China, Russia and Brazil – three of the world's biggest carbon emitters – are not attending, but senior officials from those countries are expected to participate.
articles.author: Widia Jalal

articles.headline: 'Why can't young couples buy homes?' asked a newspaper in the 1960s. The clue is in the fine print
articles.description: A nation that once prided itself on its egalitarianism and its high levels of home ownership is experiencing rising inequality, due to a growing chasm of wealth between those who own homes, and those who never will, writes Stephen Long.
articles.author: Stephen Long

articles.headline: Beetle mania alive and well as young Queenslanders bond over love of bugs
articles.description: When Izaac Boyan unearthed "Herbie" it was love at first sight — but little did the shy Central Queenslander know that his passion would be shared by others his age.
articles.author: Erin Semmler and Jasmine Hines

articles.headline: Once known as 'Drama Jana', now Dr Pittman continues to surprise
articles.description: Jana Pittman was once the "next big hope" for Australian athletics, but by the time the 2004 Olympics were done, she was "Drama Jana". This is how the world champion hurdler went from pariah to "queen".
articles.author: Susan Chenery and Ben Cheshire

articles.headline: French president accuses PM of lying about submarine contract
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has accused Scott Morrison of lying about the $90 billion submarine contract that was cancelled six weeks ago.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn and Matthew Doran

articles.headline: As America tries to kickstart its economy, it has one big problem — workers are walking off the job
articles.description: From factories to the front lines of the pandemic, American workers are fed up with dangerous conditions, stagnant wages and rising inequality. Now, they're making it known.
articles.author: Joanna Robin and Kathryn Diss

articles.headline: How Australia came to be known as a climate change 'laggard'
articles.description: Over time, Australia's international reputation on climate change has been mixed, with ups and downs along the road. But one thing is for sure — Australia goes to Glasgow with a lot of baggage, writes Michael Slezak.
articles.author: Michael Slezak

articles.headline: How the RBA allowed Australia to become a servant to property prices in a $9 trillion market
articles.description: Having created the biggest real estate bubble in history, our very own Reserve Bank now has its hands tied ahead of its November meeting, writes business editor Ian Verrender.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: International borders are reopening with quarantine-free travel, but not everyone is happy
articles.description: While borders are reopening for quarantine-free international travel for Australian citizens and residents, uncertainty remains for more than 1.6 million visa holders in Australia who have so far been left out of the government's plans.
articles.author: Hellena Souisa

articles.headline: Kris hasn't seen her partner in WA for months. Now she's been approved for travel to Europe
articles.description: Australians will be free to travel overseas from this week for the first time in 18 months, but back home, state border closures are still keeping many families apart.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: Eve was the 'shy' kid at school. Then one night she disappeared without a trace
articles.description: Eve Askew was 14 years old when, one night, she disappeared from her bedroom and was never seen again. Her brother thinks she met with foul play and that the killer "will strike again".
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: Membership changes to Victoria's peak medical body labelled 'disastrous'
articles.description: A new budget membership option introduced by the Victorian AMA has baffled medical professionals, who are criticising it as a damaging move for the industry.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: McDonald's franchisee accused of deliberately denying young workers paid breaks
articles.description: Ben Wescombe was 15 when he started work at McDonald's and says he never received a paid rest break. His union says young workers were exploited and it is taking legal action against the franchisee.
articles.author: Jessica Longbottom

articles.headline: G20 commits to carbon neutrality by around 2050, Prince Charles says trillions needed to fight climate change
articles.description: Member countries also agreed to end public financing for coal power abroad, but not domestically. Speaking in Rome, Prince Charles urged leaders to listen to the "despairing voices" of young people on climate change.
articles.author: Jessica Longbottom

articles.headline: Family and friends share memories of Australian television icon Bert Newton
articles.description: Tributes for the late Bert Newton pour in from around the country, as those who knew him best reflect on the laughs, the memories and the man behind the scenes.
articles.author: Jessica Longbottom

articles.headline: Australian Test player Peter Philpott dies aged 86
articles.description: Australian Test leg spinner and highly accomplished coach Peter Philpott has died after complications from a fall, aged 86.
articles.author: Jessica Longbottom

articles.headline: Warne challenges Smith's selection in Aussie T20 World Cup line-up
articles.description: After the disappointing loss to England, Shane Warne questions whether Steve Smith deserves to be in Australia's XI at the men's T20 World Cup.
articles.author: Jessica Longbottom

articles.headline: Kankurang initiation rite teaches boys discipline and respect in Gambia
articles.description: Young children run at the fearsome sight of the Kankurang, but in Gambia the figure symbolises a spirit that provides order and justice and is considered a protector against evil.
articles.author: Jessica Longbottom

articles.headline: 'What's wrong with saying that?': Some of Bert Newton's most memorable (and controversial) moments
articles.description: Bert Newton had decades of memorable on-screen moments, many of which delighted and entertained audiences in their thousands. Some were a little more awkward than others.
articles.author: Jessica Longbottom

articles.headline: Cute but not cuddly: Dingo pups emerge from their dens on K'gari-Fraser Island
articles.description: They may look like they'd be happy to be patted, but these dingo pups are apex predators, so it's best to keep your distance. See them exploring the wild on K'gari-Fraser Island.
articles.author: Johanna Marie

articles.headline: Beach handball officials scrap bikini rule after outcry
articles.description: A campaign that brought together the Norwegian women's beach handball team, thousands of supporters around the world and pop superstar Pink has a win, with officials scrapping requirements for female players to wear bikini bottoms.
articles.author: Johanna Marie

articles.headline: Police sift through roadside bins to leave 'no stone unturned' in search for Cleo Smith
articles.description: Police search through rubbish collected from roadside bins and declare they will 'never give up hope' of finding Cleo Smith as they continue their investigation into the four-year-old's disappearance.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: 'Gone further than we expected': Hongkongers in Australia offered new pathway to permanent residency
articles.description: The Australian government opens a pathway to permanent residency for Hongkongers, including temporary skilled, temporary graduate and student visa holders.
articles.author: Joshua Boscaini and Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Person behind wheel of this 4WD holds key to Queensland murder mystery, police say
articles.description: Two new images of a Toyota LandCruiser seen leaving the property where the body of 31-year-old mother Rene Latimore was found could be crucial in identifying her killer, police say.
articles.author: Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: In search of a stable life: Plan to rehome hundreds of brumbies from Victorian Alps
articles.description: Parks Victoria will remove all the Bogong High Plains brumbies, and increase the removal rate of feral horses from the eastern Alps, under a plan to protect vulnerable species.
articles.author: Erin Somerville

articles.headline: Liberal MPs who quit party should pay back campaign money: proposal
articles.description: South Australia's Liberal Party is considering punishing party defectors by making them pay back some of the money spent on their election campaigns, after Adelaide Hills MP Dan Cregan quit the party last month.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: 'I don't want to be in care, I want to be with you Mum': Coronial inquest begins into suicide of boy in state care
articles.description: A coronial inquest into the death of a 13-year-old boy who committed suicide while in state care has heard South Australia's Department for Child Protection made critical failures.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Excited Broken Hill residents drive 250km only to discover SA border shut
articles.description: The decision to bar New South Wales residents from entering the state was announced online 90 minutes after the rule came into effect.
articles.author: Callum Marshall, Bill Ormonde, and Andrew Schmidt

articles.headline: WA country football player sentenced for umpire assault
articles.description: The court heard former AFL-listed ruckman/forward Daniel Murray chased and assaulted an umpire after receiving a red card at the match in July.
articles.author: Sean Tarek Goodwin

articles.headline: Big business 'sniffs' the green dollar at COP26
articles.description: Climate change conferences were once the domain of scientists and bureaucrats. Now, they are increasingly attended by big business delegations eyeing off the 'green dollar'.
articles.author: Andy Park

articles.headline: 1,000-kilometre Bibbulmun Track record smashed in gruelling 'run, crawl and scramble'
articles.description: Erika Lori blitzes one of the world's longest walking trails, from Perth to Albany, in just 10 and a half days — shaving half a day off the record set by her coach.
articles.author: John Dobson

articles.headline: The Melbourne Cup explained: When is it, how to watch, favourites, prize money and more
articles.description: It's nearly the first Tuesday in November, so that means it's Melbourne Cup time — but when does it start, how long will the race take, how big a crowd will be there and what is the prize money? Here's your guide to Australia's most famous race.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: 'Extremely angry': Opposition Leader 'bitterly disappointed' over MP's drink-driving incident
articles.description: Victorian Liberal Leader Matthew Guy says he is "extremely angry and disappointed" about MP Tim Smith's weekend drink-driving incident, while federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg says it is "clearly unacceptable".
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Just the beginning for the Parkes Dish, six decades on
articles.description: The Parkes Dish will help NASA return to the moon, 60 years after the radio telescope helped broadcast the first time humans stepped foot on the lunar surface.
articles.author: Tim Fookes

articles.headline: Tasmanian farmland returns to Australian ownership in $120m deal
articles.description: Farmland in Tasmania's north-west is back in Australian hands for the first time in almost 200 years, as a family-led operation moves in.
articles.author: Lachlan Bennett and Alexandra Humphries

articles.headline: 'We are the guinea pigs': Albury-Wodonga fears outbreak will worsen as Sydneysiders return
articles.description: Regional Victoria welcomes back vaccinated Sydneysiders from today, but one border community worries it could be "bad news".
articles.author: Charmayne Allison and Sandra Moon

articles.headline: Jacinda Ardern relaxes NZ restrictions despite record number of cases
articles.description: Despite New Zealand recording 162 new cases of COVID-19, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern announces some restrictions in Auckland will be relaxed next week.
articles.author: Emily Clark

articles.headline: G20 was a win for those opposed to strong action on climate change, but the fight’s not over yet
articles.description: The crucial COP26 climate conference in Glasgow has been declared to be dead by some before it even starts after the G20 nations failed to deliver any strong commitments at their Rome meeting. But such pronouncements may be premature, Michael Slezak writes.
articles.author: Michael Slezak

articles.headline: Jeannette Young sworn in as Queensland's Governor
articles.description: In a letter to Queenslanders, Jeannette Young said it had been an "absolute honour" to be the state's chief health officer and described the journey as challenging, rewarding and, at times, stressful.
articles.author: Emilie Gramenz

articles.headline: Australia to recognise more international vaccines for travel, restrictions
articles.description: More vaccines used overseas but not in Australia are formally recognised by the national medical regulator, paving the way for international visitors in the coming months.
articles.author: Emilie Gramenz

articles.headline: The 10,000m rule, the 'hit-and-run' or something in between — what does a horse's Melbourne Cup prep look like?
articles.description: On the eve of the Melbourne Cup, we look at how past winners have prepared for the big race, and how the approach trainers take for the lead-up to Flemington has changed.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: 18yo jockey in induced coma after Kalgoorlie racecourse fall
articles.description: Apprentice jockey Hannah Fitzgerald remains in a critical condition at Royal Perth Hospital after a tragic incident at Kalgoorlie racecourse on Saturday.
articles.author: Amelia Searson

articles.headline: What will life be like for South Australia once borders are open?
articles.description: Modelling by the University of Adelaide looking at the number of hospitalisations and deaths from COVID is released to South Australians, but what does it all mean?
articles.author: Sara Garcia

articles.headline: Japan's newly minted PM defies expectation in big election victory
articles.description: Despite taking some notable hits, Japan's newly elected Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and his long-ruling Liberal Democratic Party defied expectations to retain a majority.
articles.author: Sara Garcia

articles.headline: Cattle and real estate markets are bullish. So would you buy a house or a cow?
articles.description: While house prices have climbed, beef prices have exploded. Loxton stud breeder Alizah Fogden and her partner decided to use some of the money they had saved for a house deposit to buy more cows.
articles.author: Eliza Berlage

articles.headline: Daughter of woman missing for 43 years just wants 'continual nightmare' to end
articles.description: Kathryn Gray was eight years old when she last saw her mum and, while the memories have begun to fade, the pain of not knowing what happened to her remains.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: Texas anti-abortion bounty hunter law a work of 'sinister genius' proving hard to challenge
articles.description: The US Supreme Court is facing hearings on abortion laws that promise to set the parameters for the most dramatic month for reproductive rights in three decades.
articles.author: Kathryn Diss

articles.headline: ANU college denies it failed in its duty of care over former student's sexual assault
articles.description: The Australian National University's John XXIII College is appealing the ACT Supreme Court's finding that it failed in its duty of care after a former student was sexually assaulted.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: 'Organoids' could take the guesswork out of finding the most-effective neurological drugs
articles.description: About a third of people with epilepsy never achieve effective seizure control, but University of Queensland researchers hope they can soon end the trial and error of treatment and better predict the drug combinations for individual patients.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: From last in Toowoomba to Melbourne Cup favourite. This is the rise of Incentivise
articles.description: The five-year-old goes into the Cup on the back of nine straight wins, a streak that began with his maiden victory in April. But his career hasn't always been glorious wins and big pay cheques.
articles.author: Anthea Moodie

articles.headline: Families will be forced to isolate for 14 days at home if just one member gets COVID-19 in Queensland
articles.description: Queensland Health Minister Yvette D'Ath says "opening up" will only work if the state continued to test, trace, isolate and quarantine.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: Queensland's unvaxxed workers could be a legal timebomb, lawyer warns
articles.description: One of Australia's top employment lawyers says Queensland businesses could be at risk of costly legal headaches if their unvaccinated workers spread COVID-19.
articles.author: Owen Jacques

articles.headline: 'It's unfair': The millionaires who want to pay more tax
articles.description: House prices and the share market have ballooned, but wages are barely growing — a combination widening the gap between those who make money from assets and those who make it from labour.
articles.author: Daniel Ziffer

articles.headline: From neglected child to takeover target, what a mega deal says about aquaculture
articles.description: Moves by a global meat processing giant to take over a local salmon-farming champion suggests Australia's fledgling aquaculture industry is finally growing up.
articles.author: Daniel Mercer

articles.headline: Tasmania has been racing to the 80pc fully vaccinated target. Will it cross the finish line today?
articles.description: In September, Tasmanian Premier Peter Gutwein declared the state was in a race to reach 80 per cent fully vaccinated against COVID by Melbourne Cup day. Is the state likely to reach that milestone today?
articles.author: Kate Ainsworth

articles.headline: Sophia loved the high she got from buy now, pay later services — until she couldn't make repayments
articles.description: Popular buy now, pay later services — two of the biggest players being Afterpay and Zip — are continuing to grow in popularity. However, if you're toying with the idea of opening an account, or multiple accounts, read on to find out the risks first.
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: Online subscription services for the pill providing convenient alternative, but doctors warn of risks
articles.description: For some women, seeing a doctor to renew their script for the contraceptive pill can be costly, inconvenient and in some instances, just straight out stressful, but new online subscription services are providing an alternative.
articles.author: Georgia Hitch

articles.headline: 'I can literally never forget': Prachi and Hai lost their loved ones to COVID but their fight isn't over
articles.description: The ABC spoke to five people from around the world about the toll COVID-19 has taken, both on their communities and on them personally.
articles.author: Erin Handley, Som Patidar, Sastra Wijaya, Catherine Graue, and Bang Xiao

articles.headline: Sunshine forecast, roses in bloom as crowds return to Flemington for the 2021 Melbourne Cup
articles.description: For the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic began, thousands of Melbourne Cup fans will descend on Flemington today to watch in person the race that stops a nation.
articles.author: Melissa Brown

articles.headline: She lived to 104 but Moi-Yo Miller's adventures included performing magic in Berlin when World War II began
articles.description: The world of stage magic in Australia was a male affair, until Esme Levante, Myrtle Roberts and Moi-Yo Miller came along.
articles.author: Nick Baker and Sacha Payne

articles.headline: Boris Johnson tells Glasgow climate summit world is facing 'doomsday'
articles.description: The planet will face "doomsday" if world leaders do not pull off a "James Bond" victory, UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson says at the official opening ceremony of the climate summit in Glasgow.
articles.author: Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: 'I have no regrets': Hong Kong activists go on trial over banned Tiananmen Square vigil
articles.description: Media tycoon Jimmy Lai and the seven others face charges over their roles in an unauthorised vigil marking the Tiananmen Square massacre in Beijing.
articles.author: Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: 'I'm not going to cop sledging': Morrison rejects French criticism over submarine deal
articles.description: Scott Morrison takes aim at what he describes as the French government's "sledging" of Australia, rejecting President Emmanuel Macron's assertion he lied to him about the $90 billion submarine contract.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn and Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Biden tests negative for COVID following press secretary's positive result
articles.description: US President Joe Biden returns a negative COVID test after being tested on his way to the COP26 climate talks in Glasgow.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn and Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Indigenous justice advocate named NT Australian of the Year in moving ceremony
articles.description: The woman described as the "driving force" behind an agreement aimed at reducing Indigenous incarceration rates and improving justice outcomes in the Northern Territory has been named the 2022 NT Australian of the Year.
articles.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

articles.headline: British bank boss steps down over report into Epstein links
articles.description: Barclays chief executive Jes Staley steps down following a report by UK regulators into his ties with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
articles.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

articles.headline: Perth mother jailed after eight-year-old almost died from sexually transmitted infection given to her by stepfather
articles.description: A Perth mother will spend at least three years behind bars after failing to protect her eight-year-old daughter, who almost died from a sexually transmitted infection after being molested by her stepfather.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: 44yo accused of murdering lifelong best friend with samurai sword faces trial
articles.description: The court heard Damian Beckerleg and James Reimers had been close mates since they were five, but an afternoon of fishing and drinking earlier this year ended with what the defence called an "extraordinary and tragic" death.
articles.author: Georgia Loney

articles.headline: 5 million people have officially died from COVID-19. But who's not being counted?
articles.description: Five million people — or the equivalent of New Zealand's entire population — have succumbed to COVID-19 worldwide. But that's only the official tally, with the real death toll likely to be as much as four times higher, writes Casey Briggs.
articles.author: Casey Briggs and Maani Truu

articles.headline: Unexplained gas funding timeline a 'very dark day for the Commonwealth', Federal Court judge says
articles.description: Lawyers for environmental advocates question whether the federal government fast-tracked an agreement to provide funding to a gas company in a bid to hinder legal action challenging the grant.
articles.author: Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: Attorney-General owns land 'across the road' from forest impacted by port decision, committee hears
articles.description: A former managing director of the company behind a proposed port on Kangaroo Island tells a parliamentary inquiry Attorney-General Vickie Chapman should have excused herself from the decision-making process.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Elon Musk says he'll donate billions to fight world hunger, but only if a UN agency meets his conditions
articles.description: Elon Musk, the world's richest person, says he will donate $US6 billion to the UN's initiative to address world hunger if the global body can meet his terms around transparency and accounting.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Former NT police officer found not guilty of aggravated assault
articles.description: The Alice Springs Local Court heard Chris Tencate was using his taser to create a light show for his infant son during his lunch break and he denied using the weapon to scare his wife.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: Man charged with attempted murder over violent fight in Darwin suburb
articles.description: Police charge three men — one of them with attempted murder — after a Karama fight that allegedly involved a number of people armed with poles and edged weapons.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: PM makes each-way bet on climate change at COP26
articles.description: While Australians put their money on horses today, Scott Morrison had a wager of his own: An each-way bet that $20 billion in technological investments will either fix the climate crisis, or at least convince other nations Australia is doing enough.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: Man shocked at process to get through WA hard border as he arrives in Perth to see sick mother
articles.description: A man who made it through WA's hard border to see his sick mother commends the WA Government for wanting to keep people safe, but says he's shocked at the process he had to go through to make it home to Perth.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: 'Shocked and saddened': Alec Baldwin's assistant director calls for reform
articles.description: Rust assistant director David Halls releases a statement to the New York Post,  saying he is shocked and saddened by the October 21 death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins in New Mexico and the industry must "reevaluate its values and practices".
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: World leaders agree to stop deforestation by 2030
articles.description: More than 100 leaders representing more than 85 per cent of the world's forests agree to end logging but environmental activists are calling for swifter action.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: Vax named 2021's word of the year by Oxford dictionary
articles.description: The explanation for this word's vast expansion is simply viral. No word better captures the atmosphere of the past year than vax.
articles.author: Sarah Motherwell

articles.headline: 'Some of the biggest waste in the nation's history': Questions over $38b in JobKeeper handouts
articles.description: Analysis by the federal Parliamentary Budget Office found that $38 billion in JobKeeper payments went to employers that did not suffer sustained downturns below threshold levels.
articles.author: Dan Conifer

articles.headline: Foster carer details financial troubles in 13yo SA boy's suicide coronial inquest
articles.description: The former foster carer of a 13-year-old boy who took his own life while in state care tells a coronial inquest that he was unable to care for him because he could not make ends meet.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter and Claire Campbell

articles.headline: France's President is calling Scott Morrison a liar. How did we get here?
articles.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has been called a liar by French President Emmanuel Macron while on the international stage. But did Mr Morrison mislead the French over his intentions on the submarine deal, or was the arrangement already dead in the water?
articles.author: Mahalia Carter and Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Women's and Children's Hospital reveals number of unvaccinated staff, protesters gather in Adelaide CBD
articles.description: The CEO of Adelaide's Women's and Children's Hospital reveals 133 staff have refused to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and have been forced to take leave. Meanwhile, dozens of anti-mandatory vaccination protesters rally in the CBD.
articles.author: Sarah Mullins

articles.headline: What caused Hobart's spooky Halloween sunset?
articles.description: Trick or treaters across Hobart on Sunday saw an eerie sight in the evening sky that mirrored the spooky streets below. But the answer to what caused the strange clouds is fairly straightforward.
articles.author: Will Murray

articles.headline: Australia's most decorated Olympian Emma McKeon's message to world leaders gathering in Glasgow
articles.description: Five-time Olympic gold medallist Emma McKeon joins Olympic and Paralympic champions with a message for world leaders gathering at the COP26 Summit in Glasgow.
articles.author: Brittney Kleyn

articles.headline: Where every horse finished in the Melbourne Cup
articles.description: The Melbourne Cup has been run and won at Flemington - here's where every one of the 23 horses finished.
articles.author: Brittney Kleyn

articles.headline: Researcher refuses vaccines because he's had a dose of his own COVID-19 jab
articles.description: An Adelaide medical researcher who has developed and been administered with his own COVID-19 vaccine says he is facing the sack because of his refusal to get one of the TGA-approved jabs.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Man who allegedly set ex-partner on fire likely used accelerant, court told
articles.description: Medical experts have given evidence in the attempted murder trial of a man who allegedly set his partner alight, saying the pattern of her burns indicates an accelerant was used.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Verry Elleegant secures the biggest win of her career, winning the Melbourne Cup
articles.description: Despite never winning beyond 2,400m going into the race, Verry Elleegant has secured the biggest win of her career with Melbourne Cup glory at Flemington.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Ho ho ho turns to no no no as Queensland restrictions slay Santa bookings
articles.description: A Santa hire business has copped a near 80 per cent drop in bookings as Queensland's COVID restrictions cast a pall over the holiday season.
articles.author: Cathy Border and Kimberley Bernard

articles.headline: Councillor calls for review of children's books about racism, gender identity
articles.description: Anti-racism and LGBTQIA+ campaigners reject a Toowoomba councillor's calls to remove children's books discussing discrimination from library shelves.
articles.author: David Chen

articles.headline: Why the most important part of Berejiklian ICAC hearings is actually a little boring
articles.description: The ICAC hearings into Gladys Berejiklian's conduct weren't as explosive as previous probes, but they shone an important light on process, writes state political reporter Ashleigh Raper.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper

articles.headline: Cleo snatched in ‘opportunistic attack’, police believe, as phone footage places her at camp on night in question
articles.description: Police believe missing four-year-old Cleo Smith was snatched by an opportunistic offender as they work to eliminate from the investigation more than 110 people who were camping nearby at the time.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Reserve Bank may be pressured to lift interest rates as early as 2022
articles.description: Markets are betting the Reserve Bank will be forced to lift interest rates sooner than expected in order to contain higher inflation, despite a slow pick-up in wages.
articles.author: David Chau

articles.headline: Australian dollar tumbles after RBA decision, ASX to follow Wall Street higher
articles.description: The Australian dollar fell to 74.3 US cents as the market regarded the Reserve Bank's decision as "dovish", while Wall Street is on track to end its day at record highs.
articles.author: David Chau

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: Doctor's association backs delayed freedoms for unvaccinated
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: The AMA says the NSW government's decision to delay freedoms for unvaccinated residents might be the push some people need to get their first jab.
articles.author: David Chau

articles.headline: 'Our most vulnerable group of people': COVID-19 vaccination mandate needed for aged care visitors, peak body says
articles.description: The peak body for aged care centres wants a mandate brought in for visitors to be vaccinated against COVID-19 but experts are divided.
articles.author: David Chau

articles.headline: Here we go again: Another wet, stormy trough on the way
articles.description: A trough extending from the Great Australian Bight all the way to the tropics is set to bring another soggy few days and the chance of storms as it sweeps across the country.
articles.author: Kate Doyle

articles.headline: Australia refuses to join global pledge to cut methane emissions
articles.description: Australia snubs one of the key global actions to come out of the UN climate change conference by bowing out of an international pledge to reduce methane emissions.
articles.author: Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: 'Not unusual it never gets seen again': Boat missing in Tasmania may not be found, says expert
articles.description: The body of missing Tasmanian man Thomas Courto and the boat he was travelling in are still missing. So how does a boat just vanish in Bass Strait without a trace?
articles.author: Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: Foreign Minister to visit South-East Asia to ease fears over nuclear submarine plan
articles.description: Marise Payne is expected to visit Indonesia, Malaysia, Cambodia and Vietnam in the coming days to calm anxieties about Australia's nuclear submarine program and bed down a new strategic partnership with ASEAN.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Who's hot, who's not at WBBL halfway mark?
articles.description: It's the halfway mark in the WBBL regular season, so who's hot, who's not and who's just starting to warm up? Which teams are likely to make a move in the second half of the competition?
articles.author: Duncan Huntsdale

articles.headline: 'Clean up our own backyard': Australian miners ramp up plans to cut carbon emissions
articles.description: Fossil fuels are fast losing favour in Australia as some of the country's biggest miners shift to a greener business model.
articles.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

articles.headline: The Australian bushfire survivor taking on Scott Morrison at the Glasgow climate summit
articles.description: Jo Dodds knows what it is like to be on the climate change frontline, so she went to COP26 to pressure governments into doing more about the crisis.
articles.author: Ashleigh Barraclough

articles.headline: Vaccines for children are coming. These are the frontrunners
articles.description: As vaccination rates across the world creep higher, children are about to get their turn, with the United States due to green-light Pfizer for five year olds.
articles.author: Ashleigh Barraclough

articles.headline: Frydenberg warned less than three months into JobKeeper that millions were going to firms with rising turnovers
articles.description: The ABC confirms the federal Treasurer was alerted less than three months into JobKeeper that businesses were getting taxpayer support for six months while increasing their turnovers.
articles.author: Dan Conifer

articles.headline: Australia looks like a climate laggard, as other countries ramp-up efforts
articles.description: The government is confident Australia will cut emissions by more than 26 per cent below 2005 levels by 2030, but data shows our ambition is insufficient by almost any measure.
articles.author: Michael Slezak

articles.headline: 'He needs help, not kicked when he's down': Mum's fight for son's mental health
articles.description: A Tasmanian mother describes the state's Child and Adolescent Mental Health Service as "a joke" after being told there was no psychologist on staff in the region to help her son.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: 'You're going to feel seen': New movie puts Western Sydney on the map
articles.description: A new film which intertwines the stories of eight Western Sydney writers seeks to capture the richness of life in a sometimes forgotten and misunderstood part of Australia.
articles.author: Rani Hayman

articles.headline: 'Leave it a better place': How tourism can help combat climate change
articles.description: Tourism operators might be hoping for a return to normal but a sustainable tourism expert says there is an even better option.
articles.author: Simon Leo Brown and Victoria Pengilley

articles.headline: The EU is about to put Australia back on the emissions hook with a carbon tariff
articles.description: A carbon tariff is a carbon tax applied to exports from countries like Australia that don't have one. And Europe is planning to impose one, whether our politicians like it or not, writes Peter Martin.
articles.author: Simon Leo Brown and Victoria Pengilley

articles.headline: 'Made in China' might be cheap, but it comes with a human cost
articles.description: Heavy consumption in the world's largest economies could be responsible for nearly 2 million premature deaths globally from air pollution every year, according to new modelling.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: At least 25 killed as blasts, gunfire hit Kabul hospital
articles.description: The explosions happened at the entrance of the 400-bed Sardar Mohammad Daud Khan hospital, according to a Taliban spokesperson, who says four of the attackers were killed by security forces.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: New figures reveal almost 400 healthcare workers across SA are refusing to be vaccinated against COVID-19
articles.description: Almost 400 South Australian health sector workers have been forced to take leave after refusing to be vaccinated against COVID-19, according to figures released by SA Health.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Beds and medical services cut as Queensland hospital workers defy COVID-19 vaccination mandate
articles.description: Of the state's 108,000 Hospital and Health Services workers, 3,830 — or 3.54 per cent — have provided no evidence of a COVID-19 vaccination and are not on leave, forcing cuts to surgical, medical and mental health beds, Queensland Health data obtained by the ABC shows.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Search underway after fisherman falls out of tinnie into Queensland dam
articles.description: Specialist divers have been dispatched to help look for the man, who fell out of his boat earlier today.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: How will Macron's 'liar' claim play out with Morrison's voters?
articles.description: Scott Morrison's spat with the French President is bad for his international reputation. But on the home front, the PM will reckon on neutralising Emmanuel Macron's allegation,  writes Michelle Grattan.
articles.author: Michelle Grattan

articles.headline: Meet the high-ranking Indigenous soldier blazing a trail in the military
articles.description: Lieutenant Colonel Eileen Hall, who's been honoured at a ceremony attended by the top brass at her home country in far north Queensland, wants to inspire not only First Nations people but all women to consider a military career.
articles.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath

articles.headline: Cleo Smith case 'breaks all the rules' of child abduction, criminologist says
articles.description: A criminology expert says old-fashioned police work and a million-dollar reward helped find Cleo Smith, whose 18-day disappearance broke "all the rules" of a typical child abduction case.
articles.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath

articles.headline: 'Everyone just had tears of joy': Carnarvon locals celebrate Cleo Smith's return
articles.description: Celebrations are in full swing in Carnarvon as locals breathe a collective sigh of relief over the safe return of Cleo Smith, who was found alive this morning after vanishing from the Blowholes campgrounds more than two weeks ago.
articles.author: Jessica Warriner

articles.headline: Expat races to see dying mum after receiving 11th-hour quarantine exemption
articles.description: Paul Stewart's journey from London to reunite with his dying mother has not been an easy one due to the NT's strict border rules.
articles.author: Jedda Costa

articles.headline: 'We're going to take you to see your mummy and daddy': Heartwarming video of moment Cleo is rescued released by police
articles.description: Police release a heart-warming video of the moment officers rescued four-year-old Cleo Smith, who had been missing for 18 days.
articles.author: Andrea Mayes

articles.headline: Las Vegas Raiders release NFL player after fatal car crash
articles.description: Henry Ruggs III — a rising star in the NFL — is let go by the Raiders following his involvement in a fatal motor vehicle accident in Las Vegas.
articles.author: Andrea Mayes

articles.headline: Attorney-General denies conflict of interest around Kangaroo Island house near plantation
articles.description: South Australian Attorney-General Vickie Chapman tells a parliamentary committee she received rental income from a property that would have been affected by a major port development which she subsequently blocked.
articles.author: Stacey Lee and Eric Tlozek

articles.headline: South Australian mother who tried to kill autistic son released into community
articles.description: A South Australian single mother who was "having great difficulty in coping" when she tried to kill herself and her son is released into the community on licence.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Probe finds 'poor leadership', lack of enthusiasm for safety at Caboolture hospital
articles.description: Empathy training is recommended for all staff at Caboolture Hospital after a probe finds there was poor leadership and a lack of enthusiasm for safety and quality.
articles.author: Kate McKenna

articles.headline: Videos of high school student brawl sparks investigation
articles.description: Tasmania Police are investigating after footage emerged of a fight involving a large number of students at a Hobart high school, with a cyber-bullying expert warning the videos being circulated will only add to the harm.
articles.author: Will Murray

articles.headline: Scott Morrison may want to 'move on', but leaking Macron’s private texts only ensures French fury will linger
articles.description: The Prime Minister may have felt justifiably injured after being branded a liar on the world stage, but this was the time for a cool head, not a hot one, writes Andrew Probyn.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn

articles.headline: Police release hospital photo of Cleo Smith as officer recounts 'best moment of his career'
articles.description: Police post a photo of a smiling Cleo Smith in hospital as the officer who found her in a house in Carnarvon recounts the incredible story of her rescue.
articles.author: Gian De Poloni

articles.headline: Darwin shooter apologises in court, explains why he pleaded guilty
articles.description: Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann, who has pleaded guilty to murder and manslaughter, says there are two key reasons why he changed his plea from not guilty to guilty mid-trial.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Changes to Queensland's border rules flagged as $1m stimulus comes into play
articles.description: Motorists may be waved through Queensland's southern border when the state opens up next month. Meanwhile, struggling business owners are cheering a timely new round of discount vouchers.
articles.author: Heidi Sheehan, Tara Cassidy, and Alexandria Utting

articles.headline: House where Cleo Smith was found unremarkable, but today it's the nation's focus
articles.description: The house where missing four-year-old Cleo Smith was found is unremarkable in every way, yet today it is the centre of one of the biggest police investigations in West Australian history.
articles.author: Andrea Mayes and Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: 'Move on, frankly': PM says he has no intention of apologising to French President over sub decision
articles.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says he will not apologise to France after President Emmanuel Macron accused the PM of lies and deceit over a cancelled submarine deal.
articles.author: Jake Evans

articles.headline: Penrith Panthers sack NRL premiership winner Tyrone May
articles.description: The NRL premiers cut ties with May, saying his conduct on social media after the club's grand-final victory "constituted a serious breach of his contractual obligations".
articles.author: Jake Evans

articles.headline: Man who used cattle prod to inflict 'sadistic' violence against partner jailed
articles.description: A man who assaulted his former partner with a cattle prod, threatened her with a gun and forced her to sleep outside has been found guilty of 12 counts of rape and three counts of aggravated assault.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: Aussie batting star Pucovski 'unlikely' to play first Ashes Test
articles.description: Will Pucovski is ruled out of Victoria's next Sheffield Shield match as he continues his recovery from concussion, putting the Test batter in doubt for the men's Ashes opener next month at the Gabba.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: Atlanta Braves win World Series to snap 26-year drought
articles.description: For the first time since 1995, the Atlanta Braves are crowned World Series champions, after thrashing the Houston Astros in game six in Houston.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: WA's COVID roadmap to be released on Friday, on the eve of NSW border rules easing
articles.description: The WA government will release a roadmap on Friday for transitioning to living with COVID-19, a day before it downgrades New South Wales from an "extreme risk" state to "high risk".
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine and Tom Wildie

articles.headline: Former minister spent more than $18k in one year paying for Labor memberships, IBAC hears
articles.description: An electorate officer of former Victorian Labor minister Marlene Kairouz tells a corruption hearing the member for Kororoit would spend thousands of dollars a year on branch stacking by paying for other people's party memberships.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine and Tom Wildie

articles.headline: Federal Court slams criminal case against ANZ as a 'complete shemozzle'
articles.description: Prosecutors ditch a long-running criminal case against ANZ and one of its senior executives after the Federal Court describes the matter as a "complete shemozzle" and "fairly pointless".
articles.author: David Chau

articles.headline: 'Abysmal job of running health': Outback doctor has had enough
articles.description: A doctor on the Eyre Peninsula says he can no longer tolerate working in a system which he says has little respect for frontline medical and nursing staff.
articles.author: Evelyn Leckie

articles.headline: Resources Minister not required to consider climate change when awarding gas grant, lawyers argue
articles.description: Lawyers for the federal government are arguing the Resources Minister was not required to consider the risks of climate change when determining whether to award $21 million in grants to a gas company.
articles.author: Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: The journey to Cleo Smith being found
articles.description: Police spent 18 days trying to find little Cleo Smith after she disappeared from the remote Blowholes campsite. Here's how the search unfolded.
articles.author: Sarah Motherwell and James Carmody

articles.headline: Today's forecast: Cloudy with a strong chance of confusion
articles.description: Have you ever changed social plans due to a prediction of rain that never came? It might be that you misinterpreted the forecast. So, as outdoor socialising returns, we ask the Bureau of Meteorology, how can we tell if it's really going to rain?
articles.author: Matilda Marozzi

articles.headline: Eight million Australian homes aren't energy efficient. Many occupants are battling change
articles.description: Eight million Australian homes contribute to 18 per cent of Australia's carbon emissions, a new report shows. Enacting any major change is especially hard for renters and people in low-income households.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: Maria James's family calls for a priest's exhumation, if DNA testing doesn't offer answers
articles.description: At a fresh coronial inquest into the death of a Victorian woman, the coroner warns the family of Maria James they may not get the answers they hope for, however, the answers may be found in a laboratory.
articles.author: Rachael Brown

articles.headline: Australia has a submarine-shaped hole in its defences, and few options to fill it
articles.description: The navy faces a looming headache on how to replace its ageing submarine fleet, one that a hurt French ambassador warns could create a 20-year hole in Australia's defences.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: An important detail Morrison omits when he says Australia barely contributes to global warming
articles.description: China's President was a no show at the Glasgow climate summit. It didn't go unnoticed by world leaders, but pointing the blame at China conveniently leaves out an important detail when it comes to global emissions.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: Australia was planning to phase out caged eggs by 2036, but one state is threatening to derail that
articles.description: Australia's long-awaited plan to phase out battery hens may be in doubt because of a so-called "captain's call" by a state minister, documents obtained under FOI laws reveal.
articles.author: Amy Bainbridge and Alison Branley

articles.headline: Carnarvon residents describe man taken into police custody over Cleo Smith disapperance
articles.description: Local residents give details about the man living in the house where Western Australia Police found Cleo Smith.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: How can one side of an island get far more rain than the other?
articles.description: Meteorologists tend to refer to stream weather quite frequently in Tasmania — but what is it? And how does it makes the west wet, and the east dry?
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Launceston's GroWaverley food charity shutting down, unable to keep up with demand
articles.description: A popular community run food co-op has been providing much needed relief to those unable to afford fresh food, filling a gap in vital community services. However, the volunteers running the co-op can no longer keep it running.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: Everything you need to know about ICUs and the battle to keep COVID-19 patients alive
articles.description: It's the part of the hospital where health professionals provide specialised and critical care to those who need it most. If you're a COVID-19 patient, it's the last place you want to end up.
articles.author: Ruby Cornish

articles.headline: Hope burns a little brighter as Diwali arrives for pandemic-weary Australian family
articles.description: The COVID-19 travel ban separated Parteek Mittal and Kanu Aggarwal from their youngest child. Now that Diwali has arrived, it's time to put the darkness behind.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: 'It's the best news the town could have asked for': Despair turns to joy for Carnarvon
articles.description: Searchers head to the local to pub to celebrate after four-year-old Cleo Smith found alive and well.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: What a palliative care doctor has learnt about delivering bad news
