articles.description: After having a painful experience as a junior doctor, Kathryn Mannix learnt how to handle important or 'tender' conversations more successfully.
articles.author: Sophie Kesteven

articles.headline: As Australia's border restrictions lift, I'm nervous about returning home. Here's why
articles.description: Australia may be starting to reopen its borders, but after months of yearning to come home, I find myself nervous about the prospect of returning. I wonder how I can sit at Christmas or Easter lunch knowing the person passing the salt thought it was reasonable to leave me in the wilderness during an international crisis, writes Rebekah Ison.
articles.author: Sophie Kesteven

articles.headline: It turns out whales eat a lot more than we thought — but that's a good thing
articles.description: Whales consume three times more food than previously thought, and their role in ocean ecosystems and the impact of whaling may have been vastly underestimated.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: It's hard to remember a PM's trip running off the rails so spectacularly
articles.description: The Prime Minister was yesterday imploring everyone to "move on" from Australia's diplomatic row with France over the submarine deal. Perhaps they soon will. But it's difficult to see much prospect of repair in the relationship while Morrison and Macron are both in power, writes David Speers.
articles.author: David Speers

articles.headline: Meet the detective who found Cleo Smith
articles.description: Cameron Blaine has worked on some of WA's most high-profile murders, and his appearance in a heartwarming police video of the moments after Cleo Smith was found has endeared him to many.
articles.author: Andrea Mayes

articles.headline: How police discovered the 'needle in the haystack' that led them to Cleo Smith
articles.description: Meticulous police work — rather than an accidental sighting or pure chance — led officers to a home in Carnarvon where they discovered missing WA girl Cleo Smith.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Scandinavian nations to confront past crimes against Indigenous people
articles.description: The governments of Sweden and Finland are setting up truth commissions to examine the countries' past treatment of and abuses against the region's Sami minority.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Israeli court halts auction of Auschwitz tattoo kit
articles.description: An Israeli court suspends the auction of a partial tattoo kit billed as having been used on inmates at the Auschwitz death camp, following an outcry from Holocaust survivors.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Thai police chief 'Joe Ferrari' charged with murder over suspect's death
articles.description: A Thai police colonel known for his extravagant collection of luxury cars and famous girlfriend is charged with killing a suspected drug dealer while trying to extort him for money.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: 'Read this': Alec Baldwin hits back at claims of 'chaos' on Rust set
articles.description: Actor Alec Baldwin shares a message on social media disputing reports of chaos and a lax attitude toward safety on the set of Western movie Rust, where he accidentally shot and killed a cinematographer.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Mooney scores breathtaking century in Scorchers' WBBL win over Renegades
articles.description: Opener Beth Mooney smashes an unbeaten 101 off just 63 deliveries, as the Perth Scorchers record a comfortable 40-run win over the Melbourne Renegades.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: China officials attempt to soothe fears after issuing notice urging families to stockpile necessities
articles.description: Chinese officials back-pedal after warning families to stockpile food in case of emergencies, after panic spread on social media.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Families 'floored' as pair of Secret Santas pay off 82 Christmas lay-bys at toyshop
articles.description: The couple, who wish to remain anonymous, told the manager of the store that they had vowed to perform such an act of kindness after struggling to pay the bills during their younger years.
articles.author: Sarah Lawrence

articles.headline: What this jockey overcame to ride in the Cup has 'amazed' his supporters
articles.description: Harry Coffey says he's never had so much support for finishing third last in a horse race. The jockey, who rode in this week's Melbourne Cup, hopes his ride inspires others with cystic fibrosis to chase their dreams.
articles.author: Richard Crabtree

articles.headline: Department of Justice fined over attacks on staff, including infamous guitar 'scalping'
articles.description: The Department of Justice and Community Safety has  been convicted and fined $100,000, for failing to provide a safe workplace at its youth justice facilities
articles.author: Shannon Schubert and Josie Taylor

articles.headline: Oliver wins record-equalling seventh Oaks after guiding Willowy to thrilling victory
articles.description: Veteran jockey Damien Oliver triumphs once again in the VRC Oaks, as the James Cummings-trained Willowy pips Douceur in a pulsating finish at Flemington.
articles.author: Shannon Schubert and Josie Taylor

articles.headline: Women who planned genital mutilation of newborn baby saw procedure as a 'gift to God', Perth court is told
articles.description: A mother and grandmother avoid jail after a Perth court is told they planned the genital mutilation of a two-week-old baby because, in their culture, the procedure was seen as 'a gift to God'.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: Fisherman charged with stealing shark detection tag from great white
articles.description: A West Australian man accused of stealing a detection tag from a white pointer he caught off the state's south coast has denied the charge.
articles.author: Kyle Pauletto

articles.headline: Parents of 'luckiest town in the world' welcome Cleo Smith's 'miracle' rescue
articles.description: Some parents at Cleo Smith's school had to figure out how to tell their kids about Cleo Smith's disappearance and rescue, while others had the good news broken to them by their children.
articles.author: Kyle Pauletto

articles.headline: 22 yo Perth quarantine breacher caught on train to Kalgoorlie avoids jail
articles.description: Bobbie-Lee Coombs, who skipped out on hotel quarantine after returning to WA from Victoria in September and was arrested after catching a train from Perth to Kalgoorlie, has avoided a prison term.
articles.author: Jarrod Lucas and Amelia Searson

articles.headline: 'I feel ashamed': Former Afghan interpreter fears for his family still stuck in Afghanistan
articles.description: Since the fall of Kabul, more than 100,000 Afghans have applied for humanitarian visas. While thousands were evacuated in August, many more remain stuck in Afghanistan.
articles.author: Alison Xiao

articles.headline: Melbourne Renegades achieve BBL first after signing Indian batter
articles.description: Unmukt Chand becomes the first Indian male Big Bash League player after signing with the Renegades for the upcoming season.
articles.author: Alison Xiao

articles.headline: Discovery of new breeding pairs gives hope to Granite Island little penguin colony
articles.description: Their numbers crashed from 1,600 to 16 in recent years and foxes almost finished the job. Now scientists are celebrating a discovery in a little penguin colony clinging to life on a South Australian island.
articles.author: Malcolm Sutton

articles.headline: Hackers access mySA GOV digital licence accounts, prompting warning from government
articles.description: Some South Australians are being urged to change their driver's licence number after hackers using stolen passwords gained access to some users' accounts on SA's digital licence platform, mySA GOV.
articles.author: Malcolm Sutton

articles.headline: Former Big Bash player used cricket to build trust with child grooming victims, court hears
articles.description: Former professional cricketer Aaron Summers pleads guilty to possessing and sending child abuse material and grooming young boys using Snapchat and Instagram.
articles.author: Kate Ashton

articles.headline: 'What I said, I stand by': Victorian Opposition Leader reiterates stance on drink-driving MP Tim Smith
articles.description: Victorian Opposition Leader Matthew Guy is standing by his public demand that embattled Kew MP Tim Smith not contest next year's state election.
articles.author: Richard Willingham and Yara Murray-Atfield

articles.headline: Pentagon warns China is growing its nuclear weapons arsenal faster than predicted
articles.description: A Pentagon report indicates China is expanding its nuclear arsenal much faster than anticipated, saying Beijing could have 700 warheads by 2027 and possibly 1,000 by 20
articles.author: Richard Willingham and Yara Murray-Atfield

articles.headline: 'Flying cars' drag race in outback SA as testing for planned aerial grand prix continues
articles.description: The drones hit speeds in excess of 100 kilometres per hour during the contest.
articles.author: Declan Gooch

articles.headline: Hunter New England Health District COVID cases surge past 100
articles.description: Thirty-six of the new cases were in the Hunter region, with the majority recorded further north.
articles.author: Madeline Lewis

articles.headline: Melbourne Cup-winning owner fined for COVID-19 breach during Flemington celebrations
articles.description: One of Verry Elleegant's owners is fined $10,000 after jumping a fence while celebrating Tuesday's victory at Flemington Racecourse.
articles.author: Madeline Lewis

articles.headline: Takeaway coffee cup DNA 'breakthrough' proves crucial in Adelaide cold case probe
articles.description: The trial in the cold case killing of Adelaide woman Suzanne Poll has heard a takeaway coffee cup proved crucial in the investigation.
articles.author: Tom Fedorowytsch

articles.headline: 'We've got her': Police release emotional audio recording of moment little girl found
articles.description: Police release an emotional audio recording of the moment they burst into a house in the WA coastal town of Carnarvon and found missing four-year-old Cleo Smith.
articles.author: Andrea Mayes

articles.headline: Ex-Labor staffer accused of child sex offences claims to have 'no interest in children'
articles.description: A former SA Labor staffer who admitted to child abuse offences made an "incredible" claim that he was under "duress" and has no sexual interest in children, a court hears.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: As Victoria's COVID vaccination rate gathers pace, how is your suburb faring?
articles.description: As Victoria's COVID-19 case numbers stabilise and the vaccination rate climbs, updated data shows how suburbs are faring against the state's targets.
articles.author: Mark Doman and Katia Shatoba

articles.headline: Tennis star Peng Shuai accuses former senior Chinese official of sexual assault
articles.description: The Chinese tennis star accuses a former senior official of forcing her into sex in a social media post that was later deleted.
articles.author: Mark Doman and Katia Shatoba

articles.headline: NSW Premier shrugs off questions over future of 'dud' dam projects
articles.description: Dominic Perrottet has told a budget estimates hearing that reports the government will walk away from the Wyangala and Mole River Dam projects are not true.
articles.author: Patrick Bell and Hugh Hogan

articles.headline: Did someone tell you QR codes were illegal? Here's all the information you need to debunk that
articles.description: A bevy of posts across social media platforms have claimed QR codes and proof-of-vaccination requirements contravene various sections of Australian law. But experts say the claims don't reflect reality.
articles.author: Ellen McCutchan

articles.headline: Australia is preparing for COVID-19 vaccines for young children — but how urgent is the need?
articles.description: As state leaders push for all children to be vaccinated by the year's end, National Cabinet mulls vaccines for younger kids. But the regulator is still waiting for details on safety and efficacy.
articles.author: Claudia Long

articles.headline: Uber drivers suspended after raising COVID-19 concerns, Senate inquiry hears
articles.description: An Uber driver who raised concerns about her passengers' compliance with COVID-19 restrictions found that her account was "deactivated" by the company shortly afterwards, a Senate inquiry has heard.
articles.author: David Chau

articles.headline: OCD rates have surged during pandemic — but it's harder to spot
articles.description: An increase in rates of obsessive compulsive disorder has been seen in both adults and children, with one Queensland clinic recording a nearly 50 per cent increase in enquiries.
articles.author: Tara Cassidy

articles.headline: 'Enough is enough': have Collingwood and the AFL acted too late on violence against women?
articles.description: Jordan De Goey has faced several charges of violence against women during his AFL career, but was not stood down by his club until last weekend.
articles.author: Kate O'Halloran

articles.headline: 'Totally mentally draining': Stranded Queenslanders struggle as they wait for state's border to open
articles.description: The wait continues for the thousands of Queenslanders locked out of the state due to ongoing COVID-19 border restrictions, as some warn of a mental health crisis.
articles.author: Stephanie Zillman

articles.headline: The people here were meant to be near the front of the vaccination queue. What went wrong?
articles.description: As Sydney's vaccination rate soared over 70 per cent, in Yarrabah it was still 24 per cent. How did this town get left behind?
articles.author: Mayeta Clark

articles.headline: Australia's largest bank is getting into cryptocurrency. Here's why its competitors aren't
articles.description: As more younger Australia's choose crypto investments to fast-track their savings, Australia's largest bank now wants a slice of the crypto investment pie. But there's a reason others are trending carefully.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: Drawing from super early and falling through the gaps: These are Australia's 'hidden' guardians
articles.description: Raising six grandchildren on her own is not how Jill picturing things going as she approached her late fifties. But she is far from alone.
articles.author: Norman Hermant and Lori Youmshajekian

articles.headline: 'Good as it gets': Despite COVID-19 respite, Australian hospitals 'overwhelmed' as states prepare for Delta influx
articles.description: Australian hospitals are already overwhelmed and falling behind, even with the "once-in-a-generation" slowdown in patient numbers that came with COVID-19, an AMA report finds.
articles.author: Nick Sas

articles.headline: Can Australia untangle its climate mess? You decide
articles.description: Here's how Australia could become a renewable superpower by 2030. Sounds too good to be true? You tell us.
articles.author: Tim Leslie, Ben Spraggon, Joshua Byrd, and Annika Blau

articles.headline: Sad decline of 'athletic, talented' child detailed in coroner's report
articles.description: Tasmania's coroner reveals the harrowing story of a man who began life as an "athletic and talented child" but who died, aged 36, from complications of morbid obesity after suffering a long battle with mental illness.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Kylie was against getting vaccinated. But something changed her mind.
articles.description: Tasmania is about to reach a significant COVID-19 vaccination milestone, with 90 per cent of the state's population over 16 having had at least one dose. But as the state moves closer to opening, vaccination rates for a vulnerable section of the population is lagging.
articles.author: Ellen Coulter

articles.headline: It took authorities months to act when part of an iconic Great Ocean Road town's surf club washed away
articles.description: The Wye River Surf Life Saving Club lost a $150,000 ramp when the river diverted and water lapped at the building, and locals are frustrated by how slow authorities were to respond.
articles.author: Ellen Coulter

articles.headline: Victorian government to 'make illegal logging legal' after tweak to laws
articles.description: Victoria's water catchments will now have fewer protections against logging, after a change to the legislation by the Andrews government which will allow the practice in previously off-limits areas.
articles.author: Michael Slezak

articles.headline: After two years of pandemic pain, hope is shining for these year 12 students
articles.description: Many of them have weathered one of the longest periods of lockdown in the world. Now, Victoria's class of 2021 is graduating, with some hard-earned wisdom from their extraordinary final years at school.
articles.author: Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: 'A greater awareness of our fragility': John Bell on the role of cultural leaders and the arts after COVID
articles.description: It's six years since Bell stepped down from the company he co-founded, but the octogenarian actor is showing no signs of slowing down.
articles.author: Simon Leo Brown

articles.headline: When missing children return: How can we avoid adding to Cleo Smith's trauma?
articles.description: The miraculous rescue of four-year-old Cleo Smith prompted a nationwide sigh of relief this week. Now it's time to ensure the aftermath of the ordeal doesn't add to her trauma, writes Louise Newman.
articles.author: Simon Leo Brown

articles.headline: Tiger King's Joe Exotic says he has 'aggressive cancer'
articles.description: Joseph "Joe Exotic" Maldonado-Passage, who gained fame in the Netflix documentary Tiger King, posts a message to social media saying he has been diagnosed with "aggressive" prostate cancer.
articles.author: Simon Leo Brown

articles.headline: Detectives face long road ahead to piece together Cleo Smith abduction puzzle
articles.description: WA police achieved a major milestone when they laid charges against Cleo Smith's kidnapper, but their work is far from over as they painstakingly unravel the events that led to her being held captive in a Carnarvon house.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Eternals review: Star power and celestial ambition can't save dull, formulaic Marvel blockbuster
articles.description: Oscar-winning Nomadland director Chloe Zhao wrangles Marvel's most diverse cast to date, but cannot escape the superhero-movie straitjacket.
articles.author: Luke Goodsell

articles.headline: Coalition member hits out at PM over Macron, climate change on Q+A
articles.description: Greens leader Adam Bandt compares the Prime Minister's appearance at the COP26 summit to a "cigarette salesman in a cancer ward" as Scott Morrison's stoush with the French President is questioned by a fellow Coalition member.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: 'Trajectory's not good': Great Barrier Reef bleaching study returns worrying results
articles.description: Repeated bleaching events are reducing the Great Barrier Reef's ability to recover and scientists say the events must be viewed as interconnected.
articles.author: Holly Richardson

articles.headline: UK approves Merck's antiviral COVID pill in world first
articles.description: Britain becomes the first country in the world to approve Merck's COVID-19 antiviral pill, molnupiravir.
articles.author: Holly Richardson

articles.headline: Football great and Port Adelaide veteran Russell Ebert dies at age 72
articles.description: Port Adelaide Football Club veteran and football great Russell Ebert has died from leukemia at the age of 72.
articles.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Man charged with sexual assault of a young child in a remote NT community
articles.description: Northern Territory Police charge a man over an alleged sexual assault of a young child in East Arnhem.
articles.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: ABBA releases new comeback album Voyage after 40-year hiatus
articles.description: Swedish pop sensation ABBA has made a comeback with their new album Voyage, nearly 40 years after they split up, with a digital avatar concert eventually planned in London.
articles.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Lost moose leaps through classroom window in Canada
articles.description: Students in the Canadian province of Saskatchewan got an up-close lesson on the animal kingdom yesterday, when a moose crashed through the window of their school.
articles.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Geelong signs former Adelaide Crows forward on two-year deal
articles.description: The Cats are looking to revive Tyson Stengle's AFL career, following his sacking from the Crows earlier this year.
articles.author: Tom Fedorowytsch and Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: 'I didn't sleep last night': Residents devastated by compulsory acquisition of homes for North-South Corridor
articles.description: The state government has sent letters to residents whose properties will be compulsorily acquired as part of the last installment of the North-South Corridor.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie and Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: 'Game on': Tourism critical of WA's roadmap while business calls on community to get vaccinated
articles.description: There's a mixed reaction to the government's roadmap to opening WA's borders, with tourism operators expressing disappointment and the business lobby urging the community to get vaccinated.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Scott Morrison COP26 gaffe goes viral on Chinese social media
articles.description: Scott Morrison's cops a backlash on Chinese social media after referring to "global momentum to tackle China" instead of "climate change" during a COP26 speech.
articles.author: Joshua Boscaini and Iris Zhao

articles.headline: Reserve Bank sees wage growth hitting fastest pace in years — by 2023
articles.description: The RBA says Australia's economy is recovering strongly from recent lockdowns, which bodes well for employment and wages growth.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: The big game George R R Martin is working on just got a trailer. Here's what you need to know
articles.description: Elden Ring, the big new game that Game of Thrones creator Geroge R R Martin is working on, got a new trailer today. Here's what you need to know about it.
articles.author: Peter Marsh

articles.headline: 'Hospitals can't cope already': AMAQ warns of border opening's impact on health services
articles.description: Cancer diagnoses will be delayed and routine elective surgery will "almost certainly" be cancelled in public hospitals when the Queensland border reopens and COVID-19 cases rapidly surge, the AMAQ warns.
articles.author: Peter Marsh

articles.headline: Farmers 'cautiously joyous' after Queensland food bowl is deemed no place for 'big, dirty coal mine'
articles.description: After years of anti-mine lobbying, the Minister for Resources finds there is no place in Bundaberg for a coking coal mine. But already, farmers are vowing to fight any appeal by exploration company Fox Resources.
articles.author: Lucy Loram

articles.headline: Sydney's inner-west light rail shut down for up to 18 months due to cracks
articles.description: NSW Transport Minister Rob Stokes says all 12 light rail vehicles used on the inner-west service will be out of action following the discovery of cracks last month.
articles.author: Lucy Loram

articles.headline: New York mayor-elect Eric Adams says he wants to be paid in bitcoin
articles.description: Eric Adams says he wants his first three pay cheques as New York mayor to be paid in bitcoin and he will work to make the city the "centre of the cryptocurrency industry".
articles.author: Lucy Loram

articles.headline: A multimillion-dollar Canberra arts precinct has been delayed as the government drops developer
articles.description: A multi-million dollar investment in the arts across the ACT has been delayed, after the government dropped the developer on the project.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford and Harry Frost

articles.headline: A US nuclear-powered attack submarine hit something underwater – now its two senior officers have been fired
articles.description: The USS Connecticut, a nuclear-powered fast-attack submarine, was reported to have struck an "object" underwater in early October under the busy shipping lanes of the South China Sea.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford and Harry Frost

articles.headline: Gold Coast must lift jab 'game', Palaszczuk says, as schoolies vax hubs considered
articles.description: The Premier has taken aim at flagging rates on the border as the government prepares a social media campaign to target young people who haven't been immunised.
articles.author: Dominic Cansdale and Julie Clift

articles.headline: Jordan De Goey to 'vigorously defend himself' after being charged in the US
articles.description: The Collingwood AFL player releases a statement via his lawyer after being charged in the United States last weekend.
articles.author: Dominic Cansdale and Julie Clift

articles.headline: 'Tears of joy' in High Court as Johnson & Johnson loses bid to take pelvic mesh appeal further
articles.description: Pharmaceutical giant Johnson & Johnson has its bid for an appeal to a Federal Court ruling thrown out of the High Court. Lawyers for thousands of women who are part of a class action for compensation say they hope the company takes steps to end drawn-out legal proceedings.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne and Phoebe Hosier

articles.headline: NT government pulls vaccination stats from website, admits remote region data was inflated
articles.description: The Northern Territory government removes regional vaccine data from its website after being asked why there was a discrepancy of more than 50 per cent compared to the federal government's figures.
articles.author: Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: House with window to the stars wins top architectural prize
articles.description: An accessible custom-designed home in the NSW Blue Mountains, whose roof opens to a view of the Milky Way, wins a top prize as one of the nation's best designed homes — the Robin Boyd Award for Residential Architecture.
articles.author: Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: ABC announces more jobs, funding for regional and rural journalism
articles.description: Managing director David Anderson says the cash injection will allow bureaus to deliver more local content across platforms.
articles.author: Joanna Woodburn

articles.headline: NASA unveils asteroid-fighting spacecraft as it prepares for Armageddon-style mission test
articles.description: The spacecraft will be launched later this month on a test mission to determine whether crashing into an asteroid can change its trajectory.
articles.author: Joanna Woodburn

articles.headline: Father-of-three handed five-year jail term over $500k tax fraud
articles.description: An Adelaide man who made up employers and income to defraud the Australian Tax Office out of half a million dollars has been jailed for five years.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Tasmania hopeful of hosting Ashes Test if Perth is ruled out
articles.description: Tasmanian cricket officials are expecting the fifth men's Ashes Test to be staged in Hobart should it be moved from Perth because of COVID-19 border restrictions.
articles.author: Chris Rowbottom

articles.headline: Net run rate to give cricket fans sore heads tonight, but a better tie breaker may be just over the rope
articles.description: It may determine the T20 World Cup semi-finalists tonight, but fans can be forgiven for asking: How does net run rate work again?
articles.author: Jack Snape

articles.headline: Lockdowns have ended in Sydney and Melbourne so why are many businesses still struggling?
articles.description: The scarcity of international students has a significant impact on hospitality and other industries in Australia, with some forced to reduce operating hours while others struggle with understaffing.
articles.author: Farid M Ibrahim and Dong Xing

articles.headline: 'Wellness warriors' and misinformation blamed for vaccine lag in wealthy suburbs
articles.description: Some of Melbourne's richest areas are among the least vaccinated in Victoria, figures show, with the trend leaving local doctors concerned about what is to come.
articles.author: Kristian Silva

articles.headline: It's a 'priority' technology in Australia's net zero plan. Critics say it's a 'scam'
articles.description: Part of Australia's net zero by 2050 plan is to use carbon capture and storage to help get emissions down from burning coal and gas. But is it a realistic option?
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: 'Oratory can affect the course of history': What Shakespeare's words have taught John Bell over the years
articles.description: Shakespeare's work has become a secular Bible for actor and director John Bell. Over the past 60 years, it's taught him about empathy, ambition, leadership and the power of language.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: 'COP26 is a failure': Thunberg leads youth from round the globe in Glasgow protests
articles.description: Students skip school to join teenage activist Greta Thunberg in a youth-led rally outside the COP26 climate change conference, with thousands demanding greater action from world leaders.
articles.author: Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: Morrison returns from Glasgow a significantly reduced figure at home and abroad
articles.description: Somewhere along the way, the idea that Scott Morrison and his government should be judged on how they are protecting the national interest rather than playing the political game seems to have been well and truly lost, writes Laura Tingle.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: The weight of a nation's relief hangs heavily on Cleo and her family
articles.description: No one wants to be that helicopter parent. But then little Cleo is snatched and your carefully constructed, self-confident world falls in, writes Virginia Trioli.
articles.author: Virginia Trioli

articles.headline: Nuvali will turn 30 just before 2050. Here's what her world could look like
articles.description: Summer hibernation, sweltering days, more natural disasters. As the world watches Glasgow, is this the future for Australia’s children?
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: Rise of a superpower: How politics, COVID and the birth of an industry will shape Beijing 2022
articles.description: In 2008, the world watched as China announced itself on the Olympic stage as a power on the rise. Now 14 years on, the ascension has been swift — and it has ramifications for Beijing 2022, writes Tracey Holmes.
articles.author: Tracey Holmes

articles.headline: Remote WA town steamrolled by media attention as Cleo Smith rescued
articles.description: Usually the small, banana-growing town of Carnarvon is barely worth a pit stop on the 15-hour drive from Perth to the glorious Ningaloo Reef, but the miraculous discovery of little Cleo Smith suddenly attracted the attention of the whole world.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: As many Vietnamese scrape by, a government minister eats $1,000 steak wrapped in gold leaf in London
articles.description: A video showing Salt Bae feeding a powerful Vietnamese official morsels of steak smothered in gold leaf at a luxury London restaurant sparks anger in the South-East Asian country, where the average person earns a few dollars a day.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: Injured SA workers to receive higher compensation payouts thanks to High Court ruling
articles.description: Injured South Australian workers will be entitled to hundreds of millions of dollars' worth of additional compensation following a High Court ruling against ReturnToWorkSA.
articles.author: Candice Prosser

articles.headline: If you support Taiwan's independence, China won't let you into the mainland, Hong Kong, or Macau
articles.description: The Chinese government says it has drawn up a list of people who support Taiwan's independence. It's the first time it has articulated punishment for this view.
articles.author: Candice Prosser

articles.headline: Floods kill at least six people in Indonesia as thick mud hampers relief efforts
articles.description: Flash flooding caused by torrential rains on Indonesia's main island of Java have killed at least six people, with three others missing.
articles.author: Candice Prosser

articles.headline: Kangaroo Island Mayor storms out of parliamentary inquiry after refusing to answer lawyer's questions
articles.description: Describing it as a "complete circus", Michael Pengilly storms out of a parliamentary committee looking into Vickie Chapman's refusal of a port on Kangaroo Island.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Death row inmates sue Japan, saying same-day notification of executions is 'inhumane'
articles.description: In what is believed to be a first, two prisoners facing the death penalty say the practice of being told they will be executed that day is illegal.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: 'We can almost hear the grass growing': Outback NT gets a drenching
articles.description: Some stations surpass their highest daily November rainfall, coming as a welcome relief for many after the Territory's third-warmest October on record.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: 'Our family is whole again': Cleo's parents speak for the first time since her rescue
articles.description: Cleo Smith's parents speak out for the first time since the four-year-old was rescued, saying they are "so thankful that our little girl is back within our arms".
articles.author: Kate Christian

articles.headline: Man charged with historical rape of young girl, adding to charges for more than 20 alleged stalking offences
articles.description: An Adelaide man who allegedly stalked women he met through dating apps and social media is in custody after being charged with sexually assaulting an underage girl.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Cambage escapes fine, suspension following Nigerian team incident
articles.description: Opals star Liz Cambage is handed a formal reprimand after an independent review finds she "brought Basketball Australia into censure" during a pre-Olympic clash with Nigeria.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: NT police use pepper spray on protestors at anti-vaccine rally in Darwin
articles.description: Hundreds of protesters demonstrating against mandatory vaccines clash with NT police, who use capsicum spray to disperse them during a standoff in Darwin.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Renegades beat the Heat in record WBBL run-fest
articles.description: The Melbourne Renegades post a team total of 4-207 against the Brisbane Heat — the second-highest in WBBL history — to secure a 15-run victory.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Champion sprinter Nature Strip cruises to victory in the VRC Sprint Classic at Flemington
articles.description: Jockey James McDonald has been the star of the final day of the Melbourne Cup Carnival, riding Nature Strip to victory in the VRC Sprint Classic and winning the Mackinnon Stakes on Zaaki.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Western Bulldogs AFLW players, staff in isolation following positive COVID-19 case
articles.description: A confirmed positive COVID-19 case in the Western Bulldogs' AFLW ranks forces the entire program into isolation, two months out from the start of the season.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: London 'Million Mask March' protesters burn effigy of Boris Johnson, set off fireworks
articles.description: The anti-capitalist event coincides with Guy Fawkes celebrations in the UK, with many of the protesters wearing masks bearing the face of the man behind the gunpowder plot of 1605.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Aussie Parker wins gold at World Triathlon Para Championships
articles.description: Paralympic silver medallist Lauren Parker becomes just the fifth Australian to successfully defend a world paratriathlon championship, with a stunning victory in Abu Dhabi.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Man missing after shark attack at Port Beach in Fremantle
articles.description: Water police and rescue helicopters are searching for a man after a shark attack off Port Beach in Fremantle.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Images reveal a slow-motion burial in Canary Islands volcano no-go zone
articles.description: As residents of La Palma flee their destroyed communities, one photographer captures the final moments of some homes before they are engulfed with volcanic ash and lava.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: 'I refuse to believe': Brazilian singer's death in plane crash met with shock
articles.description: Marília Mendonça dies in a plane crash on her way to a concert, triggering an outpouring of sadness and shock on social media from Brazilian sport stars, fans and politicians.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: England players arrive in Australia for Ashes series
articles.description: England players and staff will spend two weeks in a Gold Coast resort with exemptions to train at Carrara after landing in Australia for the Ashes.
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: Search for clues in the investigation into Cleo Smith's abduction far from over
articles.description: Forensic police officers at the centre of the investigation into Cleo Smith's abduction are expected to spend at least the next week at the Carnarvon house where she was found.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Pfizer says its antiviral pill cuts severe risk of COVID by nearly 90 per cent
articles.description: Pfizer will ask regulators for the pill to be made available for global use as soon as possible after clinical trials suggested it was 89 per cent effective in cutting the risk of hospitalisation and death from COVID-19.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: NT records one new COVID case as source of current outbreak remains unknown
articles.description: The Northern Territory records one new case of coronavirus, a 21-year old woman who recently arrived in Darwin from Cairns, on day two of lockdown restrictions in Katherine and a lockout in Greater Darwin.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Family breaks down as video of Ahmaud Arbery's last minutes shown at trial of men accused of murdering black jogger
articles.description: On the opening day of arguments, prosecutors reveal footage of the 25-year-old's fatal shooting, saying he was "under attack" when three white men in pickup trucks chased him through a neighbourhood in Georgia.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Richard Williams was in a dark place. Then he found adaptive mountain bikes
articles.description: The bikes are typically three-wheeled and low to the ground, meaning that not all trails can cater for the riders with a disability. But in WA that's starting to change.
articles.author: Kate Stephens

articles.headline: Woman charged with starting six fires on South Australia's Yorke Peninsula
articles.description: A 48-year old Minlaton woman is charged with six counts of starting a bushfire after the Country Fire Service responded to the blazes near Maitland yesterday.
articles.author: Kate Stephens

articles.headline: Step back in time when the 'romantically adventurous' ventured underground
articles.description: From adventurous honeymooners trekking by candlelight to a feminist discovering the fossil of a seven-foot-six megafauna kangaroo during a sit-in, Ngilgi Cave in Western Australia's South West is rich in history.
articles.author: Zachary Bruce

articles.headline: The Brookes family did things the old-fashioned way right to the end
articles.description: When the Brookes family decided to sell their Port Fairy hardware store of 45 years, they refused countless lucrative offers until they found a buyer who would keep the 100-year-old business alive.
articles.author: Emily Bissland

articles.headline: War on viruses over for Victoria's sentinel chickens after decades of bloody service
articles.description: After almost half a century on the front line in the battle against mosquito-borne viruses, the feathery guardians of Robinvale are being re-roosted to start from scratch.
articles.author: Kellie Hollingworth

articles.headline: Come for a selfie, stay for a drink: WA's state art gallery reopens
articles.description: A new gold lift, a rooftop with 360-degree views of Perth's city skyline and more than 100 new artworks are just some of the changes aimed at creating a more welcoming space.
articles.author: Emma Wynne and Joanna Trilling

articles.headline: Queensland records a fourth community case of COVID-19 in Goondiwindi cluster
articles.description: The unvaccinated woman is the fourth person in the Queensland border town to test positive this week. All cases have been linked to a woman from the NSW town of Moree who had crossed the border to go shopping.
articles.author: Emma Wynne and Joanna Trilling

articles.headline: Australia reaches 80pc double-dose vaccination target
articles.description: Eighty per cent of eligible Australians aged 16 and over have now received two doses of a COVID-19 vaccine, Scott Morrison says.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: Fence falls on patrol car as man tries to escape police in Adelaide
articles.description: Police are searching for a man who damaged a patrol car and fence before a pursuit in Adelaide's north early this morning.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Cleo Smith's case touched the nation. But not all missing children's cases will have the same outcome
articles.description: When Cleo Smith was found, a collective sigh of relief was felt across the country. Sadly, not all who are searching for their missing children will experience the same outcome. Warning: This story contains the name and image of a deceased Indigenous person.
articles.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

articles.headline: Archaeologists find 'slaves' room' in Pompeii villa
articles.description: Italy's culture minister, Dario Franceschini, says the find is an "important discovery" that enriches knowledge of "the level of society still little known".
articles.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

articles.headline: 'Slow-motion car accident on repeat': Diplomats uneasy as France-Australia relationship takes a nosedive
articles.description: While some diplomats sympathise with France's position, others worry there are much bigger concerns at play — like regional security in the Indo-Pacific.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Biden finally seals the deal on $1 trillion infrastructure package
articles.description: US President Joe Biden hails the passage of his trillion-dollar infrastructure package as a "monumental step forward for the nation" after fellow Democrats resolved a months-long standoff in their ranks to finally seal the deal.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: 'Master of my own destiny': Why this conservative town is embracing a radical renewables program
articles.description: The historic wheat and sheep farming town of Katanning is embarking on a community energy project to change not just how it gets electricity, but who gets the money.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: A powerful symbol of history holds a warning for Australia
articles.description: The Angel of History is a warning to Australia that we cannot look to the future when our eyes are fixed so deadly on the past, writes Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: US Secretary of State orders probe into 'Havana Syndrome'
articles.description: The US State Department has named a new coordinator for its investigation into cases of so-called Havana Syndrome, responding to increased pressure to investigate and respond to hundreds of brain injuries reported by diplomats and intelligence officers.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: More than 98 people killed by fuel truck explosion in Sierra Leone
articles.description: A fuel tanker explodes near Sierra Leone's capital, killing at least 98 people and severely injuring dozens of others, after large crowds gathered to collect leaking fuel.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: Flash flooding and hail as dangerous storms lash South Australia
articles.description: The worst of the thunderstorms developed around Whyalla before tracking across the state's Mid North and into the Riverland, causing blackouts to large parts of the state.
articles.author: Gabriella Marchant

articles.headline: Driver in hospital after allegedly breaching COVID checkpoints, sparking police pursuit in Northern Territory
articles.description: A driver has been left with minor injuries after crashing his car in an early morning incident that sparked two police pursuits amid a three-day COVID lockdown in the Northern Territory.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Australia thrashes West Indies to reach Men's T20 World Cup semis
articles.description: Australia qualifies for the T20 World Cup semi-finals as opening batsman David Warner scores an unbeaten 89 to secure victory with 22 balls to spare in Abu Dhabi.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: At least eight dead after stadium crush at Texas music festival
articles.description: At least eight people are dead and several others injured after a crowd surge at the Astroworld Festival in the US state of Texas.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Light rail suspension adds 'one more challenge' to Sydney students as images of cracks emerge
articles.description: Just weeks after returning to the classroom due to COVID-19, several Sydney schools have copped another blow with the decommissioning of the inner-west light rail due to cracking.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: Victorian quick presses Ashes selection claims in Shield clash against NSW
articles.description: Australia's pace attack for the men's Ashes appears settled, but a Victorian fast bowler is making sure his name is mentioned at the selection table should injury or poor form affect the hosts.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: Victorian fire services prepare for milder bushfire season with record funding boost
articles.description: Heavier than usual rainfall suggest Victoria will have a milder bushfire season than previous years, but fire authorities have warned residents to remain vigilant.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: NT police suffer chemical burns amid anti-vaccine protest in Darwin, as crowd pepper-sprayed
articles.description: NT police use capsicum spray on anti-vaccine protesters in Darwin's CBD, with a commanding officer saying water with "some sort of chemical" was thrown at them.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Teens witness shark attack off WA beach, search for victim continues
articles.description: WA police praise the actions of a group of teenagers for alerting emergency services, after a 57-year-old man is attacked by a shark at a Fremantle beach.
articles.author: David Weber and Keane Bourke

articles.headline: NT records no new COVID cases as lockout restrictions extended in Greater Darwin, announced for Katherine
articles.description: The NT records no new cases of coronavirus overnight, but Greater Darwin's lockout will be extended until midnight tomorrow. From 3pm, Katherine's lockdown will become a lockout, also until tomorrow night.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Exposure site list grows in NT as Territorians await decision on lockdown and lockout
articles.description: More venues are added to the NT government's public exposure site list, with residents in Katherine and Greater Darwin expected to today find out whether lockdown and lockout restrictions will end at midnight as scheduled.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Only two COVID patients in Western Sydney hospitals as major vaccination clinic shuts
articles.description: A vaccine hub in Western Sydney will close today as the government focuses on the rollout of booster shots which it expects most people to get at GPs and pharmacies.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Iraq's PM survives assassination bid by 'explosives-laden' drone
articles.description: Iraqi officials say seven security guards were injured in the attack at the PM's home in Baghdad's heavily fortified Green Zone.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Avocados dumped amid glut in domestic supply and imports from overseas
articles.description: West Australian avocado growers are dumping fruit because it's not worth the cost of packing and sending it to market.
articles.author: Jessica Hayes and Lucinda Jose

articles.headline: Cairns, Mission beach on alert as woman COVID-19 positive after travelling through Queensland
articles.description: Queensland issues contact tracing alerts for locations in Cairns and Mission Beach after a person tested positive for COVID-19 in the Northern Territory after transiting through the region.
articles.author: Emilie Gramenz

articles.headline: How many weeks does it take to find a job near you? Search this table and see
articles.description: The number of weeks it's taking to find a job is the statistic politicians should be competing over, writes Gareth Hutchens.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Four-year-old twin sisters die in house fire near Byron Bay
articles.description: Investigators are working to determine the cause of a fatal house fire in northern NSW early this morning that claimed the lives of two young sisters.
articles.author: Jean Kennedy

articles.headline: Search for man after shark attack uncovers pair of goggles, but little else
articles.description: A search for a man believed taken by a shark off a Fremantle beach so far uncovers just a pair of goggles, with authorities unsure if they belong to the swimmer.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: Five more schools exposed to COVID-19 as ACT records 13 new cases, reaches 95 per cent full vaccination
articles.description: The ACT records 13 new cases of COVID-19 with five more schools exposed to the virus. Meanwhile, the territory becomes the first Australian jurisdiction to reach 95 per cent full vaccination.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: Police investigate apparent needle spiking in Astroworld concert crush
articles.description: Eyewitnesses describe the pandemonium that unfolded in the crowd of rapper Travis Scott's Astroworld concert as at least eight people were killed in a sudden crushing incident.
articles.author: Penny Travers

articles.headline: Syphilis contact tracers overwhelmed as infection spreads
articles.description: While attention remains fixed on COVID-19, another, much older disease has been making a rapid resurgence, especially in remote Western Australia.
articles.author: Ted O'Connor

articles.headline: Still cool in summer: How passive solar ideas inspired a 1950s builder ahead of his time
articles.description: This suburban home in Perth's northern suburb of Yokine doesn't look much different from others on the street, but it was built in 1955 using solar design principles that have stood the test of time.
articles.author: Emma Wynne

articles.headline: Rallies in Glasgow and Sydney call for 'survival of humanity' in face of climate change
articles.description: Tens of thousands gather in Scotland's largest city and around the world calling for greater action on climate change as the COP26 conference continues.
articles.author: Emma Wynne

articles.headline: Mercedes in the box seat as Bottas and Hamilton lock out the front row in Mexico
articles.description: Valtteri Bottas takes a surprise pole position ahead of seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton as Mercedes lock out the front row for the Mexico City Grand Prix.
articles.author: Emma Wynne

articles.headline: Smile back on face of Redbacks cricketer who 'headbutted' propeller in fishing accident
articles.description: Tim Oakley knew with "half his face hanging off" he was in trouble as he swam for help off the Adelaide coast on a winter's day. He would end up getting 55 stitches.
articles.author: Matthew Smith

articles.headline: 'A big step backwards': United outclassed by City in dismal Manchester derby defeat
articles.description: Manchester United are soundly beaten 2-0 by local rivals Manchester City as pressure again swells around struggling manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.
articles.author: Matthew Smith

articles.headline: Christmas ‘extravaganza’ planned for Melbourne as part of COVID lockdown recovery
articles.description: There are concerns signs of strain are showing in Victoria's health system as the state records 1,173 new cases and nine deaths, and as the state government tries to restart Melbourne's economy.
articles.author: Matthew Smith

articles.headline: Teachers withdraw as vaccination deadline looms
articles.description: A school in New South Wales' Byron Bay region is bracing for the loss of a third of its staff, as a government-imposed vaccination deadline looms.
articles.author: Bronwyn Herbert, Bruce MacKenzie, and Miranda Saunders

articles.headline: How Tony Abbott helped build a bridge to net zero
articles.description: Ironically, given his attitude to climate change, former Prime Minister Tony Abbott inadvertently created the framework for a carbon price when he axed Julia Gillard's carbon tax, writes Ian Verrender.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: State government joins federal forum to achieve net zero; Western Sydney opens booster shot hub
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: New South Wales government signals more ambitions to cut greenhouse gas emissions than the federal government, while new vaccination centre opens in Western Sydney, as state turns its attention to booster shots.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: Wet and wild weather likely to continue all week for southern Queensland
articles.description: A wet and stormy week is expected for large parts of Queensland as the Bureau of Meteorology forecasts widespread severe thunderstorms.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: Five graphs that show Victoria is on the move again
articles.description: From the feet hitting the pavement, to the cars on the roads and planes in the sky — these are the graphs that show how Victorians are reclaiming their freedom of movement after weeks of lockdown.
articles.author: Casey Briggs and Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: 'My future is at stake': What it's like growing up in the Pacific, on the frontline of climate change
articles.description: Children and young people in the Pacific have grown up in the shadow of climate change, watching rising sea levels swallow landscapes and waiting in fear for the next natural disaster to strike.
articles.author: Jordan Fennell, Tahlea Aualiitia, and Edwina Seselja

articles.headline: Representation, equality and respect: Being queer in politics
articles.description: While every pollie's time in office is different, for Chansey Paech, Dr Kerryn Phelps and Tim Wilson there are a few similarities between their experiences and the way they've approached public life.
articles.author: Georgia Hitch

articles.headline: COVID-19 restrictions are being eased in NSW today — this is what's changing
articles.description: New freedoms for those who are fully vaccinated come into effect after the NSW government moves its COVID-19 roadmap forward. Here's what's changed.
articles.author: Georgia Hitch

articles.headline: The mystery backers of a divisive multi-million dollar beachside development have shocked locals
articles.description: Untouched beaches and native wildlife are why Hawks Nest residents love their home. All of that could change if the Obeid family get their way.
articles.author: Laura Gartry, Nick Wiggins, Lucy Carter, and Jeanavive McGregor

articles.headline: Justine’s Ruszczyk’s family says killer cop’s reduced sentence not enough for ‘obscene’ shooting
articles.description: This is how an Australian family challenged a US policing system and its use of brutal force. But for Justine’s Ruszczyk's family there is more to be done to ensure their daughter’s "obscene" death was not in vain.
articles.author: Susan Chenery, Rebecca Latham, and Jennifer Feller

articles.headline: New Zealand advances to T20 World Cup semi-finals at expense of India
articles.description: Captain Kane Williamson guides New Zealand to an eight-wicket victory at the Zayed Cricket Stadium in Abu Dhabi in a result that eliminates India ahead of its match against Namibia on Monday.
articles.author: Susan Chenery, Rebecca Latham, and Jennifer Feller

articles.headline: Allegations of Liberal Party branch stacking involving Assistant Treasurer Michael Sukkar aired in defamation case
articles.description: The allegations against the federal MP are detailed in documents filed in the Federal Court as part of defamation proceedings brought by a former Liberal Party factional figure.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: 'Bit of a weird one to celebrate': Jamie Whincup wins Sydney Supernight in Eastern Creek deluge
articles.description: Race officials call all cars in with seven laps remaining as conditions worsen around Sydney Motorsport Park, giving Whincup his second victory of the season and the 124th of his career.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Indian village marks end of Diwali with massive cow poo fight
articles.description: Joyful crowds pelt each other with fistfuls of cow manure as part of one village's local ritual to mark the end of Diwali, India's most important Hindu festival.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Hurricanes rescue innings from potential record low WBBL score, but go down to Scorchers
articles.description: Hobart Hurricanes fight back to avoid lowest-ever WBBL total, but their target of 97 proves no big challenge for the Perth Scorchers.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: 'A needless tragedy': NT Police treating woman's death after structure fire in Central Australia as homicide
articles.description: Police launch an investigation into the death of the woman after emergency services were called to the fire at a residence in the Hidden Valley Town Camp, at 11pm on Friday.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: How do crowd surges become deadly?
articles.description: Tragedies like the fatal crowd crush this week at Travis Scott’s Astroworld Music Festival have been happening for a long time. Here's why.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: At least 19 people dead after truck smashes into toll booth, six vehicles in Mexico
articles.description: The truck's brakes are believed to have failed as it was nearing a tool booth where it hit other vehicles, igniting a large fire on a highway.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Canelo Alvarez the unified super middleweight champ after knocking out Caleb Plant
articles.description: Mexican fighter Canelo Alvarez becomes the sixth man to hold all four world super middleweight boxing titles at the same time, after his win over American Caleb Plant in Las Vegas.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Police Commissioner labels anti-vaccine protesters who clashed with police as 'pretty disgraceful' following arrests
articles.description: Police say they are continuing to investigate a protest during Greater Darwin's lockout that turned violent on Saturday afternoon and say more arrests could be forthcoming.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: SA Health says it is 'unlikely' woman who sparked NT COVID-19 lockdown was infectious in state
articles.description: SA Health says it is unlikely the woman who sparked the NT lockdown was infectious while in the state.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Death of pregnant woman ignites debate about abortion ban in Poland
articles.description: The 30-year-old woman went to hospital after her waters broke but she died on the way to the operating theatre, with critics of Poland's near-total abortion ban blaming her death on laws introduced in January.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Conflict of interest declaration was 'likely' in Attorney-General Kangaroo Island port matter, email states
articles.description: Emails from the SA Attorney-General's ministerial planning adviser show he understood the minister would "likely" declare a conflict of interest before she refused a port on Kangaroo Island.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Father of soldier killed in Afghanistan hits out at Defence for 'intimidation' and 'threats' toward families
articles.description: The father of an Australian soldier murdered in Afghanistan claims families were threatened and intimidated by the Defence Department against speaking about details of the 2012 attack.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Police say fuel used in alleged domestic violence-related Alice Springs fire that killed woman
articles.description: Police say more than a dozen witnesses have given statements and investigations are ongoing following an alleged domestic violence-related homicide at Hidden Valley Town Camp on Friday.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: 'We’re all not the same': Former Don Dale detainees speak in support of $35 million class action
articles.description: Lawyers are seeking more time to sign up hundreds of former youth justice detainees to the multi-million-dollar compensation claim, while a federal court takes time to consider if the settlement sum is fair and reasonable.
articles.author: Kate Ashton

articles.headline: Astronomers catch over a third of all gravitational waves ever found in just five months
articles.description: The addition of 35 new confirmed observations of these tiny ripples in the fabric of space time takes the tally to 90 detections since 2015.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Man who assaulted two ex-partners seeks to have jail term reduced
articles.description: The lawyer for the Mildura man argues a "punitive" non-alcohol order was not properly taken into account at his sentencing last year.
articles.author: Richard Crabtree

articles.headline: Travis Scott, Astroworld organisers sued for at least $1 million as victims remembered
articles.description: A clearer picture emerges of the eight victims who died at the Astroworld Festival during a crowd crush as one injured concertgoer sues rapper and event founder Travis Scott for $1 million in damages.
articles.author: Richard Crabtree

articles.headline: 'We can no longer be friends': Farmer warns climate change deniers, after storm devastates crop
articles.description: Storms have devastated more crops in South Australia's mid north, prompting a farmer to publicly declare he was cutting social ties with any climate change deniers.
articles.author: Gillian Aeria and Lucas Forbes

articles.headline: Child care provider fined after kids escape and almost run onto busy road
articles.description: Dashcam footage captured the moment the toddlers were running along the busy Gold Coast street before a woman and school children came to their aid
articles.author: Tara Cassidy and Alexandria Utting

articles.headline: Christchurch shooter flags appeal, claiming guilty pleas were made under duress
articles.description: The Australian man convicted of killing 51 people in the attacks on two Christchurch mosques is claiming he experienced inhumane and degrading treatment while in custody.
articles.author: Emily Clark

articles.headline: Bikie gang member is second man to be charged with sniper-style murder of Rebels boss
articles.description: A second man is charged in connection with the sniper-style murder of Rebels bikie boss Nick Martin in Perth last year.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: Two Josh Allens make NFL history as the Jaguars stun the Bills
articles.description: In the NFL, Jacksonville Jaguars have earned a shock win over the highly fancied Buffalo Bills — but the result was overshadowed by the battle between Bills quarterback Josh Allen, and his Jaguars nemesis … Josh Allen.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: COVID lockout restrictions extended in Greater Darwin amid concern about new exposure site
articles.description: COVID lockout restrictions in Greater Darwin will be extended by an extra 24 hours after the identification of several new exposure sites, including one authorities have labelled of "particular concern", but the lockout in Katherine is on track to end at 5pm today.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: South Australian children who contract COVID-19 to receive at-home treatment through hospital service
articles.description: South Australian children who contract coronavirus will be able to be treated at home through a new service to be run by the Women's and Children's Hospital, health authorities say.
articles.author: Rory McClaren

articles.headline: New data reveals how much protection COVID-19 jabs are giving people in NSW
articles.description: People in NSW who are not vaccinated against COVID-19 were 16 times more likely to die, or end up in intensive care during the state's Delta outbreak, new government data reveals.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: Big Bird posted about getting his COVID vaccine. An American senator and anti-vax Twitter was having none of it
articles.description: It started with a fairly innocent Twitter post shared by a beloved Sesame Street character. Then came the accusations of propaganda and brainwashing.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: Port Beach unpatrolled at time of fatal shark attack, Health Minister reveals
articles.description: WA Health Minister Roger Cook says the location of surf lifesaving patrols will be examined as beaches in the vicinity of this weekend's fatal shark attack reopen.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: Time running out for 10-metre sperm whale stranded on Flinders Island
articles.description: Conservation experts are attending to a sperm whale stranded off the coast of northern Tasmania — but an expert has warned the species are "not the easiest to refloat".
articles.author: Liz Gwynn

articles.headline: US citizen flown to Australia to make meth jailed over major bust in Adelaide drug house
articles.description: An Iranian-born United States citizen who was found in his underwear hiding in the bedroom of a suburban Adelaide drug house is sentenced to at least five-and-a-half years in jail over an $18 million meth bust in 2018.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: 'Unreasonable': Flight Centre threatens to challenge WA's hard border in court
articles.description: Western Australia's Health Minister Roger Cook says he is confident the state can fight another legal challenge against its hard border, as Flight Centre threatens a fresh court dispute.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Adelaide cafe owner who sexually exploited child waitress seeks lenient sentence
articles.description: The lawyer for a cafe owner who sexually exploited a child waitress urges an Adelaide court to hand down a lenient sentence, saying her client lacked the social skills to date adult women.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: The rate of cancer cases in Victoria has dropped massively in the past two years, but experts say it's not good news
articles.description: Health experts fear there are thousands of Australians who are unaware they have cancer due to COVID-19 lockdowns, with new data showing the number of detected cancer cases during the pandemic is way down.
articles.author: Nadia Daly

articles.headline: Adelaide paedophile pleads guilty to more than 180 crimes against children
articles.description: An Adelaide paedophile pleads guilty to more than 180 charges in what has previously been described in court as one of the "worst and most degrading" cases of child exploitation.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Police trying to establish if others involved in Cleo Smith alleged abduction
articles.description: Detectives say they expect to remain in Carnarvon for at least a week as they try to determine if more than one person was involved in Cleo Smith's alleged abduction.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: Schools could be kept open with 'test to stay' approach instead of quarantine, Doherty Institute says
articles.description: A final report to government recommends using rapid antigen tests instead of quarantine for school children exposed to COVID-19 to safely limit the number of classroom teaching hours lost.
articles.author: Jake Evans

articles.headline: Targeting 'fence-sitters' with 'FOMO' could lift Queensland's vaccination rates, experts say
articles.description: The Queensland government needs to do more to appeal to "fence-sitters" and smarter, stronger marketing strategies are needed to boost vaccination uptake and get the state over the finish line before borders reopen, experts warn.
articles.author: Ciara Jones

articles.headline: Live: NSW Now: 65,000 students to sit HSC exams after COVID-19 delays
articles.description: MORNING BRIEFING: More than 65,000 New South Wales year 12 students will sit the HSC written exams from today after two years of COVID-19 disruptions and lockdowns.
articles.author: Ciara Jones

articles.headline: Flying doctors on alert for looming COVID outbreak in the bush
articles.description: The medical lifelines that sustain rural and regional Queensland are set to be tested, with rescue planes and helicopters bracing for what a COVID outbreak means in the bush.
articles.author: Owen Jacques

articles.headline: How domestic violence became a $2b business problem
articles.description: Domestic and family violence leads to staff absenteeism and lower productivity and  the estimated cost to business is about $2 billion annually, a new report shows. Workplaces are being asked to do more to fight the problem.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: Robbie Young made headlines as the target of a racist comment, but it's his off-field work that defines him
articles.description: Footballer Robbie Young has carved out a reputation as being lightning-fast on the football field in both the AFL and SANFL, but it was a racist comment aimed at the small forward that made him a household name. Now, he's hoping his off-field work with children will change that.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: Parisa left Afghanistan utterly 'empty'. Now, she's rebuilding her life in Melbourne
articles.description: Clothes, toothbrushes and everyday necessities donated by communities and essential services are helping thousands of Afghan evacuees in Melbourne resettle, after the Taliban takeover in August.
articles.author: Nicole Asher

articles.headline: Catching COVID would be dire for baby Austin. His parents hope rapid antigen tests will help protect him
articles.description: Families desperate to keep their most vulnerable members safe are wondering if the new test will shore up their fight against the virus.
articles.author: Sian Johnson

articles.headline: When a crowd surges forward, the artist on stage has a role to play
articles.description: There is a lot we don't know about what occurred in the Astroworld Festival. But what Travis Scott did or did not do on stage in Houston is now being scrutinised. So what role does the artist play when it comes to 'mosh pit etiquette'?
articles.author: Paul Donoughue

articles.headline: How to protect yourself from dodgy builders and defects ruining your dream home
articles.description: Building a home is a huge investment. So when it goes wrong, it can be devastating. Here's what to do to make sure it goes to plan, and the steps you can take when it's all too late.
articles.author: Adam Langenberg

articles.headline: ABC secures broadcast rights to WorldPride and Sydney Mardi Gras
articles.description: The ABC has secured the broadcast rights for Sydney Mardi Gras for the first time in 28 years and WorldPride 2023 — the largest global event in NSW since the 2000 Olympic Games.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Swimming near sharks in freezing water might sound horrifying but for Ross Frylinck, it was life-changing
articles.description: The South African filmmaker says his friend, creator of My Octopus Teacher Craig Foster, taught him that cold water swimming can seriously impact your life.
articles.author: Michael Mackenzie and Anna Kelsey-Sugg

articles.headline: Niki's kids have had to isolate twice since the end of lockdown. She's had enough — and she's not alone
articles.description: Niki Mahaffey is sick of homeschooling her two children. But two coronavirus exposures at school mean the family has had to isolate twice since the end of lockdown.
articles.author: Casey Briggs

articles.headline: How much does your morning coffee cost? It could be about to get more expensive
articles.description: Your morning coffee or the next cocktail on a night out could be about to cost you more, thanks to some lingering effects of the pandemic.
articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.headline: Barack Obama takes aim at China, Russia for missing COP26
articles.description: The former US president calls for rich countries to help poorer nations battling the effects of climate change.
articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.headline: At 83, the ‘Nimblewill Nomad' is now the oldest to hike Appalachian Trail
articles.description: For more than 3,500 kilometres this 83-year-old was walking across a large chunk of the eastern United States as he set a new record.
articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.headline: Government commits to expanding electric vehicle charging stations but no subsidies to increase uptake
articles.description: The federal government will partner with the private sector to fund 50,000 charging stations in Australian homes, in a bid to encourage more people to buy electric vehicles.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: Australian cricket team to tour Pakistan for first time in 24 years
articles.description: Australia have not played in Pakistan since Mark Taylor hit an unbeaten 334 in Peshawar in 1998, with security concerns meaning all tours since have been played in the UAE.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: Mystery surrounds kangaroo that got stuck on a hot tin roof in Mount Isa
articles.description: Firefighters in the north-west Queensland town say they are used to rescuing cats, dogs and birds, but finding a kangaroo on the roof on a house is a first.
articles.author: Andrew Saunders and Larissa Waterson

articles.headline: Chinese exchange student drowns while snorkelling in Tasmania
articles.description: A boy who drowned while snorkelling with friends in Tasmania is identified as a Chinese exchange student.
articles.author: James Dunlevie

articles.headline: Labor leader wore wire to record former SA MP accused of blackmailing him, court documents state
articles.description: SA Labor leader Peter Malinauskas was secretly fitted with a wire by detectives to record an interaction with former MP Annabel Digance and her husband who have since been accused of blackmail, according to court documents.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Two boys plead guilty to aggravated kidnapping of Peter Keeley but not guilty to murder
articles.description: Two out of three teenage boys accused of murdering the Canberra man on the NSW Far South Coast  have pleaded guilty to an additional charge of aggravated kidnapping.
articles.author: Adriane Reardon

articles.headline: Scott Boland stars with the ball as Victoria beat NSW in Sheffield Shield
articles.description: Victoria grabs another outright Sheffield Shield win late on day four against New South Wales, with bowler Scott Boland making the key breakthroughs in front of Australian selector Tony Dodemaide at the MCG.
articles.author: Adriane Reardon

articles.headline: Murder trial begins for WA father who allegedly inflicted 'head to foot' injuries on baby boy
articles.description: A father on trial for murder allegedly inflicted "head to foot" injuries on his baby son — either by "vigorously" shaking or through other violent behaviour — towards the seven-month-old boy, the Supreme Court of WA hears.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: WA record shedding sheep hits $90,000 with new breed blend coming
articles.description: A Western Australian meat sheep has sold for $90,000, smashing the state record, as breeders prepare to blend their high-priced shedding varieties with rams fetching $150,000.
articles.author: Angus Mackintosh

articles.headline: 'Puts everyone at risk': Medical adviser warns NT double vax figures are inaccurate
articles.description: Aboriginal Medical Services Alliance NT's John Boffa says the territory government's vaccination figures are inaccurate and may create a potentially dangerous situation when border restrictions relax after Christmas.
articles.author: Stewart Brash and Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Domestic violence order application against senior NT police officer withdrawn, subject to court undertaking
articles.description: Senior Northern Territory police officer Daniel Shean is no longer facing an application for a domestic violence order, after his wife agreed to withdraw the matter.
articles.author: Stewart Brash and Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Convicted Canberra gang rapists lose appeal over convictions
articles.description: Simon Vunilagi, Isimeli Vatanitawake and Josefa Masivesi sexually assaulted the victim after meeting her at Mooseheads and taking her to a Downer unit in 2019.
articles.author: Holly Tregenza

articles.headline: Calls for more testing after asbestos found in imported toys and building materials
articles.description: Unions and anti-asbestos campaigners are demanding more testing at Australia's border after revelations the deadly mineral is still slipping into the country despite a strict ban.
articles.author: Angelique Donnellan

articles.headline: Man accused of attempted murder claims woman accidentally lit herself on fire
articles.description: The man accused of lighting his former partner on fire has taken the stand for the first time during the trial, claiming his alleged victim poured fuel on herself before unwittingly igniting a flame.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Qantas A380 soars back to Sydney after gathering dust in desert for more than 500 days
