articles.description: After more than 500 days gathering dust in storage in the Californian desert, a Qantas A380 superjumbo roars back across Australian skies for the first time since 2020.
articles.author: Sarah Gerathy

articles.headline: Do you really know what's healthy and what's not when filling up your shopping trolley?
articles.description: Food Standards Australia New Zealand is developing a food database to help consumers understand the nutritional value of the food they eat.
articles.author: Jane McNaughton

articles.headline: Murdered woman Suzanne Poll's husband breaks down in court as he recounts night he found her body
articles.description: The husband of a woman murdered in an Adelaide stationery shop nearly three decades ago has broken down in court recalling the moment he discovered his wife's bloodied body in the back storage area of the shop where she worked. The following story contains content some readers may find distressing.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Scott Morrison isn't undergoing a climate conversion but an awakening to public sentiment
articles.description: The Prime Minister is no longer comparing electric vehicles with a war on the weekend. This isn't a climate conversion but an awakening to a changing political landscape, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
articles.author: Brett Worthington

articles.headline: More COVID deaths linked to Albury aged care centre outbreak
articles.description: Albury's Mercy Place aged care facility is not allowing any visitors — except for compassionate end-of-life visits — as they try to manage a COVID-19 outbreak that has claimed nine lives.
articles.author: Brett Worthington

articles.headline: 'Sophisticated email scam' costs Queensland grazier thousands of dollars
articles.description: This Queensland grazier was paying what appeared to be a legitimate business invoice, when he fell victim to a 'very sophisticated' email scam.
articles.author: Johanna Marie

articles.headline: Satellite images show mockups of US Navy ships in Chinese desert
articles.description: Satellite images by space tech company Maxar have captured mockups in the shape of US Navy aircraft carriers and other warships in the Chinese desert.
articles.author: Johanna Marie

articles.headline: Ash Gardner builds deeper connection with Indigenous identity
articles.description: For Ashleigh Gardner, spending more time at home in Australia during the pandemic meant she could reconnect with her Indigenous roots.
articles.author: Johanna Marie

articles.headline: Alec Baldwin calls for police on film sets to monitor gun safety
articles.description: Actor Alec Baldwin says he believes film and TV productions should hire police officers to monitor weapons on sets as Hollywood considers new safety measures following the fatal shooting of Halyna Hutchins.
articles.author: Johanna Marie

articles.headline: 'Less than human': Inquest hears 'contemptuous' attitude to Aboriginal inmate led to avoidable death
articles.description: An inquest into the death of First Nations man Bailey Mackander, who died after falling 8 metres while trying to escape custody, hears a "real lack of humanity" by correctional staff contributed to his death.
articles.author: Giselle Wakatama

articles.headline: Singapore to bill unvaccinated COVID-19 patients as cases surge across island
articles.description: Singapore's Ministry of Health announces that from December 8 all COVID-19 patients who are eligible for vaccination but choose not to do so will need to cover their own medical expenses.
articles.author: Jason Dasey

articles.headline: Mandatory COVID-19 vaccination for aged care visitors but not for SA schoolies festival
articles.description: As plans are unveiled for a COVID-safe schoolies festival in South Australia later this month, mandatory vaccination requirements have expanded to include residential aged care visitors and disability support workers.
articles.author: Jason Dasey

articles.headline: Ancient 'penis worms' may have been first to hermit themselves away in shells
articles.description: Millions of years before crabs did it, lowly penis worms were already living the hermit lifestyle,  fossils found in China suggest.
articles.author: Anna Salleh

articles.headline: 'I get goosebumps': Emma Gilmour becomes McLaren's first female driver
articles.description: Emma Gilmour says she never imagined she would have the opportunity to race for McLaren as she becomes the renowned team's first female driver.
articles.author: Chloe Hart

articles.headline: WA government to take on 30 recommendations after inquiry into death of 7yo who died waiting for treatment
articles.description: An independent inquiry into the death of a seven-year-old girl at Perth Children's Hospital makes several recommendations for change after finding staff were "exhausted, demoralised and isolated", but leaves her parents without closure.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: Fisherman fights off crocodile on Far North Queensland riverbank
articles.description: The 60-year-old man is recovering in hospital after the attack on the banks of the Mcivor River near Hope Vale. He escaped by stabbing the reptile with a knife after it grabbed him by the leg.
articles.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath

articles.headline: How much is your study for the HSC related to your present job?
articles.description: Three former students share their experiences with the HSC and how they deviated from those career plans to make it in areas they couldn't possibly imagine.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: Dress worn by Amy Winehouse in her final performance sells for more than $335,000
articles.description: Amy Winehouse wore the green and black dress during a show in June 2011 in Serbia one month before she died.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: Unvaccinated NRL players won't be able to play in Victoria and Queensland
articles.description: The NRL says it will adapt to public health orders that stop unvaccinated players from having access to or playing at the home grounds of four teams in Queensland and Victoria.
articles.author: David Mark

articles.headline: Queensland businesses worried about staff copping abuse over vaccination freedoms and restrictions
articles.description: Queensland hospitality businesses are concerned the state's new freedoms that are only for those fully vaccinated against COVID-19 from next month will have serious repercussions on their busiest trade time of the year.
articles.author: Jessica Stewart

articles.headline: Mick Byrne went from being sacked by Ron Barassi to VFL glory, and now boss of rugby's big hope
articles.description: After playing and coaching in three football codes, Hawthorn premiership winner Mick Byrne has been handed the task of making the Fijian Drua the next rugby powerhouse.
articles.author: Jack Snape

articles.headline: Inside a terrifying crowd crush: The moment a packed venue turns into stifling 'fluid mass'
articles.description: After the Astroworld disaster that claimed eight lives, investigators and organisers are scrambling to get to the bottom of what caused the deadly crowd crush. The science behind it is frighteningly simple.
articles.author: Lucy Sweeney and Rebecca Armitage

articles.headline: Holocaust memorial remembers 64,440 murdered Austrian Jews
articles.description: The country where Adolf Hitler was born was annexed by Nazi Germany in 1938, yet Austria has been slow to recognise its role in the Holocaust.
articles.author: Lucy Sweeney and Rebecca Armitage

articles.headline: Which car brands are going all electric and when?
articles.description: The federal government says it will not force Australians out of the car they want to drive, but the choice may have already been taken away from them. Here are the car brands that are making the permanent switch to electric.
articles.author: Lucy Sweeney and Rebecca Armitage

articles.headline: Tourism pressure mounts on Tasmanian government to end native forest logging
articles.description: Tasmania's tourism lobby ends its agreement with the forestry industry in the wake of mounting concerns from operators that logging is jeopardising the state's "clean and green" image.
articles.author: Adam Langenberg

articles.headline: NSW COVID-19 vaccination data reveals which areas are lagging
articles.description: NSW has fully vaccinated 90 per cent of its population aged 16 and over against COVID-19, but how well protected you are depends on where you live.
articles.author: Catherine Hanrahan

articles.headline: How slapping solar on the MCG could help Melbourne to net zero
articles.description: With Australia committing to net zero, a study has found central Melbourne could meet most of its energy needs with rooftop solar on skyscrapers and big public buildings like the MCG.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: One reason 2022 looks like an ideal time for a government to land re-election
articles.description: All sorts of things determine election outcomes but the economy is one and right now it could scarcely look better for the government, writes Peter Martin.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: 'Data entry error' caused vaccine report mistake, TGA says
articles.description: Australia's medicines regulator has clarified a mistake on its website that wrongly showed a six-year-old girl had experienced "heavy menstrual bleeding" and other illnesses after receiving the Pfizer vaccine, symptoms which were supposed to be attributed to a 41-year-old woman.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: What happens if you catch COVID-19 at work? You could sue your boss
articles.description: Workers compensation claims are expected to rise as restrictions ease, leaving bosses potentially liable if their staff get sick.
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: How did China's 'anti-Valentine's Day' turn into the world's biggest shopping event?
articles.description: Selling more goods than Black Friday and Cyber Monday combined, China's "anti-Valentine's Day" has transformed from a movement dedicated to singles' self-care into the world's largest 24-hour shopping spree.
articles.author: Dong Xing

articles.headline: Lukashenko accused of 'inhuman, gangster-style approach' to migrants
articles.description: The humanitarian crisis on the Belarusian border deepens as thousands wait while EU nations stiffen border patrols and accuse the Belarusian government of 'gangster style' behaviour.
articles.author: Dong Xing

articles.headline: China's military conducts combat readiness patrol near Taiwan Strait
articles.description: The military conducts the combat readiness patrol aimed at the Taiwan Strait just as US politicians touch down in Taiwan.
articles.author: Dong Xing

articles.headline: Knife-wielding man shot dead by Norwegian police
articles.description: Weeks after a bow and arrow attack leaves five dead, Norwegian police shoot a knife-wielding man dead in the national capital of Oslo.
articles.author: Dong Xing

articles.headline: Private 'catch-and-release' quarantine scheme could soon be up and running for non-Australians
articles.description: A company established by an influential Liberal party figure says it could bring up to 160,000 foreign workers and students a year into Australia via a private hotel quarantine system with support from the Home Affairs Department.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Federal government to overhaul clean energy fund to allow investment in carbon capture and storage
articles.description: The federal government has renewed plans to overhaul the Clean Energy Finance Corporation (CEFC) so it can invest in carbon capture and storage, promising $500 million of investment in emerging technology.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: NT Chief Minister apologises for Facebook post labelling COVID source a sex worker
articles.description: A Facebook post on the Northern Territory Chief Minister Michael Gunner's Facebook page said a COVID source case was a sex worker. She wasn't.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: 'A crisis and catastrophe': Children suffer with malnutrition in Taliban-run Afghanistan
articles.description: The United Nations says the number of Afghans living in near-famine conditions has risen to 8.7 million, up by 3 million from earlier this year, as a worsening drought and Taliban-run hospitals add to the suffering.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Push for inquiry into gay hate crimes to investigate claims police turned blind eye
articles.description: Legal observers say a judicial inquiry into gay and transgender hate crimes in NSW must investigate claims that police officers turned a blind eye or were involved in the attacks.
articles.author: Jason Om

articles.headline: Planning minister to give community a say on Clive Palmer's coal-fired power station proposal
articles.description: Clive Palmer's Waratah Coal wants to build a coal-fired power station near the town of Alpha in central western Queensland. The plan is before Barcaldine Regional Council, but Deputy Premier and Planning Minister Steven Miles might take over the assessment process.
articles.author: Emilie Gramenz

articles.headline: Pandemic law protesters gather at Victorian Parliament as lawyers urge government to hit pause on bill
articles.description: Victorian barristers urge the state government to halt the progression of its revamped pandemic laws through parliament, as protests over the controversial new bill continue.
articles.author: Emilie Gramenz

articles.headline: Service NSW calls in police to investigate fraudulent claims for COVID-19 business grants
articles.description: Police will use artificial intelligence to check all applications after the state government unearthed more than $20 million worth of fraud.
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: 'Dangerous, dirty play' from Nikola Jokic leads to Miami players waiting for Denver in stadium corridor
articles.description: The NBA's Nuggets and Heat clash in Denver over an ugly incident that results in MVP Nikola Jokic and Miami's Markieff Morris being ejected — and a furious Jimmy Butler and other Heat players waiting for the Nuggets outside afterwards.
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: NT police officer 'may have committed offences' in connection with partner's death, coroner finds
articles.description: Greg Cavanagh says in his 25 years as the Northern Territory coroner there has never been an occasion "a serving officer has refused to answer questions because the answers might incriminate him or her in an offence relating to a death".
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: 'Prevention is our priority': FIFO boss admits failing female workers
articles.description: One of Australia's biggest mining contractors, Macmahon, has conceded it's failed to protect female workers against sexual harassment. During a WA parliamentary inquiry hearing, the company revealed it's sacked five people this year alone for inappropriate behaviour.
articles.author: Eliza Borrello

articles.headline: Jury finds WA man guilty of murdering best friend with samurai sword
articles.description: A jury takes three hours to determine that Damian Kyle Beckerleg murdered his best friend James Reimers (pictured) after a day of fishing and drinking went horribly wrong.
articles.author: Zoe Keenan

articles.headline: Police lay charges over Hillarys incident that has left Perth father in critical condition
articles.description: Police charge a man with grievous bodily harm following an alleged physical altercation in Hillarys on Sunday that has left a Perth father-of-two in a critical condition.
articles.author: Kate Christian

articles.headline: Japan culls 143,000 chickens to contain bird flu, as more European countries record cases
articles.description: The Japanese Agriculture Ministry says it does "not believe there is any possibility of avian influenza being transmitted to humans through the consumption of chicken meat or eggs".
articles.author: Kate Christian

articles.headline: Blame it on the boogie: Dance ban killing the vibe
articles.description: Despite having no active cases of COVID in the community and 80 per cent of eligible residents double-vaccinated, Tasmania still has strict limitations on music events and dancing — and promoters say it is killing the vibe.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: Teenagers drinking at 'vacant' home found murder victim's body in the backyard, jury hears
articles.description: A group of teenagers drinking at what they thought was a vacant home in Adelaide's north-eastern suburbs discovered a body dumped in the backyard after investigating an unusual smell, a court hears.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Reigning NBA MVP suspended without pay following on-court altercation
articles.description: The NBA suspends Nikola Jokic and fines Markieff Morris for their role in an ugly incident during the game between the Denver Nuggets and Miami Heat.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Socceroos primed for emotional homecoming
articles.description: Socceroos boss Graham Arnold says he's seen a lot of emotion in his players ahead of playing on home soil for the first time in 763 days.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: 'A big deal': Donald Trump fails in bid to block probe into attack on US Capitol
articles.description: Federal Judge Tanya Chutkan rejects an argument by Mr Trump's lawyers that White House telephone records, visitor logs and other documents should be hidden from a US House of Representatives committee investigating the January 6 riot.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: The difficulty in preserving Australia's last living flamingos
articles.description: Immortalised by taxidermy, Adelaide Zoo's much-loved flamingo companions were unveiled today in the SA Museum's mammal display, drawing a round of applause from onlookers.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: Queensland passes vaccination threshold for easing of mask rules
articles.description: Queensland meets the state government's threshold for the easing of mask rules, with 80.1 per cent of the state's population over 16 now at least partially vaccinated.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: Katherine close contacts to be re-tested, residents urged to monitor health after wastewater samples test positive for COVID
articles.description: COVID viral fragments have been detected in wastewater in the Northern Territory town of Katherine, prompting health authorities to ask residents to monitor their health for any symptoms.
articles.author: Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: 'What the Chinese want is respect': Paul Keating says Australia shouldn't interfere in Taiwan conflict
articles.description: Former prime minister Paul Keating warns the federal government not to be drawn into a military conflict over Taiwan and plays down the prospect of a Chinese military invasion.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: 'Allowing a coup to be staged': Prince Harry says he warned Twitter CEO about deadly assault on US Capitol
articles.description: Prince Harry says he warned Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey via email that "his platform was allowing a coup to be staged" a day before the deadly assault on the US Capitol.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: 'You just can't escape the smell': The troubling legacy of mammoth waste disposal pits in the US wars on terror
articles.description: Thousands of veterans of the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan are coming down with illnesses they link to their exposure to toxins from massive waste sites known as burn pits.
articles.author: Barbara Miller

articles.headline: Lion takeover of Stone & Wood would 'free up' taps for independent brewers, ACCC says
articles.description: The nation's competition regulator says it won't oppose Lion's proposed acquisition of Fermentum, owner of Byron Bay-based Stone & Wood.
articles.author: Kim Honan

articles.headline: 'This is the biggest one yet': Major flooding expected as heavy rain descends upon the east
articles.description: November rain records have already been smashed through Australia's west and centre — now, heavy rain and erratic storms are shifting towards northern NSW and southern Queensland.
articles.author: Kate Doyle

articles.headline: 'Make it feel like it's the WWF': 'Raging' in the spotlight as Travis Scott video resurfaces after Astroworld disaster
articles.description: As the entertainment industry grapples with fallout of the Astroworld disaster, in which eight people were killed and hundreds injured in an apparent crowd surge, attention has turned to Travis Scott's past conduct — and his unique style of performance.
articles.author: Kate Doyle

articles.headline: Brazil legend Formiga to retire from international football
articles.description: After competing in a record seven FIFA World Cups, Brazilian veteran Formiga is set to retire from international football at the age of 43.
articles.author: Samantha Lewis

articles.headline: Officials update Queensland's COVID-19 exposure sites list after new cases emerge
articles.description: More sites in Warwick and on the Gold Coast are expected to be added by Queensland Health contact tracers.
articles.author: Samantha Lewis

articles.headline: 'Zoe's Law' introduced to NSW Parliament 12 years after Brodie lost unborn baby to drunk driver
articles.description: A bill first proposed after a drunk driver hit Brodie Donegan, causing the loss of her foetus, Zoe, 12 years ago, is introduced to NSW Parliament in a bid to impose harsher penalties for crimes that result in the loss of an unborn baby.
articles.author: Ruby Cornish

articles.headline: 'Littered with cockroaches': Former pizza bar operator faces court over food safety breaches
articles.description: The former operator of an Adelaide pizza bar has faced court today after pleading guilty to 20 charges after council inspectors found cockroaches and mouldy food on the premises.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Teenage driver and passenger accused of breaching WA hard border by speeding through checkpoint
articles.description: A 17-year-old boy driving from New South Wales and his 24-year-old passenger are charged after their car allegedly sped through the West Australian border checkpoint at Eucla, failing to stop for police.
articles.author: Abby Richards

articles.headline: 41yo truck driver charged over ambulance crash killing nurse and elderly patient
articles.description: A man has been charged over the deaths of nurse Ray Wyeth and his 87-year-old patient, who were killed when his truck hit the ambulance they were travelling in west of Rockhampton last month.
articles.author: Erin Semmler and Katrina Beavan

articles.headline: Hawks, Blues confirm positive COVID-19 cases
articles.description: Hawthorn AFL player Finn Maginness is in quarantine, while Carlton says a member of its AFLW program has returned a positive COVID-19 test.
articles.author: Erin Semmler and Katrina Beavan

articles.headline: Thieves steal camera installed to capture once-in-a-decade bloom of rare flower
articles.description: A few "choice words" slipped past the Warrnambool Botanic Gardens curator's lips when he discovered the camera, mounted four metres up a tree, had been stolen.
articles.author: Daniel Miles and Jeremy Lee

articles.headline: Flood watch continues for parts of Queensland as final wintry blast set to delivers more wild weather
articles.description: Queenslanders are being told to prepare for an onslaught of erratic thunderstorms and torrential rain up to three times the November average over coming days as parts of the state remain on flood watch.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: Planning a trip to Queensland? Beware of the fine print around COVID vaccines
articles.description: From November 19, fully-vaccinated travellers entering Queensland from interstate can quarantine at home. But there's a catch.
articles.author: Ciara Jones

articles.headline: Growing up, Mon Schafter rarely saw queer people like her in the media. Now she's leading an ABC project to change that
articles.description: ABCQueer aims to make young LGBTQIA+ feel less alone and was inspired by a brother's love for his gay sister.
articles.author: Monique Schafter

articles.headline: Victorian restaurant owner faces cancelling Christmas bookings amid 'dire' staff shortage
articles.description: Hospitality businesses are calling on the federal government to make it easier for the international workforce to return to Australia, while some hospitality workers contemplate how they can better their pay and conditions while they are in high demand.
articles.author: Oliver Gordon

articles.headline: 'I'm worrying about the kids': Aboriginal children left without on-country mental health staff in APY Lands
articles.description: Some of Australia's most vulnerable remote communities have been left without on-country mental health staff to support Aboriginal children.
articles.author: Patrick Martin

articles.headline: 'Desperate' families set to reunite as Fiji's international borders reopen to Australia
articles.description: Ten months after giving birth to her son in Melbourne, Farisha's parents will finally be able to meet their grandson as Fiji's international border opens to Australia today.
articles.author: Marian Faa and Edwina Seselja

articles.headline: Daniel Craig ends 15 years as 007 with new Bond film that packs emotional punch
articles.description: No Time To Die wraps up a five-film cycle that's variously shaken, stirred and shamelessly serviced the expectations of its generations-spanning audience.
articles.author: Luke Goodsell

articles.headline: Zoey could have been a kid who never came back to school after lockdown, but one simple step changed everything
articles.description: Her classmates were continuing lessons and enjoying social support, but Zoey had dropped out of class — and barely anyone noticed.
articles.author: Conor Duffy

articles.headline: Researchers have mapped the presence of our poo entering the world's oceans. It's not pretty
articles.description: Researchers have mapped the discharge of global wastewater — treated, septic, and raw sewage — into coastal ecosystems in what they say is the finest detail yet. And the numbers are intimidating.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: Abuse report author shocked at discoveries
articles.description: The co-author of a review into how Tasmania's education department responded to child sexual abuse allegations was shocked to discover he went to school alongside some victims and was taught by some accused abusers.
articles.author: Adam Langenberg

articles.headline: Freezing November weather nothing to crow about
articles.description: "Don't plant tomatoes before Show Day" — so the saying goes in Tasmania. Well, Show Day was three weeks ago, and those poor little tomato plants could soon be covered in snow.
articles.author: James Dunlevie

articles.headline: Police video shows the dramatic moment a wanted fugitive is found hiding in a shipping container
articles.description: The video shows police handcuffing accused drug trafficker Mostafa Baluch at a border checkpoint and seizing large wads of banknotes.
articles.author: Ursula Malone

articles.headline: As big Australian backyards disappear, experts fear our summers might get hotter. Here's why
articles.description: Demand for housing has led to a rise in subdivisions, and a loss of yard space and the trees they contain, in turn exacerbating an urban heat island effect which could be making our suburbs hotter.
articles.author: Prianka Srinivasan and Hellena Souisa

articles.headline: Abusive cops will stop being given 'special treatment' under Australian-first plan, police say
articles.description: Victoria Police has launched a landmark policy for dealing with family violence perpetrators in its ranks. But advocates fear critical flaws in the new advice will mean the welfare of abusive officers will continue being prioritised over victim safety.
articles.author: Hayley Gleeson

articles.headline: We witnessed Morrison's 'Freedom Day' this week — and his reversal on electric vehicles was the main event
articles.description: Reducing emissions without touching anything that could be interpreted as a "price" on carbon has become a political imperative for Scott Morrison, writes David Speers.
articles.author: David Speers

articles.headline: When Keating speaks about China it pays to listen. This is why
articles.description: Paul Keating is not an apologist for Chinese authoritarianism but a cold-eyed realist about Chinese power. He argues China seeks and deserves respect. But in making a case for legitimising Chinese power Keating risks defending a potentially rogue leader, writes Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: Daryl Mitchell carries his bat and hits New Zealand into T20 World Cup final
articles.description: New Zealand opener Daryl Mitchell carries his bat to become a cricketing hero as the Black Caps stun England and move into the final of the Twenty20 World Cup.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Hindus know this water is toxic but they are bathing in it anyway to celebrate the festival of Chhath Puja
articles.description: Hundreds of Hindu devotees flock to the heavily polluted Yamuna River and take a dip in its toxic waters as part of a religious festival.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Dalai Lama criticises China's leaders for having too much control
articles.description: China's foreign ministry says the door to dialogue is open with the Dalai Lama as the country praises comments made by former Australian prime minister Paul Keating.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Draft COP26 agreement calls on countries to strengthen 2030 targets
articles.description: Australia could be pushed to strengthen its 2030 emissions reduction targets by the end of next year if the draft COP26 agreement released by host the United Kingdom is agreed to.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: French women's footballer arrested after attack by masked men on teammate
articles.description: Paris St-Germain confirms Aminata Diallo is in custody over her alleged role in an attack that saw her teammate Kheira Hamraoui pulled from a car and hit in the legs with an iron bar last week.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Italy issues arrest warrant for grandfather of orphaned boy who survived cable car disaster
articles.description: The boy's maternal grandfather picked him up and brought him back to Israel without the consent of the paternal aunt he was living with.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: US parents sue fertility clinic after receiving another couple's embryo and raising the wrong baby
articles.description: According to a lawsuit filed in Los Angeles, two couples spent three months raising children that weren't theirs before swapping the infants after a mistake by the California Center for Reproductive Health.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: The Loop: It's looking like a wet one, Alec Baldwin named in shooting lawsuit and blast-off for Elon Musk's SpaceX
articles.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
articles.author: Bridget Judd

articles.headline: Producers rejoice as Tasmania's Launceston named world foodie city by UNESCO
articles.description: Launceston, in Tasmania's north, has been named as UNESCO's Creative City of Gastronomy — a gong local producers hope will help them tap into global markets.
articles.author: Manika Champ

articles.headline: Inquest into suicide of teen in state care hears residential group home had 'a culture of bullying'
articles.description: A teenage boy who took his own life in state care in Adelaide's south feared he would be forever stuck in one of the "worst placements" he'd been in, an inquest has heard.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Unvaccinated BHP coal miners stood down without pay
articles.description: Around 50 workers at the Hunter Valley's largest thermal coal mine have been stood down without pay over their COVID-19 vaccination status.
articles.author: Ben Millington

articles.headline: Rare 'Ringo Starr' cockatoo listed as endangered due to habitat loss in far north Queensland
articles.description: A spectacular bird that creates musical instruments has been listed as endangered.
articles.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath and Adam Stephen

articles.headline: Collingwood AFLW co-captain apologises for historical redface incident
articles.description: Collingwood AFLW co-captain Steph Chiocci issues an apology after old photos emerged of her wearing redface.
articles.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath and Adam Stephen

articles.headline: Police arrest two men over crash that killed father of four in Melbourne's south-east
articles.description: Detectives arrest and interview two men, aged 25 and 30, over the alleged hit-and-run crash that killed father of four Timmy Rakei early Tuesday morning.
articles.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath and Adam Stephen

articles.headline: Nurse stranded in NZ for months despite letter from WA Chief Health Officer supporting return
articles.description: A fully-vaccinated Esperance nurse and her two children have been stranded in New Zealand for three months because of Western Australia's strict border policies.
articles.author: Emily JB Smith

articles.headline: Man charged after allegedly injuring police with glass bottle at Melbourne's anti-lockdown protests
articles.description: The 52-year-old is facing 20 charges for his alleged involvement in the violent protests, which resulted in hundreds of arrests, injuries to 10 police officers and a newspaper photographer being pepper sprayed.
articles.author: Emily JB Smith

articles.headline: Saluting their service: Descendants of WWII veterans keeping diggers' stories alive
articles.description: A unique documentary project launched in regional Queensland on Remembrance Day shows a fresh and compelling perspective on the legacy of war.
articles.author: David Iliffe

articles.headline: Why does Queensland need two quarantine facilities, when other states are relaxing COVID-19 controls?
articles.description: The state's Deputy Premier has defended the two COVID-19 quarantine facilities, arguing it would leave Queensland better prepared than New South Wales and Victoria.
articles.author: Peter McCutcheon

articles.headline: In the original land of a fast food deal, dining out is getting more expensive
articles.description: Prices — or core inflation — are rising at their highest rate in three decades in the United States. Here's why and what it could mean for Australia.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: American boy named world's most premature infant to survive
articles.description: Born 132 days premature with a twin who didn't survive, Curtis Means is now healthy and 16 months old.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: Noosa property prices jump $6,000 a week as market surges through October
articles.description: Latest figures from CoreLogic show homes on the Sunshine Coast are increasing in value weekly as demand for Queensland property ramps up.
articles.author: Owen Jacques and Meg Bolton

articles.headline: 'Phenomenal' roadkill numbers in SA prompt pleas to slow down
articles.description: A massive increase in roadkill this spring is littering South Australian highways, with one wildlife rescuer finding 13 wombats and 10 kangaroos dead on a single road in the Murraylands.
articles.author: Malcolm Sutton

articles.headline: 'Great injustice': Family of 'beautiful little baby' killed by father say sentence inadequate
articles.description: Kozan Samuel Thomas Ware had been looking after his five-month-old son Adrian by himself for the first time when the incident occurred in March, 2017.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Aussie pitcher Liam Hendriks claims coveted MLB award
articles.description: Hendriks wins the American League's relief pitcher award for the second straight year, reaffirming his status as one of the MLB's top closers.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Forged signatures, deleted text messages and secret phone calls feature in latest IBAC hearing
articles.description: Former Victorian government minister Adem Somyurek tells IBAC it is "probably fair" to conclude he was aware his staff were forging other people's signatures, on his third day of evidence to an inquiry investigating misuse of taxpayer-funded staff.
articles.author: Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: Investigation launched after child swallows button battery at Queensland childcare centre
articles.description: C&K Kindergarten Association says it is cooperating fully with authorities after the incident at an undisclosed early learning centre on October 11.
articles.author: Amy Sheehan

articles.headline: Crime scene declared on Palm Island after man found dead with head injuries
articles.description: Queensland Police are investigating the suspicious death of a man on Palm Island, off the coast of Townsville.
articles.author: Jade Toomey

articles.headline: EPA investigation finds no evidence of deliberate oil dumping in Adelaide's Chinatown
articles.description: An Environment Protection Authority investigation finds new pavers in Adelaide's Chinatown were likely stained while oil was being transported but does not discover evidence it was deliberately dumped in drains.
articles.author: Jade Toomey

articles.headline: EV maker Rivian valued at more than Ford despite only having made 150 cars
articles.description: Shares of Rivian surged as much as 53 per cent on its Nasdaq debut, giving the EV maker a market valuation of more than $US100 billion.
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: 'What hope do we have?': Residents denied COVID-19 test despite exposure risk
articles.description: Gold Coast Health says testing clinics have been "flexed up" to cope with increased demand after people were turned away at Robina.
articles.author: Cathy Border, Tom Forbes, Nicole Dyer, and Heidi Sheehan

articles.headline: Queensland researcher finds gut problems not a cause of autism
articles.description: Researchers say children on the autism spectrum are more likely to have gut complaints, but the study didn't find that the microbiome causes autism.
articles.author: Emma Pollard

articles.headline: Gold Coast residents could return to lockdown if mystery COVID outbreak continues
articles.description: Gold Coast residents are warned to expect a short, sharp lockdown if further unlinked cases are detected in the next 48 hours. The mystery outbreak has boosted the otherwise sluggish vaccine uptake in the city.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: 'Not your shame to carry': How to tell your boss you're in an abusive relationship and need time off work
articles.description: More Australian employers are implementing policies to fight domestic and family violence, recognising it's a workplace health and safety issue. Here are your rights as a worker.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: Drought-stricken Queensland comes alive after drenching
articles.description: Rural residents are celebrating after storms bring heavy rain to the region with spirits high for more of the wet stuff.
articles.author: Maddelin McCosker, Ellie Grounds, and Julia André

articles.headline: African Nations Cup returns to South Australia in celebration of culture, community and football
articles.description: Cancelled last year due to COVID-19, South Australia's African Nations Cup is back. The tournament brings together African communities from all over Australia to celebrate culture and football.
articles.author: Camron Slessor

articles.headline: Doctor takes bid to treat patient with MDMA to court, in first case of its kind in Australia
articles.description: A lawyer representing the Victorian psychiatrist tells a court the doctor believes using ecstasy would help his severely ill patient, after the Department of Health knocks back his request to use the drug.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: Live music is ramping up again. These memories kept the spirit alive
articles.description: While the pandemic forced long, dark months of silence, our yearning for the shared experience of live performance has only grown stronger.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: Morrison coined a new slogan this week, but there's a problem with it
articles.description: It seemed remarkable chutzpah that Scott Morrison, back from Glasgow where Australia remains a criticised laggard despite its embrace of a 2050 target, would hit the trail to campaign on climate policy, writes Michelle Grattan.
articles.author: Michelle Grattan

articles.headline: NSW Police opposed plan to protect Aboriginal communities before fatal COVID-19 outbreaks
articles.description: One of Australia's most senior policemen swayed the New South Wales government to reject a plan to protect Aboriginal communities, before this year's spiralling COVID-19 outbreak in which at least 15 Aboriginal people have died.
articles.author: Sean Rubinsztein-Dunlop

articles.headline: Mohan and Kumar lost thousands in a social media scam that preyed on Tamil refugees
articles.description: The Hope Business scheme promised rapid returns on investments and commissions for signing up family and friends before it vanished without a trace.
articles.author: Tim Swanston

articles.headline: Cannibalism, disease and smothering are just some of the dangers free-range chickens face
articles.description: The welfare of Australia's nearly 22 million chickens has been under scrutiny recently. But not everyone agrees on what constitutes a good life for a hen.
articles.author: Simon Leo Brown

articles.headline: Chip off the ol' Moon? Mysterious near-Earth asteroid may have lunar origins
articles.description: A mysterious asteroid that travels around the Sun close to Earth may be a chunk of the Moon, a study suggests.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Socceroos in 'great position' in World Cup qualifying, but can't afford any slip ups
articles.description: Graham Arnold says the Socceroos are in a "great position" after Thursday's draw with Saudi Arabia in World Cup qualifying, but cannot afford any slip ups.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Russia again sends nuclear-capable bombers on patrol over Belarus
articles.description: Two Russian Tu-160 strategic bombers practice bombing runs at the Ruzany firing range, about 60 kilometres east of Belarus' border with Poland.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Keating's 'benign and wrong' views on China ridiculed on Q+A
articles.description: Former prime minister Paul Keating's views on China are heavily criticised, as one Q+A panellist speaks of how Liberal Senator Eric Abetz wanted her to denounce the Chinese Communist Party.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Matthew Wade blasts Australia into World Cup final
articles.description: Brilliant performances with the bat from David Warner, Marcus Stoinis and Matthew Wade against Pakistan lift Australia into the Twenty20 World Cup final against New Zealand.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Chinese leaders agree to historic resolution cementing Xi Jinping's power
articles.description: The Central Committee declares Mr Xi's ideology the "essence of Chinese culture" and praises his role in the country's economic and political rise.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Steven Gerrard appointed new coach of English Premier League side Aston Villa
articles.description: The Liverpool great, who last season led Rangers to their first Scottish league title since 2011, replaces Dean Smith as manager of the Birmingham club.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Former South African president FW de Klerk dies aged 85
articles.description: Frederik Willem de Klerk, the last president of apartheid South Africa, dies aged 85 after a battle with cancer.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Elon Musk sells $US5 billion in Tesla shares after support in Twitter poll
articles.description: Tesla boss Elon Musk sells about $US5 billion in shares days after polling Twitter users about selling 10 per cent of his stake, amid debate in the US about tax avoidance by billionaires.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Hannah Clarke's parents Queensland's Australians of the Year for domestic violence campaigning
articles.description: Sue and Lloyd Clarke have become Queensland's 2022 Australians of the Year — the state's nominees for the national award in January — for their tireless work in campaigning against domestic violence despite their horrific loss.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: Singles' Day is the biggest shopping event in the world. But this year e-commerce has less 'gunpowder'
articles.description: A more muted Singles' Day shopping extravaganza is held amid a regulatory crackdown on the technology industry in China.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: Security staffing levels unclear during Travis Scott's Astroworld set, Houston police chief says
articles.description: Houston's police chief says the show's promoter was responsible for providing security to two mosh pits in front of the stage, and the records provided by the company were "just not good".
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: 'Tasmania wasted the ink': WA cricket officials confident of staging Ashes Test in Perth
articles.description: Following Tasmania's bid to snatch the fifth men's Ashes Test, the Western Australian Cricket Association remains "positive" the match will go ahead in Perth.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: The Loop: Bert Newton's final moments, big-nosed dinosaur discovered in the UK and how Run Run the 'puppy' outfoxed its owner
articles.description: Here's your TL;DR for today.
articles.author: Bridget Judd

articles.headline: 'Silenced': Wife of constable killed on duty prevented from reading victim statement at inquest hearing
articles.description: Susan Forte, herself a serving police officer, says she has been waiting for more than four years to "have my say" over her husband's death on duty, but counsel assisting the coroner and several other lawyers argued her victim impact statement contained "scandalous" and defamatory allegations.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Former NT border worker who leaked confidential COVID information avoids jail
articles.description: Cristal Archer is handed a one-year suspended sentence for divulging restricted information to her then-boyfriend when she was working for the NT government's Department of Health, screening passengers in the Darwin Airport border control unit.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Manfred achieves his dream of becoming a physicist — at age 89
articles.description: Manfred Steiner, 89, decided to study physics rather than hit around golf balls after retirement — earning his PhD and inspiring others to pursue their ambitions at any age.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Nyrstar to cover lead material to reduce emissions in Port Pirie from dust
articles.description: A large building will be built in Port Pirie to cover material containing lead to prevent emissions from the city's smelter increasing lead levels in local children.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: American journalist jailed for 11 years in Myanmar
articles.description: A court in military-ruled Myanmar sentences US journalist Danny Fenster to 11 years in jail, as he still faces several more serious charges including terrorism.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: The net zero modelling's been released. Here are some of the big assumptions
articles.description: To save you spending your Friday night sifting through the government's modelling for its net zero by 2050 plan, here are a few of the key takeaways.
articles.author: Georgia Hitch

articles.headline: Construction giant Multiplex fined $150,000 over Canberra worksite death
articles.description: Construction company Multiplex is fined $150,000 over the death of a construction worker on one of its building sites five years ago.
articles.author: Holly Tregenza

articles.headline: SA Police Commissioner lashes out at select committee looking into harm caused by ICAC investigations
articles.description: SA's Police Commissioner criticises a parliamentary select committee that is looking into harm caused by anti-corruption commissioner investigations.
articles.author: Mahalia Carter

articles.headline: Businesses still looking for clarity — and 'loopholes' — with NT vaccine mandate about to take affect
articles.description: As the clock ticks on a wide-ranging vaccine mandate, the NT government has quietly changed the rules and warned against looking for loopholes – including one business that wants to separate out "vulnerable" members.
articles.author: Steve Vivian and Nicholas Hynes

articles.headline: Tedesco facing $10,000 fine following NRL investigation into alleged Squid Game incident
articles.description: Sydney Roosters captain James Tedesco is issued with a breach notice for "drunken and disorderly behaviour" after he was alleged to have made a racial slur against a woman, citing the Netflix series Squid Game.
articles.author: Steve Vivian and Nicholas Hynes

articles.headline: Child rescued from alleged porn operation, as man faces 43 charges
articles.description: A child has been rescued, and a man from the Sunshine Coast has been charged with more than 40 child abuse offences, including rape, after a five-day police operation.
articles.author: Owen Jacques

articles.headline: Leo watched his hometown burn. Now, he's being celebrated for saving it
articles.description: Mallacoota SES unit controller Leo op den Brouw is named Victorian Local Hero of the Year for helping his East Gippsland town rebuild after the 2019-20 bushfires.
articles.author: Madi Chwasta

articles.headline: The world's biggest meat processor says Huon Aquaculture is the start of its foray into seafood
articles.description: Executives from Brazilian meat processing giant JBS are in Tasmania surveying its new seafood company Huon Aquaculture ahead of its takeover next Wednesday.
articles.author: Fiona Breen and Tony Briscoe

articles.headline: 'Daigou is dying', but Australian products remain popular in China despite trade tensions
articles.description: The world's largest online shopping festival sets a new sales record, with Australian products playing a big part, but year-on-year growth falls to its slowest since the event began.
articles.author: Bang Xiao

articles.headline: SA storm damage bill tipped to rise as clean-up support announced
articles.description: Residents in 24 areas across South Australia will have access to cash to clean-up storm damage after initial assessments show infrastructure and crop losses have already reached $350 million.
articles.author: Victor Petrovic, Eliza Berlage, Sophie Landau, and Matt Stephens

articles.headline: Record snow falls in north-eastern China cause chaos as authorities warn of more to come
articles.description: China's National Meteorological Agency raises an orange blizzard warning – the second-highest in China's four-tiered alert system — as the country's first snowfall of the year arrives a month earlier than usual.
articles.author: Victor Petrovic, Eliza Berlage, Sophie Landau, and Matt Stephens

articles.headline: All eyes are on Xi's history-making move, but there are important pointers to the future too
articles.description: It is reasonable to assume Xi has close supporters within the CCP leadership. But they are not as visible as was the case for his predecessors, Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping, writes David Goodm
articles.author: Victor Petrovic, Eliza Berlage, Sophie Landau, and Matt Stephens

articles.headline: China Evergrande avoids default, but where is the money coming from?
articles.description: The world's most indebted developer, China Evergrande, keeps avoiding default. But where is the company getting the money from?
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: Queen to attend Remembrance Day service, in first public appearance since hospitalisation
articles.description: After weeks of bed rest and light duties as a result of an unspecified ailment, the 95-year-old monarch will watch the Remembrance Day ceremony at the Cenotaph memorial in London from a balcony, as she has for several years.
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: 'No good guys in the Labor Party': Somyurek breaks down in tears at IBAC inquiry
articles.description: The fourth and final day of Adem Somyurek's testimony to IBAC were emotional, with the former minister shedding tears over mudflinging from political rivals.
articles.author: Bridget Rollason

articles.headline: Woman pleads guilty to starting deadly house fire in Wagga Wagga
articles.description: A woman who set fire to a house killing her former housemate was retaliating after a "falling out", police tell the District Court.
articles.author: Shannon Corvo

articles.headline: 'He's never forgotten where he comes from': NBA star Patty Mills named ACT Australian of the Year
articles.description: International basketball star and Indigenous rights campaigner Patty Mills is named as the ACT's 2022 Australian of the Year nominee for his social justice work.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: 'Warrior' Rizwan nearly gets Pakistan over the line against Australia after ICU stay
articles.description: Mohammad Rizwan's knock of 67, which gave Pakistan a shot at victory against Australia in the T20 World Cup semi-final, came just hours after his release from hospital where he spent two nights in the ICU with a chest infection.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: Michelle was excited to take a sales job with an online flower company, but quickly she 'didn't feel right'
articles.description: The consumer watchdog is investigating whether large flower delivery companies are misleading people using tactics online to make their services appear local.
articles.author: Eden Hynninen

articles.headline: The 'soul destroying' crime against children so unspeakable it goes undetected
articles.description: Of the 1.4 million adults sexually abused as children, only a fraction were first abused by a stranger.
articles.author: Tracey Shelton

articles.headline: 'The anxiety had taken hold': How care in a psychiatric ward for new mothers saved Renee's life
articles.description: In the past year, there has been a 50 per cent increase in the number of new parents asking for help before or after the birth of a child because they are struggling with their mental health.
articles.author: Nicole Asher

articles.headline: Preselection headaches for Victorian Liberals as shadow treasurer moves on seat of drink-driving MP Tim Smith
articles.description: The Victorian Liberal party faces weeks of internal distraction with five sitting MPs being challenged for preselection and Shadow Treasurer David Davis making a bold bid to move to the lower house.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: ‘We can push the dialogue along’: This art festival is changing institutions from the inside
articles.description: In its sixth year, Tarnanthi, the Art Gallery of South Australia’s festival of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander art, remains committed to supporting First Nations artists and elevating their voices.
articles.author: Jo Higgins

articles.headline: England coach Eddie Jones shines in a week of Master Coach trickery, but the Wallabies have too many issues to take note
articles.description: Injuries force Wallabies into a selection reshuffle, with a shock Test debutant named in the side to take on England this Sunday. But all the English focus has been on master coach Eddie Jones, who did what he always does when his team faces scrutiny: distraction.
articles.author: Brett McKay

articles.headline: Jeongyeong's baby girl is the 'most beautiful decision' he's made. But he still hasn't met her
articles.description: Jeongyeong's first child, a baby girl, was born in August last year. But he's never been able to hold her, and temporary residents like his wife are left in limbo as Australia's borders reopen.
articles.author: Erin Handley

articles.headline: 'Relax on demand': What a freediver and a yoga teacher know about breathing
articles.description: Breathing is instinctual but that doesn't mean it can't be improved. Using different techniques for different types of exercise can impact your performance and daily life.
articles.author: Amanda Smith and Sophie Kesteven

articles.headline: Why a huge surge in US inflation could derail the Australian property market
articles.description: The Australian property market has for many years defied the laws of gravity. But analysts are warning a huge surge in US inflation has the potential to derail the Australian property market, writes David Taylor.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: The lasting scars of lockdown will shape the election, but the Prime Minister is looking elsewhere
articles.description: Whether you take a benign view of China's intentions, or an alarmed one, Taiwan and China are now becoming a very, very complex problem for everyone — including Australia, writes Laura Tingle.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: What happens when Australia's COVID-19 'honeymoon' ends? Singapore offers warning
articles.description: Many Australians are rightly looking forward to a carefree summer. However, experts warn Singapore's current COVID-19 surge may be a prime example of how Australia could struggle to remain virus-free for very long.
articles.author: Anne Barker

articles.headline: Australian-first study paves way for mothers returning to elite sport
articles.description: Some of Australia's top female sportswomen have criticised the lack of support for new mums, prompting the Australia Institution of Sport to investigate.
articles.author: Brittney Kleyn

articles.headline: This sleepy country town is a secretive centre for Big Pharma drug production
articles.description: This is the strange story of how a small, unassuming country town and a native plant became the epicentre for a major pharmaceutical drug industry and an alleged criminal cartel.
articles.author: Jon Daly

articles.headline: A princess and a rugby royal are working to counter vaccine misinformation in the Pacific
articles.description: Influential figures from across the Pacific are working to ensure public health messages relating to COVID-19 reach communities at a time where misinformation and vaccine hesitancy are rife across the region.
articles.author: Marian Faa

articles.headline: Pacific leaders vow to halt increasing fossil fuel subsidies and share COVID-19 vaccine technology
articles.description: Pacific leaders, hosted entirely online by New Zealand, agree to chart a road to post-pandemic recovery to ensure the Asia-Pacific region "remains the world’s most dynamic and interconnected regional economy".
articles.author: Joshua Boscaini

articles.headline: Second COP26 draft agreement softens language on coal and fossil fuel reduction
articles.description: The draft decision, the second released this week, is being negotiated by representatives from nearly 200 countries and the final version has to be agreed to by all countries at the summit
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: SA's Deputy Premier makes defamation threat in attempt to halt conflict inquiry
articles.description: South Australia's Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman has launched a defamation threat in a bid to halt a parliamentary inquiry examining whether she has a conflict of interest
articles.author: Leah MacLennan and Nick Harmsen

articles.headline: Perth Airport 'missed the mark' in move to recognise traditional owners on boarding gates
articles.description: Perth Airport becomes the first major airport in Australia to recognise traditional owners on its domestic boarding gates, but there are claims not all the labels are correct.
articles.author: Abby Richards

articles.headline: Aussies highlight positives from poor T20 World Cup build-up after reaching final
articles.description: Australia lost five consecutive T20 series prior to the men's World Cup, but coach Justin Langer believes the experience ultimately benefited his squad.
articles.author: Abby Richards

articles.headline: Massive funnel-web nicknamed Megaspider donated to venom-milking facility
articles.description: A massive funnel-web spider with fangs so long they could bite through a human fingernail is donated to a lifesaving antivenom program at the Australian Reptile Park.
articles.author: Abby Richards

articles.headline: Court hears alleged murder victim's house was unusually clean and smelt like bleach
articles.description: The trial of Paul Winston Oatey continues in Adelaide's Supreme Court. He is accused of murdering 53-year-old Darren Perry in December 2019. The teenage girl who the court heard discovered Mr Perry's body in a backyard gives evidence.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Katherine mask mandate extended after positive COVID-19 wastewater results
articles.description: A mask mandate in the town of Katherine is extended for a further 24 hours after positive wastewater results were detected in the region.
articles.author: Housnia Shams

articles.headline: 'Not the smartest thing': Black Caps star breaks hand punching bat, ruled out of T20 World Cup final
articles.description: An outburst of frustration leaves Devon Conway nursing a broken hand following New Zealand's semi-final victory over England, ruling the wicketkeeper-batter out of the tournament decider against Australia.
articles.author: Housnia Shams

articles.headline: Graeme Edge, co-founder of The Moody Blues, dies at 80
articles.description: Moody Blues frontman Justin Hayward confirms Graeme Edge's death on the group's website. The cause of his death has not been revealed.
articles.author: Housnia Shams

articles.headline: Aussie world champion cyclist announces retirement
articles.description: Track cycling star Kaarle McCulloch calls time on a decorated career, which includes four world championships and an Olympic bronze medal.
articles.author: Housnia Shams

articles.headline: Katherine face mask mandate extended until Monday afternoon
articles.description: Katherine residents must continue wearing face masks for a further 48 hours as authorities continue to test wastewater samples for COVID-19.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Fringe Test quick's Ashes stocks rise in WA's Sheffield Shield victory
articles.description: Jhye Richardson may be the next in line if one of Australia's fast bowlers falters in the men's Ashes, after his eight-wicket haul helps propel Western Australia to a comfortable win over Queensland.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Taylor Swift's heartbreak anthem has been re-recorded with revealing extra lyrics
articles.description: All Too Well was never released as a single, but it quickly became a fan favourite. Now it's 10 minutes long and has its own short film.
articles.author: Dannielle Maguire

articles.headline: Lawsuits filed by more than 200 people who claim to have been injured in Astroworld crowd surge
articles.description: Lawyers representing more than 200 people claiming they were injured in last week's Astroworld Festival stampede are filing another 90 lawsuits against the promoters of the event in which at least nine people died.
articles.author: Dannielle Maguire

articles.headline: US high jumper awarded 2012 Olympic gold medal nine years after London Games
articles.description: Erik Kynard is upgraded from silver to gold, following the International Olympic Committee's decision to reallocate medals from 2012 because of doping cases.
articles.author: Dannielle Maguire

articles.headline: Charles Perkins Oration: Why truth-telling and treaties are needed to reconcile Australia's past
articles.description: Tony McAvoy SC has used the 2021 Charles Perkins Memorial Oration to advocate for the establishment of truth commissions and treaties with Australia's First Peoples, labelling the often-used assertion that Aboriginal people should 'stop living in the past' as "not possible".
articles.author: Jai McAllister

articles.headline: 'Pingu' the lost Antarctic penguin swims 3,000 kilometres to New Zealand
articles.description: An Adélie penguin swims to the shores of New Zealand, at least 3,000 kilometres from its natural habitat of Antarctica.
articles.author: Jai McAllister

articles.headline: French authorities investigate alleged rape of soldier at Elysee Palace
articles.description: Both soldiers were stationed at the Elysee Palace, where French President Emmanuel Macron resides, but the accused man has since been moved away from his post.
articles.author: Jai McAllister

articles.headline: 'It's about choice': The people at the heart of the NSW euthanasia law debate
articles.description: As NSW politicians continue debating the proposed voluntary assisted dying bill, the people it affects remain in limbo.
articles.author: Nick Parmeter and Luisa Rubbo

articles.headline: 'I think they're going to sit it out': Family bogged in desert likely to be there all weekend
articles.description: Rescue authorities are currently working on a plan to retrieve a family from Perth who are trapped in outback South Australia because of torrential downpours.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Man killed in plane crash weeks after Blue Origin flight into space
articles.description: Glen de Vries, a tech company founder who travelled to space with TV star William Shatner on a rocket owned by Jeff Bezos's company last month, is among two people killed in a small plane crash in New Jersey.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Netherlands enters three-week partial lockdown amid COVID surge
articles.description: The lockdown is the first to start in western Europe since a new wave of infections began surging across parts of the continent.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: The automotive plant that helped shift gears on equality
articles.description: A new exhibition in Albury is celebrating the history of a manufacturing plant that helped smooth the road for greater gender equality in Australia's workforce.
articles.author: Allison Jess

articles.headline: Could older workers help WA through its worst-ever staff shortage?
articles.description: The hospitality industry says more can be done to entice older workers, retirees, pensioners or anyone in between to help alleviate a labour crisis that's largely a result of continued border closures.
articles.author: Georgia Loney

articles.headline: Are Australia's hawksbill turtles safe from the deadly tortoiseshell trade?
articles.description: As the illegal trade in tortoiseshell items expands in Asia, scientists track the critically endangered hawksbill turtles off the Western Australian coast to see if they are safe.
articles.author: Laura Birch

articles.headline: 'It lifts my spirits': An embattled community picks up the threads
articles.description: They call themselves the Bobin Sew 'n' Sews, and they meet each week to sew and most importantly, talk. The group, formed in the aftermath of devastating bushfires, is helping a community heal.
articles.author: Emma Siossian

articles.headline: PSG player released from custody after teammate attacked
articles.description: PSG midfielder Aminata Diallo has denied being involved in an alleged assault on her teammate Kheira Hamraoui, who was pulled out of a car and attacked by two masked men.
articles.author: Emma Siossian

articles.headline: When COVID and burnout led Fred back home, he found unexpected happiness
articles.description: Growing up, Fred Porter was desperate to leave his remote family farm for a far-flung place. But facing burnout and lockdowns, the marketing consultant returned home, finding happiness combining city work with country living.
articles.author: Samille Mitchell

articles.headline: Queensland records zero locally acquired COVID-19 cases as state inches towards 70pc double dose vaccine target
articles.description: Queensland records zero locally acquired cases of COVID-19 as residents on the Gold Coast are urged to continue coming forward for testing following unknown cases earlier this week.
articles.author: Ciara Jones

articles.headline: Harry Kane as good as sends England to 2022 World Cup
articles.description: England have made short work of Albania, all but booking their place in Qatar, but European Champions Italy have been held against Switzerland and must now beat Northern Ireland well on Monday to be certain of progressing.
articles.author: Ciara Jones

articles.headline: Torrential downpours, raging rivers and blocked roads: Alice Springs' wettest November on record
articles.description: Torrential downpours, a dry river flooded, a dramatic rescue and city traffic jams in the outback — and it's only halfway through the month.
articles.author: Saskia Mabin

articles.headline: Gippsland's wild weather not over yet as rain buckets down
articles.description: Authorities have issued a major flood warning for the Mitchell River in the east of Victoria, which is expected to peak above 5 metres this afternoon.
articles.author: Riordan Davis

articles.headline: Trump ally Steve Bannon accused of contempt of Congress after defying subpoena
articles.description: Steve Bannon, a long-time ally to former US president Donald Trump, has been indicted on two counts of contempt of Congress after defying a congressional subpoena from the House committee investigating the insurrection at the US Capitol.
articles.author: Riordan Davis

articles.headline: The cartoons changing lives: Indigenous group's gender-equity campaign success
articles.description: A social media campaign challenges gender stereotypes, creates positive images of Indigenous children, and aims to stop the violence against women.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: Marc lost a military career and had PTSD. He never thought bees would be what saved him
articles.description: The Air Force veteran struggled to leave his house in Adelaide, years after a serious incident in Afghanistan left him traumatised. He came across beekeeping by chance and is sharing their healing power with other veterans, first responders and their famili
articles.author: Bec Whetham and Daniel Franklin

articles.headline: 'You can't enter the stadiums': Cameron Smith issues blunt warning to unvaccinated NRL players
articles.description: Speaking at the City of Logan Sports Awards near Brisbane, Smith says NRL players who refuse to be vaccinated against COVID-19 will find it almost impossible to fulfil the requirements of their contracts.
articles.author: Jason Dasey

articles.headline: 'You can't be Aboriginal': Winner of the Dr Charles Perkins Prize says don't let others define who you are
articles.description: Benjamin Wilson dismissed slurs he was told at school and instead focused on storytelling and learning – which now sees him named a recipient of the Dr Charles Perkins Memorial Prize.
articles.author: Dan Bourchier

articles.headline: The Amazon could cover three quarters of Australia. It's 'in danger of becoming a savannah'
articles.description: For 55 million years, heavy rain has brought life and splendour to the Amazon rainforest. But we're approaching a tipping point.
articles.author: Zoe Kean

articles.headline: The many faces of Greg Norman's Saudi-backed golf revolution
articles.description: Greg Norman says he wants to awaken a sleeping giant of the golf world. The Asian Tour simply wants to stay alive. Saudi Arabia's intentions are altogether more questionable — these strange bedfellows could be about to change the game.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: 'I slid headfirst for about 70 metres': Britt Cox is glad she can't remember the crash that almost ended her career
articles.description: Moguls skier Britt Cox was taking on the world and winning, until she broke her collarbone and six ribs in a crash. Determined to get back into form, she's now eyeing a fourth Winter Olympics.
articles.author: Daniela Intili

articles.headline: Why is a country led by a Peace Prize winner on the brink of all-out civil war?
articles.description: Rebels are closing in on the Ethiopian capital as millions face "catastrophic famine conditions" and alleged "ethnic cleansing" in the Tigray region.
articles.author: Daniela Intili

articles.headline: 'I felt like a prisoner': Here's what it's like to live under a conservatorship like Britney Spears
articles.description: Jenny Hatch is among more than a million Americans who've lived under strict legal arrangements where their every move was controlled by someone else. Now that the Britney Spears case has shone the spotlight on conservatorships, advocates are pushing for change.
articles.author: Barbara Miller

articles.headline: The West is staring down Chinese power — but do we know what's worth fighting for?
articles.description: To talk about notions of honour or society can seem hopelessly conservative today, even reactionary. But the question remains: what to we replace them with, asks Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: Two billion vaccines, a lofty goal and unmet promises: How rich nations have failed the world
articles.description: More booster shots have now been administered in high income countries than the total number of doses given in low income countries since the pandemic began.
articles.author: Casey Briggs

articles.headline: Sara Duterte is running for vice-president of the Philippines, and she may have to take her father on
articles.description: The popular longtime mayor's candidacy for vice-president comes as a surprise because opinion polls show her ahead in the race for preferred presidential candidate.
articles.author: Casey Briggs

articles.headline: Third COP26 draft ensures rich nations deliver climate promises
articles.description: The new COP26 draft agreement also maintains a core demand for countries to set more ambitious plans to tackle global warming and asked them to phase out inefficient subsidies for the fossil fuels heating the planet.
articles.author: Casey Briggs

articles.headline: De Pasquale claims another Sydney win in Supercars Championship
articles.description: Anton De Pasquale continues to dominate the Sydney Motorsport Park circuit, securing his fifth win of 2021 and fourth in three weekends.
articles.author: Casey Briggs

articles.headline: 'Like a giant tin can hitting the water': Two men escape serious injury after light plane crashes off Perth beach
articles.description: Two men escape serious injury after a light plane crashes into the ocean off a popular Perth beach.
articles.author: Casey Briggs

articles.headline: Aussies bracing for Black Caps to 'fight and scrap' in T20 World Cup decider
articles.description: Australia knows the challenge they will face from New Zealand in the men's T20 World Cup final, especially after the Black Caps knocked England out of the tournament in the semis.
articles.author: Casey Briggs

articles.headline: Tasmania records new COVID case after man arrives on flight from Brisbane
articles.description: The Victorian man was meant to travel to Melbourne via Hobart without leaving the airport. But after his arrival, Tasmanian authorities were notified by their counterparts in Queensland he had returned a positive test.
articles.author: Alexandra Alvaro

articles.headline: Holloway outlasts Rodriguez in one of UFC's 'best fights'
articles.description: A bloodied and swollen Max Holloway defeats Yair Rodriguez in a featherweight slugfest, taking the bout by unanimous decision at UFC Fight Night in Las Vegas.
articles.author: Alexandra Alvaro

articles.headline: Attempts to decapitate Mahatma Gandhi statue a day after being unveiled by the Prime Minister
articles.description: Police appeal for witnesses after attempts to decapitate a newly unveiled statue of Mahatma Gandhi at the Australian Indian Community Centre in Rowville.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Carlton's Liam Jones announces AFL retirement after reportedly refusing COVID-19 vaccination
articles.description: The Blues confirmed Jones's retirement effective immediately, with the veteran defender saying it is for "personal reasons".
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Japan's former princess leaves for US with commoner husband
articles.description: Princess Mako will build a new life in New York, after being forced to exit the royal family due to her marriage to a commoner.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Third boat capsize in four weeks prompts warning from Tasmania Police
articles.description: Police issue a warning about water safety after three men are forced to swim ashore when their dinghy capsizes on Tasmania's west coast, the third boating incident in recent weeks.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: Ita Buttrose accuses government of political interference over complaints inquiry
articles.description: Ita Buttrose calls for the Senate to stop an inquiry into the way the ABC handles complaints, describing the probe as a "an act of political interference designed to intimidate" the public broadcaster.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: Hancock makes history with 'proudest' Coolangatta Gold victory
articles.description: Courtney Hancock writes her name into the record books with a fourth win on the Gold Coast, while Ali Day adds a seventh men's title to his collection.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: Plumes of black smoke billow into sky from factory blaze at Kurri Kurri
articles.description: A factory fire at Kurri Kurri in the NSW Hunter is sending massive plumes of smoke into the air, fuelled by hand sanitiser stored on the site.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: Eddie Jones claims Wallabies are 'going in the right direction' despite another loss to England
articles.description: Jones's England team has now won eight straight Tests against Australia, but he believes there are positive signs on the horizon for the Wallabies in the build-up to the 2023 Rugby World Cup.
articles.author: April McLennan

articles.headline: A 'Kangaroo court' over a Kangaroo Island port: How SA's Deputy Premier is caught in an unwelcome spotlight
articles.description: SA Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman is embroiled in a conflict-of-interest saga which is soaking up political oxygen for the government as it tries to reopen borders and prepare for next March's election.
articles.author: Rory McClaren

articles.headline: How will net zero shape the future? With job gains and losses. It's inevitable
articles.description: The history of the Holden car company shows how technology and politics shapes the fortunes of workers.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens
