articles.headline: 'They've just ditched in the water': Audio captures moment light plane hits ocean off Perth
articles.description: Air traffic control audio captures the moment a light plane ditches into the ocean at a popular Perth beach after the pilot reports engine trouble.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: Medi-hotel escapee who used fire escape allegedly entered SA with stolen driver's licence
articles.description: Police are are seeking public assistance to locate a woman who allegedly travelled from Darwin and entered South Australia on a stolen driver's licence, and then escaped from the Pullman medi-hotel in Adelaide's CBD.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Veteran teacher to face off with Angus Taylor in 2022 federal election
articles.description: The Voices of Hume campaign has selected Penny Ackery to take on the Energy Minister in the seat of Hume when Australia votes next year.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: 68 prisoners killed after Ecuador prison erupts with gang violence
articles.description: Authorities say a power struggle between gangs in the Penitenciaria del Litoral prison led to 68 deaths and many more injuries.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Young children unlikely to be vaccinated against COVID until next year, Health Minister says
articles.description: Australian children aged between five and 11 are unlikely to be vaccinated against COVID-19 before January, as the TGA is still reviewing the health and safety data for the age group.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: It may be incremental, but at least the COP26 climate pact mentions fossil fuels, unlike Paris
articles.description: Some were quick to declare the COP26 climate talks a failure before they even started. Now, after weeks of negotiations, Michael Slezak takes a look at what they have achieved.
articles.author: Michael Slezak

articles.headline: Honouring the forgotten faces of the ANZAC legend
articles.description: For the past ten years, Wiradjuri Elder Ruth Carney has gone to her community's ANZAC day service knowing the memory of her father and uncles are recognised.
articles.author: Olivia Ralph

articles.headline: Victorian mum wages war on waste, one lunch box at a time
articles.description: No Packet November has gone online this year, but for the nutritionist behind the campaign, the message is still the same — get your kids eating better food with less waste and we all stand to benefit.
articles.author: Sarah Lawrence

articles.headline: 'We had confidence': Mum of Perth man stranded with family in SA outback tells of fear turning to relief
articles.description: The parents of a Perth man stranded with his wife and children in South Australia's remote outback have expressed deep relief after finding out their family is safe — but the travelling group is still facing a potentially lengthy wait for floodwaters to drain away.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Man dies from burns sustained in fire allegedly related to domestic violence
articles.description: A man who suffered serious burns in an Alice Springs house fire that killed his partner, and that police were investigating as a homicide, has died.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Wilbur Smith, bestselling author, dies in South Africa aged 88
articles.description: The acclaimed author of 49 titles dies at his home in Cape Town, having sold more than 140 million copies of his books over the course of his career.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: National job vacancies are up by almost 50pc, but don't blame the 'great resignation'
articles.description: As a registered nurse, Irene McInerney's skill set is one of the most in demand in the nation. But like millions of other workers, she's feeling the strain of the labour shortage, which has left experts reeling.
articles.author: Eliza Borrello

articles.headline: Queensland set to loosen COVID border restrictions, with 1.6m people unvaccinated in the state
articles.description: As the state prepares to relax some border rules after reaching a vaccine milestone yesterday, one expert warns there is a "very real risk of chains of transmission kicking off and spreading dangerously" with so many people still to get a single COVID jab.
articles.author: Eliza Borrello

articles.headline: 'Never stop fighting': Hamilton drives from 10th to first to keep F1 title hopes alive
articles.description: Lewis Hamilton defies history in Brazil to win the Sao Paulo Grand Prix and close his deficit in the Formula 1 drivers' championship to Max Verstappen.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Why are NSW bureaucrats calling for a radical surge in immigration? Here's their economic logic
articles.description: What would happen to our standard of living if our immigration intake surged by 2 million in five years? Some economists believe it could help the economy bounce back from COVID.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Want to leave Tasmania this Christmas? Here's what you need to know
articles.description: So you're a Tasmanian itching to travel this Christmas but what are the rules for each state, and do I need a COVID test to go there and get back in?
articles.author: Laura Beavis

articles.headline: How China's hard landing could expose Australia as a one-trick export pony
articles.description: While jubilation flowed through Asian markets last week after China Evergrande narrowly stayed afloat, other Chinese developers are in major distress, spelling trouble for countries like Australia, writes Ian Verrender.
articles.author: Ian Verrender

articles.headline: Julie in France is getting $16,000 to switch to an EV. Spoiler: You're not
articles.description: Governments around the world are offering juicy purchase incentives to speed car ownership to EVs. Here's what they're offering and how it compares with Australia.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Pfizer's pill is the latest COVID-19 treatment to show promise. Here are some more
articles.description: There is a growing portfolio of potential treatments to directly target SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19, and to treat COVID symptoms.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Conservative approach to net zero would still benefit economy, modelling shows
articles.description: New economic modelling shows most Victorian regions will see strong employment and economic growth if Australia transitions to a fully net zero economy.
articles.author: Laura Mayers, Daniel Miles, and Riordan Davis

articles.headline: Australia wins its first ever World T20 title as Mitch Marsh leads biggest-ever chase in a final
articles.description: Superb knocks from Mitch Marsh and David Warner hand Australia their first Twenty20 World Cup title, after New Zealand set them a mammoth target.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Another Gaddafi in Libya? Muammar's son pitches for power as presidential election draws near
articles.description: Saif al-Islam al-Gaddafi has registered himself as a presidential candidate for the December elections. He has rarely been seen publicly for almost a decade.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Liberal backbenchers call for more ambitious 2035 emission reduction target
articles.description: A group of Liberal backbenchers facing election challenges from independent candidates renew calls for a more ambitious 2035 emissions reduction target in the wake of the COP26 summit.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Al Jazeera demands the Sudanese military release arrested bureau chief
articles.description: Al Jazeera says its bureau chief's house was raided on Friday by Sudan's security forces. The country has been rocked by nationwide protests since the military seized power last month.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: As it happened: Australia defeat New Zealand to win maiden Twenty20 World Cup
articles.description: Early in the tournament it would have been hard to see this coming but Australia have managed to claim their first-ever Twenty20 World Cup title. As it happened.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: ‘This is what keeps hope alive’: $60,000 Sydney Film Prize goes to censored Iranian filmmaker
articles.description: Mohammad Rasoulof’s drama There Is No Evil, a commentary on capital punishment in Iran, won Sydney Film Festival’s prize for ‘audacious, cutting-edge and courageous’ film.
articles.author: Dee Jefferson

articles.headline: Queen Elizabeth sprains her back and misses Remembrance Sunday service
articles.description: The Queen is forced to miss the Remembrance Sunday service in London, pulling out just hours before what was set to be her first public appearance in weeks.
articles.author: Dee Jefferson

articles.headline: Body found in septic tank at Pallara in Brisbane's south
articles.description: Police say the body was found in a septic tank in the yard of the home, set on a large block in Pallara.
articles.author: Dee Jefferson

articles.headline: Now silent under the Taliban, a Kabul cinema awaits its fate
articles.description: For decades, this historic cinema has entertained Afghans and borne witness to Afghanistan's wars, hopes and cultural shifts. Now, its gates are closed.
articles.author: Dee Jefferson

articles.headline: Travellers, states and territories told to 'pay up' millions owed to NSW in quarantine fees
articles.description: NSW ministers say the state opened its doors to returned travellers from across Australia and kept them safe in hotel quarantine and it was only fair to taxpayers these bills be paid.
articles.author: Dee Jefferson

articles.headline: Vaccination drive at multicultural event as SA health authorities aim for 80 per cent
articles.description: Nine days ahead of South Australia's deadline to significantly relax border restrictions, health authorities are continuing to seize opportunities to boost vaccination rates.
articles.author: Dee Jefferson

articles.headline: Carlton's Liam Jones announces AFL retirement after reportedly refusing COVID-19 vaccine
articles.description: The Blues confirmed Jones's retirement effective immediately, with the veteran defender saying it is for "personal reasons".
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Fears dross will explode as plant crammed with sanitiser, medical waste goes up in smoke
articles.description: It will take several days to extinguish the blaze at the NSW factory, which has hundreds of tonnes of potentially volatile aluminium waste inside.
articles.author: Ben Millington and Anthony Scully

articles.headline: Positive COVID case recorded in remote Northern Territory community
articles.description: The first case of coronavirus in a remote Northern Territory community has been recorded in Robinson River, days after lockout restrictions were lifted following an outbreak in the Top End.
articles.author: Ben Millington and Anthony Scully

articles.headline: Journalist loses court appeal to keep confidential source a secret, could be jailed for up to five years
articles.description: A journalist could be forced to reveal a confidential source, or face jail time, after Queensland's Court of Appeal finds there is no protection under the law and that public interest immunity could not be applied to a rare legal case.
articles.author: Allyson Horn

articles.headline: SA businesses welcome relaxation of COVID-19 contact rules but areas with low vaccination worrying
articles.description: Business owners say they are worried that the inevitable COVID-19 cases once the state's borders will lead to shutdowns, but at least the reduction in quarantine time for vaccinated people will reduce their extent.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Driver admits to ramming police vehicle at Adelaide car wash
articles.description: A 46-year-old man pleads guilty after a police car was rammed in Adelaide's south in August — but prosecutors drop two charges of endangering life.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Police investigated 23 sexual harassment claims from WA mine sites in the past two years
articles.description: WA Police reveal the number of sexual harassment claims they investigated stemming from mine sites across the state.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Estranged husband found guilty of killing Gold Coast woman Kym Cobby
articles.description: A Gold Coast man accused of brutally killing his estranged wife, 51-year-old Kym Cobby, in November 2017 is found guilty of murder.
articles.author: Jessica Stewart

articles.headline: 'Most properties we visited were underquoted': How Alannah tried to beat the system
articles.description: After having several offers on homes knocked back, Alannah Edyvane says she came up with a way to gauge which houses were being underquoted.
articles.author: Elias Clure

articles.headline: Death toll from Houston concert crush rises to 10 with death of child
articles.description: Ezra Blount, a nine-year-old trampled at a concert in Houston earlier this month and placed on life support, has died, announces his family's lawyer, while planning a $1.36 million lawsuit.
articles.author: Elias Clure

articles.headline: COVID is coming to SA, so what will an outbreak mean for the state?
articles.description: Twenty months to the day since SA Premier Steven Marshall declared a public health emergency in the state with the words "these are uncharted waters for our nation", he today outlined a plan to manage incoming COVID-19 cases once border restrictions are repealed. Here's a look at what that plan will mean for SA residents.
articles.author: Daniel Keane and Eric Tlozek

articles.headline: Construction company found guilty over death of teenager in Perth CBD workplace fall
articles.description: The construction company that employed a 17-year-old who died in a workplace fall in Perth's CBD is found guilty of failing to provide a safe workplace, but the teenager's family struggles to find closure amid "protracted" legal proceedings.
articles.author: David Weber

articles.headline: Five days before the Glory's season starts, Daniel Sturridge has given a brutally honest assessment of his fitness
articles.description: Star recruit Daniel Sturridge will likely come off the bench at best for Perth Glory's A-League season opener on Saturday night, with the former English Premier League striker battling to be fit after a long stint on the sidelines.
articles.author: Blake Kagi

articles.headline: GC Suns strategic delisting of Hugh Greenwood backfires as North Melbourne pounce
articles.description: Gold Coast Suns deliberately de-listed Hugh Greenwood to help with their list strategy, with a promise to re-sign him. However, North Melbourne came in and lured him to Arden Street.
articles.author: Blake Kagi

articles.headline: Australia's T20 World Cup win might make people care about the game's shortest format
articles.description: Mitchell Marsh and the Australian team found their slice of heaven in the T20 World Cup final in Dubai — and the resurgence of the much-maligned all-rounder matches Australia's rise to the top, writes Paul Kennedy.
articles.author: Paul Kennedy

articles.headline: Canberra man accused of trying to import child sex doll faces court
articles.description: Jeffrey Scott Deacon appears in the ACT Supreme Court, facing a charge of trying to import a prohibited item.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Former NSW transport boss considered resigning over rail safety concerns, inquiry hears
articles.description: Rodd Staples, who was sacked as transport secretary last November, tells a NSW parliamentary inquiry he had serious concerns about rail safety compromises resulting from a state-owned corporation's focus on turning a profit.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper

articles.headline: 'A wonderful future ahead of him': Coronial report into four-year-old's death calls for tougher health screening for truck drivers
articles.description: Blake Corney died of catastrophic head injuries when a truck ploughed into his family's car as they waited at the lights in July 2018. Today, a coroner handed down recommendations to stop the same accident from happening again.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Why Australia's T20 World Cup victors were wearing ski goggles during their celebrations
articles.description: Australia's victorious T20 World Cup team parties in Dubai wearing ski goggles as the cricket world reacts to the historic win.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Third extension for Katherine mask mandate amid concern about low testing numbers
articles.description: A mask mandate in Katherine has been extended for another two days as authorities remain concerned about low COVID-19 testing rates and positive wastewater results in the town, following last week's COVID cluster.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Suspicious fires tear through Cape York wildlife reserve, cattle station
articles.description: An arson investigation has been launched after fires burned tens of thousands of hectares of grazing land and wildlife habitat in Cape York.
articles.author: Tanya Murphy

articles.headline: One of the biggest new deals on climate action happened in the last hours of COP26
articles.description: From ministers knee-deep in seawater to China and US teaming up to tackle climate change — here is what happened at the UN COP26 Climate Change Conference.
articles.author: Tanya Murphy

articles.headline: Over 98 per cent of police, teachers and health staff vaccinated after NT mandate deadline, government says
articles.description: Releasing new vaccination data among public servants, the NT government says unvaccinated staff impacted by the government's vaccine mandate will not be paid beyond Tuesday 5pm after they were stood down on Friday afternoon.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Taliban forces hold Kabul military parade showcasing captured US weapons
articles.description: American-made armoured vehicles and weapons, as well as Russian helicopters are on display during a Taliban military parade in Kabul.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Flying doctors had to administer COVID vaccines to this Indigenous township but they've defied the odds
articles.description: A tiny Aboriginal community in South Australia's Flinders Ranges reaches a double vaccination rate of 80 per cent well ahead of the rest of the state.
articles.author: Declan Gooch

articles.headline: Unions slam 'utopian' ad campaign spruiking SA's health system as ramping data shows grim reality
articles.description: Representatives from various unions representing healthcare professionals condemn the state government's ad campaign spruiking the health system as new ramping data shows hospitals continue to struggle.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Queensland's impending restrictions for the unvaccinated saw a boost in people taking up the jab, but will it last?
articles.description: Tough new COVID restrictions for unvaccinated Queenslanders coming into effect next month gave the state's slowing vaccination rate a much-needed boost, says an infectious diseases expert.
articles.author: Rachel Riga

articles.headline: The Torres Strait Islanders combatting vaccine misinformation
articles.description: With just a month left before Queensland borders open, community leaders in Cape York and the Torres Strait are fighting both a pandemic and a torrent of misinformation.
articles.author: Jemima Burt

articles.headline: After 'Miss M Roberts' sat for an Archibald portrait almost 90 years ago, her story was forgotten — until recently
articles.description: Usually, the mystery of a painting is in who painted it, but this time it was the model in a Great Depression-era masterpiece that eluded experts until a father and daughter team figured it out.
articles.author: Rachel Clayton

articles.headline: What does a sperm donor shortage mean for children not yet born?
articles.description: More and more couples are turning to IVF to have children, prompting a surge in demand for donor sperm. New mum Lauren Burns says there’s another side to the baby boom that leaves donor-conceived people desperate to know their biological background.
articles.author: Belinda Hawkins and Cheryl Hall

articles.headline: 'I sense a tsunami coming': Some Tasmanians are concerned about border reopening as Premier says 'get ready'
articles.description: With a month to go before Tasmania's border reopens and the predicted arrival of COVID-19 to the state, there are growing concerns among vulnerable Tasmanians.
articles.author: Fiona Blackwood and Damian McIntyre

articles.headline: Rare parcel of land in inner Sydney for sale, but there's a catch
articles.description: A large parcel of land in a sought-after Sydney suburb is scheduled to go on sale after being stuck in a bureaucratic logjam for nearly two decades, but a local councillor says prospective buyers are "probably going to be disappointed".
articles.author: Tony Ibrahim

articles.headline: After seven years, police hope for William Tyrrell breakthrough within two weeks
articles.description: Police hope using  a "different type of search method" at "new locations" will help them find the body of William Tyrrell who went missing from the NSW Mid-North Coast more than seven years ago.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: Gemma was in line for a promotion. But everything changed when she fell pregnant
articles.description: Construction is one of the most male-dominated industries in Australia, with some advocates saying it's time for gender mandates.
articles.author: Nick Baker and Paul Barclay

articles.headline: 'Bait and switch', 357 offers and the fine print: What I learnt from switching electricity retailers
articles.description: I sifted through 30 power retailers' offers to save on my home bills. Then I checked and discovered I'd been switched to a more expensive plan, writes Bruce Mountain.
articles.author: Nick Baker and Paul Barclay

articles.headline: A hospital program is supporting women to give birth in their own homes, and the results are positive
articles.description: If you'd told Camilla Kennedy five years ago that she would one day give birth at home, she says she probably would have laughed. But, just a few weeks ago, the 33-year-old did just that.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: After 18 months of 'Fortress Australia', we have some answers about whether mass migration lowers wage growth
articles.description: When COVID-19 forced Australia to shut international borders, it started a test that might kill off the idea that boosting migration keeps wage growth lower for the whole community.
articles.author: Daniel Ziffer and Samuel Yang

articles.headline: 'Saved by coal': Why India refuses to give up an ecosystem that gives life to millions
articles.description: India fought for a watered-down final deal at COP26 because coal remains its biggest source of fuel for electric power, tied to millions of jobs and livelihoods, with no viable alternative in sight.
articles.author: Daniel Ziffer and Samuel Yang

articles.headline: Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon turns himself in to US authorities
articles.description: Surrendering to US authorities to face contempt charges in relation to the January 6 Capitol riot, Steve Bannon vows to take down US President Joe Biden.
articles.author: Daniel Ziffer and Samuel Yang

articles.headline: Serious concerns about forced labour in solar industry raised by Australian senators
articles.description: A group of senators, human rights experts and lawyers call on the government to assure Australian consumers that the solar industry is not exposed to grave human rights abuses in China's Xinjiang province.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: Philippines President Duterte will not run against daughter, opting instead for Senate
articles.description: Mr Duterte previously said he would run for the vice-presidency, until his daughter announced her intentions to do the same.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: Victorian government agrees to changed proposed pandemic bill
articles.description: The Victorian government agrees to make significant amendments to its pandemic bill after discussions with crossbenchers.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: UK raises terror threat level to severe in wake of Liverpool explosion
articles.description: Police say the taxi explosion outside Liverpool Women and Children's Hospital was an act of terror, as the UK changes its threat level to severe, meaning an attack is "highly likely".
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Myanmar frees jailed American journalist Danny Fenster three days after 11-year jail sentence
articles.description: His release was confirmed by his employer, Sonny Swe, the publisher of Frontier Myanmar, and former US ambassador Bill Richardson, who says Mr Fenster will fly home via Qatar.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Perth family surrounded by flooded roads now facing extreme heat in Simpson Desert
articles.description: After being forced to contend with the effects of torrential rain, Ori and Lindsey Zavros and their two young children are now facing time stuck in the Simpson Desert amid a blast of hot weather.
articles.author: Daniel Keane

articles.headline: NT re-approves controversial water licence with new conditions
articles.description: A Chinese-backed agribusiness has its right to extract a record amount of groundwater from arid Central Australia upheld, following a review prompted by concerns from traditional owners and environment groups.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: 'Use a different haka': Māori tribe tells anti-vaccine protesters to stop using its heritage
articles.description: A Māori tribe that claims New Zealand's most famous haka as its heritage tells anti-vaccine protesters to stop using the traditional performance to promote their message.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: State and territory border rules have changed yet again — here's where you can travel
articles.description: Interstate border rules are once again changing, so we've put together this simple guide to what each state requires for people entering.
articles.author: Samantha Jonscher

articles.headline: Adelaide Hills man pleads guilty to firearms offences after more than 200 weapons seized
articles.description: An Adelaide Hills man has pleaded guilty to more than 80 firearms offences after police seized more than 200 weapons, including an assault rifle, from his rural property.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: NT Chief Minister threatens public sector job cuts after wage freeze voted down
articles.description: Chief Minister Michael Gunner says the public service will either need to agree to a four-year wage freeze or face the possibility of job losses after public servants overwhelmingly rejected a wage policy.
articles.author: Jesse Thompson

articles.headline: Small-town plant crammed with sanitiser, 'extremely volatile' waste will burn for days
articles.description: It will take several days to extinguish the blaze at the NSW factory, which has hundreds of tonnes of potentially explosive aluminium waste inside.
articles.author: Ben Millington and Anthony Scully

articles.headline: NASA is outraged by an anti-satellite missile test. Russia's downplaying the whole thing
articles.description: The head of Russia's space agency is due to meet with NASA representatives over the incident, which put International Space Station astronauts on alert.
articles.author: Dannielle Maguire

articles.headline: Two global superpowers, one Zoom call and four hours: Did the Biden-Xi summit avert catastrophe?
articles.description: Tensions between the US and China are simmering. But one of the few areas Joe Biden and Xi Jinping agree on is that letting relations deteriorate further would be a mistake of historic proportions, writes Kathryn Diss.
articles.author: Kathryn Diss

articles.headline: The Loop: NT's COVID situation escalates, William Tyrrell search continues, Adele helps man propose
articles.description: Here's a quick wrap-up of news from today to keep you in the loop.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: Russia has been building its military on the Ukraine border, raising fears of another conflict in Europe
articles.description: Fears of a Russian military attack on neighbouring Ukraine are growing amongst the international community, as the Kremlin continues its build-up of troops on the border.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: 'I'm ready': Rising Aussie star moves a step closer to Formula 1 dream
articles.description: Australian Oscar Piastri continues his rise up the ranks after being named as a reserve driver for one of the Formula 1 teams in 2022.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Potential corruption risks in draft legislation for 2032 Olympic Games organising committee, CCC warns
articles.description: Provisions to exempt elected officials from declaring conflicts of interest if they are also a director on the 2032 Olympic Games organising committee presents corruption risks, the head of Queensland's corruption watchdog warns.
articles.author: Rachel Riga

articles.headline: 'A serious escalation' in the NT's COVID situation has sparked lockdowns and mask mandates. Here's what we know
articles.description: Katherine has been in and out of lockdown for two weeks, and now the remote Robinson River community is too. So how did it get to the point in the NT and what do we know about the latest COVID cluster?
articles.author: Rachel Riga

articles.headline: AFL fans who allegedly faked documents, breached COVID rules to watch grand final will plead guilty to NT border breaches
articles.description: Hayden Burbank and Mark Babbage are already serving time in jail for breaching Western Australia's strict COVID-19 border rules to go to the grand final. Now they will also plead guilty in the Northern Territory for similar offences.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: After her fiancé was killed by a train, Maddie is determined to improve rail crossing safety
articles.description: Maddie and Ethan were due to marry in March and looked forward to starting a family. But in February, Ethan was killed at a rail crossing which had no lights or boom gates.
articles.author: Dan Conifer

articles.headline: After a decade on the run, former WA tourism operator jailed for nine years for abusing girls
articles.description: Convicted paedophile and former international fugitive Charles Batham is sentenced to almost a decade behind bars for abusing two girls in Broome in WA's Kimberley, after fleeing Australia in 2011.
articles.author: Erin Parke

articles.headline: Essendon boss isolating after testing positive to COVID-19
articles.description: Bombers chief executive Xavier Campbell — who is fully vaccinated — began experiencing symptoms on Monday, but has not had direct contact with members of the club's football program.
articles.author: Erin Parke

articles.headline: Social distancing, PPE not used until first case emerged during St Basil's aged care outbreak, inquest hears
articles.description: A coronial inquest into the outbreak at St Basil's in Melbourne's north that led to the deaths of 50 people has heard a staff member who spread COVID to the facility was permitted to come to work after reporting flu-like symptoms.
articles.author: Danny Tran

articles.headline: 'Best present I've ever asked for': Families reunite at airports as COVID-19 rules ease in Queensland
articles.description: Elated families reunite across Queensland's airports today as COVID-19 restrictions ease in the state, but there are others waiting to drive across the border — still locked out and at the "end of their tether".
articles.author: Nibir Khan

articles.headline: 'Extreme body modification artist' guilty of manslaughter after botched implant surgery
articles.description: Self-proclaimed extreme body modification artist Brendan Russell is found guilty of manslaughter over the death of a NSW woman he discouraged from seeking medical help for an infected implant.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Ernie Dingo joins vaccination fight in bid to boost lagging jab rates in WA Indigenous communities
articles.description: TV personality Ernie Dingo will drive from Perth to the Pilbara this week as part of a federal government campaign to tackle vaccine hesitancy among Indigenous communities in remote WA.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Paralympian Katie Kelly crosses the line into retirement
articles.description: Katie Kelly's Paralympic career may be over, but the retiring Aussie para-triathlete has another challenge out of competition — her passion for helping people with a disability in sport and in the workplace.
articles.author: Paul Kennedy

articles.headline: Chinese President Xi Jinping warns US President Joe Biden over Taiwan in 'frank' meeting
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping tells US President Joe Biden his country will take "decisive measures" if "pro-Taiwan independence" forces cross a "red line," Chinese state media reports.
articles.author: Paul Kennedy

articles.headline: Aussie great confirmed as Hockeyroos coach through to Paris Olympics
articles.description: Katrina Powell — a two-time Olympic gold medallist as a player — is locked in as the Hockeyroos' permanent coach, after serving in the role on an interim basis at the Tokyo Games.
articles.author: Paul Kennedy

articles.headline: Reserve Bank boss delivers good and bad news for borrowers with jobs
articles.description: The Reserve Bank boss delivers a combination of good news and bad news for workers who have mortgages in his latest message on inflation, wages and interest rates.
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: Scrap the Australian Open 'for the people', says Nick Kyrgios
articles.description: Nick Kyrgios calls for the Australian Open to be cancelled, but Victoria sports minister Martin Pakula says he could not follow the logic of his comments and that Aussies "are absolutely gagging for major events".
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: SA imposes mandatory vaccination policy for teachers and early childhood workers
articles.description: Teachers and volunteers at South Australian schools, preschools and early childhood facilities have been told they will need to be double-vaccinated for COVID-19 before the start of the 2022 school year.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Police search for stolen car after mysterious outback disappearance
articles.description: Queensland Police hope identifying the occupants of a stolen white Ford Focus could help solve the suspicious disappearance of Jeremiah Rivers near Noccundra last month.
articles.author: Danielle O'Neal and Ellie Grounds

articles.headline: Shark feeding frenzy near shore at Rottnest Island as whale carcass attracts hungry predators
articles.description: A huge whale carcass floating just off Perth's holiday playground of Rottnest Island attracts a large group of sharks, prompting authorities to close the island's beaches.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Adele talks divorce and helps a couple get engaged in her new special
articles.description: The singer sat down for an interview with Oprah before giving her first concert since her split from her husband in 2019.
articles.author: Dannielle Maguire

articles.headline: Being Bluey's dad for one day busted some big parenting myths for me
articles.description: In the interest of family experimentation and likely award-winning-journalism, I decided to spend an entire day trying to match Bandit's legendary dad energy by agreeing to do whatever my kids wanted, for as long as they wanted.
articles.author: Dan Colasimone

articles.headline: We're very poor at judging risks — sometimes, we need to see them to understand them
articles.description: Numerical truths count for little when it comes to our perceptions of things like diseases and vaccines — we're more affected by the views of our peers.
articles.author: Markus Mannheim

articles.headline: Cyber attack affects Federal Group payroll system but staff will still be paid
articles.description: Tasmania's largest private sector employer, gaming and hospitality giant Federal Group, has been affected by a cyber attack for the second this year. This time it it has hit the company's payroll software.
articles.author: Adam Langenberg

articles.headline: How an arson attack forged Australia's new Organic Farmer of the Year
articles.description: A blaze that destroyed their Sunshine Coast store was the catalyst for Mick Dan and Kelly Burton to start farming genuine organic food. Now they have three farms and 20 staff.
articles.author: Jennifer Nichols

articles.headline: 'So much love': How the queer skateboarding community helped Poppy Olsen come out
articles.description: Australia's Poppy Olsen speaks about being one of several openly LGBTQI+ skateboarders at the Tokyo Olympics, and coming out to her mum.
articles.author: Kate O'Halloran

articles.headline: Debate around Victoria's COVID-19 pandemic bill has turned ugly. Here's what you need to know
articles.description: As protesters use violent imagery to demonstrate on the steps of Victorian Parliament, legal groups are sounding the alarm on pandemic laws being debated inside. Here's your quick guide to the controversial bill at the centre.
articles.author: Elise Kinsella and Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: Australia to donate Pfizer and Moderna vaccines in Indo-Pacific
articles.description: The federal government will expand its vaccine donation program to include Pfizer and Moderna doses, with a focus on the Indo-Pacific region and nations in desperate need of doses.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: How advice to a domestic violence survivor was compared to a restaurant recommendation
articles.description: When Emma disclosed domestic violence to a team leader at work, they responded by recommending a personal growth course. Emma says that advice, instead of getting appropriate domestic violence support, cost her financially and emotionally.
articles.author: Sally Brooks

articles.headline: Bookstores facing supply chain crisis ahead of Christmas rush
articles.description: Australia's independent bookstores are facing a critical supply crunch heading into their busiest period, with smaller booksellers worried they will not have copies of in-demand titles ahead of Christmas.
articles.author: Madeleine Morris

articles.headline: 'We had just about given up hope': Ancient assassin spider survived Kangaroo Island bushfires
articles.description: A pair of assassin spiders — a species feared extinct after the Kangaroo Island bushfires — have been found outside their known range on the island.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: 'Are we alone in the universe?': How a telescope custom-designed in Sydney could unlock the answer
articles.description: The TOLIMAN project is aiming its finely-tuned lense across a 40-trillion kilometre expanse to find habitable planets in the neighbouring star system, Alpha Centauri.
articles.author: Ruby Cornish

articles.headline: Police seize car in Sydney as part of renewed search for William Tyrrell's remains
articles.description: A car from Sydney's south has been seized and will undergo weeks of forensic examination. It comes as police begin their third day of searching around the house William Tyrrell disappeared from seven years ago.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen, Emma Siossian, and Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Royal watchers are worried about the Queen, but could she really abdicate?
articles.description: The Queen's trip to hospital and extended rest has raised a question royal watchers don't want to contemplate: Will the 95-year-old Queen continue as monarch? Could she step further away from public life, or even abdicate?
articles.author: Catherine Taylor

articles.headline: Sarah Baartman endured horrific injustices in her life. Centuries on, they have not been forgotten
articles.description: Not even her early death could put an end to the abuse she endured in life. It took a president's lobbying and the fight of her people to finally lay her to rest.
articles.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg and Marc Fennell

articles.headline: Most of the world is ahead of Australia. This is what COVID experts from four countries say we could learn
articles.description: We asked leading experts in four countries — Canada, Singapore, the US and the UK— about "living with COVID". This is what they said.
articles.author: Nick Sas

articles.headline: Australia's Human Rights Commission takes fight against racism to a new level
articles.description: The Australian Human Rights Commission flips the onus in tackling crowd-based racism to encourage the sports themselves, and the venues they are played in, to be proactive in calling out poor behaviour.
articles.author: Tracey Holmes

articles.headline: Would-be homebuyers ‘stuck in a dead-end road’ and renewed migration is likely to push prices even higher
articles.description: When Australia opens its borders to migrants to help in the post-COVID recovery, already skyrocketing house prices could further lift. One economist predicts the cost of buying a home will jump 5 per cent and rents will rise 7 per cent.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: James Jeggo handball costs Socceroos in draw with China
articles.description: A penalty given against James Jeggo leaves Australia with a disappointing draw against China and drops them below Japan in their World Cup qualifying campaign.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Polish forces use water cannons on migrants at Belarus border after stones thrown at guards
articles.description: Polish border forces on Wednesday said they were attacked with stones by migrants at the border with Belarus and responded by using water cannons against them.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Russia rejects accusations it endangered astronauts with missile test
articles.description: Russia says it did conduct a weapons test targeting an old satellite but rejects US claims its actions put the lives of astronauts at risk.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Labor announces NBN pitch ahead of next federal election
articles.description: The federal opposition promises to give 1.5 million homes and businesses access to higher speed internet if Labor wins the next federal election.
articles.author: Claudia Long

articles.headline: Triple suicide bombers in Uganda capital kill three civilians, wound dozens
articles.description: The blasts occurred at the police station and near parliament, leaving at least five people in critical condition.
articles.author: Claudia Long

articles.headline: 'We feel safe now': Perth family tells of their relief after five days stranded in Simpson Desert
articles.description: A young Perth family who had to be rescued from the Simpson Desert after their campervan became bogged have spoken to the ABC about their experience.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie and Gabriella Marchant

articles.headline: Property developer's art collection sells for $921m, including highest price paid for Pollock
articles.description: The art collection belonging to Harry Macklowe and ex-wife Linda Burg goes under the hammer, after a New York judge ordered them to sell it after their divorce and split the profits 50/50.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie and Gabriella Marchant

articles.headline: Stonemasonry pleads guilty after workers exposed to the risk of silicosis
articles.description: A Hobart stonemasonry business pleads guilty to health and safety breaches that exposed workers to the risk of developing the incurable lung disease.
articles.author: Laura Beavis

articles.headline: Teen revealed violent thoughts to mother before she killed 10yo, court documents show
articles.description: A 15-year-old was waiting for a referral to a Sydney psychiatrist before she killed a 10-year-old girl, but her mother did not get a call before the incident despite a GP describing her behaviour as concerning, court documents reveal.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Tiny fraction of WA healthcare workers quit in protest over jab mandate, new figures show
articles.description: Just 0.1 per cent of WA healthcare workers resign or are sacked over their protest of the COVID vaccination mandate, but the nurses union says the figures don't tell the whole story.
articles.author: Kate Christian

articles.headline: Jail for Melbourne man who flew around world to groom and abuse underage girls
articles.description: The County Court heard the 43-year-old groomed five vulnerable teenage girls online, with one victim saying the abuse has left her feeling "completely alone".
articles.author: Shannon Schubert

articles.headline: Live: Undercard underway ahead of Tim Tszyu vs Takeshi Inoue in Sydney
articles.description: Tim Tszyu meets Takeshi Inoue in a high-risk super welterweight contest at Sydney's Qudos Bank Arena. Follow all the action in our live blog.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: With half its staff in isolation, Katherine's only major supermarket has slashed opening hours during lockdown
articles.description: Katherine's Woolworths — the town's only major supermarket — is struggling to keep its doors open, with half its staff in isolation as the COVID crisis in the town continues.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: The Loop: Baby among NT COVID cases, human remains found in NZ mine and the Word of the Year is...
articles.description: Get in the loop with a speedy wrap of today's news.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: Move to make Christmas Day a public holiday in SA passes Lower House but unlikely to proceed
articles.description: Christmas Day would become a public holiday but the Christmas Eve half-day public holiday would be scrapped under a move that has passed South Australia's House of Assembly.
articles.author: Leah MacLennan and Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Where do the Socceroos go from here in World Cup qualifying?
articles.description: The Socceroos' hopes of direct qualification for the World Cup are in the balance with four games left in their qualifying group. What do they have to do to make next year's tournament, and what happens if they don't clinch an automatic spot?
articles.author: Andrew McGarry

articles.headline: The NBN has been 'fully operational' for almost a year, but some Australians still don't have reliable internet
articles.description: Fixed wireless connections are typically used in regional and rural areas, but many Australians are still struggling with access and reliability issues.
articles.author: Ellen Coulter

articles.headline: Court hears differing stories about why Adelaide man took so long to get help after child consumed GHB
articles.description: A man failed to seek immediate medical help for a toddler who had consumed a club drug in order to concoct a narrative for authorities and avoid getting into trouble, an Adelaide court hears.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: 'Abhorrent' paedophile's prison bashing, COVID infection should shave time off sentence, lawyer says
articles.description: Bret Anthony Chesworth was a member of a global child abuse network that was busted by the AFP last year and is facing sentencing. Prosecutors say his crimes were "particularly depraved".
articles.author: Giselle Wakatama

articles.headline: Human remains found in New Zealand mine, 11 years after explosion killed 29 workers
articles.description: Human remains are discovered for the first time in New Zealand's Pike River mine, more than a decade on from the disaster that killed 29 workers.
articles.author: Giselle Wakatama

articles.headline: Gastro outbreak sends Coffin Bay oyster region into trading freeze
articles.description: One of South Australia's premium oyster-growing operations has been closed for business, and all oysters banned from sale, as authorities investigate food-poisoning cases caused by a type of seaborne bacteria.
articles.author: Brooke Neindorf

articles.headline: 'Once the truck started to sink down I knew we were in trouble': Family grateful after Simpson Desert rescue
articles.description: The Perth family rescued from South Australia's outback say they are grateful for all of the help and support they have received during a "roller-coaster" week.
articles.author: Gabriella Marchant and Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: Victim of Broome paedophile Charles Batham speaks out
articles.description: With the 77-year-old sex offender and fugitive now behind bars, a woman who survived his abuse says she's disappointed by his nine-year jail term.
articles.author: Erin Parke

articles.headline: Australian baseball team to pay players and staff in Bitcoin
articles.description: The Perth Heat say they will accept Bitcoin as payment for merchandise and even ballpark concessions as they move away from dollars to cryptocurrency.
articles.author: Erin Parke

articles.headline: Potholed highway causing near-death caravanning crash reignites debate over country roads
articles.description: Debbie is lucky to be alive after her caravan flipped when it hit a pothole. Now she wants make sure it doesn't happen to others.
articles.author: Daniel Miles and Nicole Chvastek

articles.headline: Man arrested, woman facing extradition over alleged murder of toddler 30 years ago
articles.description: A Porters Retreat man is arrested and a New Zealand woman is facing extradition over the alleged 1987 murder of a toddler in the NSW Central Tablelands.
articles.author: Madeline Austin

articles.headline: Inside the forensic tools police are using to try and find William Tyrrell
articles.description: Officers are using a combination of technologies to try and make a breakthrough in one of Australia's most high-profile police investigations — the disappearance of the little boy in a Spider-Man suit.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: 'I wasn't sure if I was going to come home with him or bury him': Premature birth risks PTSD
articles.description: Queensland mother Ebony Wells wants to raise awareness on World Prematurity Day about the possible trauma and risks to parents' mental health after having a baby born too early.
articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

articles.headline: At America's busiest seaport, thousands of empty containers pile up
articles.description: US ports have been inundated with cargo since the COVID-19 pandemic shifted spending patterns.
articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

articles.headline: Why this farmer won't be counting any chickens once the vaccine mandate hits
articles.description: Jeff Pow will have to close his poultry business in regional WA because none of his staff will get COVID jabs. He isn't the only small business owner facing an uncertain future.
articles.author: Jacqueline Lynch

articles.headline: 2021's Word of the Year alludes to a uniquely Australian problem
articles.description: The Word of the Year, decided by the ANU's Australian National Dictionary Centre, illustrates the unique predicament the nation found itself in as it worked to vaccinate the population against COVID-19.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: What do we know about COVID-19 vaccines for kids under 12?
articles.description: With almost 60 per cent of Australian children aged 12 to 15 now fully vaccinated against COVID-19, focus is turning to younger age groups. But approving vaccines for them is more complex.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: Macarthur FC determined to prove they're a heavyweight in A-League Men's 2021/22 season
articles.description: After falling just short of making the grand final in their foundation campaign, the Bulls want to show they are among the title contenders in the upcoming season.
articles.author: Chloe Hart

articles.headline: 'It's now your turn to be uncomfortable': Australian beer's moment of reckoning
articles.description: Amid reports of harassment and abuse in the Australian beer industry, a group of female leaders has banded together to force change.
articles.author: Jeremy Story Carter

articles.headline: Noel loves vintage cars — but his EV now takes pride of place in his garage
articles.description: A growing number of Australian car lovers are turning to electric vehicles — but experts and industry figures say more can be done to encourage uptake and lower prices.
articles.author: Jeremy Story Carter

articles.headline: This town has been a 'wonderful cocoon' during COVID, but its elderly locals are bracing for that to change
articles.description: With a median age of just over 58, residents in one of South Australia's "oldest" towns are "extremely apprehensive" for COVID-19 to be circulating throughout the community when state borders open on November 23.
articles.author: Alice Dempster

articles.headline: US Capitol rioter 'QAnon Shaman' sentenced to over three years in prison
articles.description: Jacob Chansley, the so-called "Qanon Shaman", is sentenced to almost three and a half years in prison for his role in the US Capitol riots in January 6.
articles.author: Alice Dempster

articles.headline: Borders are reopening and COVID is coming. What can Tasmanians expect?
articles.description: It's a message Tasmania's Premier Peter Gutwein has been driving home: COVID will enter Tasmania when borders open next month. So when and where is the state likely to have an outbreak?
articles.author: Monte Bovill

articles.headline: The cleanest jet fuel has an explosive history. Would you board a hydrogen plane?
articles.description: As the world looks for new ways to combat climate change, hydrogen has emerged as a potential saviour for polluting industries like aviation. But will it work?
articles.author: Nick Dole

articles.headline: Childcare 'crisis situation' as vaccine mandates force some workers out
articles.description: Childcare centre operators say fee hikes at some centres are inevitable as mandates for COVID-19 vaccinations around the country force them to terminate some staff and put others on leave.
articles.author: Alison Branley and Conor Duffy

articles.headline: Kate's abusive ex racked up almost $86k of debt in her name. This is how she got help
articles.description: Shortly after domestic violence survivor Kate left her husband, the banks started chasing her to repay debts in her name. It was not until she got help from a lawyer and financial counsellor that she realised there was a way out.
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: Sam is trapped in Katherine as COVID cases grow. And he's not the only one
articles.description: As Katherine grapples with the NT's biggest COVID-19 outbreak to date, Sam Ashley has been sleeping on a patch of grass near the river.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts and Kate Ashton

articles.headline: Private security could soon guard secretive naval communications base instead of AFP
articles.description: One of the country's most secretive and important military facilities, which helps support Australian and US naval operations, could soon be guarded by private security personnel, rather than federal police.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Cash hoarders stuffed record amounts under mattresses during pandemic
articles.description: Before the pandemic, there were about $80 billion in notes circulating in Australia. Now there's $100 billion — but it's not in cash registers.
articles.author: Henry Belot

articles.headline: Endangered curlews feed here at the end of their epic migration, but a retirement village may be built next door
articles.description: Critics say a plan to develop a retirement village next to endangered bird habitat will further jeopardise a species in decline, but the developers say they're being made scapegoats.
articles.author: Nick Kilvert

articles.headline: Court only avenue for alleged victims to prove claims against nurse James Griffin
articles.description: The Tasmanian Health Service has not admitted to the abuse by Launceston nurse James Griffin claimed by the three plaintiffs, as court documents detail new information about concerns raised at the hospital about his conduct.
articles.author: Loretta Lohberger

articles.headline: William Tyrrell strategy 'lacking in early days' but valuable lessons helped find Cleo Smith, expert says
articles.description: A leading criminologist says some of the reasons William Tyrrell hasn't been found in seven years helped police in Western Australia locate missing girl Cleo Smith after 18 days.
articles.author: Mark Reddie

articles.headline: In the suburbs of Melbourne, Logan felt a void in his life. He filled it with fire
articles.description: Leaving the beaches of Samoa for the suburbs of Melbourne created a void in Logan’s life, one that could only be filled by returning to his roots.
articles.author: Jacqueline Howard

articles.headline: With a federal election looming, the Great Resignation presents politicians with big opportunities
articles.description: For employers trying to keep and attract the best staff, COVID-inspired upheaval in Australia's job market presents enormous challenges. For politicians facing a looming election, it presents opportunities, writes David Speers.
articles.author: David Speers

articles.headline: The same places keep appearing in most-disadvantaged lists. COVID means it could be getting worse
articles.description: The most comprehensive report into disadvantage in Australia reveals disadvantage is not only entrenched in some communities, it also impacts a wide range of factors.
articles.author: Norman Hermant and Josie Taylor

articles.headline: As the NT's COVID outbreak grows, so are questions about why this at-risk community isn't in lockdown
articles.description: Pressure is growing on the NT government to declare a lockdown in Borroloola, a large remote community with strong links to Robinson River where six Aboriginal people have so far tested positive to COVID amid a Territory cluster.
articles.author: Norman Hermant and Josie Taylor

articles.headline: Drug crisis, corruption and COVID-19 on voters' minds as Tonga heads to the polls
articles.description: While climate change and COVID-19 have dominated the news cycle, Tonga's battle with corruption and drug use are also front of mind for voters as they head to the polls.
articles.author: Catherine Graue, Liam Fox, and Edwina Seselja

articles.headline: 'She's alright': Queen makes first in-person engagement since hospitalisation last month
articles.description: The 95-year-old monarch was forced to pull out of Remembrance Sunday services last weekend after suffering a sprained back, Buckingham Palace said.
articles.author: Catherine Graue, Liam Fox, and Edwina Seselja

articles.headline: Senior cleric linked to terror network behind the Bali nightclub bombings charged over alleged sham charity
articles.description: The charity used the cover of social and educational motives to collect funds and divert some of them to terror group Jemaah Islamiyah, which is regrouping after its spiritual leader Abu Bakar Bashir was released from prison this year.
articles.author: Catherine Graue, Liam Fox, and Edwina Seselja

articles.headline: Restrictions may lift earlier as Victoria kicks vaccination goals, but health workers urge more protection
articles.description: Mask use will be scaled down in Victoria, and venues will be able to operate at greater capacity as part of a further easing of restrictions that could be in place for the weekend.
articles.author: Richard Willingham

articles.headline: Push to get businesses, banks to help end scam text messages
articles.description: The pandemic is providing fertile ground for an uptick in cybercrime, with scammers targeting Australians with dodgy texts and robocalls — something the federal Opposition wants to stop.
articles.author: Claudia Long

articles.headline: US and China announce easing of restrictions on each other's journalists
articles.description: All details are yet to be firmed up and made public and there is yet to be a timeline for bringing the changes in, even after a year of tense discussions over the new arrangements.
articles.author: Claudia Long

articles.headline: Collapse of major building group leaves hundreds in limbo amid building boom
articles.description: The collapse of a Brisbane-based construction company leaves hundreds of homes unbuilt across Australia and one Queensland family's first home dreams in limbo.
articles.author: Nibir Khan

articles.headline: Remote community at heart of NT COVID outbreak set to reach 100 per cent vaccination rate
articles.description: Every resident in Robinson River has now been tested for COVID. And although only 15 are yet to receive their first vaccine, authorities say all want to roll up their sleeves.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Adelaide man arrested over alleged witness intimidation
articles.description: Police arrest an Adelaide man after he allegedly attempted to intimidate a witness in a major indictable matter.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: Tim Sheens lands major signing with star Eel to join Wests Tigers in 2023
articles.description: The Wests Tigers' 2005 premiership coach — recently appointed as the club's director of football — makes his impact felt upon his return, with the recruitment of Parramatta's Isaiah Papali'i.
articles.author: Lauren Roberts

articles.headline: The Loop: House prices are 'rolling over', get ready for a micro-moon and winds whip up volcanic ash from over 100 years ago
articles.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
articles.author: Bridget Judd

articles.headline: Labor compares Morrison's comments about Melbourne protests to Trump's support for violent extremists
articles.description: A Labor frontbencher has likened the Prime Minister's reaction to protests in Melbourne to how Donald Trump behaved after violent protests in the US city of Charlottesville in 2017.
articles.author: Bridget Judd

articles.headline: Listeria concerns prompt the recall of more cheese products after first alert earlier this week
articles.description: Two Aldi cheese products are the latest to be recalled over listeria contamination fears, just days after similar action was announced for products sold at Woolworths and IGA stores.
articles.author: Bridget Judd

articles.headline: Former Canberra football coach gives evidence in his child sex offences trial
articles.description: Stephen James Porter pleaded guilty to three child sex offences earlier this year. He appeared in court today, where he gave his version of events.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Spain's Muguruza makes history with WTA Finals triumph
articles.description: Garbiñe Muguruza becomes the first Spaniard to win the season-ending championship, following a straight-sets defeat of Estonian Anett Kontaveit in Mexico.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Hong Kong begins culling wild boars in urban areas
articles.description: The government says it will capture and euthanise all wild boars found in the city, after a policeman was bitten in an incident last week.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Stroke survivor hit by car during charity ride around Australia's 'most extreme' compass points
articles.description: Melbourne stroke survivor Tommy Quick, who set himself the task of cycling 9,000 kilometres around Australia, is now in a hospital bed with broken bones after being hit by a car in SA.
articles.author: Evelyn Leckie and Sara Garcia

articles.headline: COVID-inspired extremism isn't new for Australian intelligence agencies
articles.description: The recent ugly scenes in Melbourne have been shocking, but for intelligence agencies who monitor various security threats to the country, they are neither surprising nor unexpected.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Perth naturopath guilty of indecently assaulting 18 female patients including teenager
articles.description: A WA jury convicts Mauricio Bascunan Cabrera of touching the women on their breasts and buttocks during consultations, while the 41-year-old is also found guilty of touching one patient on her genital area.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh and David Weber

articles.headline: Longest lunar eclipse since 15th century will grace our skies tomorrow night
articles.description: Step outside after sunset tomorrow and you may be lucky enough to see the Moon change colour on the horizon as an end-of-week treat.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Genomic sequencing confirms link between current NT COVID outbreak and earlier cluster
articles.description: Genomic sequencing has confirmed the Northern Territory’s current COVID-19 outbreak is linked to a previous cluster that was sparked earlier this month by an interstate arrival who lied on her border entry form.
articles.author: Jano Gibson

articles.headline: Former Labor MP Craig Thomson to 'vigorously fight' charges over alleged visa migration fraud
articles.description: Former federal Labor MP Craig Thomson "denies any wrongdoing" and will fight charges over his involvement in an alleged multi-million-dollar visa migration fraud.
articles.author: Jano Gibson

articles.headline: Bank tips house prices will fall in 2023. But they'll still be 27 per cent higher than they were in 2019
articles.description: ANZ is tipping house price falls in 2023 as the pandemic boom in Australian housing comes to an end amid worsening affordability, more stock on the market and rising interest rates.
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: SA parliament passes vote of no confidence in Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman
articles.description: South Australia's parliament has passed a vote of no confidence in Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman.
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: Could you afford to spend $300 a week on COVID tests just so you could work?
articles.description: Thousands of people in the Queensland-New South Wales border zone fear they will have to pay through the nose just to get to their jobs.
articles.author: Bern Young

articles.headline: Victorian COVID-19 restrictions ending in time for Boxing Day Test, Australian Open
articles.description: After last summer's MCG Test and Australian Open had severe restrictions, Victoria's government is lifting crowd caps in time for both events to have capacity crowds.
articles.author: Bern Young

articles.headline: Sunbaking croc forces closure of Port Douglas beach
articles.description: A popular beach favoured by US presidents and celebrities has been closed after a crocodile was spotted sunning itself on the beach.
articles.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath

articles.headline: Man charged over allegedly scaling down three-storey quarantine hotel
articles.description: Authorities are awaiting COVID-19 test results from a man who allegedly left hotel quarantine in Tasmania and spent nine hours in the community.
articles.author: Adam Langenberg

articles.headline: Darwin shooter left without lawyers after sacking expert legal team
articles.description: Darwin shooter Benjamin Hoffmann could represent himself through sentencing, after firing his expert legal team.
articles.author: Melissa Mackay

articles.headline: While some national festivals will go ahead in Canberra next year, one has fallen victim to COVID-19
articles.description: The National Multicultural Festival, held each year in Canberra, won't go ahead in 2022. After a year of COVID-19 lockdowns, the territory will have to wait until 2023 to celebrate the festival's 25-year milestone.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: Major Queensland hotels lock out the unvaxxed ahead of December deadline
articles.description: Some tourism businesses say they would rather refuse bookings from unvaccinated people than try to navigate the state’s impending COVID-19 restrictions.
articles.author: Owen Jacques

articles.headline: 'For their own safety': Queensland under growing pressure over vaccine mandate for teachers
articles.description: Queensland is one of only two states without COVID-19 vaccination mandates for teachers and childcare workers as the state prepares for a wave of cases in unvaccinated children with health experts warning a school outbreak will be "extremely disruptive".
articles.author: Emma Pollard

articles.headline: Why this family is keeping a ceremonial fire burning at the Carmichael mine
articles.description: After years of controversy, the Carmichael mine is weeks away from exporting coal. But the fight's not over for this group who fear cultural heritage sites are in danger of being lost.
articles.author: Angel Parsons

articles.headline: Police video reveals the lies a killer told as he tried to get away with murdering his wife
articles.description: In what could easily be a scene from a Hollywood thriller, a police camera captures 59-year-old father Andrew John Cobby spin a web of lies about the murder of his estranged wife Kym.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: Why Canada's floods could make Christmas trees cost more
articles.description: Canada exports about 2.3 million Christmas trees a year. Now, at a time of high demand, this year's crop has been damaged by historic flooding.
articles.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

articles.headline: Roaring Twenties or a decade-long economic slump? RBA says it's up to us
articles.description: The Reserve Bank is looking at its economic forecasts and is all too aware economic conditions could go either way: boom times or bust.
articles.author: David Taylor

articles.headline: 'Whatever it takes': GP clinic to charge unvaccinated patients for masks
articles.description: A Launceston GP is flagging its own COVID protocols ahead of borders reopening, as Premier Peter Gutwein admits there will only be spot checks of vaccination status at airports.
articles.author: Sean Wales

articles.headline: Pandemic workers kill pet dog in China while helpless owner watches on
articles.description: The owner of the pet corgi watched the killing via her home security camera, after being forced to leave the dog in her apartment to undergo quarantine.
articles.author: Sean Wales

articles.headline: 23 under 23: The best young players to look out for this A-League Men's season
articles.description: You might not know these players now, but once this year's A-League gets underway, they'll be aiming to put their names up in lights. Here's 23 players under 23 to keep your eyes on this season.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: This week’s news quiz theme is 'Who am I?' Reckon you know?
articles.description: Every week, we ask you if you’ve been paying attention to the news. We bet you thought we meant the words, right? Well, here’s a test — this week, did you take note of who was saying what?
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Last Night in Soho: Anya Taylor-Joy goes full blonde bombshell in blood-soaked thriller
articles.description: In this psychosexual horror, Edgar Wright (Baby Driver; Shaun of the Dead) exposes the seedier side of London’s swinging 60s.
articles.author: Jason Di Rosso

articles.headline: Meet the politician more powerful than Biden and Trump: 'I wouldn't wish this upon anyone'
articles.description: Joe Manchin spent more than a decade being largely ignored in the US Senate. Then a twist of fate turned him into America's most influential politician.
articles.author: Joanna Robin

articles.headline: 'The country is divided': Could border closures impact the federal election?
articles.description: Many in Australia lost family members during India's brutal second wave of coronavirus, while Australians living overseas say they feel abandoned by the federal government.
articles.author: Max Walden

articles.headline: Federal government champions gas-fired recovery, but regulator questions the cost to consumers
articles.description: The energy regulator is concerned households that use gas could face significant future costs if the federal government continues to promote the gas sector while also aiming to reach net zero emissions by 2050.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: 'The public have no idea': Australian nurses reveal the true extent of burnout in the workforce
articles.description: Across the country nurses are burnt out, exhausted and looking for new jobs, saying COVID-19 has only exacerbated workload pressures and staffing issues that existed long before the pandemic. Here's a look at the state of the workforce.
articles.author: Emily Sakzewski

articles.headline: Morrison bracing for a fortnight from hell
articles.description: Since he returned from overseas, Scott Morrison has been where he's most comfortable — on the campaign trail. But no more, writes Michelle Grattan.
articles.author: Michelle Grattan

articles.headline: 'They kill them': Fears for man's life after ethnic targeted arrest in country on brink of civil war
articles.description: The mother of an Australian man stranded in Ethiopia's capital Addis Ababa is pleading with the federal government to help get him out of the war-torn nation.
articles.author: Lydia Feng

articles.headline: After seven years of nothing, a William Tyrrell breakthrough — then more nothing
articles.description: After seven long years, there was a flurry of excitement on the William Tyrrell search site in Kendall this week. Meanwhile, in Sydney, the case becomes personal between the state's top cop and a former detective.
articles.author: Riley Stuart

articles.headline: Centrelink and a coffin club: Why some men's sheds are opening their doors to more people
articles.description: Men's sheds have been vital parts of their communities in the decades since they started in Australia. But now they may need to change in order to survive.
articles.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg and Chris Bullock

articles.headline: Kim Kardashian helps Afghanistan's women's youth development soccer team flee to UK
articles.description: After weeks in limbo waiting for a flight out of Pakistan, about 30 teenage players and 100 members of their families land in the UK, thanks to a trio of benefactors.
articles.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg and Chris Bullock

articles.headline: What does living with COVID look like? Europe's bleak winter is the world's worst-case scenario
articles.description: The days in the northern hemisphere are growing short and cold, allowing the Delta variant to take hold as people retreat indoors, while vaccine immunity wanes and inoculation rates stagnate.
articles.author: Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: Victoria opens up as state nears 90pc vaccination milestone
articles.description: Victorians embrace post-lockdown life as restrictions ease substantially in the state, offering even more freedoms than in neighbouring New South Wales.
articles.author: Isabella Higgins

articles.headline: 'Pure discrimination' against Q+A guest's daughter panned by disability advocate
articles.description: Whether Australia endures a "great resignation" remains a future issue but issues of workplace discrimination and gender equality are placed squarely in the spotlight on a Q+A that ends with some sad news.
articles.author: Paul Johnson

articles.headline: Three-year-old drowns in suburban pool south of Perth
articles.description: Police confirm a three-year-old boy has drowned in a suburban swimming pool south of Perth, as a report finds there has been a spike in drownings among children aged under four across Australia.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: What you need to know about the EU-Belarus migrant crisis
articles.description: The European Union and Belarus are locked in a stand-off over migrants that has come against a backdrop of tensions between the West and Minsk's backer Moscow.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: Disgraced WA public servant Paul Whyte sentenced to 12 years in jail over taxpayer theft
articles.description: The corrupt West Australian bureaucrat at the centre of Australia's single biggest case of public sector fraud will serve a minimum of 10 years behind bars for masterminding the theft of $27 million of taxpayers' money and using it to fund a lavish lifestyle.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: Gabon is the last bastion of endangered African forest elephants
articles.description: African forest elephants are critically endangered, but a new study has found that the heavily forested central African nation of Gabon is a last stronghold, with 95,000 animals identified.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: The shock Tim Paine scandal that was four years in the making
articles.description: Cricket fans were taken aback when news of Tim Paine's indiscretions and resignation broke, but Cricket Australia probably wasn't — and that is much of the problem, Dean Bilton writes.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: India to repeal controversial farm laws after more than a year of protests
articles.description: The controversial farm laws were passed in September last year, prompting widespread protests from farmers who argued the law would shatter their livelihoods.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: The Loop: Tim Paine asks for forgiveness, Philippines to welcome back tourists and ever seen a blow-dried booby?
articles.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Australia's Cricketers' Association saddened Tim Paine 'felt the need to resign'
articles.description: The ACA shows its support for Tim Paine, saying it didn't feel he needed to step down as Australian men's Test captain despite the sexting scandal revelations.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Man sentenced to 20 years in jail for murdering bikie boss at popular Canberra bar
articles.description: Frederick Tuifua is sentenced for the murder of Canberra Comanchero commander Pitasoni Ulavalu in Civic at Kokomo's bar last year.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Where is Peng Shuai? Chinese tennis star's whereabouts remain unknown after assault claim
articles.description: Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai posted an allegation against a former prominent Chinese government official on Weibo earlier this month. Since then the tennis world has asked the question, where is she?
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Regions with low vax rates at risk of being cut off from rest of WA, McGowan warns
articles.description: The Premier issued the warning during his visit to the Pilbara, which has the lowest vaccination rates in the country.
articles.author: Verity Gorman, Laura Birch, and Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: Expensive COVID test requirement may be scrapped as Queensland reviews border rules
articles.description: The Queensland government reviews border requirements which currently see families faced with paying hundreds of dollars for COVID tests when entering the state.
articles.author: Ciara Jones

articles.headline: It's been a very wet spring in Hobart, but water restrictions could be next
