articles.description: The garden is groaning and the kids are cranky after what seems like non-stop spring rain, but water restrictions could be ahead for southern Tasmania because ageing water treatment systems can't keep up.
articles.author: Loretta Lohberger

articles.headline: Here are the websites, apps and certificates required to get into South Australia next week
articles.description: Technology is key to South Australia's strategy to contain COVID-19 when the state reopens its borders to NSW, Victoria and the ACT next Tuesday, November 23. Here's how it will all work.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert

articles.headline: Dutton mocks Chinese ambassador, labels comments 'so silly it's funny'
articles.description: Wang Xining gave a wide-ranging interview where he slammed Australia's plans to acquire nuclear-powered submarines, warning the government might expose its own citizens to the risk of a nuclear accident.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Tennis star Peng Shuai is the latest in a growing list of high-profile disappearances in China
articles.description: Peng Shuai disappeared after making an explosive #MeToo claim about a top government official on social media. She joins a growing list of those who have gone missing.
articles.author: Annika Burgess

articles.headline: Platoon that was accused of killing Afghan prisoner to save space on aircraft now under criminal investigation, Defence confirms
articles.description: The Defence Department reveals there is an active criminal investigation into the conduct of an Australian commando platoon in Afghanistan in 2012.
articles.author: Josh Robertson

articles.headline: Carer sentenced to home detention for assaulting teenager with cerebral palsy
articles.description: A carer is sentenced to eight months' home detention for assaulting a teenager with cerebral palsy, after she was caught on a home security camera.
articles.author: Candice Prosser

articles.headline: Meet the gifted drummer beating a path to stardom
articles.description: Jack Butcher may not own a drum kit, but that hasn't stopped him from following the footsteps of his grandfather — one of the original members of Papunya's Warumpi Band.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: 'I'm deeply sorry': Paine steps down as Australian Test captain amid sexting scandal
articles.description: Tim Paine announces he will quit the role immediately after a 2017 text exchange with a woman is revealed, describing his decision as being "incredibly difficult" to make.
articles.author: Emma Haskin

articles.headline: Tim Paine quits as Australia Test captain, as it happened
articles.description: Australian cricketer Tim Paine stands down as Test captain over a sexting incident from four years ago, as it happened.
articles.author: Dean Bilton and Simon Smale

articles.headline: Three Canberrans end up in hospital after eating suspected death cap mushrooms
articles.description: Three people presented to hospital emergency rooms in the ACT this week after eating wild mushrooms, suspected to be poisonous death caps.
articles.author: Charlotte Gore

articles.headline: 'We can't cut people off': Draft code aims to ensure aged care visits can continue in lockdown
articles.description: Advocates say the Council on the Ageing's draft code is the first step towards implementing national standards to limit the devastating impact of isolation on aged care residents.
articles.author: Mikaela Ortolan, Katherine Smyrk, and Sandra Moon

articles.headline: 'My old tribe and my new tribe': Dani Laidley returns to North Melbourne
articles.description: Former North Melbourne coach Dani Laidley makes a warm return to Arden St in a rare public appearance as the club celebrates clearing its debt.
articles.author: Mikaela Ortolan, Katherine Smyrk, and Sandra Moon

articles.headline: 'We have serious concerns': US considers diplomatic boycott of Beijing Olympics
articles.description: United State activists and members of Congress from both parties are pressing the Biden administration to boycott the Beijing Winter Olympics over alleged human rights violations against Muslim minorities.
articles.author: Mikaela Ortolan, Katherine Smyrk, and Sandra Moon

articles.headline: 'Misadventure' to blame for missing NSW toddler AJ Elfalak's three-day ordeal
articles.description: The disappearance of a toddler from a property in the NSW Hunter Valley earlier this year, that sparked a massive land and air search, is confirmed as a case of misadventure.
articles.author: Ruby Cornish

articles.headline: MLC Insurance fails more than 260,000 customers, regulator claims
articles.description: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission is alleging in court that MLC Life Insurance has been mishandling insurance policies for more than two decades.
articles.author: Gareth Hutchens

articles.headline: Sarah Gigante is in pursuit of a spot in the Tour de France Femmes
articles.description: Sarah Gigante is getting closer to a spot in the very first women's Tour de France, a childhood dream that for so long seemed impossible.
articles.author: Daniela Intili

articles.headline: The self defence question at the centre of the Rittenhouse verdict
articles.description: Kyle Rittenhouse has been found not guilty of homicide after shooting dead two men and injuring a third at a Black Lives Matter protest. The question at the centre of his trial: Was it self defence?
articles.author: Jordan Hayne

articles.headline: Ghislaine Maxwell's life of privilege ended with her dramatic arrest. Now she faces trial on grooming charges
articles.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was once photographed with New York's celebrity elite. Now she is known as inmate 02879-509 and is about to go on trial for grooming girls for Jeffrey Epstein.
articles.author: Lucia Stein

articles.headline: Couple separated by border closures renew wedding vows in video call minutes before husband dies
articles.description: Iva was on a train to work in Sydney when she renewed her wedding vows to her dying husband in Fiji. Five minutes later, he took his last breath.
articles.author: Marian Faa

articles.headline: Their shop was their retirement plan. But after two billionaires came to town, Adrian and Liz are walking away with nothing
articles.description: Residents of Pearcedale, an hour's drive from Melbourne, still think of it as a country town, and the local shops are the heart of the community. When two billionaires snapped up the strip six years ago, locals didn't bat an eyelid.
articles.author: Jessica Longbottom, Eden Hynninen, Danielle Bonica, Kate Higgins, and Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: Jury clears Kyle Rittenhouse of all charges in Kenosha shootings
articles.description: A Wisconsin jury has cleared Illinois teen Kyle Rittenhouse of all charges after he shot and killed two people and wounded another during protests in the city of Kenosha last year.
articles.author: Jessica Longbottom, Eden Hynninen, Danielle Bonica, Kate Higgins, and Joseph Dunstan

articles.headline: Take on EVs? What Australia can learn from Norway and 80s synth-pop band A-ha
articles.description: Norway is leading the world in EV adoption, while Australia seems stuck in first gear. How can we catch up?
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Morrison was slow to respond to violent threats in Victoria. Then one 'of course' too many left him on the back foot
articles.description: The ugly escalation in Melbourne is the sort of moment you would expect leaders to quickly respond to and settle down — but the Prime Minister couldn't resist adding a political kicker, writes Laura Tingle.
articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: At 75, the Queen of the Netherlands sat down for dinner. The next day she lost her title
articles.description: In 2013, not long after turning 75, Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands hosted a dinner party. What happened next changed the course of history and some people think the British royal family should take note.
articles.author: Catherine Taylor

articles.headline: Britain outlaws Palestinian militant group Hamas
articles.description: Announcing the decision, Britain's Interior Minister says "Hamas has significant terrorist capability, including access to extensive and sophisticated weaponry", while the militant group says the move shows "absolute bias toward the Israeli occupation".
articles.author: Catherine Taylor

articles.headline: Melbourne City hold on to get their title defence off to a winning start at home agaisnt Brisbane Roar
articles.description: Two goals in three minutes guided Melbourne City to victory in the opening game of the new A-League Men season
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Austria to reimpose national lockdown, make vaccines mandatory as COVID-19 cases surge
articles.description: The lockdown, starting on Monday, will be the first in western Europe this autumn as a fourth wave drives case numbers upwards across the continent.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Charges laid over anti-vaccination protest which unfolded in front of schoolchildren
articles.description: Police charge two men over a vaccination clinic protest, while other protesters rallying outside WA schools are labelled "pathetic" and "gutless".
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: The NT COVID outbreak has gotten 'even stranger' and could be silently spreading. Here are the new testing rules
articles.description: Chief Minister Michael Gunner says there's a "a very real possibility" there are people with COVID in the NT who don't know it, as authorities bring in new testing rules to get to the bottom of the latest cluster.
articles.author: Keane Bourke

articles.headline: China calls Taiwan office in Lithuania an 'extremely egregious act', says Baltic state will be responsibile for consequences
articles.description: China says Lithuania "shall be responsible" for the consequences that come after the opening of a de facto Taiwan embassy in the European nation.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Van with an 'angel onboard': Motorbike rider praises tourists for helping save his mate's life
articles.description: The Zavros family weren't the only travellers to be rescued from the remote SA outback this week. Bill Kidd says a van "with an angel onboard" helped save his mate's life.
articles.author: Tom Fedorowytsch

articles.headline: 'Enormous' $27 million public sector theft sees corrupt WA bureaucrat handed 12-year jail term
articles.description: Corrupt West Australian bureaucrat Paul Whyte will serve a minimum of 10 years behind bars for masterminding the theft of $27 million of taxpayers' money and using it to fund a lavish lifestyle.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: Tim Paine's resignation as Australian cricket captain is a shock four years in the making
articles.description: Cricket fans were taken aback when news of Tim Paine's indiscretions and resignation broke, but Cricket Australia probably wasn't — and that is much of the problem, Dean Bilton writes.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: More than a pretty picture: These calendar boys want to get their community talking
articles.description: Meet some of the men from Kangaroo Valley who decided their best option to improve men's health was to take their clothes off.
articles.author: Sarah Moss

articles.headline: 'That route is closed': Unvaccinated travellers banned from entering Northern Territory
articles.description: The Northern Territory will become the second jurisdiction in Australia to ban unvaccinated arrivals, with only limited exceptions, under sweeping changes to border rules announced by the Chief Minister.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: PM's performance at COP26 behind Allegra Spender's tilt at seat of Wentworth
articles.description: The realisation that Scott Morrison was "never going to get there" at the climate conference in Glasgow was the tipping point for Carla Zampatti's daughter to run in next year's federal election.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: 'Pillars of our democracy': Labor pledges to restore funding to ABC and SBS
articles.description: Arguing the electoral cycle is leaving public broadcasters vulnerable, Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese says a Labor government would provide funding certainty for the ABC and SBS.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: China disavows knowledge of tennis star's disappearance following rape allegation
articles.description: Chinese authorities maintain they are unaware of the controversy surrounding missing tennis player Peng Shuai, as men's player Novak Djokovic says he supports the idea of cancelling tournaments in China until the issue is resolved.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Photos from the sky show lush green paddocks turning into brown inland seas
articles.description: Aerial and satellite imagery reveals the extent of inland NSW flooding, but it may only be a preview of what is on the way.
articles.author: Mollie Gorman

articles.headline: Mayor of Dutch city condemns protests that led to police firing shots at rioters
articles.description: Crowds of rioters in the Dutch port city of Rotterdam torch cars and throw rocks at police after gathering to voice opposition to government plans to restrict access to indoor venues.
articles.author: Mollie Gorman

articles.headline: Thousands march around the country at anti-lockdown, vaccine mandate rallies
articles.description: Crowds voicing anti-lockdown and anti-vaccine mandate messages have taken to the streets across the country, with the largest rallies in Melbourne and Sydney. Demonstrators have met in parks in Brisbane and Hobart, while those in Perth have gathered in a public square.
articles.author: Sian Johnson and Judd Boaz

articles.headline: 'This behaviour has no place in our country': MPs receive death threats over vaccine mandate
articles.description: Queensland authorities hit out at "reckless and unwelcome" anti-vaxxers as the state again records no new locally acquired COVID-19 cases.
articles.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

articles.headline: NT records one new COVID-19 case as Territory-wide mask mandate lifts
articles.description: The Chief Minister says the Northern Territory recorded one new case of coronavirus, a 31-year-old woman from Robinson River who was not infectious while in the community.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Rittenhouse verdict pours fuel on America's heated gun debate
articles.description: Kyle Rittenhouse‘s acquittal for the fatal shootings of racial justice protesters last year spurs strong opinions on both sides of the US gun debate.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: In pictures: Longest partial lunar eclipse since 1440
articles.description: The longest partial lunar eclipse in more than 500 years dazzles night skies around the world in an event dubbed the "blood moon" due to its red haze.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: No two-legged intercontinental playoffs for last places at Qatar World Cup
articles.description: If Australia has to go in the intercontinental playoffs for the World Cup finals in Qatar, they won't be able to clinch a spot in front of home fans or a hostile away crowd, with FIFA saying playoffs will be one-off games at neutral venues.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Queensland scientists studying placenta stem cells to help growth-restricted babies
articles.description: Placenta stem cells donated by Brisbane mums are being studied as a potential treatment to reduce brain injury in growth-restricted babies.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Photographer Mick Rock, known as 'the man who shot the 70s', dies aged 72
articles.description: The UK rock photographer, who took iconic images of Lou Reed, Iggy Pop and Queen as well as being David Bowie's official photographer in the early 1970s, is remembered as a "photographic poet".
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: Can time-poor parents manage a buy-nothing, recycled Christmas?
articles.description: The idea of writing a song to celebrate one of the most waste-inducing events of the year was a huge challenge for eco-musician Charlie McGee, but he found a way to make it work.
articles.author: Zachary Bruce

articles.headline: Transplant side effect GVHD can feel like mozzies biting, but it's your own cells attacking you
articles.description: Researchers are looking for new ways to ease the harmful side effects of a condition that affects around 70 per cent of bone marrow transplant recipients.
articles.author: David Iliffe

articles.headline: Wallabies forced to make more changes as they finish off spring tour against Wales
articles.description: Wales vs Australia features two injury-plagued sides robbed of their spiritual leaders and desperately trying to finish the last game of the year with a win. It could be terrible, but might just be brilliant, writes Brett McKay.
articles.author: Brett McKay

articles.headline: Players must be vaccinated to take part in Australian Open, says tournament director Craig Tiley
articles.description: Tournament director Craig Tiley ends speculation over next year's Australian Open, confirming all players — including world number one Novak Djokovic — must be vaccinated to play at Melbourne Park.
articles.author: Brett McKay

articles.headline: NSW passes Zoe's Law to impose harsher penalties for the death of an unborn baby
articles.description: A bill first proposed after a drunk driver hit Brodie Donegan, causing the loss of her foetus, Zoe, 12 years ago, passes NSW Parliament and will see tougher penalties for crimes that result in the loss of an unborn child.
articles.author: Danuta Kozaki, Danuta Kozaki, and Danuta Kozaki

articles.headline: Victoria records 1,166 new local COVID-19 cases and five deaths
articles.description: There are now 9,581 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 458 people have died during the state's current Delta outbreak.
articles.author: Danuta Kozaki, Danuta Kozaki, and Danuta Kozaki

articles.headline: The deadly new risk Afghan women face: It starts with a strange phone call and can end with murder
articles.description: There were warnings that women's rights activists in Afghanistan were in danger, Now, they are disappearing and being killed in the streets.
articles.author: Som Patidar, Emily Clark, and Tom Joyner

articles.headline: No jab, no job: Why Chantal has chosen to quit rather than get the COVID vaccine
articles.description: Chantal has baked her final loaf in a job she loves, choosing to leave rather than get the COVID vaccine. She's not alone, with business owners fearing a worker drought when government-mandated vaccine rules soon kick in.
articles.author: Rebecca Trigger

articles.headline: What are my chances of getting long COVID if I'm fully vaccinated?
articles.description: Vaccination reduces the risk of severe disease, but what does it mean for long COVID? Here's what the science says.
articles.author: Olivia Willis

articles.headline: Just like Sparta and Athens, America and China are on a collision course
articles.description: The Thucydides Trap states that when a rising power meets a waning one, war becomes inevitable. But China-US relations are more complicated than a simple power battle, writes Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: Four friends, one album and a disaster of epic proportions: A fresh look inside the Beatles' last stand
articles.description: What The Beatles: Get Back will show is that all the elements of the band's break-up were there in January 1969, along with the good things. But as history tell us, sooner or later something had to give.
articles.author: Mark Bannerman

articles.headline: I've grieved derailed career plans and gone on wild diets, but I've finally come to appreciate my disability
articles.description: Although I've had to grieve my past self, my disability, Myalgic encephalomyelitis, has freed me from the weight of my own expectations about who I should be — and helped me become braver than I ever imagined, writes Alice Rumble.
articles.author: Mark Bannerman

articles.headline: An activist, a director and an MMA fighter: Harry Potter stars have come a long way from Hogwarts, 20 years on
articles.description: It's been 20 years since the release of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone, which inspired a new generation of Potterheads and skyrocketed the young cast to superstardom. Here's what they've been up to since.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: Chinese state media says Peng Shuai will appear 'soon', amid speculation over missing tennis star
articles.description: Chinese state media employees post photos of missing sportswoman Peng Shuai, saying she is staying in her own home "freely" and "didn't want to be disturbed", ahead of an imminent public appearance.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: Disallowed goals see Daniel Sturridge's A-League Men debut end in 1-1 draw
articles.description: In front of a crowd of more than 17,000, the former Liverpool and England striker had 10 minutes at the end to try and snatch victory for Perth Glory.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Diving save ensures goalless Sydney derby, Tony Popovic gets winning start as Victory boss
articles.description: A long-range strike from Wanderers' former England international Jack Rodwell nearly sends the boisterous crowd of 23,118 into raptures during the tight derby.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Heavy rain in India leaves 17 dead, dozens missing
articles.description: The southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh has been hit by intense torrents since Thursday, sparking massive floods in at least five districts, officials say.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: North Melbourne's Ben Cunnington to undergo chemotherapy
articles.description: Cunnington needs a nine-week course of chemotherapy, but the Kangaroos say he is expected to make a full recovery.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Flood-hit Canadian province limits petrol purchases, non-essential travel
articles.description: British Columbia imposes restrictions on fuel and non-essential travel to ease supply chain disruptions and support recovery work after floods and mudslides that have destroyed roads, houses and left thousands stranded.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Cricket Australia admits it mishandled Paine investigation
articles.description: Cricket Australia's current leadership team says the organisation "sent the wrong message" with its management of the 2018 investigation into Tim Paine's role in a sexting incident, conceding he should have been removed as Test captain at the time.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: 'Mud on their hands': Cricket Australia criticised for handling of Paine sexting scandal
articles.description: Former players question the governing body's management of the incident, which has led to Tim Paine stepping down as the Australian men's Test captain ahead of the Ashes series.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Twelve people to stand trial over Kardashian West jewel heist in Paris
articles.description: The charges relate to a 2016 robbery when the reality TV star was tied up at gunpoint and locked in a bathroom in her rented Paris apartment.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Remembering the 645 lives lost on HMAS Sydney in Australia's greatest naval tragedy
articles.description: Hundreds of people in the Western Australian fishing town of Denham turn out to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the sinking of HMAS Sydney, claiming 645 lives.
articles.author: James Liveris

articles.headline: NT's COVID-19 outbreak has jumped to the poverty-stricken fringes of Katherine. Here's the latest
articles.description: Military forces and police have been deployed to the remote communities of Binjari and Rockhole, with residents facing weeks confined to their homes amid a hard lockdown, the toughest actions deployed against the virus in the Northern Territory to date.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Venezuela claims Guinness World Record for largest orchestra
articles.description: Venezuela's National System of Youth and Children's Orchestras sets a new Guinness World Record for the largest orchestra, with 8,573 musicians playing simultaneously.
articles.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

articles.headline: Local surfers dominate state junior surfing titles in Wollongong
articles.description: Hosting the NSW state junior surfing titles seems to have paid off with Illawarra surfers Oceanna Rogers and Lennix Smith winning the Under 18s female and male events at East Corrimal Beach.
articles.author: Nick McLaren

articles.headline: China reduces diplomatic ties with Lithuania over opening of Taiwan office
articles.description: In retaliation for Lithuania allowing Taiwan to open a representative office in its capital city, Vilnius, China reduces the level of its diplomatic relations with the Baltic nation to below ambassador level.
articles.author: Nick McLaren

articles.headline: More than 1,500 Queensland drivers caught with phones in just one week
articles.description: Dozens of offenders were caught breaking Queensland's mobile phone and seatbelt rules multiple times within just four days this month. If the trend continues, the government warns 12 drivers could lose their licence each day.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Villani century thwarts Strikers as WBBL finals are locked in
articles.description: The WBBL final will be played at Perth Stadium next Saturday after the Scorchers clinched top spot with a comfortable eight-wicket win over the Sydney Sixers.
articles.author: Alex Brewster

articles.headline: Queen Elizabeth II marks first wedding anniversary without Prince Philip
articles.description: Queen Elizabeth II marks her first wedding anniversary alone, seven months after the death of her husband of 73 years, Prince Philip.
articles.author: Melissa Maykin

articles.headline: 'Bring it on': Labor would welcome election fought on cost of living
articles.description: Citing the rising cost of petrol and a drop in real wages, Shadow Treasurer Jim Chalmers says Prime Minister Scott Morrison has been "lying" about the economy, with "real consequences" for families.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn and Claudia Long

articles.headline: Federer and Nadal voice concern for Peng Shaui
articles.description: Tennis greats Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal voice concern for Chinese player Peng Shuai, as advocates call on the IOC to push China for proof of her safety.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn and Claudia Long

articles.headline: Protests erupt over COVID lockdown and vaccination rules across Europe
articles.description: Tens of thousands of protesters, many from far-right groups, march in Austria and other European nations as COVID-19 restrictions tighten.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn and Claudia Long

articles.headline: 'Nothing's going to stop me': Queensland's Health Minister says she has received death threats
articles.description: Yvette D'Ath insists she still feels safe in her ministerial role despite receiving death threats, saying she sees her role as extremely important and "I love what I do".
articles.author: Andrew Probyn and Claudia Long

articles.headline: 'Threat to lives is extreme': Army brought in to help contain NT COVID-19 outbreak amid nine new cases
articles.description: The NT's Chief Minister says the federal government has offered to deploy 20 ADF personnel, as well as army trucks, to assist with the unfolding situation in the remote community of Binjari.
articles.author: Steve Vivian

articles.headline: 'Heroic' police officer saves two boys from almost certain death in flooded NSW river
articles.description: A NSW police officer will be recommended for a bravery award after he jumped into the flooded Lachlan River to rescue two boys clinging desperately to a log in the fast-moving current.
articles.author: Mollie Gorman

articles.headline: SA details COVID-19 home care plans for positive cases when borders reopen
articles.description: COVID-positive patients who are isolating at home once SA's borders reopen on Tuesday will have access to devices allowing health staff to regularly monitor their symptoms.
articles.author: Mollie Gorman

articles.headline: 'We'll have to wait and see': Djokovic non-committal about Australian Open after ATP Finals loss
articles.description: World number one Novak Djokovic's season is over with a loss at the ATP Finals — and the Serbian says he has not made up his mind whether he will play at the Australian Open.
articles.author: Mollie Gorman

articles.headline: Another piece of fabric found at William Tyrrell search site
articles.description: NSW Police find another piece of fabric as they push ahead with a search for the remains of missing boy William Tyrrell, despite bad weather on the NSW Mid-North Coast
articles.author: Mollie Gorman

articles.headline: Worker is second to die in two years at central Queensland coal mine
articles.description: Police confirm a 54-year-old man was killed in a mining accident at the Curragh open-cut coal mine in central Queensland early this morning.
articles.author: Mollie Gorman

articles.headline: 'This is the best crop of import talent our country's ever seen': WNBA players arrive in Townsville
articles.description: The Townsville Fire rebrand a nostalgia-inducing venue as they welcome some of the best WNBA players for the upcoming WNBL season.
articles.author: Brittney Kleyn

articles.headline: 'It's really challenging': Waiting 10 hours for the first cuddle
articles.description: Tide and Kove were born prematurely at 34 weeks and are still at the hospital's specialist nursery. Their parents hope the whole family will be home by Christmas.
articles.author: Inga Stunzner and Erin Semmler

articles.headline: Can Qatar reshape its image on the back of the 2022 FIFA World Cup?
articles.description: With only a year until it hosts the World Cup, Qatar has undergone significant change. But for some of its critics, it is still not enough, writes Tracey Holmes.
articles.author: Tracey Holmes

articles.headline: Wales earn last-gasp win over Wallabies and All Blacks go down again in Paris
articles.description: Dave Rennie's Wallabies team is denied victory in its final match of the European tour, going down to Wales from a kick after time expired in Cardiff — while the All Blacks lose to a rampant French outfit in Paris.
articles.author: Tracey Holmes

articles.headline: Father's missing war medal finds its way back to his daughters
articles.description: A "bizarre" chain of events leads to three sisters being reunited with their father's Korean War medal, more than half a century after he left his family, never to return.
articles.author: Meg Bolton and Amy Sheehan

articles.headline: Having access to toilets is a basic human right, but for those with a disability, access is still a common problem
articles.description: It wasn't until Robyn Thompson's multiple sclerosis progressed that future trips to the loo became a major part of preparing for any trip outside the house. She says the issue is all too common.
articles.author: Meg Bolton and Amy Sheehan

articles.headline: How Sam McDaniel is rebuilding the relationship with his famous dad, Wayne
articles.description: Years after his father, Wayne, lit up Australian basketball, Sam McDaniel is set to lead the Tasmania JackJumpers into a new era of NBL — and he will do it with the help of his dad, despite them spending years apart.
articles.author: Chris Rowbottom

articles.headline: Missing tennis star Peng Shuai says she 'wants her privacy respected' in video call with IOC president
articles.description: After concerns for her safety following her sexual assault allegation against a former Communist Party official, the International Olympic Committee says Ms Peng has told its president that she is "safe and well".
articles.author: Chris Rowbottom

articles.headline: From terminator to germinator: Find out how these farmers are helping Australia reach net zero
articles.description: When Joe Vaughan started his vineyard, he approached farming like a battlefield — killing unwanted pests and plants. Now he is among a growing number of farmers promoting life through regenerative agriculture.
articles.author: Matilda Marozzi

articles.headline: SA Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman steps down pending investigation
articles.description: South Australia's Deputy Premier steps down from her ministerial roles, pending the outcome of an ombudsman's inquiry into her decision to knock back a seaport on Kangaroo Island.
articles.author: Isabel Dayman

articles.headline: How this homemade barber shop reunited three brothers to address men's mental health
articles.description: Sam and his brothers spent 10 months handcrafting a mobile barber shop to encourage more men to talk about what's going on in their lives.
articles.author: Donal Sheil

articles.headline: Facebook group 'seeing laugh reacts on death' as COVID misinformation spreads
articles.description: COVID-19 has intensified misinformation and community polarisation along issues like vaccination, but it's a symptom of a broader problem facing social media.
articles.author: Dominic Cansdale

articles.headline: Community reels as investigators piece together tragic fire that tore through Werribee home
articles.description: Neighbours shed tears and firefighters looked visibly shaken after a blaze in Melbourne's west in the early hours of Sunday morning resulted in the deaths of four children.
articles.author: Dominic Cansdale

articles.headline: AFL draft top 30: Ranking the best talents in this year's crop
articles.description: With the AFL draft just around the corner, check out our rankings of the best 30 young players available to find out who is really the cream of the crop.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Shared e-scooters locked out of Brisbane party districts after midnight in six-month trial
articles.description: Shared e-scooters will be locked from midnight to 5am on weekends in Brisbane's CBD and Fortitude Valley in a six-month safety trial from December 1.
articles.author: Lucy Stone

articles.headline: Cashing in: ASX fuels billions of dollars of wealth through floats in 2021
articles.description: Why are so many companies listing on the ASX, who is benefiting and what exactly is involved in an initial public offering anyway?
articles.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

articles.headline: For real life! New Bluey episodes are out this week. Here's when to watch
articles.description: There's new games to play with Mum and Dad, and some lessons to be learned along the way for Bluey and her sister Bingo in season three.
articles.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

articles.headline: Grace wanted to speak. But telling her story time and time again has taken its toll
articles.description: Just 26, and still processing years of trauma, Grace Tame was thrust into the limelight when she became Australian of the Year. She looks back over a turbulent 10 months.
articles.author: Greg Hassall and Winsome Denyer

articles.headline: 'Inheriting my father's enemies': The pros and cons of having a famous parent
articles.description: Three people with famous parents open up about the opportunities and challenges that come with the family name.
articles.author: Nick Baker

articles.headline: From bowsers to batteries: When demand for petrol dries up, what will happen to servos?
articles.description: Electric vehicles are coming, and they don't need liquid fuel. That spells trouble for service stations.
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Hamilton dominates in Qatar as Verstappen's championship lead shrinks to eight points
articles.description: Lewis Hamilton is just eight points behind Max Verstappen in the fight for the Formula 1 title after dominating the Qatar Grand Prix.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: PNG is expected to have only one-third of its population vaccinated by 2026
articles.description: Fewer than 4 per cent of eligible adults are currently vaccinated against COVID-19 in Papua New Guinea, while the outlook for other parts of Melanesia is also pessimistic.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Shooting at holy site in Jerusalem kills one and injures four
articles.description: Police say the attack took place near an entrance to a contested flashpoint shrine known to Jews as the Temple Mount and to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Baby boy tests positive for COVID-19 in Hobart quarantine after flight from Melbourne
articles.description: Both mother and son were tested for COVID-19 while in quarantine in Hobart, with Public Health Tasmania informed of the infant's positive result on Sunday.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: Manchester United's Ole Gunnar Solskjaer sacked as manager
articles.description: The sacking comes after a humiliating 4-1 defeat to Watford, their fourth loss in five Premier League games.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Sudan military to reinstate ousted prime minister, release arrested officials
articles.description: Military and government officials say a deal has been reached between Sudan's military and civilian leaders to reinstate Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok, who was deposed in the October 25 coup, with detained government officials and politicians also to be released.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Sydney washout sees Shane van Gisbergen seal Supercars championship
articles.description: Shane van Gisbergen is celebrating his Supercars championship after heavy rain washed out Sunday's Sydney SuperNight event and made his lead insurmountable.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Prime Minister forced to backtrack after claiming he told opposition about Hawaiian holiday
articles.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison claimed he had told the opposition he was headed to Hawaii during the catastrophic bushfires in 2019 — only to be made to clarify his comments twice just hours later.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Patient accused of punching GP for refusing vaccine exemption
articles.description: Queensland doctors say threats against staff are on the rise amid fear among some people about the impacts vaccine mandates will have on their lives.
articles.author: Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: New Zealand to move away from COVID zero, Air New Zealand cancels 1,000 Australian flights
articles.description: New Zealand will end a three-and-a-half-month lockdown in Auckland next week as it adopts a new coronavirus control strategy, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says. It comes as Air New Zealand cancels 1,000 flights to Australia.
articles.author: Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: Public servants offered $10,000 'bonus' as hundreds of staff sacked for refusing COVID jab in NT
articles.description: To get public servants to agree to a four-year pay freeze, NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner is offering a $10,000 "bonus" which would be funded using the salaries of staff recently sacked for refusing to get vaccinated.
articles.author: Jano Gibson

articles.headline: WTA are not convinced Chinese tennis player Peng Shuai is safe and well, despite call with IOC president
articles.description: Concerns continue to grow for Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai's safety following her sexual assault allegation against a former Communist Party official.
articles.author: Jano Gibson

articles.headline: Jen's teenage son has tried to end his life three times. She says the lack of regional youth mental health care is at 'crisis point'
articles.description: Regional Victorian children are in critical need of specialist mental health care services. More care has been promised, but desperate parents fear it will be too little, too late.
articles.author: Charmayne Allison and Rosanne Maloney

articles.headline: 'Life will never be the same': Young mother's despair as father pleads guilty to killing six-month-old
articles.description: Evander Wilson, 21, pleaded guilty before the Supreme Court over his actions at his Mildura home in April 2020 that led to the death of his baby son, Jakobi.
articles.author: Josie Taylor and Richard Crabtree

articles.headline: The Loop: Wisconsin Christmas parade turns to tragedy, NASA's gonna kick some asteroid and BTS dominate American Music Awards
articles.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
articles.author: Bridget Judd

articles.headline: Perth Scorchers star awarded coveted WBBL honour
articles.description: Sophie Devine is named captain of the WBBL team of the season, with her Scorchers opening partner Beth Mooney also included in the star-studded XI.
articles.author: Bridget Judd

articles.headline: 'Anti-mandate is anti-vax': Chief Minister hits out at critics of COVID-19 mandates as NT senator backs One Nation
articles.description: Michael Gunner accuses opponents of vaccine mandates of being "anti-vaxxers", even if they have willingly received the COVID-19 jab themselves.
articles.author: Jano Gibson

articles.headline: Perth Modern School suspends principal and deputy following investigation
articles.description: Perth Modern School suspends principal Lois Joll and associate principal Val Furphy after a review of workplace culture as Shenton College's principal, Mike Morgan, steps in as interim head.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Adelaide's last drive-in cinema to close after more than 65 years
articles.description: Metropolitan Adelaide's last drive-in cinema will close its gates for the final time in early 2022, with its owners citing a changing film industry, piracy, the COVID-19 pandemic and the introduction of daylight saving as reasons it is no longer viable.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: You wouldn't recognise them in a line up, but two of his own senators are about to make Morrison's job hell
articles.description: Two Liberal senators, who few in the party expected to be elected, have found themselves holding the Prime Minister's legislative agenda just months out from an election, potentially making Scott Morrison's job even harder, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
articles.author: Brett Worthington

articles.headline: St Basil's aged care manager accused of failing to pass on keys, passwords as outbreak struck
articles.description: The manager of Melbourne's St Basil's aged care home is accused of failing to pass on clinical notes, keys and computer passwords to the staff who came in to run the facility as a deadly COVID-19 outbreak took hold.
articles.author: Danny Morgan

articles.headline: Investors swindled by Sydney businesswoman a step closer to getting money back
articles.description: A court finds missing Sydney businesswoman Melissa Caddick broke the law by operating without the required financial services licence, ordering her company be wound up and permanent receivers appointed.
articles.author: Sarah Gerathy

articles.headline: Collingwood coy about De Goey's Magpies future
articles.description: Collingwood coach Craig McRae is unsure whether Jordan De Goey will play again for the Magpies after the 25-year-old's arrest in New York last month.
articles.author: Sarah Gerathy

articles.headline: Canberra woman charged with hitting man with car at Mount Ainslie lookout
articles.description: Kiah Knight, 18, pleads not guilty to charges of negligent driving causing grievous bodily harm and failing to give assistance.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne and Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: SA Premier apologises after surge in applications to enter SA crash website
articles.description: SA's website for entry assessment is inundated with more than 25,000 applications ahead of the state borders opening at 12:01am on Tuesday.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Mother left 'dead inside' after daughter's murder by partner in Mount Gambier
articles.description: The mother of a woman murdered by her partner in South Australia's south-east tells the Supreme Court she is haunted by the memories of her daughter "beaten, battered, bruised, lifeless" while hooked up to a life machine in hospital.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Family of Melbourne woman who died after 'unnecessary' CT scan calls for change
articles.description: A lawyer for the family of Melbourne mother-of-two Peta Hickey says they intend to launch civil action after the Victorian coroner finds doctors' poor judgement, inadequate training and lax industry standards contributed to the death.
articles.author: Melissa Brown

articles.headline: Worker dies on building site in Perth's southern suburbs
articles.description: A man dies while working on a residential building site in North Coogee in Perth's south, after he is believed to have been struck on the head.
articles.author: Lana Taranto

articles.headline: Lakers, Pistons game halted for melee after enraged Detroit player goes after LeBron James
articles.description: LA Lakers star LeBron James elbows Detroit Pistons player Isaiah Stewart in the face during a game, and all hell breaks loose with an on-court melee.
articles.author: Lana Taranto

articles.headline: What is sustainable when it comes to fashion? Europe's new laws rate synthetics over natural fibre
articles.description: Tackling "greenwashing" in the fashion industry, Australian wool and cotton growers have joined forces to take on Europe's new textile labelling laws over the very definition of sustainable.
articles.author: Joshua Becker

articles.headline: 'We miss you Mommy': What is happening with Monaco's Princess Charlene?
articles.description: Princess Charlene's long-awaited return to Monaco under a cloud ahead of major celebrations in the wealthy nation. Here's what we know about it.
articles.author: Joshua Becker

articles.headline: Woman dies after being struck by falling tree branch while bushwalking
articles.description: Police say the weather conditions in NSW's Watagans National Park were poor following heavy rainfall and, despite rescue efforts, the woman could not be revived.
articles.author: Madeline Lewis and Liz Farquhar

articles.headline: Find the AFL draft prospect that would be perfect for your team
articles.description: Does your AFL team need a new full forward? An explosive midfielder? An intercepting gun? Use our interactive tool to see which players fit the brief.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Australian MPs fight Chinese bid to join Interpol's governing body
articles.description: Several Australian politicians are fighting to block a Chinese official from Interpol's executive committee, fearing Beijing may use the crime fighting body to target political dissidents.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Internet speeds in Canberra vary from suburb to suburb, and these residents have had enough
articles.description: Canberrans tired of slow internet speeds are calling from changes to the ACT's NBN connections, which experts say vary depending on which suburb you live in.
articles.author: Rosie King

articles.headline: 'It's not going to fix the delays': Advocates fear new bill won't ease Queensland's parole backlog
articles.description: Prisoners Legal Service estimates the backlog comes at a monthly cost of $3.9 million to the Queensland taxpayer.
articles.author: Rosie King

articles.headline: Tourists might swerve holiday destinations with low vaccination rates, experts warn
articles.description: Chief executive of the Queensland Tourism Industry Council Daniel Gschwind says data shows holiday-makers will take health into consideration when choosing a destination.
articles.author: Elizabeth Cramsie

articles.headline: Getting a job with a proper wage is Olivia's 'greatest achievement'. But advocates say it shouldn't be that hard
articles.description: The disability royal commission heard more than 50 per cent of people with disability of working age were unemployed in 2018. Advocates say it's time for change.
articles.author: Celina Edmonds and Nas Campanella

articles.headline: A federal anti-corruption commission was promised at the last election — now it may not happen before the next one
articles.description: It is looking less and less likely that a bill to establish a federal anti-corruption commission will be introduced before Christmas. And, if an election is called for March, there will be no time to legislate it before people head to the polls.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: New age of the asterisk? Integrity of elite sport under pressure as pandemic goalposts shift
articles.description: The positive COVID-19 test of cricketer Will Sutherland exposed a threat to the integrity of sporting competitions set to be repeated time and again over the coming months as Australia learns to live with COVID-19.
articles.author: Jack Snape

articles.headline: How migration fraud works and ways to avoid visa scams in Australia
articles.description: Linh* was desperate when she handed over $110,000 to a self-proclaimed migration agent, her case is now under police investigation.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: Waukesha police chief says Christmas parade deaths 'not a terrorist event'
articles.description: Waukesha's police chief provides an update into the investigation into the incident which left five people dead and dozens injured.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: Working from home is here to stay. How will it change the face of Melbourne?
articles.description: One in three Victorian workers could be working several days a week from home by 2036, with Infrastructure Victoria predicting it will put further strain on transport networks on Melbourne's urban fringe.
articles.author: Kristian Silva

articles.headline: Tourists may have to pay to visit Cape York's tip
articles.description: Thousands of people visited the peninsula this year, but it may be the last cohort who get to visit its tip for free. And any money raised would help tackle a host of problems.
articles.author: Jemima Burt

articles.headline: SA border opens. Here's who can come in and what rules are in place
articles.description: At the stroke of midnight, South Australia's border opened. Here's a breakdown of who can enter the state and what rules are in place.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie

articles.headline: Woman stole $940k to play online game with no chance of 'real money' win
articles.description: A Tasmanian woman has pleaded guilty to stealing $940,000 from her employer to fund her addiction to an online gambling game that does not pay out real money.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Video reveals 'bastardisation' of recruit at army base
articles.description: Lawyers for a young former military recruit are taking the Australian Defence Force to court over his experience at an army barracks in Victoria.
articles.author: Michael Vincent

articles.headline: Costello says RBA 'irresponsible' on rates, but who is responsible for housing affordability?
articles.description: Australia's skyrocketing property market has seen house prices increase 22 per cent in 12 months. As Alan Kohler writes, there's no easy answer to housing affordability.
articles.author: Alan Kohler

articles.headline: New space at Sydney Opera House provides chance for people to get creative
articles.description: The Sydney Opera House unveils its latest performance space aimed at encouraging the audience to explore their creativity.
articles.author: Sofie Wainwright

articles.headline: 'Ruthless and dangerous': How Australia's most powerful lobby sways votes and swings seats
articles.description: When Andrew Wilkie took on one of the country's most persuasive political operators, he wasn't prepared for the bloodbath that followed.
articles.author: Inga Ting, Katia Shatoba, Michael Workman, Nathanael Scott, and Alex Palmer

articles.headline: What's with all the bird flu outbreaks lately, and should we be worried?
articles.description: The COVID-19 pandemic may have crushed seasonal flu to historically low levels, but another type of flu — avian influenza or bird flu — has shown no signs of slowing.
articles.author: Belinda Smith

articles.headline: Will Australia follow Europe into a fourth COVID wave?
articles.description: Europe is facing a fourth wave of COVID. As we watch on, it is reasonable to ask whether Australia will be confronted with the same fate, writes Raina MacIntyre.
articles.author: Belinda Smith

articles.headline: This pastor thinks it's 'anti-Christian' to back the religious discrimination bill
articles.description: The religious discrimination bill is expected to be introduced into Parliament this week. These queer pastors question the bill's necessity, and worry about its consequences.
articles.author: Siobhan Marin

articles.headline: This expert says too many social media platforms are 'wild west-y' when it comes to protecting women's safety
articles.description: Twenty-three-year-old Kate says she's impacted by the personal abuse she's faced online as well as a constant slew of degrading content. What are platforms doing about it?
articles.author: Siobhan Marin

articles.headline: With a nod to Adele, Spotify did something many big tech companies don't: They listened
articles.description: For years, Spotify ignored pleas from artists and customers to change one aspect of their streaming service. But when Adele spoke, the streaming giant listened.
articles.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

articles.headline: 'You've got to risk it for the biscuit': Is equity crowdfunding worth the risk?
articles.description: First-time investors are pouring millions of dollars into unlisted start-ups and small-to-medium-sized businesses through online crowdfunding campaigns. But is it really a smart way to invest?
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: Xi tells ASEAN that China will not 'bully' smaller neighbours
articles.description: The Philippines criticised China's recent actions in the South China Sea at a conference of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations.
articles.author: Rhiana Whitson

articles.headline: Officer warns of more deaths on popular Mt Augustus climbing trail if paths not closed in hot months
articles.description: An inquest into the deaths of four hikers on Western Australia's remote Mount Augustus is told a police officer believes the summit trail should be closed during the hottest half of the year.
articles.author: Joanna Menagh

articles.headline: Canberra man found guilty of threatening partner with chainsaw released on good behaviour bond
articles.description: A 48-year-old man who was caught on CCTV threatening his partner with a chainsaw is released by the ACT Magistrates Court.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: Confusion over former SA deputy premier's pay while in cabinet but not a minister
articles.description: Premier Steven Marshall says Vickie Chapman will relinquish her ministerial perks, car, office and additional salary while under investigation, but there appears to be no mechanism under the Parliamentary Remuneration Act for a minister to relinquish part of his or her salary.
articles.author: Nick Harmsen

articles.headline: Dani Laidley returning to North Melbourne 'just being herself is a very, very positive sign'
articles.description: Transgender advocates say Dani Laidley's return to Arden Street last week was an important step in recognising the trans community and showing how important a support network is in making people feel comfortable in their own skin.
articles.author: Tom Maddocks

articles.headline: Australians who make 'statements of belief' protected under watered-down religious discrimination bill
articles.description: The details of a long-awaited and highly contentious bill to strengthen protections for religious beliefs are revealed, including safeguards for organisations that want workers to practise their religion.
articles.author: James Glenday

articles.headline: Major hint revealed about who may replace Tim Paine as Aussie men's captain
articles.description: In what may be a sign as to who takes Paine's place as men's Test skipper, Pat Cummins is added to the cover of the digital version of the official Ashes video game.
articles.author: James Glenday

articles.headline: Mark McGowan considers moving family from home in Perth's south amid alleged threats
articles.description: Western Australia's Premier Mark McGowan is considering moving his family out of their Rockingham home after threats were made against him and his wife and children.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Kyle Rittenhouse gives his first inteview since being acquitted over fatal shooting and wounding of protesters
articles.description: In the interview with Fox News host Tucker Carlson, Mr Rittenhouse gives his opinion of the trial he faced and his plans for the future.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: The Loop: We're in for a wet one, mammoth's tusk found 3,000 metres undersea and man alive after night in morgue freezer
articles.description: Here's your TL;DR for today.
articles.author: Bridget Judd

articles.headline: Police called after transgender flags 'desecrated' in Tasmania
articles.description: Transgender flags — raised at Hobart's Town Hall to mark a Day of Remembrance — have been vandalised after flying for less than 24 hours, with a local advocate saying the "desecration" was a "reminder of the stigma and hate" faced by the community.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Speculation over 'hidden message' in Peng Shuai selfie
articles.description: A photo frame featuring Winnie the Pooh in one of Peng Shuai's selfies has some people speculating it could be a subtle hint from the Chinese tennis star.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: NSW Premier defends Western Sydney lockdown despite Chant email calling for 'consistency'
articles.description: A war of words erupts over an email sent by the state's Chief Health Officer in August with the Opposition Leader saying it's evidence the government didn't follow health advice. Premier Dominic Perrottet says the email did not amount to health advice.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper

articles.headline: 'Burnt to ash': Bus catches fire in Bulgaria, killing 45 people onboard, including children
articles.description: The North Macedonian bus catches fire on a highway in western Bulgarian killing dozens, including children, as survivors are rushed to hospital with burns.
articles.author: Ashleigh Raper

articles.headline: Jason Horne-Francis says he can 'handle the pressure' if picked first in tomorrow's AFL Draft
articles.description: Jason Horne-Francis is all but locked in to join the Kangaroos with the number one pick in tomorrow night's AFL National Draft and he says he can handle any pressure that comes his way.
articles.author: Camron Slessor

articles.headline: Indian cricket star Poonam Yadav opens up on record-breaking WBBL season
articles.description: Poonam Yadav is part of the largest Indian cohort driving record WBBL ratings. The leg-spinner opens up on bonds formed with her Heat teammates.
articles.author: Kate O'Halloran

articles.headline: Another Christmas in Siberia for stranded Aussies with unapproved vaccines
articles.description: NSW model James Cater and his partner Anna are fully vaccinated with the Sputnik vaccine. They want to come home but instead are facing another Christmas overseas.
articles.author: Lindsay McDougall and Kelly Fuller

articles.headline: Woodside's Scarborough gas decision sparks inner-city protests as CEO defends project
articles.description: Woodside CEO Meg O'Neill says the Scarborough gas project is important to meet the world's energy needs as protesters gather outside the company's Perth offices.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: Court blocks bid to release secret Ben Roberts-Smith report
articles.description: A secret Channel Seven legal report that "summarises all of the known rumours and allegations" about war veteran Ben Roberts-Smith will remain private after a court ruling today.
articles.author: Harriet Tatham

articles.headline: 'Implausible' that father tripped and fell on daughter while sweeping floor
articles.description: An Adelaide man is found guilty of causing injuries and life-threatening harm to his daughter at their northern suburbs home in 2018. WARNING: This story contains graphic content that readers may find distressing.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: William Tyrrell's foster-parents to enter plea over alleged assault
articles.description: William Tyrrell's foster-parents will enter a plea to assault charges against them in two weeks, a Sydney court hears.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: British cycling legend suffers broken ribs, collapsed lung in race crash
articles.description: Mark Cavendish admits he's "in a bit of pain", having been hospitalised following a crash in a track cycling event in Belgium.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Another Port River dolphin found dead as interim report struggles to identify cause
articles.description: A third dolphin is found dead inside the Adelaide Dolphin Sanctuary with all showing similar symptoms of illness before they died, but an interim investigation is no closer to finding the cause.
articles.author: Malcolm Sutton

articles.headline: 'Testament to resilience, strength and unity': Yuwaalaraay/Euahlayi win native title
articles.description: The Federal Court of Australia has granted the Yuwaalaraay/Euahlayi people native title rights to nearly 13,000 hectares of land in south west Queensland.
articles.author: David Iliffe

articles.headline: Are bosses liable for compo if you catch COVID-19 at work?
articles.description: Businesses could face workers' compensation claims from staff if they can prove they caught COVID-19 in the workplace, lawyers say.
articles.author: Owen Jacques and Alex Easton

articles.headline: University leaders calls for an end date to COVID-19 quarantine requirement for international students
articles.description: Fully vaccinated international arrivals will not have to quarantine once the state reaches 90 per cent vaccination, but Griffith University executives say the state stands to lose students to other states without a concrete timeframe.
articles.author: Owen Jacques and Alex Easton

articles.headline: Singer MAY-A on being nominated for an ARIA Award at age 20
articles.description: Her five top songs have been streamed more than 18 million times.
articles.author: Owen Jacques and Alex Easton

articles.headline: 'I've never been more motivated': Shyla Heal's inspiring message after devastating WNBA axing
articles.description: Shyla Heal gears up for WNBL season with the Sydney Fames and is more motivated than ever to prove herself after the devastating and unexpected axing from the WNBA.
articles.author: Chloe Hart

articles.headline: 'There's a buzz in the air': Five Christmas gift ideas that will make you feel super woke
articles.description: For many of us, the idea of spoiling those we care about in the wake of long lockdowns (and a very long year indeed) feels like the perfect solution to a rather torturous year.
articles.author: Gemma Breen

articles.headline: Beth and Larry spent almost $700 on COVID-19 travel insurance. It won't cover them for lockdowns, border closures
articles.description: Australians travelling overseas for the first time since international borders reopened are paying hundreds of dollars for travel insurance — but the fine print reveals some very big COVID-related exclusions.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: Do you think there's a gender pay gap at your work? That info could one day be made public
articles.description: More businesses may be forced to report things, such as whether they pay superannuation on parental leave, how much their chief executive is paid and provide a clearer breakdown of wages, if recommendations to a government review of the Workplace Gender Equality Act are taken up.
articles.author: Georgia Hitch

articles.headline: After caring for her mother for 12 years, Leonora realised she would have to start working again at 74
articles.description: Leonora Brown cared for her ailing mother for 12 years — and after her death, the 74-year-old realised she would have to return to workforce.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: Tourism industry says clarity on COVID-19 test funding a 'Christmas gift for consumers'
articles.description: Tourism operators are rejoicing after federal Health Minister Greg Hunt confirmed PCR tests required for anyone travelling in to and out of Queensland, would be funded in a 50–50 arrangement between the federal and state governments.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: Explosions tear through Serbian munitions factory, killing two and injuring 16
articles.description: The blasts reportedly shattered windows in nearby homes and could be heard in the centre of the Serbian capital 15 kilometres away.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: Mystery surrounds the death of missing campers. Could police be close to finding the answers?
articles.description: It's been a long 18 months for the family of Russell Hill and Carol Clay as they wait to find out exactly what happened out in the remote high country where they disappeared.
articles.author: Elise Kinsella

articles.headline: Foreign stem cells saved Shelley's life, but doctors say they should be available at home
articles.description: Stem cells made the difference for Shelley Garvie, but experts say Australia is a long way behind where it needs to be in finding donors for the treatment and are calling for reform.
articles.author: Catherine Heuzenroeder

articles.headline: SA's border is open. How are businesses responding?
articles.description: With the border open, South Australian businesses are having to adapt quickly. Some are imposing their own vaccine mandates, while others are calling for more clarity.
articles.author: Rebecca Opie and Matthew Smith

articles.headline: 'I would be a statistic if it wasn't for football': First Indigenous Matilda Karen Menzies
articles.description: Karen Menzies didn't know she was Indigenous until she was 16. As she struggled to come to terms with her identity, football provided her safety, purpose and joy. In many ways, it saved her life.
articles.author: Samantha Lewis

articles.headline: Royal Commissioner acknowledges potential conflict of interest over friendship with RSL president, who co-owned vineyard with brother
articles.description: Royal commissioner James Douglas QC — whose brother once co-owned a vineyard with the president of the RSL — has acknowledged a potential conflict of interest just days out from the start of the royal commission into veteran suicides.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: See the incredibly detailed data sparking allegations of 'widespread' illegal logging in Australian forests
articles.description: High-resolution spatial data and information obtained as part of an ABC investigation sparks allegations of widespread and systemic illegal logging in protected Victorian water catchments.
articles.author: Michael Slezak, Mark Doman, Katia Shatoba, Nathanael Scott, Alex Palmer, and Laura Kewley

articles.headline: Could you really jump from a plane into a storm, holding 9 kilos of stolen cash, and survive?
articles.description: For 50 years, DB Cooper has occupied a special place in American mythology: The well-dressed stranger who committed the perfect crime, fell from the sky and maybe, just maybe, got away with it.
articles.author: Rebecca Armitage and Lucia Stein

articles.headline: Pushing ahead with Marinus Link would result in 'Snowy 2.0' like loss, report finds
articles.description: A proposed undersea power cable and electricity storage project in Tasmania would not be able to compete with cheaper battery storage in Victoria, a report has found.
articles.author: Laura Beavis

articles.headline: Global hackers tried to break into Tasmania Police accounts 800 times
articles.description: An internal report from Tasmania's Department of Police, Fire and Emergency Management has warned the agency is vulnerable to attack from cyber criminals without extra resourcing.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Meet the five women trying to unseat one of Australia's most popular politicians
articles.description: Five women are vying to unseat Clover Moore, but all know it will take a miracle to beat the hugely popular Sydney Lord Mayor. This is why they're standing anyway.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: How a Chinese tennis star's mysterious 'disappearance' tells the bigger story of a fragile superpower
articles.description: Xi wants to return China to the apex of global power. Yet right now the 'disappearance' of a female tennis player is revealing the folly of China's claim to greatness, writes Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: 'Can-do capitalism' is delivering less than it used to. Here are 3 reasons why
articles.description: Before the pandemic Australia's economy was disturbingly and unusually weak. Can-do capitalism didn't do what it should then, and there's no reason to believe it can do now, writes Peter Martin.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: Inside NASA's real-life Armageddon mission — minus Bruce Willis and a nuclear bomb
articles.description: The Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) is set to begin its 10-month journey to nudge a space rock out of its orbit. Here's what we know about the mission.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Defence 'torture' video victim says he still has 'night terrors'
articles.description: Former ADF trainee Alister French says he still has nightmares after he was bound and gagged and assaulted at an army barracks in Victoria last year.
articles.author: Michael Vincent

articles.headline: Renewed calls to delay NT border reopening until Indigenous vaccination rates increase
articles.description: Aboriginal health groups appeal to the NT government to ease back on border reopening plans, saying the Territory's hospital system could be overwhelmed as Indigenous vaccination rates continue to lag.
articles.author: Jane Bardon

articles.headline: Marrakesh the goat now the GOAT, fetching Australian record $21,000 price at sale
articles.description: A couple from Cobar have rewritten the record books by paying the new top national price for a goat, a 79-kilogram breeding buck who's also "a very nice goat".
articles.author: Hugh Hogan and Lucy Thackray

articles.headline: Mark McGowan could intervene if conservationists prevail in Woodside Supreme Court fight
articles.description: Mark McGowan says a move to overturn environmental approvals for Woodside's $16.5 billion Scarborough project could put other projects at risk.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: WBBL finals live: Brisbane Heat take on Adelaide Strikers in elimination clash
articles.description: The Heat and Strikers face off in the opening match of the WBBL07 finals series. Check out the live scores and stats in our ScoreCentre.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: Carlton AFL boss returns positive COVID test
articles.description: Blues chief executive Brian Cook is self-isolating, with his positive case forcing key staff members to miss this evening's AFL national draft in Melbourne.
articles.author: Evelyn Manfield

articles.headline: 'To use us as props is disgusting': Aboriginal health worker with COVID-19 slams anti-vaxxers, defends NT response
articles.description: Luke Ellis was the first health worker in the NT to contract COVID-19. As he continues to battle the disease, he's taken to social media to dispel misinformation and defended the government's handling of the outbreak in remote communities.
articles.author: Jacqueline Breen

articles.headline: The Loop: MP likens COVID-19 restrictions to Nazi Germany, the ARIAs are on tonight, excitement over coral spawning
articles.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: World's first planetary defence spacecraft lifts off
articles.description: NASA's one-way mission to crash a spacecraft into an asteroid blasts off from California. The mission is to demonstrate the world's first planetary defence system by deflecting an asteroid from a potential doomsday collision with Earth.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: Boy, 7, who drowned in neighbour's pool remembered as 'lovely, affectionate and caring' child
articles.description: A boy, 7, who drowned in his neighbour's pool north of Adelaide has been remembered by his grieving family as a "lovely" child.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Rising star Sophie Dwyer earns call-up to Australian squad
articles.description: Sophie Dwyer has had a breakout year in Super Netball, where she was largely expected to come off the bench. Now the sharp shooter has her sights set on an Australian debut.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Protesters teargassed as they call for Solomon Islands PM to step down
articles.description: Police in Solomon Islands use tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse large crowds that turned out in the capital Honiara this afternoon, demanding the country's Prime Minister step down.
articles.author: Max Walden, Edwina Seselja, and Catherine Graue

articles.headline: NSW man charged with using social media to advocate violence against politicians
articles.description: The ABC understands the Prime Minister Scott Morrison and Victorian Premier Dan Andrews were among those targeted by 37-year-old farmhand Wade Homewood.
articles.author: Ursula Malone

articles.headline: Teens behind 'horrendous' killing of 14 kangaroos weep in court
articles.description: The magistrate said the boys, both 17, carried out the act "without any real rationale other than a brain explosion".
articles.author: Adriane Reardon

articles.headline: Mining managers grilled in challenge to mandatory COVID-19 vaccines
articles.description: A workplace COVID-19 vaccination mandate is being fought in court after unvaccinated mineworkers were stood down.
articles.author: Giselle Wakatama

articles.headline: Live: The AFL draft is here — join the discussion as we count down to the first pick
articles.description: The AFL draft is here, as some of best young players in the country launch their journeys with new clubs. Follow all the discussion and every pick in our live blog.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: George Christensen likens COVID-19 restrictions to Hitler, Pol Pot regimes
articles.description: Outspoken Coalition backbencher George Christensen has used a speech in federal parliament to liken state and territory COVID-19 restrictions to the despotic regimes of Nazi Germany and Cambodia, calling for civil disobedience as a response.
articles.author: Matthew Doran

articles.headline: Bad week gets worse for Paine after team mate hits car with massive six
articles.description: Current and past cricket stars back Tim Paine to stay in the Australian Test team — but a tough week on the pitch gets worse as a massive six from a teammate leaves a costly dent in the former skipper's car.
articles.author: Chris Rowbottom

articles.headline: Three 'cowards' who beat a fellow prisoner to death given 17-year jail terms
articles.description: Three men described as "cowards" are given 17-year jail terms for killing a fellow Hakea Prison inmate, while another man who had been coerced into the attack, is also jailed.
articles.author: David Weber

articles.headline: COVID-19 PCR test confusion about 'singling out Queensland' ahead of looming federal election, Palaszczuk says
articles.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk says she was unaware until yesterday that people coming to Queensland would not have to pay for a COVID-19 test to enter the state, despite the cost being covered by an inter-governmental deal since the pandemic began.
articles.author: Phoebe Hosier and Rachel Riga

articles.headline: Recording paints St Basil's aged care home as 'place of neglect' during deadly COVID-19 outbreak
articles.description: A woman — who lost both her parents during a COVID-19 outbreak at an aged care home in Melbourne's north that killed 50 people — gives evidence that her father wasn't provided food as the crisis engulfed the facility.
articles.author: Danny Morgan

articles.headline: Before Richard Ludwig's company went bust, he and his advisers smuggled more than $740,000 out of the business
articles.description: On the surface, it appeared to be another business going to the wall after failing to pay its mounting bills. But the reality was very different.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: Sydney-Hobart organisers 'confident' race will return in 2021
articles.description: The host club of the Sydney-Hobart Yacht Race is confident the blue water classic will proceed this year after it was cancelled in 2020 due to COVID-19 concerns.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: Sydney removalists sentenced over COVID trip days before family tragedy
articles.description: The three men were en route to the Central West when one of their COVID tests came back positive. Days later, the mother of two of the men died of the virus.
articles.author: Mollie Gorman

articles.headline: NT senator says she may cross floor over the government's proposed voter ID laws
articles.description: Coalition senator Sam McMahon says she's concerned the laws could negatively impact already low voter turnout in remote parts of the Northern Territory.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Manly NRL player's positive COVID test forces cancellation of Gallen boxing bout
articles.description: Sea Eagles prop Josh Aloiai — who is fully vaccinated — was due to fight NRL great Paul Gallen in Newcastle next month.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: 'Most highly cited immunologist in Australia' faces allegations of misconduct after 'a number of complaints'
articles.description: An external investigation found Professor Mark Smyth "seriously breached codes relating to responsible research conduct".
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Students playing key role in long-awaited CBD rebuild to make themselves more employable
articles.description: A Queensland high school and a local council partner up to get students building hands-on projects that will revitalise a tired city centre, keep kids in school and help solve a rising unemployment problem.
articles.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

articles.headline: Quarantine hub contract's 'cloak of secrecy' exposed
articles.description: The Queensland government is under fire for signing a confidentiality clause in the contract to build the 1,000-bed Wellcamp quarantine facility in the state's south.
articles.author: David Chen

articles.headline: COVID's fog of confusion over border testing — where it takes days to confirm nothing has changed
