articles.description: Instead of being nipped in the bud at the earliest opportunity, concerns over incoming travellers having to fork out up to $150 for a PCR test festered in the news cycle — and swelled — until a breakthrough on Tuesday afternoon, writes Kate McKenna.
articles.author: Kate McKenna

articles.headline: How a former Diamond plans to see more Indigenous netballers at the elite level
articles.description: Former Australian Diamond, Sharon Finnan-White, creates a Queensland-based netball program as a pathway to the Super Netball competition for young Indigenous talent.
articles.author: Brittney Kleyn

articles.headline: Three men found guilty of murder of unarmed black man Ahmaud Arbery in US
articles.description: A jury has found three men guilty of the murder of black man Ahmaud Arbery, who was shot while jogging in the US state of Georgia in February 2020.
articles.author: Brittney Kleyn

articles.headline: 'I bawled my eyes out': When 11 friends were diagnosed with COVID, they banded together to overcome the stigma
articles.description: A group of 13 fully vaccinated friends went out for a post-lockdown dinner in Melbourne's CBD. Three days later, 11 of them tested positive to COVID.
articles.author: Sian Johnson

articles.headline: Why Black Friday is becoming the most wonderful time of the year for retailers
articles.description: November has now outpaced December as the biggest retail trading month of the year and shoppers are planning to spend even more this Black Friday and Cyber Monday in an effort to get gifts in time for Christmas.
articles.author: Stephanie Chalmers

articles.headline: Veterans encouraged to use new legal service ahead of military suicides royal commission
articles.description: Free legal advice is being offered to veterans and relatives wishing to give evidence to the highly anticipated royal commission examining Australia's spiralling rates of military suicide.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: South Australian deputy premier vote to be held today, with two MPs vying for the title
articles.description: South Australia will have a new deputy premier in place by the end of the day, with Lower House Liberal MPs to cast a vote in a secret ballot. So, who is in the running?
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Dinghy capsizes on English Channel, leaving at least 31 dead
articles.description: A dinghy filled with people has capsized in the English Channel, leaving at least 31 dead, in what officials have described as the worst disaster involving migrants to occur on the waterway.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Every morning Andrew woke to the sound of his cellmate on the toilet
articles.description: Prisoners are forced to use the toilet in front of cellmates, a new report says, because the Tasmanian government is dealing with growing numbers by adding beds to single cells not designed for them.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: Former person of interest in Willam Tyrrell case says new search brought back painful memories
articles.description: The pensioner says he was "humiliated" by detectives investigating the disappearance of William Tyrrell and is considering suing police over his treatment.
articles.author: Mark Reddie

articles.headline: With one ill-fated answer, Morrison managed a double own goal
articles.description: For prime ministers, parliamentary sitting weeks are often a bit like a visit to the dentist — something that must be endured. But this one has been particularly painful for Scott Morrison, writes David Speers.
articles.author: David Speers

articles.headline: Indoor air quality is a 'regulatory no-man's-land'. And that matters with COVID
articles.description: There's lots of talk about fixing ventilation to stop COVID, but bad indoor air has been a problem for decades. How will this change, and what can we do in the meantime?
articles.author: Anna Salleh

articles.headline: 'Lines get blurred between carer and family': why families of those with mental health issues need support
articles.description: More than 45 per cent of Australians experience mental illness in their lifetimes, but there's often a shortage of services and support for their families.
articles.author: Sophie Kesteven and Isabelle Summerson

articles.headline: China's students are getting new school textbooks — and they reveal a lot about where China is headed
articles.description: Xi Jinping's growing cultivation of a personality cult is reminiscent of the days of Mao Zedong, write Shih-Wen Sue Chen and Sin Wen Lau.
articles.author: Sophie Kesteven and Isabelle Summerson

articles.headline: The controversial COVID posts fuelling a little known senator's popularity online
articles.description: Liberal Senator Gerard Rennick has rapidly become the federal parliamentarian with the busiest Facebook page, thanks to his frequent posts about vaccines and COVID-19 lockdowns.
articles.author: Casey Briggs

articles.headline: Sarah was a prominent conservationist. Then a private investigator says he was told to find 'dirt' on her
articles.description: The ABC can reveal VicForests hired a private investigator to conduct surveillance on conservationists and, more recently, conducted what some have called "digital surveillance" on people the agency argues are trying to "discredit" it.
articles.author: Michael Slezak and Laura Kewley

articles.headline: German coalition parties sign agreement deal to end Angela Merkel's 16-year grip on power
articles.description: The three-party coalition agreement is a departure from Ms Merkel's conservative-led government's agenda, with a push towards renewable energy and a plan to phase out coal by 2030.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Stunning day in Swedish politics sees nation's first female prime minister resign within hours
articles.description: Magdalena Andersson, the leader of Sweden's Social Democrats, briefly becomes the nation's first female prime minister before resigning due to losing the support of the minor party in her coalition.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: COVID leaves Cyprus stockpiling millions of kilograms of halloumi
articles.description: For many it's a staple of a BBQ but in Cyprus right now they have halloumi stockpiled in the millions of kilograms as the pandemic impacts exports badly.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: Ethiopia's PM heads to front lines to personally direct fight against Tigray forces
articles.description: The government says Abiy Ahmed has gone to take charge in a yearlong war,  leaving daily work of running the country to his deputy, as rival fighters approach the capital Addis Ababa.
articles.author: Jack Hawke

articles.headline: National energy market report reveals expected price drops for power bills across country
articles.description: Household power bills are predicted to continue falling across Australia in the coming years, a new report says, despite the closure of major sites such as the Liddell power station in NSW.
articles.author: Alina Eacott

articles.headline: More than 80 guests in lockdown at Byron Bay backpackers after confirmed COVID case
articles.description: The Member for Ballina says a Byron Bay hostel is going into a lockdown due to a positive COVID case at the venue.
articles.author: Jean Kennedy

articles.headline: Former champion says amateur snooker players should not play pro tournaments, after losing to 19-year-old
articles.description: After losing in the first-round of one of snooker's biggest tournaments to a 19-year-old amateur, former World Champion Shaun Murphy began criticising the governing body for allowing non-professionals to play big tournaments.
articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Child protection department 'largely ignored' Aboriginal placement policy before suicide of girl, 9, coroner says
articles.description: In her inquest findings, the Northern Territory coroner Elisabeth Armitage says Territory Families did not provide a nine-year-old girl, "Sammy", adequate therapeutic treatment and ignored its responsibility to find her kinship care.
articles.author: Jano Gibson

articles.headline: New Zealand Opposition Leader ousted hours after demoting rival

articles.description: Perth soccer player Danny Hodgson is moved out of the intensive care unit at Royal Perth Hospital almost three months after he was attacked on a night out.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: Giddey joins elite NBA company, 'unbelievable' Mills stars in Nets' win
articles.description: Josh Giddey enters the record books alongside LeBron James and LaMelo Ball, while Boomers legend Patty Mills plays a key role in the Nets' triumph over the Celtics.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: Dreams DJ and singer in feud over credit for ARIA-nominated track
articles.description: As Australia's night of nights for the music industry got underway, discontent was brewing behind the scen
articles.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

articles.headline: 'Hello, conspiracy theorists. Please, get a life': NT chief's big swipe at 'international trolls' spreading COVID-19 misinformation
articles.description: The Northern Territory Chief Minister has delivered a spray against "tinfoil hat-wearing tossers sitting in their parent's basement" who he says are spreading conspiracy theories about the Territory's current COVID-19 outbreak.

articles.headline: 'Hopefully it'll get more Sudanese kids to play footy': These top AFL draft picks are taking it all in their stride
articles.description: For the first time ever a South Sudanese player has been chosen in the top five of the AFL national draft.

articles.headline: Australia to send troops and police to Solomon Islands amid unrest
articles.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says Australian troops and police will be sent to Solomon Islands to help stabilise the island nation amid growing violence and unrest.

articles.headline: 'We've been made visible': Aboriginal Tasmanians celebrate first steps to treaty
articles.description: A report plotting a pathway to a treaty with Aboriginal Tasmanians recommends the creation of a truth-telling commission to establish an official record of the past and heal divisions.

articles.headline: Fire threat rises for parts of WA as hot summer ahead
articles.description: Parts of Western Australia, including Perth, are being tipped for heightened fire potential this year, as a hot summer is forecast for the state.

articles.headline: Usman Khawaja's captaincy may cost him an Ashes spot after Travis Head tons up
articles.description: Queensland captain Usman Khawaja hands Travis Head another opportunity to prove his worth for a spot in the first Test team by enforcing the follow-on in the Sheffield Shield clash with South Australia.
articles.author: Tyne Logan

articles.headline: Energy Minister Dan van Holst Pellekaan confirmed as SA's new Deputy Premier
articles.description: Dan van Holst Pellekaan is officially South Australia's new Deputy Premier, after a vote of Lower House Liberal MPs this afternoon.
articles.author: Leah MacLennan and Sara Tomevska

articles.headline: 'No more fat to cut': Why this small business owner is boycotting Black Friday
articles.description: Regional NSW milliner Laura Hall says after years of drought and the pandemic, small businesses like hers can't afford to cut prices for Black Friday.
articles.author: Amelia Bernasconi and Bridget Murphy

articles.headline: Live: AFL draft continues with clubs ready to pounce on bargains — join the discussion
articles.description: After some surprises on night one, the AFL draft continues with a number of highly regarded players still on the board. Follow every pick in our live blog.
articles.author: Dean Bilton

articles.headline: Robert Friscic took on the Catholic Church over historical sexual abuse and won. Lawyers say his case has set a precedent
articles.description: A Melbourne man has been awarded a record settlement by the Catholic Church of $3.7 million for historical sexual abuse, after the Archdiocese of Melbourne admitted a former Archbishop breached his duty of care.

articles.headline: Larkham feels more 'developed' as a coach ahead of Brumbies return
articles.description: Wallabies great Stephen Larkham will return to Canberra to take charge of the Brumbies ahead of the 2023 Super Rugby Pacific season, believing he has improved as a coach during his stint in Ireland.
articles.author: Rachael Brown

articles.headline: Mark McGowan quick to dismiss WA Vaccine Commander's January border reopening claim
articles.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan was quick to correct his Vaccine Commander Chris Dawson's claim the WA border would drop in January.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: Australian farmers just as productive with borders closed, study finds
articles.description: New data shows Australia's fruit and vegetable grower output remained steady despite border closures reducing worker numbers.
articles.author: Kath Sullivan

articles.headline: Gunshots allegedly fired in remote NT community
articles.description: Police are responding to reports of serious unrest and gunshots being fired in the community of Peppimenarti, south-west of Darwin, which has been struggling with reports of violence for months.

articles.headline: 'Slap on the wrist': Farmers fume as Whitehaven Coal fined $200,000 for taking water
articles.description: Farmers say they are outraged by the size of the fine handed to Whitehaven for unlawfully taking 1,000 megalitres of water between 2016 and 2019, during what one farmer calls "the worst drought in living memory".

articles.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath and Adam Stephen

articles.headline: Russian military warns debris from one of its rockets could fall into Tasmanian waters

articles.headline: SA records three new cases of COVID-19, three Qantas flights listed as exposure sites
articles.description: South Australia records three new cases of COVID-19, with three flights now listed as exposure locations.
articles.author: Sara Garcia

articles.headline: Something unusual happened to stillbirth rates during the Melbourne lockdown
articles.description: A new study finds the rate of stillbirth in Melbourne during the lockdown period increased from one in 400 births to one in 300.
articles.author: Sara Garcia

articles.headline: How a Canberra program is saving lives by empowering the loved ones of opioid users
articles.description: After combating his own addiction, one Canberra man is empowering the families of those with opioid addictions — and his program is saving lives.
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: There are ten goats in this photo and ten questions in this quiz. Can you get 'em all right?
articles.description: It's getting towards the end of the year, and many of us are getting a little weary. Are you still keeping up with all things news?
articles.author: Antoinette Radford

articles.headline: Phil witnessed China tourism boom in Australia. But now that's over and many like him have moved on
articles.description: China's new official report says the majority of its citizens choose to travel domestically, which poses 'great uncertainty' about when, and whether, Chinese tourists will return to Australia in pre-pandemic numbers.
articles.author: Samuel Yang

articles.headline: When will international travel in Queensland return to normal?
articles.description: Airlines cannot commit to reinstating or establishing international flights in and out of Brisbane due to ongoing uncertainty about border closures, quarantine and COVID-19 testing requirements, travel industry advocates say.

articles.headline: Germany COVID-19 death toll passes 100,000 as fourth wave rages

articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

articles.description: As a statutory authority, the Adelaide Festival needs a directive from SA Health to bring in compulsory double-vaccination rules — but Premier Steven Marshall says that's not coming anytime soon.

articles.headline: The world is asking 'Where is Peng Shuai?', but Chinese tennis fans don't even know she's missing
articles.description: Even China's biggest tennis fans haven't heard about Peng Shuai's alleged disappearance, which is causing alarm among international tennis players and human rights groups.
articles.author: Iris Zhao

articles.headline: It’s been called 'the devil's machine’. Macquarie Bank used a more technical name for it
articles.description: Internal documents show how Australia's largest investment bank took part in a controversial German tax scheme despite warnings of reputational damage and legal risk.
articles.author: Mario Christodoulou and Raveen Hunjan

articles.headline: Efat couldn't say goodbye to her family when she fled Kabul. Now she doesn't know if she'll see them again

articles.headline: 'I couldn't find a job to save my life': Prue spent three years looking for work before starting her own law firm

There's a growing body of evidence that suggests this is not just bad for them, but bad for business profits and the economy.

articles.description: The great geopolitical contest of the 21st century is playing out on Australia’s doorstep, writes defence correspondent Andrew Greene.

articles.headline: Seven accused drug traffickers arrested in Adelaide's south

articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Company fined $320,000 after teen worker falls to his death at Perth construction site

articles.author: Erin Handley

articles.description: House of Gucci weaves the tale of how Patrizia Reggiani managed to muscle her way into one of fashion's most powerful families and threaten its legacy, setting off a "reckless spiral of betrayal, decadence and revenge". The true story behind it is almost unbelievable. Warning: spoilers for House of Gucci ahead.
articles.author: Lucy Sweeney

articles.headline: Survivor hauled out of Russian coal mine but six more deaths recorded

articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.headline: Wallabies coach apologises for spray at referees after Wales loss

articles.author: Laura Tingle

articles.author: Michael Doyle

articles.headline: Coastal development allegedly linked to Obeid family interests rejected
articles.description: A Port Macquarie development proposal, scrutinised in an ABC Four Corners report examining the Obeid family's coastal property interests, has been knocked back.
articles.author: Luisa Rubbo

articles.author: David Taylor

articles.author: Lani Oataway

articles.author: Tom Wildie

articles.author: Isabel Dayman

articles.headline: Police presence boosted in Northbridge following fatal stabbing

articles.author: Kate Christian

articles.headline: Man charged with murder, another arrested, over shooting death of woman who answered her door
articles.description: A man has been charged with murder, and NSW Police are seeking the extradition of a second man, after Newcastle woman Stacey Klimovitch was shot dead at her front door almost six months ago.
articles.author: Carly Cook and Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: More weekend protests against vaccine mandates across the nation
articles.description: Thousands of protesters gather in Melbourne's CBD to oppose the Victorian government's vaccination policies and proposed pandemic laws.
articles.author: Carly Cook and Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: USA claim 3-0 win over Australia in the first of two friendlies
articles.description: The Matildas have lost 3-0 to world champions USA in the first of two friendlies on home soil.
articles.author: Samantha Lewis

articles.headline: Tasmania pays out record $1.4m to child abuse survivor of paedophile teacher
articles.description: The Tasmanian government settles a group of six historical child sexual abuse cases, with one of the survivors receiving what is thought to be the state's largest child abuse settlement to date.
articles.author: Loretta Lohberger

articles.description: Five weeks from the running of the 170th Wallabadah Cup, Racing NSW officials recommend it ends with the "rollercoaster" track ruled too dangerous.
articles.author: Jennifer Ingall

articles.headline: 'Everything that is happening is expected': SA records three new COVID cases
articles.description: South Australia records three new cases of COVID-19, as authorities say they are concerned about exposure sites in the state's south-east.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: NSW changes travel advice for southern Africa in response to new COVID variant
articles.description: Travellers arriving in NSW from southern Africa are now required to get tested for COVID-19 and isolate as health officials move to stop the spread of the new Omicron variant.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin

articles.headline: 'The bulk of this savaging, I deserve': Reporter issues on-air apology for botched Adele interview

articles.headline: 'We don't know a lot about it': Health bosses monitoring Omicron outbreak as new travel ban comes into force

articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.headline: South African traveller in NT quarantine tested for new Omicron COVID variant
articles.description: As Katherine moves out of lockdown and into a lockout, Northern Territory authorities are racing to determine if a new positive case at Howard Springs has the Omicron variant of concern.
articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.author: Stephanie Borys

articles.author: Jacqui Street

articles.headline: Ukraine's President claims Russia and a local oligarch are plotting to overthrow him next week
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claims his country's intelligence service has uncovered plans for a Russia-backed coup d'etat in the country next week that allegedly involves one of Ukraine's richest oligarchs.
articles.author: Jacqui Street

articles.headline: Protesting Indian farmers won't budge until new laws revoked

articles.author: Hugo Rikard-Bell

articles.headline: Woman launches civil action against Canberra prison authorities for alleged breach of human rights
articles.description: A woman strip searched in an "inhuman and degrading way" in Canberra prison launches a civil action against prison authorities, claiming denial of procedural fairness and breaches of the human rights act.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Only nine farms remain in local hands in Tasmania's dairy country but a farmer group wants to turn the tables
articles.description: In a region with one of the highest levels of corporate and foreign-owned farmland in Australia, a farmer investment group has sprung up in Tasmania's north-west to keep local farmers on the land.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Man escapes quarantine and heads to Darwin's party strip before being located by police
articles.description: A man who allegedly snuck out of the Howard Springs quarantine facility is found by police almost six hours later at a licensed venue in the Darwin CBD.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: One new COVID case detected in Queensland as state tracks a week ahead for vaccination target
articles.description: Queensland records one new case of coronavirus as the state tracks towards hitting the 80 per cent double vaccination milestone on December 10.
articles.author: Kym Agius

articles.headline: NSW teachers vote to strike for first time in 10 years after 'exhausting' all options
articles.description: Teachers in public schools across New South Wales vote to go on strike next month over what they say are "unsustainable" workloads and "uncompetitive" salaries.
articles.author: Paige Cockburn

articles.headline: Get Back: Peter Jackson's epic Beatles documentary dispels myths about the band's final year
articles.description: Peter Jackson’s epic eight-hour series shows the band's camaraderie and creative genius even in their death throes.
articles.author: Luke Goodsell

articles.headline: A stranger told Jennelle she shouldn't have children. Now she's a proud mum
articles.description: One of the biggest challenges for parents with blindness or low vision can be negative attitudes from others. But with support from peers and a bit of planning, these women have navigated motherhood and found immense love and joy.
articles.author: Celina Edmonds and Nas Campanella

articles.headline: 2023 Women's World Cup is already changing the game for First Nations communities
articles.description: The 2023 Women's World Cup is the first to use Indigenous languages in its official identity, hinting at work beneath the surface to further embrace and support First Nations communities.
articles.author: Samantha Lewis

articles.headline: ‘You’re not bouncy enough to have ADHD’: Australian school kids say ADHD is severely misunderstood
articles.description: ADHD affects one in 20 Australian children, which means, statistically, there is a child with ADHD in every single classroom in the country. But a recent study shows 55 per cent of teachers do not have adequate training on managing ADHD in the classroom.
articles.author: Jacqueline Howard

articles.headline: House prices depend on interest rates: As one goes up, the other will fall
articles.description: House price falls are all but baked in as interest rates start rising over the next couple of years. How much prices fall mainly depends on how high and quickly borrowing costs end up rising, writes Michael Janda.
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: Omicron 'may already be here in Australia'. Experts say there's more we can do to stop COVID
articles.description: The emergence of the Omicron variant of coronavirus shows Africa needs greater access to vaccines, experts say. There are also warnings we shouldn't give up masks, social distancing or contact tracing in Australia.
articles.author: Max Walden

articles.headline: 'There have been rumours': Why the next two years could decide the fate of Kim Jong Un
articles.description: North Korea claims to have been COVID-free for the duration of the pandemic. But recent events south of the border could have major implications for the secretive nation and its enigmatic ruler.
articles.author: Carrington Clarke

articles.headline: Michael never told anyone about the thoughts in his head until they landed him in prison
articles.description: All Michael wanted as a kid was for the bad thoughts to go away. And one day they did, but the reason why led him down a dark path.
articles.author: Rachel Clayton

articles.headline: What do Australia's great novels have in common?
articles.description: A new three-part documentary series puts Australian literature firmly in the spotlight, and asks the question: can books help us understand our country?
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: Why Adele's imperfect voice sets her apart
articles.description: Adele's voice is soulful, rich and powerful – but it is in her vulnerability we can really see what an incredible artist she is, writes Narelle Yeo.
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: How an ancient message shows the path to protecting Aboriginal communities from COVID-19
articles.description: If the urgent problems fuelling COVID-19 outbreaks in Indigenous communities aren't addressed, things will continue to go poorly for First Nations people across Australia, writes Tynan King.
articles.author: Tynan King

articles.headline: Australia is at the crosshairs of a big shift, as the tussle with China over the Pacific steps up a level
articles.description: The Pacific Islands are in the front line of Xi Jinping's vision of the China Dream: China as the unrivalled regional power. Unrest in the Solomon Islands shows us what happens when the balance of power shifts and security and order can no longer be guaranteed, writes Stan Grant.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: UK and Germany confirm first Omicron cases as Europe prepares for spread of new COVID variant
articles.description: The world is on high alert as the UK and Germany both record two cases of the new variant, while the Czech Republic finds suspected infections and borders slam shut.
articles.author: Stan Grant

articles.headline: All international arrivals into NSW and Victoria to quarantine under reimposed border rules
articles.description: New South Wales and Victoria reimpose quarantine requirements for international arrivals as South Australia and Western Australia tighten their border rules.
articles.author: Yara Murray-Atfield

articles.headline: Western Australia tightens border with South Australia after new COVID cases
articles.description: Western Australia will force all arrivals from South Australia to isolate for 14 days under the new rules, with Premier Mark McGowan saying the decision was linked to concerns about the new Omicron variant.
articles.author: Jacob Kagi

articles.headline: Police charge longest-serving Queensland mayor with assaulting women
articles.description: Charges arise from alleged incident during the annual racing event in the tiny north Queensland town in August.
articles.author: Larissa Waterson

articles.headline: Tears and prayers at funeral of four children who died in Werribee house fire
articles.description: Mourners cried as the tiny coffins were carried overhead of family and friends before being laid to rest.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Perth Scorchers beat Adelaide Strikers to win their first WBBL title
articles.description: Perth Scorchers defeat Adelaide Strikers by 12 runs to become the new WBBL champions, with South African allrounder Marizanne Kapp starring with bat and ball in the final.
articles.author: Neelima Choahan

articles.headline: Plans unveiled for largest road infrastructure project in SA's history
articles.description: Plans have been released showing the final design for South Australia's biggest infrastructure project.
articles.author: Eric Tlozek

articles.headline: 'It's devastating': Tearful Cairns mother learns she'll be sent to the Gold Coast after COVID hotel fire
articles.description: Dozens of people evacuated after a hotel quarantine fire in Cairns say they've been told they'll be flown thousands of kilometres away to complete the rest of their isolation.
articles.author: Allyson Horn

articles.headline: China study warns of 'colossal' COVID outbreak if it opens up, with daily cases forecast to exceed 630,000
articles.description: A study by Peking University mathematicians shows China could not afford to lift travel restrictions without more efficient vaccinations or specific treatments.
articles.author: Allyson Horn

articles.headline: Australia's first cases of Omicron COVID-19 strain detected in Sydney travellers
articles.description: NSW Health confirms two returned travellers have tested positive for the new Omicron COVID-19 variant in Sydney, making them the first known cases in the country.
articles.author: Allyson Horn

articles.headline: Alex Carey boosts his Test debut chances with a century for SA
articles.description: Alex Carey blasts a century for South Australia as Gurinder Sandhu claims a hat-trick for Queensland in their one-day cup clash.
articles.author: Allyson Horn

articles.headline: Australia out of Davis Cup despite win
articles.description: Australia's bid to lift the Davis Cup is over before the knockout stages despite Alex de Minaur inspiring a 2-1 victory over Hungary in Turin.
articles.author: Allyson Horn

articles.headline: Seasonal farm worker dies after lightning strike on farm south of Darwin
articles.description: A 34-year-old man has died overnight in hospital after being struck by lightning earlier last week, while working on a mango farm in Berry Springs.
articles.author: Myles Houlbrook-Walk

articles.headline: Anti-troll laws could force social media companies to give out names and contact details
articles.description: In an attempt to crack down on trolls, the federal government proposes new social media laws that could force companies to reveal names of anonymous users.
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: No new cases of COVID-19 in SA
articles.description: South Australia has recorded no new cases today as border rules tighten, less than a week after opening up to vaccinated travellers.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin and Candice Prosser

articles.headline: Some businesses start to reopen in Solomon Islands as Morrison says more support being sent from Australia
articles.description: The Prime Minister says Australian military and federal police personnel are in Solomon Islands "to provide a stable and safe environment" as tensions begin to ease after days of rioting and looting that left three people dead.
articles.author: Stacey Pestrin and Candice Prosser

articles.headline: Residents told to stay indoors as fire engulfs linen factory in Perth's east
articles.description: Residents living near a factory fire in Perth's east are advised to stay indoors to avoid plumes of smoke and fumes filling the sky.
articles.author: Tabarak Al Jrood

articles.headline: NT records three more local COVID cases linked to Katherine cluster, as remote community enters lockdown
articles.description: Three more local COVID-19 cases are recorded in the NT overnight, as the remote community of Lajamanu enters lockdown and testing continues of a South African traveller who may be carrying the new Omicron variant.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Israel to ban entry of foreigners from every country over Omicron variant
articles.description: Israel will ban the entry of all foreigners into the country, making it the first country to shut its borders completely in response to a new and potentially more contagious coronavirus variant.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Fraud risk with Queensland check-in app not a flaw, minister says
articles.description: A function that allows other people's vaccination certificates to be uploaded to the Check In Qld app is not a flaw and would be "incredibly difficult" to carry out fraudulently, says Queensland Digital Economy Minister Leeanne Enoch.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: Man arrested over stabbing outside Adelaide nightclub
articles.description: A man is arrested over a stabbing outside an Adelaide nightclub in the early hours of this morning.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: How much would it cost to reforest Australian farmland for carbon credits?
articles.description: Offsetting agricultural emissions through reforestation would cost a fair chunk of farm profits, new research suggests. So what's the best way to tackle agricultural emissions?
articles.author: Angus Mackintosh

articles.headline: A COVID-hit Portuguese football team could only field nine players. They conceded seven goals in a half
articles.description: Portuguese team Belenenses is only able to field a team of nine players — including two goalkeepers — due to a COVID outbreak, and finds itself 7-0 down against Benfica before the match is abandoned.
articles.author: Angus Mackintosh

articles.headline: George Kambosos Jr crowned world unified lightweight champion after defeating Teófimo López
articles.description: Australian boxer George Kambosos Jr has defeated Teófimo López in a monumental upset to become the world unified lightweight champion. Follow all the action in our live blog.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Masked gunman fired 'random shots' at passing pedestrians before taking hostage, police say
articles.description: Clad all in black and carrying two rifles, a masked gunman who fired shots on a shopping strip on the NSW South Coast is now in custody, with police saying they don't yet know why he did it.
articles.author: Alison Xiao, Kevin Nguyen, and Tim Fernandez

articles.headline: Secrecy, confusion and chaos – the week that was in SA politics
articles.description: Last week started with the resignation of a defiant Deputy Premier and ended with a visit from the Prime Minister. Here's how it all played out.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Three dead as Storm Arwen batters UK
articles.description: Three people are killed by falling trees across the United Kingdom as winter storm Arwen brings high winds and snow to the country.
articles.author: Stacey Lee

articles.headline: Woman charged with arson after blaze guts rooms at Cairns quarantine hotel
articles.description: A 31-year-old woman is charged with arson and wilful damage after allegedly lighting a fire under a bed at a Cairns quarantine hotel, forcing the evacuation of more than 160 people.
articles.author: Nibir Khan

articles.headline: Nicole lost her son to mitochondrial disease when he was nine days old. Now, she's walking for change.
articles.description: Nicole Baldry's son Henry died from mitochondrial disease when he was just nine days old. She hopes proposed changes to donation laws will mean other parents avoid the grief she has endured.
articles.author: Charlotte Gore

articles.headline: NT COVID outbreak spreads hundreds of kilometres to Lajamanu, community sent into lockdown
articles.description: Positive wastewater results prompt a snap lockdown in the community of Lajamanu, 560 kilometres from the centre of the current outbreak in Katherine.
articles.author: Charlotte Gore

articles.headline: Five people charged over Siberian coal mine disaster that killed 51
articles.description: The five mining officials will remain in pre-trial detention for two months pending an investigation into Russia's deadliest tragedy since 2010.
articles.author: Charlotte Gore

articles.headline: Public servants have been told to return to the office, but what risk do they face as COVID-19 remains in the community?
articles.description: Federal public servants have been told to return to the office in the wake of eased COVID-19 restrictions, sparking debate over whether it is the safest approach as the virus continues to circulate in the community.
articles.author: Niki Burnside

articles.headline: By dethroning a would-be king, George Kambosos Jr sits atop Australian boxing
articles.description: George Kambosos Jr’s stunning win over Teófimo López could lay claim to being the best ever by an Australian overseas, making Kambosos Australian boxing’s current number one, writes Simon Smale.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Omicron is now in Australia. What does that mean for Queensland?
articles.description: Queensland Health says officials are closely monitoring developments in NSW after the detection of two cases of the new COVID-19 variant in hotel quarantine.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Hubert the Eurasian hobby makes history, a long way from home
articles.description: Hubert is the first of his species ever seen in eastern Australia, and birders are wondering whether he's a climate change vagrant from Europe or he just got lost in La Niña.
articles.author: Riordan Davis

articles.headline: Louis Vuitton's star designer Virgil Abloh dies of cancer
articles.description: Louis Vuitton star designer Virgil Abloh has died of cancer, his family and employer LVMH say.
articles.author: Riordan Davis

articles.headline: The COVID-19 pandemic positives for Australians living with disabilities
articles.description: From the blind photographer observing details, to living solo for the first time, or discovering the power of roller skating — the pandemic for these Australians living with disabilities has been a chance to find joy, independence and new passions.
articles.author: Riordan Davis

articles.headline: How Nas Campanella's TV debut helped her think about motherhood
articles.description: Years ago Nas Campanella played a pregnant woman on prime time TV. The experience made her feel conflicted — but it also helped her think about motherhood.
articles.author: Nas Campanella

articles.headline: There's backlash to China's LGBTQI+ movement — but it's not led by religious groups
articles.description: Queer communities in China are increasingly seen as a political threat to state stability, writes Jinghua Qian.
articles.author: Nas Campanella

articles.headline: Around this vacant paddock in Melbourne's west, a campaign is gathering steam
articles.description: For years, the idea of a mini-CBD at Werribee East has been floated, adopted, and abandoned by government. Now, the community is making a renewed push to put planning for Melbourne's west on the state election agenda.
articles.author: Margaret Paul

articles.headline: 'A female coach really understands the female game': A-League Women welcomes record number of female coaches
articles.description: There was only one female head coach in Australia's top women's football competition last year, but the upcoming season beginning on December 3 will see that rise to four.
articles.author: Chloe Hart

articles.headline: Susan Neill-Fraser will find out tomorrow if she can walk free from prison — here's what her appeal is about
articles.description: Neill-Fraser has been fighting to clear her name ever since she was charged with murdering her partner, Bob Chappell, in 2009. A decision in her latest appeal will be handed down almost nine months after her lawyers argued there has been a miscarriage of justice.
articles.author: Loretta Lohberger

articles.headline: What happens when your builder goes bust? For some, their life savings disappear
articles.description: Kate and Rod Iskander can only look on in despair at what should be their new home — a building site littered with bricks and hardening bags of cement. Their builder went bust two months ago and they've already sunk their life savings.
articles.author: Fiona Blackwood

articles.headline: The COVID-19 tests expected to form a 'line of defence' when WA opens its doors to the world
articles.description: When Western Australia finally opens its doors to the rest of the world – potentially letting in the Omicron variant of COVID-19 – rapid antigen self-tests could form an important line of defence to prevent  outbreaks in high-risk settings.
articles.author: Kate Christian

articles.headline: How the 'threat of disclosure' could bring Ghislaine Maxwell's sex trafficking trial to a swift end
articles.description: Sixteen months after FBI agents swooped in on her remote hideaway to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell on sex abuse charges, the trial of the British socialite is beginning in New York. Here's what you need to know.
articles.author: Barbara Miller and Peter Jones

articles.headline: Your super could be taxed up to 32 per cent when you die — here's how to avoid it
articles.description: It's not called a 'death tax', but millions of Australians' retirement savings may be taxable upon death, writes Nassim Khad
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: Father manufactures medicine for sick son in China after COVID-19 limits treatment
articles.description: A desperate father is manufacturing medicine for his sick son after he was unable to get treatment in his country due to COVID-19.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: Ashlie used to help feed the homeless, now at 64 she's homeless herself
articles.description: After falling into an unexpected cycle of disadvantage, Ashlie Stevenson is one of hundreds of thousands of Australians languishing on waiting lists for public housing.
articles.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

articles.headline: Housing affordability is a national crisis, but for one group of young people it can be life changing
articles.description: The housing affordability crisis is being felt acutely by young people with a disability, partly because the hidden costs of having a disability can make it much more difficult to save a deposit and pay off a mortgage.
articles.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

articles.headline: Netherlands confirms 13 Omicron cases as new COVID variant continues to spread
articles.description: Dutch authorities say investigations will continue after the new variant was detected in 13 out of 61 travellers who tested positive for COVID-19 on flights from South Africa.
articles.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

articles.headline: The Loop: Quick Q&A on Omicron, proposed anti-troll laws and best-behaved schoolies 'ever'
articles.description: Get in The Loop with a quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: Home loan interest rates to keep favouring owner-occupiers over investors under new rules
articles.description: Home loan interest rates are likely to keep favouring owner-occupier borrowers over property investors under changes to bank capital rules, while business loan interest rates may also come down.
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: 'Don't let fear get in the way': No proof so far that Omicron is worse than other strains, expert says
articles.description: Worried about the new strain of COVID-19? Omicron has been grabbing plenty of headlines, but a leading infectious disease expert says there's no need to panic just yet.
articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

articles.headline: TikTok celebrity cosmetic surgeon banned from performing surgery
articles.description: A senior associate of the controversial clinic owner Dr Daniel Lanzer has been banned by the national health regulator from performing all types of cosmetic surgery and ordered to remove his social media posts.
articles.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

articles.headline: Australia's fashion industry mourns Louis Vuitton designer Virgil Abloh
articles.description: An Australian designer who has followed Virgil Abloh's career says he paved the way for others, in particular, people of colour.
articles.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

articles.headline: Police search old mining site for bodies of allegedly murdered campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay
articles.description: The head of the Victoria Police Missing Persons Squad has arrived at a remote area of bushland to help search for the remains of the missing campers.
articles.author: Nicole Asher

articles.headline: 'He's the Michael Jordan': Aussie boxer inspired by Kambosos Jr's stunning world title victory
articles.description: George Kambosos Jr's stunning win over Teófimo López has young prospect Harry Garside hoping Australian boxing is about to enter a golden era.
articles.author: Nicole Asher

articles.headline: NSW confirms two more Omicron cases in travellers from southern Africa
articles.description: Genomic testing confirms another two cases of the Omicron COVID-19 variant from passengers who arrived in Sydney from southern Africa last night.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: After months of hints, Matthew McConaughey rules out bid to be next celebrity politician
articles.description: After publicly weighing up whether to run for office in America's second-largest state, Matthew McConaughey says he will instead focus on supporting businesses and foundations that create pathways for others to succeed.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: Greens call for ban on filling in wombats' burrows as Murraylands incident investigated
articles.description: Landowners who fill in burrows and "bury wombats alive" would face potential jail time under a proposal from the South Australian Greens.
articles.author: Isabel Dayman

articles.headline: What we know about Omicron's 'unusual constellation of mutations'
articles.description: Scientists around the world are racing to understand more about the latest COVID-19 variant, dubbed Omicron. While there's still a lot to learn, here's a little bit of what we do (and don't) know so far.
articles.author: Olivia Willis and Belinda Smith

articles.headline: NSW police officer allegedly lied to court to support then-girlfriend's false rape claim
articles.description: NSW police officer Scott John White is accused of lying to a court to support a fake rape claim by his then-girlfriend Sarah Jane Parkinson.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: One new COVID-19 case in SA as doctors' union calls for pause on arrivals
articles.description: South Australia records one new COVID-19 case, in an interstate traveller, as the AMA state president calls for a stop to interstate and international arrivals while more information is gathered about the Omicron variant.
articles.author: Eugene Boisvert and Rory McClaren

articles.headline: Australian intervention in Solomon Islands 'not helpful', says province Premier
articles.description: Australia is holding up "corrupt leadership" in Solomon Islands says Daniel Suidani, Premier of Malaita, whose supporters are behind protests in Honiara.
articles.author: Evan Wasuka

articles.headline: Man who allegedly strangled former partner and took their child faces court
articles.description: Family members of a Logan mother left "fighting for her life" after her former partner allegedly strangled her and took off with their baby say she and the boy "didn't deserve" what happened.
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Novak Djokovic's dad claims his son will likely skip Australian Open over vaccine mandate
articles.description: There is further doubt over whether the men's world number one will compete at Melbourne Park, with his dad likening Tennis Australia's stance on player vaccination to "blackmail".
articles.author: Talissa Siganto

articles.headline: Nation's largest live exporter has licence reinstated after three-year ban
articles.description: Live sheep exporter Emanuel Exports is given the green light to resume exporting animals from December 3, following a three-year ban.
articles.author: Jessica Hayes, Belinda Varischetti, and Kath Sullivan

articles.headline: Mother tells Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide her son was ridiculed and vilified
articles.description: Grieving mother Nikki Jamieson tells the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide her son endured endless torment and ridicule by his chain of command and felt no-one had his back.
articles.author: Sally Eeles

articles.headline: Has Omicron blocked Australians from revisiting their favourite travel spots despite open borders?
articles.description: It's been a long two years and many Australians are eager to return to their favourite holiday spots — but with a new variant of concern, is it possible to book a ticket today? Here's what you need to know.
articles.author: Sally Eeles

articles.headline: 'He has been significantly punished': Prison escape lands man in solitary confinement for a year, court hears
articles.description: The lawyer for a man who abseiled out of an Adelaide prison a year ago has told the District Court his client has been in solitary confinement since his escape and is a "good person" when not on methamphetamine.
articles.author: Claire Campbell

articles.headline: Children put at risk as Sydney gym sprayed with bullets in 'disgusting' attack
articles.description: Police investigate whether a shooting that took place at a Sydney gym this morning and left one man injured was linked to the feuding Allameddine and Hamzy families.
articles.author: Mark Reddie

articles.headline: 'Best' schoolies on record celebrated, despite resurgence of the mullet
articles.description: As schoolies comes to a close and Surfers Paradise returns to its former self, politicians, authorities and volunteers have praised partygoers as the best-behaved in the history of the tradition.
articles.author: Kimberley Bernard

articles.headline: Former private schoolboy 'can't apologise enough' after stabbing man in eye during brutal attack
articles.description: Brett Halcro, who was stabbed in the eye during an unprovoked assault in Sydney last year, sobs in court as he confronts one of his teenage attackers.
articles.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

articles.headline: Will new government laws spell the end of online trolling? Probably not, but it could make it much harder
articles.description: Social media companies will shoulder more burden to deal with online harassment under laws proposed by the government. So what do we know, and what remains unanswered?
articles.author: Tom Lowrey

articles.headline: WA Police officers who refuse vaccine will be stood down on full pay, union says
articles.description: About 20 WA Police officers who are refusing to get vaccinated will continue to get paid in full while the police executive decides what to do, their union says.
articles.author: Blake Kagi

articles.headline: US, allies reap benefits as fallout from Australia's trade row with China hits $17b
articles.description: Australia's closest security allies, led by the United States, have been the biggest beneficiaries of Beijing's campaign of economic coercion against Canberra, according to a new report.
articles.author: Daniel Mercer and Tom Edwards

articles.headline: Storms, floods and a heatwave: The weather in store for Queensland this week
articles.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says 100-year-old November rainfall records might be about to tumble in some parts of Queensland and flooding remains a concern, as heatwave conditions descend on the outback.
articles.author: Elizabeth Cramsie

articles.headline: Three-year waitlists as rural Australia's 'horror' childcare situation worsens
articles.description: Some regional childcare providers have more than 300 children on their waitlists, as parents despair and the industry buckles under critical staff shortages.
articles.author: Julia André and Larissa Waterson

articles.headline: Rainfall goes against the grain — but record crop still looms
articles.description: Australia's largest-ever grain crop is now being harvested but recent rains mean some growers will miss out on high prices.
articles.author: Kath Sullivan and Joanna Prendergast

articles.headline: International students and visa holders urged to 'hang in there' for another two weeks as Omicron keeps borders closed
articles.description: International students barred from entering Australia for at least another two weeks are being urged to "hang in there" after the federal government postponed its reopening plan in response to the new Omicron strain of COVID-19.
articles.author: Nour Haydar

articles.headline: Margaret fled her home 20 years ago. Violence in Solomon Islands has brought back painful memories
articles.description: Margaret Teobasi Tadokata says the deadly riots and unrest in the Solomon Islands capital Honiara echo the ethnic tensions that forced her and her young family to flee the country more than two decades ago.
articles.author: Dubravka Voloder

articles.headline: Have you asked for an Airbnb refund during COVID? Ross was refused one – and then told to break lockdown
articles.description: A lack of regulation has created "buyer beware" situation where some people are being denied refunds for short-term rental bookings that they can't use during COVID. And this is lining the pockets of the head companies.
articles.author: Emilia Terzon

articles.headline: Cannes winner Titane is a surreal horror about a serial killer with a sexual fetish for cars
articles.description: For all its body-horror and swoon-inducing gore, Titane is a multifaceted exploration of identity and belonging.
articles.author: Jason Di Rosso

articles.headline: It's home to 37 government departments, but this tiny island's residents are still sick and homeless
articles.description: Thursday Island is the administration centre of the Torres Strait, but underneath all that administration and bureaucracy residents say their lives are a daily struggle.
articles.author: Jemima Burt

articles.headline: What's it like to renovate in Antarctica? These expeditioners are about to find out
articles.description: Below-freezing temperatures, gale force winds and penguins — it's what awaits expeditioners travelling to preserve the remains of Mawson's Huts in Antarctica.
articles.author: Rebecca Hewett

articles.headline: A contraceptive patch and an annual vaginal ring: The contraception Aussie women are missing out on
articles.description: Contraception is a game changer for women around the world, but for many the risks and side effects that come with it can take a real toll on their quality of life. So in 2021, what else is on offer and when are men going to a bigger part of the conversation?
articles.author: Georgia Hitch, Emma Machan, and Andrew Kesper

articles.headline: Australian deployment to Solomon Islands caught in political cross-fire engulfing Honiara
articles.description: Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare defends calling in Australian police and army troops for help, saying without them his government would be left "to the mercy of criminals and hooligans."
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: Nearby Mount Delusion, this forest was supposed to be thriving. Instead it was a weed-infested 'moonscape'
articles.description: The ABC reveals alarming evidence that forests aren’t always being grown back after they've been logged, undermining a state-run timber company's claim to sustainability.
articles.author: Michael Slezak, Mark Doman, Stephen Hutcheon, and Alex Palmer

articles.headline: What evidence there is that identity verification stops online bullying?
articles.description: The government wants to strip social media users of their anonymity, so what evidence is there this will make the internet a better place?
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: A panel of leading Australian pandemic experts convened yesterday to discuss Omicron — here's what they said
articles.description: A network of independent Australian experts established in the wake of the pandemic recommend bringing COVID-19 vaccine boosters four months forward in response to the Omicron variant.
articles.author: Nakari Thorpe and Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: Artificial intelligence is making decisions that affect us and some of those choices aren't that smart
articles.description: Artificial intelligence is making decisions about people's insurance claims, credit scores and more. ABC Top 5 academic Jathan Sadowski explains why that matters.
articles.author: Nakari Thorpe and Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: The Earth has more water than makes sense. The missing source may be the Sun
articles.description: The origin of Earth's water is a mystery, but one source could be the Sun, a new study that analyses the chemistry of an asteroid suggests.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: The two scenarios that can bring on new variants like Omicron
articles.description: Every time someone gets infected with SARS-CoV-2, there is a chance the virus could generate a more fit variant, which could then spread to others. This is the basics of how the Omicron variant emerged. So does vaccination disrupt the process?
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: 'I decided God can't have it both ways': Fiona remembers the first time she was told she was special
articles.description: Disability advocates are warning the federal government's religious discrimination bill doesn't go far enough to protect the rights of vulnerable communities.
articles.author: Emma Myers

articles.headline: Australia's word of the the year is phonetically satisfying  — and very frustrating
articles.description: Linguistics gets political as two dictionaries, and the voting public, choose "strollout" as their word of the year for 2021, writes Tiger Webb.
articles.author: Tiger Webb

articles.headline: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey's resignation sparks surge in company's share price
articles.description: Shares in Twitter surge more than 10 per cent at opening bell as news of Mr Dorsey's resignation breaks.
articles.author: Tiger Webb

articles.headline: Sweden gets its first female Prime Minister... for the second time
articles.description: Sweden's first female Prime Minister has come out on top again, having resigned mere hours after first being elected last week.
articles.author: Tiger Webb

articles.headline: WHO warns Omicron COVID variant poses 'very high risk' of infection surge around world
articles.description: The World Health Organization is urging nations to accelerate vaccination of high-priority groups to prepare for the latest identified variant of SARS-CoV-2.
articles.author: Tiger Webb

articles.headline: Trailblazing and internationally acclaimed, David Dalaithngu walked tall in two cultures
articles.description: His career spanned nearly 50 years and took Indigenous Australia to the world, but now Northern Territory actor David Dalaithngu AM has died.
articles.author: Matt Garrick

articles.headline: Live: Australia takes on USA in second friendly in Newcastle
articles.description: Fresh off a 3-0 victory over the Matildas on Saturday, the USA will be hoping to make it two from two when they take on the hosts in tonight's final friendly. Follow our live blog.
articles.author: Samantha Lewis

articles.headline: 'Time to change our parliament forever': Former PM Gillard urges politician code of conduct following Jenkins review
articles.description: Australia's first female prime minister Julia Gillard has thrown her support behind the sex discrimination commissioner's recommendation for a code of conduct for politicians, as she responds to the review triggered by Brittany Higgins's revelations on the culture of parliament.
articles.author: Stephanie Dalzell

articles.headline: The Loop: Human remains found in Victorian bushland, Omicron causes border uncertainty, 'Luna love' changes classroom energy
articles.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: Donut day in SA one week on from opening the borders
articles.description: There have been no new cases of COVID-19 reported in SA today. SA Health has opened a drive-through vaccination clinic in Adelaide's north.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: NRL refuses to register Anthony Milford's Rabbitohs contact
articles.description: The NRL says it will not consider registering Milford's contract with South Sydney until the completion of criminal proceedings against the 27-year-old.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: The Elf on the Shelf is about to arrive in homes across Australia. But what is it?
articles.description: Have you heard of the Elf on the Shelf Christmas tradition? This modern trend, adored by families worldwide, keeps children on their best behaviour before Santa arrives.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: Why everything is different for Shaun Johnson's Warriors comeback
articles.description: After three seasons with Cronulla, New Zealand international Shaun Johnson returns to the Warriors as a different player and a different man.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: 'They hate motorists': Brisbane Lord Mayor labels lower speed limit plea a 'socialist' Greens push
articles.description: A Greens request for 30 kilometres an hour speed limits would "punish" drivers and force "them out of their cars", Brisbane Lord Mayor Adrian Schrinner says.
articles.author: Lucy Stone

articles.headline: Jordan De Goey returns to Australia with AFL career in the balance
articles.description: The stood-down Collingwood player has been charged with assault and will virtually face a New York court on December 8.
articles.author: Lucy Stone

articles.headline: 'Extremely irresponsible': International students lash out after long-awaited travel plans cancelled again
articles.description: The snap decision to delay the easing of border restrictions leaves many international students again uncertain and confused, with experts saying it could further damage Australia's reputation as an education destination.
articles.author: Bang Xiao, Natasya Salim, Farid Ibrahim, Erwin Renaldi, and Marian Faa

articles.headline: Prominent Australians call for WA government to pull 'unacceptable' Aboriginal heritage bill
articles.description: The proposed laws were drafted in the wake of the Juukan Gorge disaster, but some Aboriginal leaders say there had not been enough consultation.
articles.author: Rhiannon Shine

articles.headline: Defence allowed to vet evidence presented to inquiry into bushfire accidentally sparked by its own helicopter
articles.description: An ACT coroner has allowed a suppression order on the brief of evidence presented to a bushfire inquiry, so the Department of Defence can determine if there are any security issues.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Growing doubt over Ashes finale in Perth as WA Premier sticks to 'strict' COVID rules
articles.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan casts renewed uncertainty on whether Perth will host a match of the upcoming Ashes series, in light of COVID-19 restrictions.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Woods says a return to the top not a 'realistic expectation'
articles.description: Tigers Woods says it's unrealistic for him to make a return to the PGA Tour's full-time schedule but that he's likely to pick certain tournaments to play at.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: NSW records wettest November in 100 years — and it couldn't have come at a worse time for some
articles.description: Historic downpours this month caused mayhem in parts of the state, including for farmers who watched with dismay as rain they sorely needed two years ago came right at the wrong time.
articles.author: Amelia Bernasconi

articles.headline: Susie lives with an inoperable brain tumour. Small town community support has helped her along the way
articles.description: Life in regional Australia can be harsh and demanding for people living with a disability but our regions also offer a sense of community which can give hope in challenging times, writes Susie Alderman.
articles.author: Amelia Bernasconi

articles.headline: Coroner hears Theo Hayez wasn't a drinker, drug user or risk-taker — so why would he walk a 'scary' bush track alone at night?
articles.description: Theo Hayez's cousin says she has retraced his steps on the track he followed just before he disappeared and she believes he would not have made that trek by himself.
articles.author: Leah White

articles.headline: Japanese Crown Prince gives rare candid remarks, criticises media's coverage of daughter's wedding
articles.description: Crown Prince Akishino says people are "deeply hurt" by the slander from intense media coverage, fabricated stories and comments on the internet, after his daughter Mako developed post-traumatic stress disorder during her three-year engagement.
articles.author: Leah White

articles.headline: Human remains found in search for missing Victorian campers
articles.description: Police searching for the bodies of missing Victorian campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay find human remains in bushland in the state's remote High Country.
articles.author: Leah White

articles.headline: Patient 'left in agony' welcomes cosmetic surgery review
articles.description: The medical regulator announces a major review of patient safety in the cosmetic surgery sector, after Four Corners revealed details of serious hygiene and safety breaches in clinics operated by Dr Daniel Lanzer.
articles.author: Leah White

articles.headline: 'I could see he was purple and wasn't breathing'
articles.description: Rural women are almost twice as likely to give birth prematurely as women who live in major cities — as one Lightning Ridge mother found during her own "very scary situation".
articles.author: Olivia Ralph

articles.headline: What does it take for a COVID-19 strain to become a 'variant of concern'?
articles.description: There are actually thousands of coronavirus strains out there, but there are a few boxes that need to be ticked before they're escalated to the level Omicron's at.
articles.author: Dannielle Maguire

articles.headline: Missing man's Indigenous family plead for cultural collaboration with police
articles.description: Jeremiah Rivers' desperate relatives are feeling out of the loop six weeks after the East Kimberley man went missing in suspicious circumstances in south west Queensland.
articles.author: Ted O'Connor and Danielle O'Neal

articles.headline: Racing minister defends greyhound industry amid RSPCA probe into dog euthanasing
articles.description: Tasmania's Minister for Racing defends greyhound racing participants as "animal lovers" while confirming the state's most decorated trainer is under investigation by the RSPCA.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Men charged after woman allegedly stabbed and forced into car north of Adelaide
articles.description: Two men are charged with the attempted murder of a woman who was allegedly stabbed and forced into a car in a shopping centre car park in Adelaide's north this morning.
articles.author: Emily Baker

articles.headline: Golden trifecta for Queensland graziers as rain takes records by storm
articles.description: High cattle prices, low interest rates and the wettest November in 61 years is offering up a rare opportunity for Queensland cattle operations.
articles.author: Maddelin McCosker and Ashleigh Bagshaw

articles.headline: Vaccination mandate won't prevent crisis in childcare with early educators 'leaving in droves', advocate warns
articles.description: Queensland childcare advocate Georgie Dent says she is concerned the sector will lose significant numbers of staff next year, despite the vaccination mandate for educators.
articles.author: Baz Ruddick

articles.headline: 'A legacy you'd rather not have': Long-COVID study finds most patients still suffering months later
articles.description: An Australian study investigating the long-term impacts of COVID-19 found three-quarters of the participants had lingering symptoms months after their recovery.
articles.author: Ainslie Drewitt-Smith

articles.headline: After years of concealing the abuse they suffered, thousands of child sexual assault survivors are yet to see a cent
articles.description: Survivors of child sexual abuse have criticised lengthy delays in the federal government's national redress scheme, with one expert saying some elderly survivors are dying before receiving any compensation.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne and Jamie Travers

articles.headline: 'Are you OK?': Ruben lost his dad to suicide at age 14, now he helps others in need
articles.description: As a teenager, Ruben was heartbroken and struggled to understand why his father took his own life. Eleven years later, he now volunteers as a phone counsellor at Lifeline to help save the lives of others.
articles.author: Michael Luu

articles.headline: Salmon producers develop alliance to help tackle 'negative' press
articles.description: Tasmania's salmon industry has weathered years of criticism, most recently from Booker-prize winning author Richard Flanagan. Now it's enlisting business leaders to fight back.
articles.author: Rebecca Hewett

articles.headline: How science has turned HIV into a treatable, preventable condition
articles.description: In just half a lifetime, modern science has turned HIV, one of the most fearsome diseases in human history, into a treatable, preventable condition.
articles.author: Jeremy Fernandez

articles.headline: When masks came on, my main way to understand the world was shut off
articles.description: I never realised how much I relied upon lip-reading to simply participate in the world until masks made it impossible. Now, I no longer want to carry the burden of communication, writes Vikki McNaughton.
articles.author: Jeremy Fernandez

articles.headline: Canberra gynaecologist facing nine patient complaints promises to have surgeries supervised
articles.description: The Canberra gynaecologist at the centre of an ABC investigation has stopped working at one hospital, and has promised he will no longer perform laparoscopic surgery at another without a senior clinician present.
articles.author: Sarah Curnow and Anne Connolly

articles.headline: Woman with COVID-19 isolating in Hobart after arriving on Sydney flight
articles.description: People who were on a Jetstar flight from Sydney to Hobart on Monday are asked to isolate after a passenger tests positive for COVID-19.
articles.author: Sarah Curnow and Anne Connolly

articles.headline: Susan Neill-Fraser's second appeal against her murder conviction has been dismissed. What comes next?
articles.description: Susan Neill-Fraser's second appeal against her murder conviction has failed —  but it's the dissenting opinion of one justice that could provide a pathway for her case to reach the High Court, writes Loretta Lohberger.
articles.author: Loretta Lohberger

articles.headline: Laura was meant to meet her Australian granddaughter this week — but travel rules changed mid-flight
articles.description: A South African grandmother and other passengers were placed into hotel quarantine when they arrived in Australia, after the government introduced a travel ban against nine African countries while their plane was mid-flight.
articles.author: Erin Handley

articles.headline: With the Ashes a week away, here's how Australia spent the year not preparing for Test cricket
articles.description: Australia has only played four men's Tests in the best part of two years, while England has played 20. Heading into the Ashes, we look at how the Aussies have prepared for cricket's greatest contest.
articles.author: Jon Healy

articles.headline: This couple was slugged $78k over a fire in their rental. Their story led to a 'huge win for renters' across Australia
articles.description: Big insurers agree to change their policies of pursuing renters over unintentional and accidental property damage, after consumer advocate groups and the ABC help expose the issue.
articles.author: Amy Bainbridge and Lucy Kent

articles.headline: Nervous wait across Sydney and Central Coast after Omicron COVID exposures
articles.description: People who have been to almost a dozen exposure sites across Sydney and the NSW Central Coast face a nervous wait to see if they've contracted the Omicron strain of COVID-19.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: What today's GDP figures will — and won't — show about Australia's economic health
articles.description: Looking beyond the latest quarterly GDP figures, the truth is Australians are getting better off more slowly than before, writes Peter Martin.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: Zombie cicadas, honey fungus and psychedelics: Welcome to the wild world of fungi
articles.description: The biologist says there's a lack of research into fungi despite more than 90 per cent of plants dependant on the micro-organisms to help them to extract nutrients.
articles.author: Sophie Kesteven and Michael Mackenzie

articles.headline: Jenkins says Westminster traditions no bar to punishing elected MPs for harassment, bullying
articles.description: The author of a landmark review of the workplace culture in Parliament House says it is a "myth" that MPs and senators are shielded from sanctions just because they cannot be sacked.
articles.author: James Elton

articles.headline: There are five variants of concern. This is where Omicron differs
articles.description: There have been 11 COVID-19 strains named by the WHO, including the newly-identified Omicron. But what happened to the rest of them?
articles.author: Maani Truu

articles.headline: Why has it taken so long to crack down on cosmetic cowboys?
articles.description: In a major win for Australian patients, the medical regulator AHPRA this week announced its first ever review into patient safety in the cosmetic surgery sector. But the problems with the multi-billion-dollar industry have been well known by authorities for decades, writes Lauren Day.
articles.author: Lauren Day

articles.headline: Women have been visiting this sacred place for thousands of years. But red tape has made access 'painstaking and humiliating'
articles.description: Traditional owner groups across Australia say many sacred Aboriginal sites are still at risk of destruction, despite sweeping recommendations made after the inquiry into the Juukan Gorge disaster.
articles.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

articles.headline: Former Lesotho prime minister charged with the 2017 murder of his estranged wife
articles.description: The former Lesotho prime minister and his current wife got married days after the killing of his estranged wife. The two were in the middle of an acrimonious divorce.
articles.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

articles.headline: 'Preventing the suffering of children': MPs in debate over mitochondrial donation
articles.description: Federal MPs make heartfelt speeches to Parliament on the ethical quandaries raised by a proposed law that could reduce the risk of children developing a debilitating, and sometimes fatal, genetic disease.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: Taliban promised amnesty, but former Afghan government officers are still being murdered: HRW Report
articles.description: The Taliban promised amnesty to those who'd served in the previous Afghan government when it swept to power. Human Rights Watch says that amnesty is being violated.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: Dutch health authority says Omicron COVID variant was there nearly two weeks ago
articles.description: Dutch health officials say the COVID-19 Omicron variant was detected in the Netherlands days before two South African flights touched down in Amsterdam with at least 14 infected passengers.
articles.author: Melissa Clarke

articles.headline: A slanging match and mysterious flyers — tensions flare ahead of council election
articles.description: Police are called to a polling booth in Sydney's north after tensions between two councillors reach fever pitch ahead of local government elections.
articles.author: Kathleen Calderwood and Echo Hui

articles.headline: Wettest November in 100 years for many places in Queensland, and La Niña will ensure the rain continues over summer
articles.description: Monthly rainfall records tumbl across Queensland with some places recording the wettest November they've seen in more than 100 years.
articles.author: George Roberts

articles.headline: NSW flood damage bill tipped to exceed $1b as farmers watch crops go under
articles.description: The flooding has inundated crops around the state and downgrades in quality are set to cost farmers dearly.
articles.author: David Claughton, Lara Webster, and Michael Condon

articles.headline: Flash flooding warnings issued as storms lash Melbourne, state's north
articles.description: Residents in some parts of Melbourne are being warned not to enter flood waters as slow-moving storms pelt the city with heavy rain and hailstones and lead to road closures.
articles.author: David Claughton, Lara Webster, and Michael Condon

articles.headline: New $185m package to lure tourists, students, workers back to WA when the borders open
articles.description: The WA government is throwing $185 million at measures aimed at boosting businesses and attracting tourists, students and workers back to the state when it eventually opens up.
articles.author: Nicolas Perpitch

articles.headline: Katy Perry's 'emotional response' to Australian designer aired in court battle
articles.description: Singer Katy Perry's manager says she was upset when she made disparaging remarks about an Australian clothes designer in emails revealed in court.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Sixth case of Omicron variant of COVID-19 confirmed in NSW
articles.description: NSW Health confirms a sixth returned traveller in the state has tested positive for the Omicron COVID-19 variant of concern and that he visited a Sydney chemist while infectious.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell
