articles.headline: 'World-class' Carey backed to handle Ashes pressure
articles.description: Australian all-rounder Cameron Green says wicketkeeper Alex Carey will be suited to Test cricket should he be named as Tim Paine's replacement.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Tel Aviv named the world's most expensive city
articles.description: Rising prices for groceries, transport and alcohol push Tel Aviv to the top of the list in the latest global latest Cost of Living survey.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: Mexican drug lord El Chapo's wife sentenced to three years in prison
articles.description: A US judge sentences 32-year-old Emma Coronel Aispuro, the wife of Mexican drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, to three years in prison, after she pleaded guilty to helping the Sinaloa drug cartel.
articles.author: Jamie McKinnell

articles.headline: 'I feel confident now': program teaches children vital water safety skills
articles.description: Surf Life Saving SA says too many people from migrant families are drowning, and has launched a new campaign to make a difference.
articles.author: Matthew Smith

articles.headline: Christian Porter and Greg Hunt to quit politics, will not contest next election
articles.description: Two of the nation's most high-profile federal politicians will call it quits at the next election, with Health Minister Greg Hunt set to join former attorney-general Christian Porter in announcing his retirement.
articles.author: Andrew Probyn and Jake Evans

articles.headline: 'I've been told my kid will be put in a grave': Emotional NT Chief Minister reveals anti-vaxxer death threats
articles.description: During a COVID-19 press conference in Darwin, Chief Minister Michael Gunner is visibly shaken while revealing his son has been the subject of a specific death threat. The NT Police Commissioner says the threats are under investigation.
articles.author: Jano Gibson

articles.headline: Honduras set for diplomatic switch from Taiwan to China as Xiomara Castro shapes to become first woman president
articles.description: Xiomara Castro's plans for government include a possible switch of diplomatic ties from Taiwan to Beijing, and negotiating a new debt deal with the International Monetary Fund.
articles.author: Jano Gibson

articles.headline: 'My daughter is worth more than a $2 brass pin': Family offended by Defence response to seaman's suicide
articles.description: Defence finds documents relating to the bullying of a suicidal young seaman only after the royal commission into veteran suicide began, the seaman's sister reveals.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: SA records first cases of local transmission since state borders reopened
articles.description: South Australia has recorded three new cases of COVID-19, including the first instances of local transmission since borders reopened last week.
articles.author: Rory Callinan

articles.headline: Almost 50 police employees barred from work as WA COVID-19 vaccination mandate enforced
articles.description: WA police officers are among tens of thousands of Western Australians who are required to have had one dose of a vaccine by today.
articles.author: Lucy Martin

articles.headline: What are the key takeaways from the review into parliament's work culture?
articles.description: Yesterday's report into the culture of work in federal parliament, sparked by Brittany Higgins's allegations, painted a pretty sobering picture. These are the key recommendations for how to make Parliament House a better place to work.
articles.author: Georgia Hitch

articles.headline: NT parliament passes changes to abortion laws making it easier to terminate later-term pregnancies
articles.description: The Northern Territory parliament has passed changes to its abortion laws, making the process easier for women seeking to have a second trimester termination.
articles.author: Saskia Mabin

articles.headline: Alex, 84, is being evicted from his home after the collapse of a housing scheme
articles.description: As a Senate inquiry looks into the collapse of the Sterling Group housing scheme, some of the elderly victims are now finding themselves homeless.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: Victorian government dismisses 'blackmail' claims from Djokovic's dad over Aus Open vaccine mandate
articles.description: Victorian Sports Minister Martin Pakula rejects claims by Novak Djokovic's dad that Australian Open organisers are forcing players to get vaccinated against COVID-19.
articles.author: Michael Atkin

articles.headline: 'It's beyond wicked': Farmer blasts energy authority, Powercor after St Patrick's Day bushfire backdown
articles.description: Jill Porter lost half her dairy herd when bushfires tore through south-west Victoria. Now, she wants someone to be held to account so other families are spared such trauma.
articles.author: Daniel Miles and Jeremy Lee

articles.headline: Space junk has forced NASA to temporarily postpone a spacewalk. So where did it come from?
articles.description: NASA is forced to temporarily postpone a spacewalk because of space junk that could puncture an astronaut's suit or damage the International Space Station.
articles.author: Daniel Miles and Jeremy Lee

articles.headline: Backpacker tells inquest Theo Hayez didn't appear drunk on the night he disappeared in Byron Bay
articles.description: Inquest hears the missing backpacker was sober enough to talk about European politics before Google searching a small village seldom known to tourists.
articles.author: Leah White

articles.headline: 'We don't want them walking the streets': Morcombe family welcomes tougher child killer parole laws
articles.description: Queensland Parliament last night passed legislation that could see the "worst of the worst" kept behind bars for decades after their parole date.
articles.author: Amy Sheehan

articles.headline: Lady Jane in Spain: The Australian mango enjoying sweet success internationally
articles.description: It was developed near Katherine in the NT, but there are now commercial plantings of this mango in Spain and trials underway in more than 10 countries.
articles.author: Matt Brann

articles.headline: Scientists identify armoured dinosaur with tail like Aztec weapon
articles.description: The Stegouros elengassen is a four-legged creature which lived in what is now South America's southernmost tip during the Cretaceous Period.
articles.author: Matt Brann

articles.headline: We can't stop workplace sexual harassment without banning non-disclosure agreements
articles.description: NDAs are increasingly used against employees who make complaints about discrimination and harassment. But the practice has a chilling effect on people's willingness to speak out, and must be eradicated, write Maria O'Sullivan and Judith Bessant.
articles.author: Matt Brann

articles.headline: Drought, a mouse plague and now La Niña — but is that good or bad news for farmers?
articles.description: Even though Australia has just had its wettest November in more than two decades, some farmers are still waiting.
articles.author: Matt Brann

articles.headline: Claire quit her job and sold her possessions — then Omicron changed everything
articles.description: Claire Ebersohn was only two days away from starting her new life in Australia but global panic over the Omicron strain of COVID-19 has locked her out of the country.
articles.author: Kevin Nguyen

articles.headline: Jennifer visited a museum and saw her own heart on display
articles.description: The history of medical transplants stretches back millennia and includes some bizarre and gruesome milestones.
articles.author: Nick Baker

articles.headline: Was it a bear, or an early human? Mystery of 3.7-million-year-old footprints solved
articles.description: Around 3.7 million years ago, a metre-high early human gingerly walked across the slippery ground in what is now Tanzania. But what species were they?
articles.author: Belinda Smith

articles.headline: Twitter's new Indian-American CEO highlights corporate Australia's lack of cultural diversity
articles.description: American technology giants including Twitter, Google, Microsoft and IBM are among American companies promoting people of Indian origin to CEO. But in Australia, it is rare for top publicly listed company chiefs to come from culturally diverse backgrounds, Nassim Khadem writes.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: Wealthy nations starved the developing world of vaccines. Omicron shows the cost of this greed
articles.description: The new variant is a warning: unless we take urgent action to correct global vaccine inequities, we risk the emergence of further variants, some of which may evade vaccines.
articles.author: Nassim Khadem

articles.headline: 'Significant momentum': How some super funds become more profitable by investing sustainably
articles.description: A new study shows Australian superannuation funds that invest responsibly are becoming increasingly profitable than traditional funds. But some analyst says they need to be more transparent.
articles.author: Samuel Yang

articles.headline: World War II bomb explodes near Munich's main train station, injuring four
articles.description: A World War II bomb explodes on a construction site near a busy train station in central Munich, injuring four people.
articles.author: Samuel Yang

articles.headline: Historic laws to ban hackers, human rights abusers and possibly Putin's cronies from Australia
articles.description: The legislation, partly based on the United States Magnitsky Act, allows the federal government to sanction people who engage in "egregious conduct" and could see cyber hackers, rights abusers and corrupt officials banned from Australia.
articles.author: James Glenday

articles.headline: SA parliament goes into COVID-19 shutdown to allow contact tracing after former premier tests positive
articles.description: South Australia's parliament will be adjourned on Thursday morning, and all MPs and staff directed to avoid in-person meetings, after former premier Jay Weatherill tested positive for COVID-19.
articles.author: Nick Harmsen

articles.headline: Former SA premier Jay Weatherill tests positive for COVID-19
articles.description: Former South Australian premier Jay Weatherill has tested positive for COVID-19 after attending an event on Saturday where other cases were present.
articles.author: Stacey Lee and Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Operation Ironside nets 18 more suspects as police seize guns and drugs
articles.description: The latest arrests come amid a wave of SA Police raids across Adelaide, with guns seized and six properties searched in relation to what police described as drug trafficking and money laundering activities.
articles.author: Stacey Lee and Daniel Keane

articles.headline: Two young men sentenced to four years in jail over fatal hit-and-run in Alice Springs
articles.description: A judge says a man aged 20 and a boy aged 16 had shown a "selfish disregard" for the safety of other road users in their actions after a hit-and-run last year that left a 47-year-old man dead.
articles.author: Mitchell Abram

articles.headline: Young woman was stabbed by own family because she was dating man of another faith, court told
articles.description: A 21-year-old woman stabbed in an Adelaide suburban shopping centre car park on Tuesday morning was attacked and ambushed by members of her own family because she was dating someone outside her faith, a court hears.
articles.author: Gabriella Marchant

articles.headline: The Loop: Hunt and Porter quit politics, man dies in Qld floods, world's most expensive city named
articles.description: Get yourself in The Loop with a speedy wrap of today's news.
articles.author: Kelsie Iorio

articles.headline: COVID case visited major Gold Coast shopping centre on Black Friday
articles.description: The city is on high alert as Queensland Health confirms a new positive COVID case went to Robina Town Centre last week.
articles.author: Alexandria Utting

articles.headline: Queensland's drenching to continue over summer, following record-breaking November
articles.description: Monthly rainfall records tumble across Queensland with some places recording the wettest November they've seen in more than 100 years.
articles.author: George Roberts

articles.headline: Woman dies in hospital days after going missing on Tiwi Islands
articles.description: A 35-year-old woman dies in Royal Darwin Hospital, days after she went missing on the Tiwi Islands and was found stranded in mangroves.
articles.author: Samantha Dick

articles.headline: The father of missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez storms out of coronial inquest
articles.description: The father of missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez has stormed out of a coronial inquest in Byron Bay, as security guards give evidence about evicting his son.
articles.author: Leah White

articles.headline: US white supremacists targeting under-vaxxed Aboriginal communities, WA Premier says
articles.description: Mark McGowan says American hate groups are specifically targeting remote Aboriginal communities by spreading misinformation about COVID-19 vaccinations.
articles.author: Jarrod Lucas

articles.headline: NSW Police officer found guilty of perjury for lying about girlfriend's fake rape claim
articles.description: A NSW police officer who helped his girlfriend fabricate a rape claim is found guilty of perjury.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: Minister calls for Shandee Blackburn murder inquiry to reopen
articles.description: "It can't be left the way it is": The mother of murdered woman Shandee Blackburn welcomed the Minister's comments, a week after forensic results came under the spotlight.
articles.author: Tobi Loftus

articles.headline: 'So missed by all of us': Family of man believed to have been killed by Adelaide drug dealers speak
articles.description: The family of a man believed to have been killed by Adelaide drug dealers speak of the grief and pain they have experienced since he was last seen on December 19 last year.
articles.author: Rebecca Puddy

articles.headline: 'You can't hate yourself into being better': The misconception around feeling guilt versus shame
articles.description: Research professor Brené Brown has spent a large part of her career looking at shame, which she says has now become an epidemic in society. So how can we better deal with our feelings?
articles.author: Rebecca Puddy

articles.headline: NSW man's alleged $5,000 rampage in Tasmanian COVID quarantine hotel
articles.description: A New South Wales man who flew into Tasmania then allegedly refused to leave and caused $5,000 worth of damage to his hotel quarantine room is sent packing by police.
articles.author: Lucy MacDonald

articles.headline: After three court trials, a man has been jailed over a shooting in Canberra's south
articles.description: The juries in Christopher Cunningham's first two trials were dismissed, and the third trial had already been running for seven days when Cunningham agreed to plead guilty.
articles.author: Elizabeth Byrne

articles.headline: If you think this is rats jumping off a sinking political ship, think again
articles.description: The departure of some of the nation's most high-profile Liberal politicians on the eve of an election easily lends itself to the suggestion of rats fleeing a sinking ship. But as the last poll showed, it's not over until the votes are cast, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
articles.author: Brett Worthington

articles.headline: WA Premier Mark McGowan flags tighter South Australia border as government seeks 'urgent' health advice
articles.description: The West Australian border with South Australia looks to be toughened as early as this afternoon after 18 COVID-19 cases are detected in Adelaide in the space of 24 hours.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Widow of man paralysed on 69th birthday says NDIS threshold has 'got to be fixed'
articles.description: Both major parties have been accused of "shameful" inaction over the NDIS age cut-off. Now, advocates are fighting to make it a federal election issue.
articles.author: Kelly Fuller and Sarah Harvey

articles.headline: PM accuses Labor of 'disgraceful slur' over Home Affairs contract awarded to two close friends
articles.description: Scott Morrison hits back at any suggestion he had a role in the Home Affairs Department awarding an almost $80,000 contract to a company run by two of his closest friends.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Surgeon fined in Austria for amputating wrong leg, judge awards damages to widow of patient
articles.description: The surgeon marked the wrong leg of her 82-year-old patient, who died before the case came to court.
articles.author: Andrew Greene

articles.headline: Big bank mortgages below 2 per cent going, going, gone
articles.description: Mortgages from the big four banks with a '1' in front of the interest rate are now a thing of the past, while investors take over as the drivers of lending and property price growth.
articles.author: Michael Janda

articles.headline: 'We hear your voice, and we will listen': Task force recommends staged approach to criminalising coercive control in Queensland
articles.description: The approach would include public education, an implementation plan to prepare for criminalisation in 2024 and co-designing a strategy to address the over-representation of First Nations people in the criminal justice system before the legislation is introduced.
articles.author: Emilie Gramenz

articles.headline: Man accused of helping to kidnap Stuart MacGill was a bikie on parole, court told
articles.description: A man accused of involvement in the alleged kidnapping of former cricketer Stuart MacGill was on parole at the time and is allegedly an affiliate of the Comanchero motorcycle gang, a Sydney court has heard.
articles.author: Emilie Gramenz

articles.headline: 'It's just wrecked everything': Inglewood begins massive flood clean-up
articles.description: Residents in the southern Queensland border town of Inglewood start the clean-up after floodwaters inundated homes and businesses.
articles.author: Georgie Hewson, Jon Daly, and Anthea Moodie

articles.headline: AFL legend Ron Barassi tests positive for COVID-19
articles.description: The 85-year-old will miss taking part in Melbourne's long-awaited AFL premiership celebrations at the MCG on Sunday.
articles.author: Georgie Hewson, Jon Daly, and Anthea Moodie

articles.headline: Greg Hunt confirms he's retiring from politics at the next election
articles.description: Federal Health and Aged Care Minister Greg Hunt announces he will retire at the next election and not recontest his seat in Victoria.
articles.author: Georgia Hitch

articles.headline: The $35 hardware in your home that could cost you $14,000
articles.description: There's a hidden flood risk in your home and it has absolutely nothing to do with the rain, or your drains. But it could cost you tens of thousands of dollars if you don't sort it out.
articles.author: Ellen-Maree Elliot

articles.headline: Victorian government's pandemic bill set to become law after passing upper house
articles.description: After weeks of negotiations and substantial amendments, the Victorian government's controversial pandemic legislation has cleared its last hurdle.
articles.author: Ellen-Maree Elliot

articles.headline: Scores of protesters demand a drink at 'freedom pub' after anti-vax licensee convicted
articles.description: Demonstrators waved placards decrying "tyranny" and called for "justice" outside Singleton Court. Inside, Bradley John Hill's matter was dealt with in five minutes.
articles.author: Jake Lapham

articles.headline: Mum threatened at knifepoint with children in car
articles.description: Police allege the woman parked her Range Rover station wagon at her Klemzig home around 3:20pm yesterday and was approached by a man armed with a knife.
articles.author: Jake Lapham

articles.headline: 'Explanation needed' after teenagers' escape from Howard Springs quarantine, NT opposition says
articles.description: After two escapes in a number of days, the NT opposition is renewing calls for the federal government to resume control of Darwin's main quarantine facility.
articles.author: Jake Lapham

articles.headline: Everything you need to know about the Bathurst 1000
articles.description: This year's Supercars season concludes on the mountain at the Bathurst 1000 this weekend. Here's everything you need to know ahead of the great race around Mount Panorama, including its later start time.
articles.author: Simon Smale

articles.headline: Higher prices predicted for watermelons, chilli after torrential rain destroys summer crops
articles.description: Australians are set to pay a premium for popular summer produce, with widespread storms destroying crops across Queensland. Some growers say the deluge has wiped out up to 85 per cent of their crops.
articles.author: Jake Kearnan and Johanna Marie

articles.headline: Queenslanders in for a brief reprieve before more flooding set to hit sodden southern Queensland
articles.description: As floodwaters recede and residents across southern Queensland clean up, the weather bureau warns isolated storms across already sodden catchment areas could lead to more flooding next week.
articles.author: Baz Ruddick

articles.headline: Elective surgery patients in Queensland may require COVID test
articles.description: Elective surgery patients may require a negative COVID-19 test in the 72 hours before their procedures under options being discussed within Queensland Health to reduce the risk of hospital transmission.
articles.author: Baz Ruddick

articles.headline: 'People not heeding our advice': Some Tasmanians stuck in floodwaters as storms strike
articles.description: Hobartians are mopping up this morning following thunderstorms that brought heavy rain and hail to the Tasmanian capital and parts of the state's south-east.
articles.author: Baz Ruddick

articles.headline: There were winners, losers and big losers amongst Australia's universities last year — and the 'big eight' didn't escape
articles.description: Some universities actually increased revenue once the pandemic started, yet some vice-chancellors are deeply unhappy. The reasons why are complex, writes Conor Duffy.
articles.author: Conor Duffy

articles.headline: Nathan was once told he'd never run his own business — now he's doing it with the support of a major corporate
articles.description: When Nathan Johnston was younger, people told him he was "dreaming" when he talked about starting his own business. But on International Day of People with Disability it becomes a reality, as he launches a social media platform he created from his dining room table.
articles.author: Nas Campanella and Celina Edmonds

articles.headline: Friday News Quiz: Rhianna, Trump and Katter were in the headlines this week. Only one was kicked out a bar
articles.description: Will you be declared a national hero for your efforts or will you be unceremoniously thrown out? Test yourself to find out.
articles.author: Nas Campanella and Celina Edmonds

articles.headline: 'Moving towards COVID-normal': ACT to overhaul state of emergency laws, but don't expect Victorian-style protests
articles.description: The ACT government says it will soon be hard to justify calling the ongoing pandemic a public health "emergency", and wants to move away from that language.
articles.author: Markus Mannheim and Rosie King

articles.headline: Rachelle Miller says she made her allegations about Alan Tudge not for revenge, but so that other women can be heard
articles.description: It took a bruising year after Rachelle Miller first told her story about minister Alan Tudge for her to finally be heard, and for him to face consequences and stand aside, writes Louise Milligan.
articles.author: Markus Mannheim and Rosie King

articles.headline: An eight-hour year and hot enough to melt iron — this planet's 'not somewhere you'd want to go on holidays'
articles.description: About 30 light-years away a rocky planet as dense as pure iron orbits a red dwarf star half the size of our Sun. A year on GJ 367 b is shorter than a day on Earth.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Germany considers COVID-19 vaccine mandate as cases surge
articles.description: Germany bans unvaccinated people from non-essential stores and venues, and considers making vaccines mandatory as new case numbers hit 70,000 in 24 hours.
articles.author: Genelle Weule

articles.headline: Satellites have discovered huge cloud of undisclosed methane emissions over Australia, experts say
articles.description: Methane is a powerful, invisible gas that might be a key driver of global warming. Now satellite imagery is raising questions over whether Australia has been accurately reporting its emissions to international bodies.
articles.author: Steve Cannane

articles.headline: Myanmar junta cancels passports of high-profile opponents and shadow government figures
articles.description: Myanmar's military junta revokes the passports of dozens of its leading opponents in an apparent attempt to stop them travelling and building international opposition to the regime.
articles.author: Stephen Dziedzic

articles.headline: SA has opened it borders to COVID, what can Tasmania learn from it?
articles.description: South Australia is a little over a week into reopening their borders and what happens with COVID-19 infections — and the death rate — is being watched closely by Tasmania, where the island state is soon to open up to the world.
articles.author: Liz Gwynn

articles.headline: People in NSW have to vote tomorrow — this is what you need to know
articles.description: Almost every NSW resident has to vote in one of the more than 120 elections set to be held tomorrow. This is what you need to know.
articles.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

articles.headline: Eye-opening moments in the classroom remind me why teaching is my dream job
articles.description: I want to change negative perspectives and misconceptions about disability that I have faced my whole life. And already I've had so many special, eye-opening moments in the classroom that remind me I'm on the right path, writes Ashleigh Gibson.
articles.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

articles.headline: If solar is now so cheap, why is my power bill still so high?
articles.description: After years of increases, power prices are set to fall, thanks largely to cheap solar. So how cheap can solar get? And what does this mean for your electricity bill?
articles.author: James Purtill

articles.headline: Omicron has again disrupted travel plans, but one country is pushing ahead with its quarantine-free experiment
articles.description: Fiji has pushed to get its vaccination rate to more than 90 per cent and has come up with a model for international travel that requires travellers to stay in the same place for a few days, but also feels nothing like quarantine.
articles.author: Emily Clark

articles.headline: Patty Mills becomes first basketballer to take home Don Award
articles.description: Patty Mills is setting franchise records for the Brooklyn Nets in the NBA but leading the Boomers to an Olympic medal has helped him to claim on of Australian sports' top honours.
articles.author: Emily Clark

articles.headline: Health Minister 'disappointed' at being kept in the dark over detection of Legionella bacteria at Perth hospital
articles.description: A detection of Legionella bacteria at Sir Charles Gairdner Hospital in Perth leads to 16 rooms being treated for the bacteria and two patients receiving precautionary antibiotics, as the Health Minister criticises health executives over a failure to communicate.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Meghan wins court battle with British tabloid that published private letter to her father
articles.description: The decision spares the Duchess of Sussex from having to appear at a trial in which her estranged father Thomas Markle would also have given evidence.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: 'We have concerns': US slams China's hypersonic weapons tests
articles.description: Beijing's efforts to accelerate its military capabilities were highlighted by its July test of a hypersonic weapon, capable of partially orbiting the Earth before re-entering the atmosphere and gliding on a manoeuvrable path to its target.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: Supercars veteran eyeing first Bathurst 1000 crown
articles.description: Lee Holdsworth — who is partnered with Chaz Mostert — is allowing himself to dream of a maiden Bathurst 1000 win in his 18th attempt.
articles.author: James Carmody

articles.headline: The Loop: Tudge stands aside, Australia's eighth Omicron case, Spotify Wrapped releases 'audio auras' and why shame isn't helpful
articles.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
articles.author: Dannielle Maguire
